Health benefit: Improves chest and triceps strength and enhances shoulder stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing the wall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended. 2. Place hands on the wall at shoulder height and shoulder-width apart. 3. Bend elbows and lean chest toward the wall. 4. Push back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral while lowering with control

Health benefit: Builds pressing strength and supports daily upper body tasks
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright with feet flat and knees at 90 degrees. 2. Bring palms together in front of the chest with elbows bent. 3. Press palms firmly together and hold
Safety cue: then release.
MET value: Sit tall with shoulders down and press with a controlled tempo

Health benefit: Increases upper body strength with reduced load for progressive training
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a raised surface like a countertop. 2. Place hands on the edge at shoulder-width and step back slightly. 3. Bend elbows and lower your chest toward the surface. 4. Push back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and descend slowly from the shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances chest muscle activation and improves muscular endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft. 2. Bring palms together at chest level with elbows out. 3. Press palms inward to create tension and hold.
Safety cue: Keep elbows level and ribs lowered while maintaining steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and builds endurance in rotator cuff and deltoids
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet a few inches away. 2. Press your lower back and shoulders gently into the wall. 3. Slide your arms up the wall to shoulder height. 4. Hold that raised position and then slide arms down.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and shoulders down while holding the raise

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and increases joint circulation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. 2. Extend both arms out to shoulder height with palms down. 3. Make small controlled circles forward. 4. Reverse and make small controlled circles backward.
Safety cue: Move from the shoulders with small controlled circles and avoid torso sway

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back muscles and supports improved posture
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright with feet flat and knees bent. 2. Hold a band or towel with both hands in front of you at chest height. 3. Pull elbows back and squeeze shoulder blades while keeping the torso stable. 4. Hold the pulled position and then release slowly.
Safety cue: Sit tall
MET value: pull shoulder blades back and hold without shrugging

Health benefit: Engages core and shoulder stabilizers to enhance whole body coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place hands on the wall at shoulder height. 2. Step feet back so your body forms a straight plank angle with feet fixed. 3. Lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder
Safety cue: then return it. 4. Lift your left hand and tap your right shoulder
is_not_suitable_for: Brace the core and keep hips level to minimize rotation while tapping

Health benefit: Boosts lower limb circulation and promotes basic aerobic activity
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed. 2. Lift one knee a low distance toward your hip. 3. Lower that foot and alternate lifting the other knee in a steady march.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and lift knees with controlled

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and supports gentle cardiovascular movement
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright near the edge of a chair with feet flat. 2. Lift one knee a small distance while keeping the torso stable. 3. Lower that foot and alternate lifting the other knee in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Sit tall
MET value: engage the core and lift each knee with control

Health benefit: Improves balance and weight transfer control in standing
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. 2. Shift your weight to the right foot and lift the left heel slightly. 3. Return to center and shift weight to the left foot.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and shift weight over the standing foot

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and ankle activation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet together and knees soft. 2. Tap the right toe out to the right side while keeping weight on the left foot. 3. Return to center. 4. Tap the left toe out to the left side while keeping weight on the right foot.
Safety cue: Tap toes side-to-side with controlled movement

Health benefit: Promotes coordinated limb movement and light cardiovascular activation
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall near the front of a chair with feet flat. 2. Lift the right knee and pump the left arm forward. 3. Lower both to the starting position. 4. Alternate by lifting the left knee and pumping the right arm.
Safety cue: Sit tall and lift arms and legs smoothly with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and gentle upper body movement
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. 2. Swing both arms forward and up to shoulder height. 3. Swing both arms back and down with a gentle bend.
Safety cue: Swing arms with control while maintaining a slight hip hinge

Health benefit: Improves upper body coordination and promotes light aerobic effort
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall with hands near your chest. 2. Extend the right arm forward in a controlled light punch. 3. Retract the right hand to the chest. 4. Repeat the same motion with the left arm.
Safety cue: Punch lightly while keeping shoulders down

Health benefit: Encourages hip extension control and safe backward stepping practice
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. 2. Step the right foot back and lightly tap the heel on the floor. 3. Step the right foot forward to the start and repeat with the left foot.
Safety cue: Step back slowly and keep weight balanced over the front foot

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps activation and promotes knee joint stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand behind a chair and hold the backrest for balance. 2. Extend the right knee forward until the leg is nearly straight. 3. Pulse the right leg with small movements and then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the standing leg stable and extend the knee in small controlled pulses

Health benefit: Maintains spinal mobility and improves trunk rotation awareness
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands on your thighs. 2. Rotate your torso gently to the right keeping hips square. 3. Return to center and rotate gently to the left.
Safety cue: Sit tall and twist only from the ribs within a small range

Health benefit: Enhances ankle range of motion and circulation around the foot
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand with one foot slightly lifted off the ground. 2. Rotate the lifted ankle clockwise in a controlled circle. 3. Reverse the rotation counterclockwise and switch feet.
Safety cue: Rotate the ankle slowly with relaxed toes

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexibility and eases movement into daily activities
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall with feet flat on the floor. 2. Place the right ankle on the left knee. 3. Press the right knee gently outward to open the hip. 4. Return to start and switch to place the left ankle on the right knee.
Safety cue: Open the hip slowly while keeping the spine neutral

Health benefit: Improves posterior hip activation and standing balance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on a support if needed. 2. Squeeze the glute of one leg and lift the heel slightly off the floor
Safety cue: keeping the knee straight. 3. Hold the short lift for a count and lower with control. 4. Repeat on the other side.
MET value: Keep hips square and core braced as you extend the leg

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and upper back relaxation
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides. 2. Lift both shoulders toward your ears and roll them back in a smooth arc. 3. Continue the rolls and then reverse direction.
Safety cue: Roll shoulders slowly with controlled range and upright posture

Health benefit: Enhances lateral neck mobility and segmental movement awareness
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall with eyes forward. 2. Keep your chin level and glide your head straight to one side
Safety cue: using a hand to guide if needed. 3. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
MET value: Keep chin tucked and glide the neck laterally with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves pelvic control and low back movement coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent. 2. Tuck your pelvis under by contracting your lower abdominals and flattening your lower back. 3. Release to a neutral pelvis and repeat.
Safety cue: Engage lower abs and tilt the pelvis with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Encourages spinal mobility and controlled flexion extension sequencing
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands on thighs. 2. Round your spine and tuck your chin to your chest to flex. 3. Arch your spine and lift your chest to extend. 4. Move slowly between the two positions.
Safety cue: Start from the thoracic spine and move with a long neutral neck

Health benefit: Increases wrist range of motion and forearm coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Extend both arms forward at shoulder height with palms down. 2. Bend your wrists to point fingers up
Safety cue: then bend them to point fingers down in a controlled motion. 3. Rotate your palms inward and outward to complete the flow.
MET value: Keep elbows soft and move wrists through a full comfortable range with control

Health benefit: Enhances calf muscle activation and lower leg circulation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands on a support if needed. 2. Rise onto the balls of both feet and squeeze your calves. 3. Lower your heels back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep knees slightly bent and control heel rise and descent with steady tempo

Health benefit: Improves diaphragmatic breathing and ribcage expansion with overhead reach
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with arms at your sides. 2. Inhale and raise both arms overhead in a smooth motion. 3. Exhale and lower your arms back to your sides.
Safety cue: Inhale to raise arms and exhale to lower while keeping ribs down and core engaged

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and posterior thigh extensibility
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the edge of a chair with one leg extended and heel on the floor. 2. Hinge at your hips and lean forward with a long spine until you feel a stretch in the back of the thigh. 3. Hold briefly and sit back upright.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes ankle dorsiflexion range and gastrocnemius flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on it at shoulder height. 2. Step one foot back with the heel down and the knee straight. 3. Lean forward into the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves chest flexibility and posture
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall at arm's length and place both forearms on the wall at shoulder height. 2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the wall while keeping a long spine. 3. Hold the stretch and breathe evenly. 4. Step back to release.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder blades gently retracted and avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Increases neck mobility and reduces stiffness
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall and relax your shoulders. 2. Lower your chin slowly toward your chest until you feel a gentle stretch at the back of the neck. 3. Hold the position and breathe. 4. Return your head to neutral.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin slightly and keep the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances lateral spine mobility and side torso flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Stand feet hip-width apart and raise your right arm overhead. 2. Reach your right arm up and lean your torso to the left while keeping hips facing forward. 3. Hold the side stretch and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Lengthen through the side body and avoid shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Improves hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall on a chair and cross your right ankle over your left knee. 2. Flex the right foot and keep your hips level. 3. Hinge slightly forward from the hips until you feel a shallow glute stretch. 4. Hold and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and hinge from the hips without rounding

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle trunk lengthening
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands on your knees. 2. Rotate your torso to the right using your left hand on the outside of your right thigh and your right hand behind you. 3. Lengthen the spine as you hold the twist.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and hinge forward from the hips while keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and knee range of motion
Steps to perform: 1. Stand beside a wall or sturdy chair and place one hand on the support. 2. Bend your right knee and grab your right ankle with your free hand. 3. Pull your heel toward your glute while keeping knees close and hips level. 4. Hold and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep knees aligned and pelvis neutral while gently pulling the heel toward the glute

Health benefit: Improves breath control and promotes relaxation
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or lie down in a comfortable position and place one hand on your chest and one on your belly. 2. Inhale slowly through your nose and let your belly rise while keeping your chest still. 3. Exhale slowly through your mouth and let your belly fall.
Safety cue: Breathe deeply into the belly with relaxed shoulders and minimal chest movement

Health benefit: Enhances overall flexibility and full body lengthening
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and raise both arms overhead. 2. Reach upward through your fingertips and lengthen your entire body while lifting slightly onto your toes. 3. Hold the full-body reach and breathe. 4. Lower your arms and heels back to the floor.
Safety cue: Reach overhead with core engaged and avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves balance and ankle stability with light support
Steps to perform: 1. Stand near a chair or wall and place a hand on it for light support. 2. Shift your weight onto your left leg and lift your right foot a few inches off the ground. 3. Keep your hips level and maintain an upright posture while you hold the position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Challenges balance and coordination through narrowed base of support
Steps to perform: 1. Stand and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot. 2. Keep your hips square and maintain an upright posture with eyes forward. 3. Hold the tandem stance steady and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Stack feet heel-to-toe

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands on a stable surface for light support. 2. Rise onto the balls of your feet by lifting your heels upward. 3. Pause at the top and feel your calves engaged. 4. Lower your heels slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and lift heels slowly with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic balance and lateral weight transfer
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and shift weight onto one leg. 2. Reach the opposite arm forward or to the side while keeping hips level. 3. Pause briefly while maintaining balance on the standing leg. 4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Shift weight through the standing foot and reach without rotating the hips

Health benefit: Improves seated core control and arm reach coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands on thighs. 2. Lift one foot slightly off the floor and reach forward with the opposite arm. 3. Hold briefly
Safety cue: return foot down
column19: and reach while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Promotes single leg balance and lower limb endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place hands lightly on it for support. 2. Lift one knee to hip height and hold while keeping your torso upright. 3. Lower the foot slowly and repeat with the other knee. 4. Maintain steady breathing throughout the marches.
Safety cue: Stand upright
MET value: march slowly with controlled knee lift and relaxed shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances postural control and shoulder mobility during balance tasks
Steps to perform: 1. Stand on one leg and extend both arms forward at shoulder height. 2. Hold your balance while keeping hips level and core engaged. 3. Lower the lifted foot and switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Engage your core and reach with controlled arm movement while maintaining balance

Health benefit: Builds functional leg strength and improves transitional movement control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit at the edge of a chair with feet hip-width and hands on the seat. 2. Lean forward
Safety cue: press through your feet
MET value: and lift your bottom a few inches off the seat. 3. Hold the partial stand while keeping your back straight and shoulders relaxed. 4. Lower back down with control to the seated position.
column19: and pause with knees slightly bent

Health benefit: Challenges sensory integration to improve balance confidence
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and place one hand lightly on a stable surface. 2. Close your eyes and maintain an upright posture while feeling the support. 3. Open your eyes and step away from the support when you are ready.
Safety cue: Distribute weight evenly
is_not_suitable_for: and breathe steadily with eyes closed

Health benefit: Increases core stability and supports upright posture
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width and place hands on hips. 2. Draw your belly button toward your spine to brace the core. 3. Hold the brace while maintaining normal posture and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Brace your core

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and scapular control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place hands shoulder-width on the wall. 2. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the wall in a controlled manner. 3. Hold halfway with elbows at about 90 degrees while keeping body straight. 4. Push back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and control the push with steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens chest and improves shoulder blade adduction control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall with feet flat and hold a small ball or pillow between your hands at chest height. 2. Press the hands together firmly to squeeze the object and engage your chest. 3. Hold the squeeze for a count
Safety cue: then release with control.

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and triceps endurance and scapular control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at shoulder height
Safety cue: palms facing down. 2. Press palms downward to straighten the elbows and extend the arms. 3. Slowly return to the start position and repeat.
MET value: Brace your core and press down with controlled scapular movement

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and postural alignment through isometric activation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand side-facing a wall and place your forearm against the wall at shoulder height. 2. Press the forearm into the wall without moving your shoulder to create tension. 3. Hold the press isometrically
Safety cue: then relax and repeat.
MET value: Press your palm into the wall keeping shoulders down and spine neutral

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic extension and overhead range of motion
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands by your sides. 2. Reach both arms straight overhead with palms facing each other. 3. Hold the overhead reach
Safety cue: then lower the arms back to the sides.
MET value: Sit tall and reach overhead without arching your lower back

Health benefit: Builds elbow flexor endurance and increases upper arm muscle activation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with arms by your sides and palms facing forward. 2. Curl the hands toward the shoulders while keeping the elbows close to the torso. 3. Squeeze the biceps at the top
Safety cue: then lower the hands slowly back to the start.
MET value: Keep elbows by your sides and curl with slow controlled tension

Health benefit: Improves core stability and enhances balance during functional tasks
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft. 2. Draw the navel toward the spine and lift the pelvic floor to brace the core. 3. Maintain a neutral spine and hold the brace while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Draw your belly button to your spine and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright with one hand supporting the elbow behind the head. 2. Straighten the top arm by pressing the hand upward to extend the elbow. 3. Lower the hand back behind the head with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep upper arm vertical and extend at the elbow with control

Health benefit: Increases core endurance and shoulder stability with reduced joint loading
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands flat on the wall at shoulder height. 2. Step the feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels. 3. Keep the core tight and hold the angled plank position. 4. Walk the feet forward to return to standing.
Safety cue: Hold a straight line from head to heels and avoid letting hips sag

Health benefit: Enhances upper back strength and promotes scapular retraction for better posture
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with knees slightly bent and elbows bent at 90 degrees. 2. Pull the elbows straight back while squeezing the shoulder blades together. 3. Hold the contracted position isometrically
Safety cue: then release slowly.
MET value: Squeeze shoulder blades together and resist rotation in your torso

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and boosts circulation with low impact movement
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands on the sides of the chair. 2. Lift one knee a few inches off the seat while keeping the torso stable. 3. Lower that foot and alternate lifting the other knee in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis still and lift each knee slowly without rocking

Health benefit: Improves lateral balance and coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent. 2. Shift weight onto one foot and tap the other toe to the side with a minimal bend. 3. Return the tapping foot to center and keep weight steady. 4. Repeat to the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you tap with a slight knee bend

Health benefit: Enhances upper body mobility and arm endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands at chest. 2. Extend one arm forward in a quick punch
Safety cue: reaching fully. 3. Pull the arm back and repeat on the other side at steady pace.
MET value: Sit tall with shoulders relaxed and extend punches with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Improves balance and controlled weight transfer
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and soft knees. 2. Shift weight slowly onto one foot and let the hips move slightly. 3. Transfer weight to the other foot while swinging the arms gently. 4. Continue shifting back and forth in a smooth flowing motion.
Safety cue: Shift weight smoothly through the midfoot keeping knees soft and movements controlled

Health benefit: Engages core while improving seated coordination and light aerobic activity
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands at sides or in front. 2. Lift one knee toward chest while pressing the opposite hand forward or up. 3. Lower the leg and switch to the other knee while alternating the arm. 4. Maintain an upright torso and steady breathing throughout.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright spine and brace the core as you lift each arm with control

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances ankle stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands for balance if needed. 2. Rise onto the balls of both feet to lift the heels. 3. Pulse up and down in small controlled movements and lower back slowly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Combines deep breathing with shoulder mobility to promote relaxation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand or sit tall with arms at sides. 2. Inhale and raise both arms overhead until comfortable. 3. Exhale and lower the arms back to the sides with control.
Safety cue: Coordinate breath with the raise exhaling on the lift and keep shoulders down

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and improves trunk rotation control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands on hips or across chest. 2. Rotate the torso a small amount to one side keeping hips still. 3. Return to center and rotate a small amount to the other side. 4. Continue alternating with controlled movement and a neutral spine.
Safety cue: Rotate from the upper spine with hips square and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic balance and forward reach confidence without stepping
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge slightly at the hips. 2. Reach one arm forward while shifting weight slightly but keep feet planted. 3. Return the arm and repeat with the other arm as if walking without stepping.
Safety cue: Reach forward with a tall neutral spine and control each movement without stepping

Health benefit: Improves ankle range of motion and proprioception through controlled movements
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with one leg extended or supported and the other foot free. 2. Lift the foot slightly and use the big toe to trace the letters of the alphabet in the air. 3. Reverse direction or switch feet and repeat at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Trace the alphabet with controlled ankle motion keeping the foot relaxed and supported

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and supports hip extension mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall near the edge of a chair with feet flat and hands for support. 2. Press one heel into the floor and extend the same-side hip back to lift the foot slightly. 3. Squeeze the glute briefly at the top and keep the torso steady. 4. Lower the foot back down and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the pelvis level and drive the movement from the glutes with core engaged

Health benefit: Improves lower back and core stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft. 2. Tuck the tailbone and draw the belly in to flatten the lower back. 3. Hold the tilt for a few seconds while breathing normally. 4. Release to neutral and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and tilt the pelvis using the low abdominals

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and loosens upper back muscles
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and relax your arms by your sides. 2. Roll both shoulders up
Safety cue: back
MET value: and down in a smooth arc. 3. Reverse the direction with slow controlled rolls. 4. Keep breathing steadily throughout the movement.
is_not_suitable_for: Roll the shoulders slowly with control keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Promotes neck alignment and reduces forward head posture
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall with the chin level. 2. Draw the chin straight back to create a double chin without tilting the head. 3. Hold briefly
Safety cue: relax to neutral
is_not_suitable_for: Retract the chin straight back keeping eyes level and spine neutral

Health benefit: Increases spinal flexibility and stretches the lower back
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the edge of a chair with feet flat and hands on your thighs. 2. Exhale and round the spine
Safety cue: curling the chest toward the thighs. 3. Inhale and return to an upright tall spine.
MET value: Exhale as you round forward and hinge from the hips with the pelvis anchored

Health benefit: Maintains wrist range of motion and eases joint stiffness
Steps to perform: 1. Extend one arm and form a loose fist with the hand. 2. Rotate the wrist in slow circles clockwise for several repetitions. 3. Reverse the circles counterclockwise and switch hands.
Safety cue: Circle the wrists slowly with relaxed forearms and shoulders down

Health benefit: Enhances rib cage expansion and coordinates breath with movement
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms at your sides. 2. Inhale deeply while sweeping both arms up overhead. 3. Exhale while sweeping the arms down and forward to the starting position. 4. Coordinate steady breathing with each sweep.
Safety cue: Inhale to sweep the arms overhead and exhale as you lower with control

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and hold a stable surface for balance. 2. Lift one leg straight out to the side without tilting the torso. 3. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift the leg from the outer hip without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Enhances lateral neck mobility and movement range
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed. 2. Place one hand on the side of your head and gently pull your ear toward your shoulder. 3. Keep the opposite shoulder down and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and thoracic extension
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. 2. Raise both arms overhead and interlace fingers or turn palms up. 3. Reach upward through your fingertips and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Engage your core and reach upward without overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Encourages upright posture and spinal alignment
Steps to perform: 1. Sit at the edge of a chair with feet flat and sit bones grounded. 2. Sit tall and reach the crown of your head upward to lengthen the spine. 3. Maintain length as you hold and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral chin and lengthen the spine as you inhale

Health benefit: Gently increases quadriceps flexibility and knee joint range
Steps to perform: 1. Stand beside a chair or wall and place one hand on it for support. 2. Bend the knee of the working leg and bring the heel toward your buttock. 3. Grasp the ankle lightly and keep knees close and hips level. 4. Pull gently a shallow distance and hold the position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets posterior shoulder and upper back mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Bring one arm across your chest at shoulder height. 2. Use the opposite hand to press the arm near the elbow toward your chest. 3. Keep the shoulders down and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep the torso square and pull the arm across the chest with a straight spine

Health benefit: Improves core strength and spinal stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees soft. 2. Brace your core by drawing the belly button toward the spine. 3. Hold the brace while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Brace the core and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances calf strength and ankle stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands on hips or a support. 2. Shift weight into the balls of your feet and lift both heels. 3. Balance on your toes with control. 4. Lower your heels back down slowly.
Safety cue: Lift heels slowly and keep weight centered over the midfoot

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and balance endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall with palms on the wall at shoulder height. 2. Step one foot back and lift the opposite knee in a marching motion. 3. Hold the lifted knee and keep an upright torso. 4. Lower the knee and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the wall and lift the knee with control

Health benefit: Improves upper body reach and postural control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms extended forward at shoulder height. 2. Shift weight onto one leg while reaching both arms overhead or forward. 3. Hold the balance and return to neutral
Safety cue: then switch legs.
MET value: Keep hips level and reach arms slowly without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Enhances proprioceptive awareness by challenging sensory reliance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand near a sturdy surface and place one hand lightly on it. 2. Close your eyes and stand tall with feet hip-width. 3. Maintain the supported stance and reopen your eyes when ready.
Safety cue: Stand with light hand support and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Enhances overall balance and lower limb stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and knees slightly bent. 2. Engage your core and relax your shoulders. 3. Lift one foot a few inches off the ground or shift weight slightly. 4. Hold the position
Safety cue: then switch sides or lower the foot.
MET value: Stand tall with knees slightly bent and weight evenly distributed

Health benefit: Improves shoulder endurance and postural stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart. 2. Place forearms on the wall at shoulder height and elbows bent. 3. Press into the wall
Safety cue: draw shoulders down
MET value: and hold the position. 4. Maintain the hold with steady breathing.
is_not_suitable_for: Press your entire back into the wall and keep shoulders down and back

Health benefit: Builds triceps endurance for improved arm function
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright with a weight held in both hands behind the head. 2. Keep elbows pointing upward and upper arms close to the ears. 3. Extend the forearms upward until the arms are straight. 4. Lower the weight slowly back behind the head with control.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to your head and move only at the elbow joint

Health benefit: Develops upper back strength and scapular control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with knees slightly bent and hold a resistance band or towel anchored at chest height. 2. Pull elbows back and squeeze the shoulder blades together without moving the torso. 3. Hold the contracted position and maintain steady tension.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and hold without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and low impact cardiovascular activity

Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart. 2. Place palms on the wall at chest height and press firmly. 3. Hold the press while engaging your core and breathe.
Safety cue: Brace core and press evenly through both palms keeping spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances cross-body coordination and motor pattern integration for improved balance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. 2. Lift your right knee and bring your left elbow toward it. 3. Lower and return to standing. 4. Repeat on the opposite side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall and move opposite arm and leg with controlled rhythm

Health benefit: Promotes hip extension range of motion and quadriceps lengthening
Steps to perform: 1. Kneel with your right knee on the floor and left foot forward in a lunge. 2. Tuck your pelvis slightly and shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the right hip. 3. Keep your torso upright and engage your core. 4. Switch legs and repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Posteriorly tilt the pelvis and gently shift hips forward while keeping torso upright

Health benefit: Enhances ankle stability and dynamic balance during gait
Steps to perform: 1. Stand at one end of a straight line or imaginary line. 2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe each step. 3. Walk slowly along the line while focusing on steady balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular retractors and improves shoulder posture and stability
Steps to perform: 1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms by your sides forming a W. 2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your hands and chest slightly off the ground. 3. Hold the lifted position while keeping elbows bent and palms down. 4. Lower slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze shoulder blades down and together as you lift

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor power and dynamic balance while enhancing coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with hands up for balance and weight on your supporting leg. 2. Lift the knee of the kicking leg toward hip height. 3. Extend the foot forward in a controlled low kick. 4. Retract the foot and place it back
Safety cue: then repeat on the other leg.
MET value: Brace core and extend the kicking leg with control without leaning back

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder stability through controlled protraction and retraction
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall with hands on the wall at shoulder height and arms straight. 2. Keep arms straight and squeeze shoulder blades together to lower your chest slightly toward the wall. 3. Push through your hands to spread the shoulder blades apart and return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep arms straight and move only through the scapula by protracting and retracting with control

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic extension and shoulder mobility while gently opening the chest
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands and knees with hips above knees and hands forward. 2. Walk your hands forward and lower your chest toward the floor while keeping hips raised. 3. Rest your forehead or chin on the mat and breathe while holding the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked above knees and reach forward while maintaining a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops single leg posterior chain strength and balance with improved hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform: 1. Stand holding a stable support with one hand and shift weight onto one leg. 2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the standing knee and extend the other leg back. 3. Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in the standing hamstring while keeping your back flat. 4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and enhances posterior chain activation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or a support. 2. Shift weight onto one leg and keep the standing knee soft. 3. Lift the other leg straight back without bending the knee. 4. Lower the lifted leg with control and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and hinge from the glutes with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet together and arms relaxed at sides. 2. Step laterally to the right while swinging both arms across the body. 3. Step back to center and swing arms out to the sides. 4. Repeat the step and swing to the left.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and control the arm swing with your core

Health benefit: Enhances upper back mobility and posture
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and hands behind the head. 2. Tuck the chin slightly and brace the core. 3. Open the chest and arch the upper back over the chair back. 4. Return to neutral with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and open the chest while initiating movement from the upper back

Health benefit: Increases elbow and triceps flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Stand or sit tall and raise one arm overhead. 2. Bend the raised elbow and reach the hand down the back. 3. Use the opposite hand to gently press the elbow. 4. Hold the stretch and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Keep the neck long and pull the elbow gently toward the head without forcing

Health benefit: Improves core engagement and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Start on knees and forearms with elbows under shoulders. 2. Step feet back and keep knees on the floor with a straight line from head to knees. 3. Engage the core and avoid sagging hips. 4. Hold the position for the desired time while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep a straight line from knees to head

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder range of motion and spinal elongation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at sides. 2. Reach one arm overhead while slightly leaning to the opposite side. 3. Lower that arm and repeat on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Exhale as you reach up and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances wrist mobility and joint lubrication
Steps to perform: 1. Extend arms in front at shoulder height with palms down. 2. Make slow circular motions with the wrists in one direction. 3. Reverse the direction and repeat the circles the same number of times.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the full range and control the motion from the wrist

Health benefit: Opens hips and encourages gentle lower back relaxation
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Reach hands toward the outside of the knees or shins. 3. Gently pull knees toward the armpits while keeping the spine on the floor. 4. Hold the position and breathe deeply for several breaths.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back gently grounded and move with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor control and dynamic balance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg. 2. Bend the other knee and grab the shin or behind the thigh with both hands. 3. Pull the knee toward the chest while keeping the standing leg slightly bent and balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets inner thighs and glutes to strengthen lower body
Steps to perform: 1. Stand wide with toes turned outward and feet wider than shoulder-width. 2. Lower hips back and down until thighs reach near parallel to the floor. 3. Keep chest up and knees tracking over the toes. 4. Push through the heels to return to standing.
Safety cue: Drive hips back
MET value: keep chest tall and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances hand eye coordination and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with one foot slightly forward and hands raised at chin level. 2. Strike the speed bag using loose wrists in rapid alternating taps. 3. Keep elbows close and wrists relaxed while maintaining a steady rhythm. 4. Continue small circular motions with consistent light taps.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and control the circular motion from the wrists

Health benefit: Promotes hip and groin flexibility and relaxation
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back and bring the soles of your feet together. 2. Let the knees fall open to the sides in a butterfly position. 3. Rest your arms by your sides and relax the hips.
Safety cue: Draw the belly toward the spine and keep the lower back gently on the mat

Health benefit: Strengthens shin muscles and improves ankle dorsiflexion
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and lift your toes off the ground so only heels contact the floor. 2. Take small steps forward walking on your heels. 3. Maintain an upright posture and controlled steps.
Safety cue: Keep toes pointed up and maintain an upright posture

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip stability and glute engagement
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips. 2. Step one foot diagonally behind into a shallow curtsy while bending both knees slightly. 3. Keep your torso upright and your front knee aligned over the ankle. 4. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over the ankle and torso upright

Health benefit: Improves coordination and activates hip flexors and core
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a low step with feet hip-width apart. 2. Lift one foot and tap the toe onto the step
Safety cue: then lower it back down. 3. Alternate feet rapidly while keeping light
is_not_suitable_for: Control each tap with a steady tempo and keep hips level

Steps to perform: 1. Sit or lie with one leg extended and the foot relaxed. 2. Pull the toes and foot up toward the shin using the ankle muscles. 3. Lower the foot back to neutral with control.
Safety cue: Pull toes toward the shin with controlled movement and keep the ankle steady

Health benefit: Lengthens hamstring muscles and improves posterior chain flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall on the edge of a chair and extend one leg straight. 2. Flex the extended foot and hinge forward from the hips toward the toes. 3. Keep the spine long and reach toward the foot. 4. Return to upright and switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and hinge at the hips to reach toward the shin

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances balance during gait

Safety cue: controlled steps. 3. Keep heels elevated and maintain an upright torso.

Health benefit: Enhances spinal stability and shoulder control
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees. 2. Extend one arm forward until it is parallel to the floor. 3. Hold the lifted arm and keep the spine neutral. 4. Lower the arm with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you lift the arm

Steps to perform: 1. Sit with both knees bent at 90 degrees and shins stacked in front of you. 2. Place hands on the floor for support and brace your core. 3. Rotate your hips to lift the top knee and switch legs so the other shin becomes on top. 4. Continue switching sides with controlled movement.

Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg. 2. Bend the opposite knee and grasp the ankle or foot behind you. 3. Pull the foot toward the glutes and keep the knees close together.

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and rhythmic movement patterning
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and step one foot diagonally to the side. 2. Cross the opposite foot behind the first foot and step laterally again. 3. Cross the first foot in front and continue stepping laterally with rhythm. 4. Repeat the pattern moving smoothly in the same direction.

MET value: keep the stepping knee tracking over the foot and chest upright

Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and hold onto a support for balance. 2. Bend one knee and curl the heel toward the glutes slowly. 3. Lower the foot with control and repeat on the other leg.

Return the hand to the floor and drop the hips toward the front heel. 4. Step the feet together and switch sides with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases shoulder external rotation and upper back flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall and raise one arm overhead then bend the elbow to reach down the back. 2. Reach the opposite arm behind the lower back and try to clasp the fingers. 3. Hold the stretch and then switch arm positions.

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and single leg balance capacity

Safety cue: then switch sides.
is_not_suitable_for: hips squared and lift the leg slowly with control

Health benefit: Builds chest strength while activating glutes and posterior chain
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent
Safety cue: feet flat
MET value: and a weight held over your chest. 2. Drive hips upward into a bridge so your torso forms a straight line from knees to shoulders. 3. Lower the weight to your chest while keeping hips lifted. 4. Press the weight up until arms are extended and maintain the bridge.
is_not_suitable_for: Brace your core and keep a neutral spine while pressing the weight

Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder width and arms relaxed at your sides. 2. March in place by lifting each knee toward hip height while keeping feet wide. 3. Drive opposite arms in sync with the stepping motion.
Safety cue: Walk with an upright torso and take controlled short steps

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and joint awareness through controlled circular motion
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on your hips. 2. Rotate your hips in a large controlled circle in one direction. 3. Reverse the direction and repeat the hip circles.

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and inner thigh flexibility and seated range of motion

Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and avoid rounding

Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and soles of the feet together in a frog shape. 2. Press through your heels and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips into a bridge. 3. Lower the hips back down with control and repeat.

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and activates lower leg muscles for functional movement

Safety cue: then switch sides.
MET value: Hinge back from the hips keeping hips level and controlled

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and anterior torso opening with low intensity
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your stomach with forearms on the floor and elbows under shoulders. 2. Press forearms into the floor and lift your chest to create a gentle backbend. 3. Keep hips and legs relaxed on the floor and hold the pose.

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance while strengthening hamstrings and hip stabilizers
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall with one fingertip lightly touching it for balance. 2. Shift weight onto one leg and hinge forward at the hips while lifting the opposite leg straight back. 3. Keep a neutral spine and reach toward the floor with the hands or a weight. 4. Drive hips forward to return to standing and switch legs.

Health benefit: Enhances triceps strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place hands in a diamond shape under your chest. 2. Step back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels. 3. Bend elbows and lower your chest toward the wall keeping elbows close. 4. Push through your palms to return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and elbows tracking close to the ribs

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and pelvic control
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with arms out to the sides and legs together. 2. Lift legs toward the ceiling as high as comfortable. 3. Lower legs to one side and smoothly swing them to the other side like a pendulum.

Health benefit: Increases core rotational mobility and oblique engagement
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall on a chair and hold the seat for support. 2. Lift both knees and bring shins parallel to the floor. 3. Rotate knees together from side to side like windshield wipers.

Health benefit: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility

Sweep your arms out to the sides and overhead toward your ears in a controlled arc. 4. Return your arms to your sides slowly.
Safety cue: Keep the forehead anchored and move the shoulders slowly

Health benefit: Supports thoracic extension and shoulder mobility during reaching movements

Health benefit: Improves scapular upward rotation and shoulder blade control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place forearms on the wall at shoulder height. 2. Press your forearms into the wall and draw your shoulder blades down and together. 3. Slide your forearms upward along the wall as high as comfortable while keeping contact. 4. Lower your forearms back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep forearms and wrists contacting the wall and initiate movement from the scapulae

Health benefit: Enhances biceps and anterior shoulder flexibility for improved range

Health benefit: Builds hip flexor endurance and core stability during isometric hold
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and engage your core. 2. Lift one knee up to hip level and hold it there with control. 3. Maintain balance while holding the knee at hip height.

Health benefit: Improves core stability and shoulder coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Assume a kneeling plank with hands under shoulders and knees on the ground. 2. Brace your core and keep hips stable and square. 3. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder while avoiding hip rotation. 4. Return the hand and repeat on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while tapping each shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and low impact cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform: 1. Stand feet together with arms at your sides. 2. Step one foot out to the side while sweeping both arms out and overhead. 3. Step the same foot back to center while lowering arms to your sides. 4. Repeat the movement alternating sides at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the arm sweep through the full range

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and posture alignment
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and eyes forward. 2. Push your chin straight forward without tilting the head. 3. Pull your chin straight back to align the ears over the shoulders and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the chin slightly tucked and perform slow controlled neck protraction and retraction

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the floor and open your legs into a wide V with toes pointing up. 2. Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips with a flat back. 3. Reach both hands toward one foot while keeping the opposite leg active. 4. Return to center and repeat the reach toward the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a long spine and hinge forward from the hips

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle proprioception

Safety cue: heel to toe. 2. Lift your arms out to the sides and focus on a fixed point. 3. Shift weight slowly forward and backward to challenge balance. 4. Switch lead foot and repeat the sequence.
Tags: and engage the core to control balance

Health benefit: Builds unilateral glute strength and pelvic stability

Squeeze the glute of the supporting leg at the top. 4. Lower hips back down with control and repeat before switching legs.

is_not_suitable_for: and squeeze the glute at the top

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and ankle stability

Safety cue: landing softly on both feet with knees bent. 3. Immediately hop the same small distance to the left and continue alternating.

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or lie down with the leg extended and the foot relaxed. 2. Point your toes away from you to perform plantarflexion. 3. Pull your toes back toward your shin to perform dorsiflexion and repeat.
Safety cue: Control the motion and move the foot deliberately while keeping the lower leg stable

Health benefit: Enhances spinal rotation and hip flexibility

Safety cue: then switch legs.

is_not_suitable_for: Keep hips stacked and reach through the top arm to lengthen the side body

Steps to perform: 1. Pretend a straight line on the floor and place one foot directly in front of the other. 2. Keep eyes forward
Safety cue: shoulders relaxed

is_not_suitable_for: Keep shoulders over wrists and maintain a neutral spine while hovering knees

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and running mechanics
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and engage your core. 2. Drive one knee up toward the chest using the hip flexors. 3. Lower the foot back down with control and repeat on the other side.

Health benefit: Enhances rib cage mobility and postural alignment
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands resting on the rib cage. 2. Gently shift the rib cage to one side without moving the hips. 3. Return to center and repeat the movement to the other side.

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and range of motion
Steps to perform: 1. Extend one arm in front with palm facing down. 2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers back toward the forearm. 3. Hold the stretch and then switch to the other wrist.

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated limb control

Keep your lower back pressed gently into the mat and maintain core tension. 4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Press the low back into the floor and move slowly with controlled breathing

Safety cue: Rotate through the torso while keeping hips stable and shoulders relaxed

Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and imagine a clock behind you. 2. Reach one arm back and across toward the 5 o'clock position while rotating your torso. 3. Return the arm to neutral and then reach the opposite arm toward the 7 o'clock position. 4. Maintain an upright posture and move with controlled motions.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and reach posteriorly with control

Safety cue: Stack the shoulder over the forearm and keep hips lifted in a straight line

Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and standing balance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with your back and shoulders against a wall and feet hip-width apart. 2. Step the feet slightly forward so knees are over the toes. 3. Slide down the wall by bending the knees to a shallow squat. 4. Press through the heels and straighten to standing.
Safety cue: Keep weight in the heels and chest lifted with knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral hip control
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your side with legs straight and stacked. 2. Support your head with your bottom arm and keep hips squared. 3. Lift the top leg upward in a controlled motion. 4. Lower the leg slowly back to the start.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift the leg with slow controlled movement from the hip

Health benefit: Enhances core rotational control and low back mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Sit near the edge of a chair with knees bent and feet off the floor. 2. Lean back slightly keeping the spine long and brace the core. 3. Rotate the knees together to one side and then to the other like wipers.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move the legs slowly without jerking

Health benefit: Improves calf strength and ankle push off power
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with one knee bent and the forefoot supported by your hands or a band. 2. Place your hands on the ball of the foot to provide resistance. 3. Press the toes and forefoot down as if pointing the foot. 4. Hold the press and then relax the foot back to neutral.
Safety cue: Stabilize the ankle and press through the ball of the foot with controlled force

Health benefit: Strengthens peroneal muscles and enhances lateral ankle stability
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with the knee bent and the foot relaxed on the floor. 2. Place the inside edge of the foot against a stable object or your hand. 3. Push the sole outward against the resistance without moving the ankle.
Safety cue: Keep the ankle steady and resist outward without lifting the heel

Health benefit: Supports foot intrinsic strength and improves arch support
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with both feet flat on the floor and toes and heels touching the surface. 2. Keep toes and heel planted and lift only the arch of the foot. 3. Hold the lifted arch briefly and then relax it back down.
Safety cue: Shorten the foot by lifting the arch while keeping toes relaxed and the heel grounded

Health benefit: Promotes balance and reinforces hip and leg weight transfer
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes pointing forward. 2. Shift your weight to one leg by bending that knee and moving your hips toward it. 3. Return to center and repeat the shift to the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly with hips level and knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Enhances deep core engagement and spinal support during movement
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Draw your belly button gently toward your spine to engage the core. 3. Maintain a neutral spine and keep the breath steady while holding the brace.
Safety cue: Exhale and draw the belly gently toward the spine while keeping the low back neutral

Health benefit: Improves pelvic mobility awareness and coordinated pelvic control
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat
Safety cue: imagine a clock on your pelvis. 2. Tilt the pelvis gently toward 12 o'clock to perform a posterior tilt. 3. Tilt the pelvis toward 6 o'clock for an anterior tilt and then toward 3 and 9 o'clock for lateral shifts. 4. Return to the neutral center between each movement.
MET value: Use small controlled pelvic motions and keep the low back gently contacting the mat

Health benefit: Improves neck posture and deep cervical flexor activation
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and head resting on the floor. 2. Tuck your chin and slide your head straight back along the surface without lifting it. 3. Hold the retracted position briefly then relax back to neutral.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin and keep the neck long with shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and upper back movement efficiency
Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands crossed over your chest. 2. Rotate your upper back to one side while keeping your hips facing forward. 3. Glide the thoracic spine back to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and glide from the thoracic spine while keeping the lumbar stable

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and posterior chain endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with one arm at your side and the palm facing backward. 2. Press the back of your hand gently against a wall or immovable surface without moving the arm. 3. Hold the contraction for a short count then relax.
Safety cue: Hold the extension with scapulae depressed and torso steady

Health benefit: Encourages scapular mobility and controlled shoulder range of motion

Safety cue: sliding your hands away while keeping the elbows on the table. 3. Return your hands to the starting position with control.
MET value: Slide the arms with elbows tracking under shoulders and chest open

Health benefit: Promotes elbow alignment and forearm muscle engagement
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand with your elbow bent and the upper arm resting against your side. 2. Squeeze the elbow into your side using the muscles around the shoulder and hold. 3. Release the squeeze and reset for the next repetition.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to your sides and squeeze evenly without shrugging

Health benefit: Increases biceps tension and upper arm stability
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with your arm bent at 90 degrees and palm facing up. 2. Place your other hand or a fixed object against your palm to provide resistance. 3. Press the hand into the resistance without allowing the arm to move. 4. Hold the contraction then slowly relax.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep the elbow fixed while contracting the biceps

Health benefit: Improves forearm rotational control and wrist coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with your forearm supported on a table and your elbow bent to 90 degrees. 2. Rotate your palm from facing up to facing down while keeping the forearm on the surface. 3. Return the palm to facing up with control.
Safety cue: Anchor the forearm and rotate slowly with controlled wrist movement

Safety cue: Keep hips square and ribs down as you lean from the chest into the stretch

Slowly slide your arms upward along the wall while maintaining contact. 4. Slide the arms back down to the starting position with control.

Steps to perform: 1. Sit tall at the edge of a chair with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs. 2. Inhale and reach both arms overhead while lengthening through the spine. 3. Exhale and lower your arms while maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Reach tall with a braced core and extend through the full spine

Safety cue: then lower it and lift the other. 3. Swing your arms and keep a rapid
is_not_suitable_for: Maintain upright posture and brace your core while controlling each rapid knee lift

Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your side with hips stacked and knees bent about 90 degrees. 2. Keep feet together and maintain a stable pelvis. 3. Lift the top knee upward while keeping the feet touching. 4. Lower the knee with control and repeat
Safety cue: then switch sides.

Steps to perform: 1. Sit with one leg extended and the ankle unsupported. 2. Move the ankle to "write" the letters of the alphabet with your big toe. 3. Repeat the sequence with the other ankle.

Steps to perform: 1. Kneel on a mat with knees spread wide and big toes touching. 2. Sit back toward your heels and lower your torso between your thighs. 3. Extend your arms forward and rest your forehead on the mat. 4. Relax your shoulders and hold the position.

Keep your hips steady and return the top hand to the starting position. 4. Repeat the rotation slowly for the prescribed reps.

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder endurance and coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands in light fists at chin level. 2. Bend your knees slightly and shift weight into a quick
Safety cue: rhythmic stance. 3. Throw small
MET value: fast punches to the midsection with alternating hands. 4. Keep your hands returning quickly to guard after each punch.
is_not_suitable_for: Stabilize the shoulder blades and keep elbows slightly bent with controlled punches

Health benefit: Promotes gentle shoulder joint mobility and fluid movement
Steps to perform: 1. Lean forward and support your non-working hand on a table or chair. 2. Let the working arm hang relaxed and make small clockwise circles from the shoulder. 3. Reverse the direction and make small counterclockwise circles for the same time.

is_not_suitable_for: and make small controlled circles from the shoulder

Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright with your elbow bent to 90 degrees and a towel or strap under your forearm. 2. Press your forearm inward against a fixed object without moving the shoulder. 3. Hold the contraction firmly and then relax the pressure.

Safety cue: upward punch into the opponent�s body with your lead hand. 3. Return your hand to guard and repeat with the rear hand. 4. Move your feet lightly between punches to maintain balance.

Keep your body straight and lower your chest toward the wall by bending the elbows. 3. Push back to the start position using your chest and triceps while keeping knuckles on the wall.
Safety cue: Keep wrists neutral and shoulders aligned over the knuckles with core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain activation and thoracic extension control
Steps to perform: 1. Lie face down with arms resting alongside your body and palms down. 2. Squeeze your glutes and gently lift your chest a few inches while keeping the arms on the floor. 3. Hold the lifted position briefly and then lower back down.

Health benefit: Encourages lateral mobility and light cardiovascular movement

Safety cue: rhythmic pace.

Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and relax your shoulders. 2. Shift your weight slowly onto one foot and lift the other foot a few inches while maintaining balance. 3. Place the lifted foot down heel first and transfer your weight smoothly onto it. 4. Repeat the movement slowly with the opposite foot
Safety cue: keeping a calm
is_not_suitable_for: Transfer weight slowly with controlled steps and maintain a tall upright posture

Steps to perform: 1. Sit on a mat with knees bent and hands placed behind your hips for support. 2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the floor to form a V with torso and thighs. 3. Extend your legs to a comfortable angle and keep your core engaged. 4. Hold the position while keeping your chest lifted and breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand near a wall with feet hip-width apart and hands relaxed at your sides. 2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot off the floor. 3. Reach the free hand forward to touch the wall lightly and maintain balance.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and knee slightly bent to maintain controlled balance

Health benefit: Strengthens hip adductors and supports pelvic stability
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat on the floor and knees slightly apart. 2. Squeeze your knees together until they gently touch. 3. Hold the squeeze briefly and then release slowly to the start position.
Safety cue: Sit tall and squeeze through the inner thighs while keeping spine neutral

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and glute activation
Steps to perform: 1. Kneel on one knee with the other foot planted forward in a lunge stance. 2. Shift weight into the front leg and lift your torso upright. 3. Pulse by bending and straightening the front knee a few inches. 4. Keep your core engaged and repeat for the desired number of pulses before switching sides.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over the ankle and pulse with control

Health benefit: Builds ankle dorsiflexion strength and improves gait mechanics
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and toes lifted off the floor. 2. Shift weight onto your heels so the toes remain raised. 3. Walk forward a short distance while keeping toes elevated and posture upright.
Safety cue: Keep toes lifted and walk with controlled even steps

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles while challenging single leg balance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand next to a stable surface and place one hand lightly on it for support. 2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot off the floor. 3. Rise onto the ball of the standing foot by lifting the heel as high as comfortable. 4. Lower slowly back to flat and repeat for the desired reps
Safety cue: then switch legs.
MET value: Keep weight centered over the midfoot and rise slowly through the heel

Health benefit: Improves calf flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and loop a towel around the ball of the foot. 2. Keep the knee straight and gently pull the towel toward you until you feel a stretch in the calf. 3. Hold the stretch for the desired time
Safety cue: then switch legs.
MET value: Keep spine long and dorsiflex the ankle by pulling the towel with control

Health benefit: Develops core stability and coordinated trunk limb movement
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent
Safety cue: feet flat

Safety cue: moving the top arm across your body and toward the opposite side. 4. Return the arm to the start position with controlled movement.

MET value: Keep chin tucked and neck long while retracting the head

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and rotation
Steps to perform: 1. Begin on hands and knees with one hand behind your head. 2. Rotate your torso and lift the elbow of the top arm toward the ceiling. 3. Open the chest and follow the movement with your eyes. 4. Return the elbow toward the supporting hand and repeat.
Safety cue: Anchor hips over knees and rotate through the thoracic spine with a stable core

Health benefit: Strengthens upper trapezius and supports shoulder elevation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand or sit upright with arms at your sides. 2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears. 3. Lower the shoulders fully and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift and lower the shoulders with control while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and finger range of motion
Steps to perform: 1. Stand side-on to a wall with fingertips touching at waist height. 2. Slowly "crawl" your fingers sideways up the wall without moving your torso. 3. Stop at a comfortable height with the arm straight. 4. Reverse the motion to walk your fingers back down.
Safety cue: Stand tall and crawl your fingers along the wall using scapular movement

Health benefit: Builds rotator cuff endurance and stabilizes the shoulder joint
Steps to perform: 1. Stand in a doorway with elbow bent 90� and forearm across your abdomen. 2. Place the back of your hand against the doorframe. 3. Push outward against the frame without letting the elbow move. 4. Hold the press for a few seconds
Safety cue: then relax.
MET value: Keep the elbow pinned to your side and press outward without letting the shoulder hike

Health benefit: Improves forearm rotational mobility and functional wrist control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with elbow bent and forearm supported on a table
Safety cue: thumb pointing up. 2. Rotate the forearm to turn the palm up (supination). 3. Rotate the forearm to turn the palm down (pronation) and repeat.

Health benefit: Increases wrist and forearm flexibility for improved reaching tasks
Steps to perform: 1. Place palms together at chest level in a prayer position. 2. Keep palms pressed and slowly lower your hands toward your waist. 3. Maintain the pressure as the wrists bend backward. 4. Hold briefly
Safety cue: then release the hands.

Steps to perform: 1. Lie face down with arms extended out to the sides in a T position
Safety cue: palms down. 2. Keep the neck neutral and squeeze the shoulder blades together. 3. Lift the arms a few inches off the ground while keeping elbows straight. 4. Lower the arms back down with control and repeat.

Slide down just enough to create a shallow bend in the knees while keeping your back against the wall. 3. Hold the position with core engaged and weight in your heels. 4. Push through your heels to slide back up to standing.

Safety cue: feet flat hip-width

is_not_suitable_for: Drive hips up and keep the pelvis stable as you alternate legs

Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the floor with both knees bent at 90 degrees so one thigh faces forward and the other faces to the side. 2. Sit tall and hinge slightly forward from the hips to create space for rotation. 3. Shift your hips to rotate both legs into the opposite 90/90 position while keeping your spine tall. 4. Pause briefly
Safety cue: then return to the starting position or switch again.

Health benefit: Enhances balance and ankle strength to support confident walking mechanics
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and focus on a straight line ahead. 2. Take a step and place your heel down first
Safety cue: rolling forward onto the toes. 3. Continue forward with small controlled steps while keeping upright posture.

Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand with feet flat and toes relaxed. 2. Actively spread all toes apart as wide as possible without curling. 3. Hold briefly
Safety cue: then relax and repeat.

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and relaxation of the back and hip muscles
Steps to perform: 1. Kneel on the floor with big toes touching and knees wide or together as comfortable. 2. Sit back toward your heels and lower your torso forward until your forehead rests on the mat. 3. Extend your arms forward or alongside your body and relax into the position.

Safety cue: Keep neck long and chin tucked while gently guiding your head toward the shoulder

Safety cue: Keep ribs down and move slowly from the shoulder joint with controlled small circles

Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens core and shoulder stabilizers with lower impact on wrists

Keep the torso upright and rotate slightly away from the arm to increase the stretch. 4. Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral
is_not_suitable_for: and gently lean forward from the hips

Health benefit: Improves triceps endurance and functional pushing capacity
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the edge of a chair with hands gripping the edge beside your hips. 2. Slide your hips forward slightly and bend the elbows a small amount to lower a few inches. 3. Press through the palms to straighten the arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and hip flexor activation while providing light cardiovascular stimulus
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and lift the right knee while driving the left arm forward. 2. Land softly on the ball of the foot and lower the foot back to the ground. 3. Repeat on the opposite side by lifting the left knee and driving the right arm. 4. Continue alternating with quick
Safety cue: exaggerated marching steps and rhythmic arm swings.

Tuck your pelvis slightly and shift your weight forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the hip. 3. Keep your torso upright and breathe steadily while holding the stretch. 4. Return to the starting position and switch sides.

Safety cue: Keep the knee relaxed and pump the ankle slowly through full range while breathing evenly

Safety cue: to the side
MET value: or to the back. 3. Return the tapped foot to the starting position and keep the standing knee soft. 4. Repeat taps while maintaining balance and a steady core.

Health benefit: Supports arch strength and improves foot stability
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with both feet flat on the floor and knees at hip width. 2. Press your heel and toes down while lifting the midfoot arch upward. 3. Hold the lifted arch briefly and then relax back to the flat foot.

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and encourages posture awareness
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a support and place your hands shoulder-width on the surface. 2. Drop your belly and lift your chest to arch the back while inhaling. 3. Round your back and tuck your chin toward your chest while exhaling.

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and range of motion

Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees soft. 2. Reach both arms forward at chest height and clasp your hands. 3. Rotate your upper torso to the right
Safety cue: sweeping your arms open and looking over your right shoulder. 4. Return to center and repeat to the left.

Safety cue: lower with control

Tags: and place heel to toe with control
