Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly soft. 2. Begin jogging in place with a quick rhythm. 3. Flick each heel up to touch the glute on each step. 4. Pump your arms naturally to maintain momentum.
Safety cue: Maintain upright torso and land softly under your hips

Health benefit: Enhances core stability while adding dynamic cardiovascular challenge
Steps to perform: 1. Place forearms on the floor under your shoulders and extend legs behind you. 2. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels. 3. Jump both feet out wide and then back together in a controlled motion. 4. Maintain steady hips and repeat the jack movement.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep hips level throughout movement

Health benefit: Improves deep neck muscle engagement and posture alignment
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Gently draw your chin straight back toward your throat to create a double chin. 3. Hold the tuck briefly
Safety cue: then relax your head back to the starting position.
MET value: Gently nod chin toward chest and keep shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with your back and heels against the wall and feet hip-width apart. 2. Place elbows and forearms against the wall with hands near shoulder height in a "W". 3. Slide your arms upward into a "Y" while keeping forearms and back against the wall. 4. Lower back to the "W" position with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Press low back gently to wall and retract shoulder blades

Health benefit: Develops lumbar stability and coordination between limbs
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands under shoulders and knees under hips with a neutral neck. 2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until they align with your spine. 3. Hold briefly
Safety cue: then return to the starting position and switch sides.
MET value: Extend opposite arm and leg while keeping neck aligned with spine

Health benefit: Relieves upper neck and shoulder tension through targeted stretching
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall and place one hand behind your back. 2. Turn your head about 45 degrees toward the same side and drop your chin toward your chest. 3. Use the free hand to gently press the back of your head to increase the stretch and hold.
Safety cue: Depress the shoulder on the stretching side and gently guide head forward

Health benefit: Improves proprioception and single leg stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and shift your weight onto one leg. 2. Lift the other foot slightly off the floor and soften the standing knee. 3. Keep eyes open and fix a point ahead to maintain balance
Safety cue: then lower the foot to return.
MET value: Keep hips level and core braced while softening the standing knee

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and upper back muscles for improved posture
Steps to perform: 1. Lie face down with your forehead resting on the floor and arms extended overhead with thumbs up. 2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift the arms off the floor into an "I"
Safety cue: then lower. 3. Move the arms out to the sides into a "T"
MET value: lift by squeezing the shoulder blades
is_not_suitable_for: then lower. 4. Move the arms into a "Y" angle and lift by engaging the upper back
column19: Maintain a neutral neck and initiate movement from the shoulder blades

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and gentle core engagement
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips. 2. Tuck your chin slightly and round your spine a small amount toward the ceiling. 3. Lift your chest a small amount and allow a gentle arch in your lower back. 4. Move slowly between the rounded and arched positions using small controlled motions.
Safety cue: Coordinate slow breaths with gentle pelvic tilts and avoid forcing range

Health benefit: Builds hip abductor strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your arm. 2. Keep the top leg straight and lift it upward from the hip without rotating the pelvis. 3. Lower the leg with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and toes pointing forward while lifting with control

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and functional range of motion
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips. 2. Lift one knee a few inches and begin a controlled circular motion from the hip. 3. Make smooth circles clockwise for several reps. 4. Reverse the circle direction and repeat with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and move from the hip joint

Health benefit: Builds upper body pressing strength with reduced joint load
Steps to perform: 1. Place hands shoulder-width on a stable chair and step feet back into a straight plank line. 2. Keep a straight line from head to heels and brace your core. 3. Bend elbows to lower your chest toward the chair until elbows reach about 90 degrees. 4. Press through the palms to straighten the arms and return to the top.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels

Steps to perform: 1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Press into your forearms and lift hips toward the ceiling into a pike/dolphin position. 3. Hold briefly at the top while keeping shoulders over elbows and core engaged. 4. Lower hips back to forearm plank with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge from shoulders and exhale as hips lift

Health benefit: Strengthens upper forearms and chest while promoting wrist stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at chest height with fingers pointing down toward your feet. 2. Step back into an angled plank so your body forms a straight line from head to heels. 3. Bend elbows to lower your chest toward the wall while keeping palms flat and elbows close to your sides. 4. Push through the palms to straighten the arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to sides and control descent

Health benefit: Increases lower body strength and hip mobility while emphasizing glute activation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes turned out slightly. 2. Keep chest lifted and push hips back as you bend knees to lower into a squat. 3. Drop down until thighs are at least parallel to the floor. 4. Drive through the heels to stand up and squeeze glutes at the top.
Safety cue: Push knees out over toes and sit back into hips

Health benefit: Improves lower abdominal and hip flexor endurance and leg control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit at the edge of a sturdy chair with one foot resting on a low object and the other foot flat on the floor. 2. Keep your torso upright and engage your core. 3. Straighten the leg on the object and lift the foot so the knee rises above the object. 4. Lower the leg with control and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Press lower back into seat and lift with slow controlled breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens the posterior chain and enhances shoulder and core stability

Safety cue: hold the position
is_not_suitable_for: Squeeze glutes and hold hips level without overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Builds shoulder strength and balance while improving proprioception
Steps to perform: 1. Face a wall and place your hands shoulder-width on the floor about a foot from the wall. 2. Walk your feet up the wall until your body forms an incline with hips over shoulders. 3. Keep your arms straight
Safety cue: shoulders packed
MET value: and core engaged while holding the position. 4. Walk your feet down to return to the start when finished.
is_not_suitable_for: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and engage core to prevent sagging

Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and toes slightly turned out. 2. Lower into a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back while keeping your chest up. 3. Drive through your heels to stand and immediately lift onto your toes into a calf raise. 4. Lower your heels back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive knees to track toes and transfer weight smoothly to heels

Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and clasp your hands together in front of you. 2. Rotate your torso and raise the clasped hands diagonally above one shoulder. 3. Swing the clasped hands down and across your body toward the opposite hip with controlled motion. 4. Reverse the movement back to the start or switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate through your torso with braced core and control the descent

Safety cue: then repeat.
MET value: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest upright

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and hand eye coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with one foot slightly forward and knees soft. 2. Raise hands to chin level with elbows bent and wrists loose. 3. Punch rapidly with alternating hands in small
Safety cue: controlled motions. 4. Keep a steady rhythm and return hands to guard between punches.
MET value: Keep a soft bend in knees and maintain a tall neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and footwork
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with knees slightly bent and hips low. 2. Take quick
Safety cue: small steps to the side leading with the foot in that direction. 3. Push off the trailing foot to change direction and keep a steady rhythm.

Health benefit: Increases trunk rotational mobility and core engagement

Rotate your torso to one side until you feel the twist in your obliques. 4. Return to center and rotate to the other side in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Sit tall brace core and rotate from the ribs not the lower back

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder mobility and upper body muscular endurance

Safety cue: alternating which arm crosses on top. 3. Maintain a fast
MET value: controlled tempo and keep shoulders relaxed.
is_not_suitable_for: Keep shoulders down and back control arm speed with steady breathing

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and core control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides. 2. Step your right foot out to the side while lifting both arms straight out to shoulder height to form a T. 3. Step the right foot back to center while lowering your arms to your sides. 4. Repeat the same stepping and arm movement to the left
Safety cue: alternating sides in a controlled rhythm.

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and spinal rotation range
Steps to perform: 1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands lightly behind your head. 2. Rotate your chest and shoulders to the right while keeping your hips facing forward. 3. Return to center and rotate your chest and shoulders to the left.
Safety cue: Sit tall and brace your core rotate from the thoracic spine keeping hips stable

Safety cue: keep knees close together
is_not_suitable_for: Keep knees together and pull heel to glute without arching lower back

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and balance control
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees. 2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg back until both are parallel to the floor. 3. Pull your elbow and knee back under your torso toward each other. 4. Immediately extend the arm and leg again
Safety cue: then perform the same sequence on the opposite side.

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Begin on hands and knees with a neutral spine and hands under shoulders. 2. Place your right hand behind your head with your elbow wide and rotate your chest upward toward the ceiling. 3. Rotate your chest down toward the supporting arm

Safety cue: landing heel to toe. 4. Continue taking slow

Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms at your sides. 2. Bend one knee and draw it toward your chest using both hands behind the thigh. 3. Pull the knee toward your chest and hold the position. 4. Release the leg back to the starting position with control.

Safety cue: propping your body on your forearm with elbow under your shoulder. 2. Press into the forearm and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels. 3. Safety cue: then quickly switch legs

Safety cue: rhythmic manner.

Continue crawling with controlled
Safety cue: deliberate steps while maintaining a neutral spine.

Safety cue: then switch sides.

Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart
Safety cue: knees soft
MET value: and hands at waist level. 2. Rotate your torso and drive one elbow across your body at waist height. 3. Retract the elbow and repeat on the other side with a controlled motion. 4. Keep a firm core and alternate strikes at a steady pace.
is_not_suitable_for: Rotate through hips strike with elbows while keeping shoulders relaxed and down

Health benefit: Improves shoulder blade mobility and upper back posture
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall at arm's length and place palms on the wall at shoulder height. 2. Keep elbows straight and draw your shoulder blades down and together. 3. Hold the retracted position briefly while keeping your neck relaxed. 4. Release the scapulae back to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades down and together keeping neck long

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with hands on your hips and weight on one leg. 2. Hinge at the hips and slide your torso forward while lifting the free leg straight back. 3. Keep a neutral spine and a slight bend in the standing knee as you lower. 4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keep back flat and hips level

Health benefit: Promotes spinal stability and coordinated contralateral limb control
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine. 2. Keep your right arm resting by your right side and brace your core. 3. Extend your left leg straight back until it aligns with your torso
Safety cue: keeping hips level. 4. Return the leg to the floor
is_not_suitable_for: Brace core and keep spine neutral as you lift opposite leg

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and promotes gentle spinal articulation
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips. 2. Inhale and lift your chest forward and up to lightly extend the thoracic spine. 3. Exhale and round your upper back
Safety cue: tucking the chin to emphasize thoracic flexion. 4. Move smoothly between the two positions while keeping the movement focused in the upper back.
MET value: Initiate movement from mid back articulating each vertebrae

Health benefit: Teaches proper hip movement and hamstring loading for safe bending
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands reaching toward the floor. 2. Hinge at the hips by pushing them back while maintaining a long
Safety cue: neutral spine. 3. Keep soft knees and lower your hands toward the ground until you feel a hamstring stretch. 4. Drive the hips forward and squeeze the glutes to return to standing.
MET value: Push hips back keep spine long and weight through heels

Health benefit: Builds core stability and improves abdominal muscle control
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Engage your core and glutes to keep hips stable. 3. Draw your right knee toward the floor and tap it lightly
Safety cue: then return to plank. 4. Repeat the movement with the left knee
is_not_suitable_for: Maintain a neutral spine and brace your core before each knee tap

Health benefit: Improves chest and anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a doorway and place one forearm low on the doorframe at about waist height. 2. Step the foot opposite the stretched arm forward until you feel a chest and front-shoulder stretch. 3. Keep your chest lifted and shoulders down while maintaining the stretch. 4. Release
Safety cue: switch arms
MET value: and repeat on the other side.
is_not_suitable_for: Keep hips square and gently retract shoulder blades as you lean forward

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and enhances lateral hip stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and step your right leg diagonally behind your left into a curtsy. 2. Bend both knees and lower until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor. 3. Pulse by making small up-and-down movements with both knees while keeping your torso upright. 4. Return to standing and switch sides to repeat the pulses on the other leg.
Safety cue: Drive hips back keep chest lifted and control small pulses from glutes

Health benefit: Improves balance while enhancing neck mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Stand in a tandem stance with one foot directly in front of the other heel to toe. 2. Slightly bend your knees and engage your core to stabilize your balance. 3. Slowly turn your head to the left
Safety cue: then to the right
MET value: keeping your eyes level. 4. Return your head to center and repeat the head turns while maintaining the stance.
is_not_suitable_for: Stand tall with weight evenly distributed and move head slowly with control

Health benefit: Emphasizes upper chest and shoulder strength development
Steps to perform: 1. Place your feet on a stable elevated surface and position hands shoulder-width on the floor. 2. Brace your core and keep your body in a straight line from heels to head. 3. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor while keeping hips level. 4. Push through your palms to straighten the arms and return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from heels to head and inhale on descent

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and functional balance with assistance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand on one foot with the other leg extended forward and place a chair behind you within reach. 2. Sit back slowly onto the chair by pushing your hips back and keeping the supporting knee aligned over the foot. 3. Tap the chair lightly with your glutes and pause briefly while maintaining balance and a straight torso. 4. Drive through the heel of the supporting foot to stand back up and extend the free leg forward.
Safety cue: Sit back onto the chair gently keeping chest up and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and hip flexor control
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back and lift your shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground into a hollow position. 2. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor and hands by your sides or under your hips for support. 3. Alternate small
Safety cue: rapid up-and-down kicks with both legs while maintaining the hollow shape. 4. Keep movements controlled and avoid letting your lower back arch.
MET value: Brace your core and press lower back into the floor before starting kicks

Health benefit: Develops anterior shoulder strength and improves scapular control
Steps to perform: 1. Place your hands on the floor at hip level with fingers pointing toward your feet and arms straight. 2. Lean your shoulders forward over your hands while keeping your body in a straight plank line. 3. Hold the forward lean using shoulder and core tension and then return to a neutral plank.
Safety cue: Lean from the shoulders with wrists aligned and scapulae protracted

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and improves gait related stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and wear a weighted vest if using extra load. 2. Step forward with one foot and lower your back knee toward the ground until both knees form 90-degree angles. 3. Push through the front heel to stand and bring the back foot forward into the next lunge step. 4. Continue alternating legs while maintaining an upright torso and steady stride.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and front knee tracking over the ankle each step

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal flexion and improves hip and core coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Lie flat with arms overhead and legs extended. 2. Simultaneously lift your torso and legs
Safety cue: reaching your hands to your knees and touching them at the top. 3. Lower back down with control to the starting position.
MET value: Exhale as you lift keeping lower back rounded and ribs pulled down

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and functional mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Kneel on both knees with your torso upright. 2. Place one foot forward flat on the floor with the front knee bent about 90 degrees. 3. Drive through the front heel to stand up to full height. 4. Reverse the motion and return to the kneeling start with control.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and hips forward as you stand

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and enhances elbow extension control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a low wall and place hands shoulder-width on it at hip level. 2. Step your feet back so your body forms a straight line with elbows slightly bent. 3. Bend your elbows to lower your forehead toward the wall while keeping elbows close to your sides. 4. Press through your palms to straighten your elbows and return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to ears and hinge from shoulders

Health benefit: Improves upper body pushing strength and core stability
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a push-up position with hands under shoulders and body straight. 2. Lower your chest to the floor by bending your elbows and then press up to full arm extension. 3. Rotate your torso and reach one arm toward the ceiling while stacking your feet to hold a side plank. 4. Return your hand to the floor
Safety cue: rotate back to center
MET value: and repeat toward the other side on the next rep.
is_not_suitable_for: Brace core and move slowly to avoid hip sag

Health benefit: Increases single leg power and dynamic balance
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a lunge with one foot forward and the other foot back
Safety cue: both knees bent. 2. Explosively jump and switch leg positions in midair. 3. Land softly with the opposite foot forward in a lunge and absorb the impact through hips and knees. 4. Maintain an upright torso and repeat the jump-switch rhythm.
MET value: Land softly with knees tracking toes and absorb with hips

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core engagement and coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor hip-width apart. 2. Engage your core and lower both knees to one side until your heels tap the floor. 3. Use your obliques to bring your knees back to center and then lower them to the other side to tap the floor.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and rotate from the waist

Health benefit: Develops rotational mobility and shoulder stability
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart. 2. Lift your right foot and kick it through to the outside of your right hand while rotating your hips. 3. Return the right foot to plank and repeat the same motion with the left leg. 4. Alternate sides in a controlled
Safety cue: steady rhythm.
MET value: Maintain a neutral spine and initiate rotation from your core

Health benefit: Boosts core endurance and rotational coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Begin in a high plank with hands under shoulders. 2. Drive your right knee toward your left elbow
Safety cue: rotating your hips and torso. 3. Return the right leg to plank and quickly drive the left knee toward the right elbow. 4. Alternate legs at a steady
is_not_suitable_for: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and brace your core

Health benefit: Builds explosive lower body power and vertical jump ability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips. 2. Bend your knees and lower into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor. 3. Explode upward into a vertical jump and land softly back into the squat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Enhances hip power and anaerobic capacity
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hands together at your chest. 2. Drop into a deep squat with your hips low and chest upright. 3. Explode forward or upward into a jump and land softly back into the deep squat.
Safety cue: Drive through hips and absorb landing by bending knees

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the floor with hands slightly behind your hips and knees bent. 2. Lean back slightly
Safety cue: extend your legs straight out
MET value: and then pull your knees back toward your chest. 3. Repeat the extension and tuck motion in a controlled
Tags: Keep lower back pressed to the floor and exhale on contraction

Health benefit: Develops upper back and pulling strength while improving posture
Steps to perform: 1. Lie under a sturdy table and grip the edge with hands wider than shoulder-width. 2. Extend your legs and keep your body straight from head to heels. 3. Pull your chest up toward the table edge by squeezing your shoulder blades. 4. Lower with control to full arm extension.
Safety cue: Keep body in a straight line from head to heels and engage core

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and hip stability enhancing balance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and step one foot back into a reverse lunge. 2. Bend both knees until your front thigh is nearly parallel to the floor. 3. Pulse up and down a few inches while keeping your torso upright. 4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over toes and torso upright

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and hip abductors while enhancing lateral core stability
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on one side and prop yourself on the forearm with elbow under the shoulder. 2. Stack your feet and lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels. 3. Lift your top leg upward while keeping your hips steady. 4. Lower the leg with control and repeat
Safety cue: then switch sides.
MET value: Stack shoulders and hips and lift top leg without dropping hips

Health benefit: Improves hamstring mobility and activates core stabilizers
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and hinge at the hips to place hands on the floor with slightly bent knees. 2. Walk your hands forward until you reach a strong high plank with shoulders over wrists. 3. Hold the plank for the prescribed time while keeping a straight line from head to heels.
Safety cue: Brace core and maintain a neutral spine as you reach plank

Health benefit: Enhances scapular retraction and upper back muscular endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms bent so hands point toward your ears forming a "W." 2. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your shoulder blades to lift your hands and forearms a few inches. 3. Pause while maintaining the squeeze and hold the lifted position. 4. Lower with control to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep neck long

Health benefit: Builds single-leg glute strength and improves hip extension control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with your upper back against a bench and one foot flat on the floor. 2. Extend the other leg straight out and brace your core. 3. Drive your planted heel into the floor and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line. 4. Lower your hips slowly until they hover above the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes to drive hips level while keeping pelvis neutral and spine long

Health benefit: Combines unilateral leg strength with thoracic rotation and core coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with one foot forward and one foot back in a split stance. 2. Lower into a lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees. 3. Rotate your torso toward your front leg while keeping your hips square. 4. Press through the front heel to rise and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes and rotate from thoracic spine

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances ankle stability for balance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand on one foot on the edge of a step or flat surface with the other foot slightly off the ground. 2. Lower your heel down below the step level if possible and hold tension. 3. Raise your heel as high as you can and squeeze your calf
Safety cue: then lower back down with control.
MET value: Rise slowly through ball of foot with controlled descent and neutral hip alignment

Health benefit: Targets obliques and improves dynamic core endurance and control
Steps to perform: 1. Set up in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Rotate your hips to one side and lower them to lightly tap the floor. 3. Return to center and rotate to the other side
Safety cue: repeating the dips with controlled movement.
is_not_suitable_for: hinge only at hips and keep shoulders stacked over wrists

Health benefit: Develops shoulder pressing strength and challenges upper body stability
Steps to perform: 1. Place your feet on a stable chair and hands on the floor shoulder-width apart. 2. Pike your hips up so your body forms an inverted V and your head points toward the floor. 3. Bend your elbows to lower your head toward the floor while keeping your core tight. 4. Press through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the pike position.
Safety cue: Lead with crown of head maintaining a long spine and controlled descent

Health benefit: Enhances single leg strength and balance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand beside a sturdy frame and grip it with the hand nearest the frame
Safety cue: feet hip-width apart. 2. Shift weight onto the working leg and extend the free leg forward with the toes lightly touching the floor. 3. Bend the working knee and sit back into the heel while using the frame to assist balance. 4. Drive through the heel to return to standing and repeat.
MET value: Keep chest upright and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Builds core and hip flexor strength and improves trunk control
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the floor with hands beside hips and fingers pointing forward. 2. Press firmly through the hands and lift your hips off the floor while drawing knees toward the chest. 3. Keep the torso upright and hold the tucked position using shoulder engagement. 4. Lower your hips back down under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and core fully braced

Health benefit: Strengthens biceps and forearm grip
Steps to perform: 1. Lie under a sturdy table and reach up to grasp the table edge with an underhand (supinated) grip shoulder-width apart. 2. Extend your legs and brace your core so your body forms a straight plank from head to heels. 3. Pull your chest toward the table by bending the elbows and squeezing the biceps. 4. Slowly straighten the arms to return to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to sides and retract shoulder blades

Health benefit: Develops hamstring and glute strength for posterior chain resilience
Steps to perform: 1. Kneel with your ankles secured under a stable surface or held by a partner and keep hips extended. 2. Tighten the glutes and hamstrings and maintain a straight line from knee to shoulder. 3. Lean forward from the knees
Safety cue: controlling the descent with your hamstrings as far as you can. 4. Use your hands to catch yourself lightly and push back up to the starting kneeling position.
MET value: Hinge from hips and keep a straight line from head to knees

Health benefit: Enhances upper body strength and muscular control through slow lowering
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Lower your chest toward the floor slowly over 3–5 seconds while keeping elbows close to the body. 3. Lightly touch the floor
Safety cue: then push back up briskly or drop to your knees to reset and repeat.
MET value: Inhale and lower slowly keeping forearms vertical and core braced

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal strength and improves core stability
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. 2. Place your hands by your sides or under your hips for support. 3. Exhale and curl your pelvis up
Safety cue: lifting your hips toward your ribcage. 4. Inhale and slowly lower your hips back down with control.
MET value: Tuck pelvis and lift slowly using your abs keep neck relaxed

Health benefit: Strengthens rear deltoids and upper back to support better posture
Steps to perform: 1. Anchor a resistance band in the doorframe at about eye level and hold the ends with both hands. 2. Step back into a staggered stance with arms extended and palms facing each other. 3. Pull the band toward your face
Safety cue: keeping elbows high and squeezing your shoulder blades. 4. Slowly extend your arms back to the start with control.
MET value: Squeeze shoulder blades together and lead with elbows keep chest proud

Health benefit: Improves full body conditioning and metabolic endurance with low impact
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and bend at the hips to place hands on the floor. 2. Step your feet back one at a time into a high plank position. 3. Step your feet forward one at a time to return them near your hands. 4. Stand up by driving through your heels to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace core as you step each foot back

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and lateral coordination through dynamic plank movement
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Keep your core tight and slightly hop both feet together to the right. 3. Hop your feet back through center and then together to the left. 4. Continue alternating controlled hops while maintaining a stable plank position.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while controlling each small hop

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and core strength while improving lateral mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands and toes with knees bent and hovering a few inches off the floor. 2. Keep your hips low and core engaged with hands under your shoulders. 3. Step your right hand and right foot one step to the right. 4. Follow with your left hand and left foot and continue stepping sideways in a controlled pattern.
Safety cue: Maintain low hips and neutral spine move slowly with opposite hand foot coordination

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and improves core endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the edge of a chair with feet off the floor and hands behind your head. 2. Lean back slightly and bring your right knee toward your chest while twisting your left elbow toward it. 3. Extend the right leg as you lift the left knee and twist your right elbow toward it. 4. Alternate sides rapidly while keeping your core engaged.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and rotate through your torso with controlled speed

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and lower body coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes slightly turned out. 2. Sit into a shallow squat with chest lifted. 3. Swing your right leg across your body and shift weight onto your right foot. 4. Reverse the motion to the left and continue alternating swings.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips keep chest tall and knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Enhances agility and rapid footwork
Steps to perform: 1. Stand in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent and weight on your toes. 2. Jump both feet in toward each other
Safety cue: then immediately jump them back out wide. 3. Repeat the in-out motion rapidly while staying light on your feet.
MET value: Stay light on your toes keep hips low and maintain rhythmic breathing

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness and upper body coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand in a boxing stance with hands up and elbows tucked. 2. Rotate your hips and drive a compact left hook
Safety cue: snapping from the shoulder. 3. Return the left hand and immediately rotate to throw a right hook with the same snap. 4. Continue alternating hooks quickly while maintaining your guard.
MET value: Rotate from your hips keep your guard up and exhale on each punch

Health benefit: Boosts aerobic fitness and full body coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet together and arms extended straight in front at chest height. 2. Jump feet out wide while sweeping your arms out to the sides. 3. Jump feet back together and clap your hands in front
Safety cue: repeating the seal jack motion.
MET value: Land softly with knees slightly bent keep chest lifted and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core strength and rotational stability
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your side and prop your forearm under your shoulder with legs stacked. 2. Lift hips to form a straight line from head to heels and extend the top arm toward the ceiling. 3. Rotate your torso and thread the top arm under your body
Safety cue: reaching through the gap. 4. Reverse the motion to return to the side plank and repeat for reps.
MET value: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you rotate under and reach

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and improves lateral lower body stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and place one hand on a stable support at arm height. 2. Step to the side with one foot and push hips back while bending the stepping knee and keeping the other leg straight. 3. Drive through the bent heel to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge hips back keep chest tall ensure knee tracks over toes

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and posterior chain flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with knees bent
Safety cue: feet flat
MET value: and hands behind hips with fingers pointing away. 2. Press through your feet and hands to lift hips while rotating one shoulder toward the ceiling and opening the chest. 3. Reach with the top arm overhead and continue the rotation to extend through the thoracic spine. 4. Lower hips and torso back to the start and repeat on the other side.
is_not_suitable_for: Open chest by driving through shoulders and lift hips maintaining neutral neck

Health benefit: Improves static balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform: 1. Stand and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot. 2. Keep hips level
Safety cue: shoulders relaxed
MET value: and fix your gaze on a point ahead. 3. Hold the position and maintain steady breathing for the desired time
Tags: Stack hips and shoulders keep gaze forward and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and reinforces proper hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width and interlace fingers behind your head
Safety cue: keeping elbows wide. 2. Hinge at the hips by pushing them back while maintaining a neutral spine and slight knee bend. 3. Continue the hinge until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. 4. Drive hips forward to return to standing while squeezing glutes and keeping the chest up.
MET value: Hinge from hips with neutral spine and maintain chest up throughout

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps and calf strength while enhancing lower body muscular endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart a few inches away. 2. Slide down until knees form about a 90-degree angle and press your lower back into the wall. 3. Lift both heels off the floor onto the balls of your feet and hold. 4. Lower your heels back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Keep knees aligned over toes and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves scapular stability and shoulder posture
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with knees bent
Safety cue: feet flat
MET value: and hands placed behind your hips with fingers pointing forward. 2. Lift your hips until your torso and thighs form a straight tabletop position and keep your arms straight. 3. Pull your shoulder blades together without bending your elbows. 4. Release the scapulae to neutral and repeat the squeeze.
is_not_suitable_for: Squeeze shoulder blades down and together without shrugging keep neck long

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and core while promoting hip extension strength
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed behind hips with fingers pointing toward your feet. 2. Press through your hands and heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels. 3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the elevated position. 4. Lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift hips into a straight line and squeeze glutes while keeping ribs drawn

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and promotes gentle relaxation of the lower back
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with arms extended in a T and knees bent over your hips. 2. Drop both knees to one side while keeping both shoulder blades touching the floor. 3. Turn your head to the opposite side and hold the twist.
Safety cue: Keep both shoulders grounded and lead the twist from the hips

Health benefit: Develops core stability and dynamic shoulder endurance through alternating forearm to hand transitions
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Press one palm into the floor and then the other to rise into a high plank. 3. Lower one arm at a time back to the forearm plank while keeping hips steady. 4. Alternate leading arms and maintain a braced core.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and steady breath while preventing hips sagging

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness while improving hand eye coordination and movement economy
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent and raise fists to chin. 2. Throw alternating jabs and crosses with controlled rotation and return hands to guard. 3. Add hooks and uppercuts while staying on the balls of your feet and maintain a steady rhythm. 4. Keep hands up and move only within a small step range without leaving your spot.
Safety cue: Keep soft knees and rotate power from hips not shoulders

Health benefit: Improves unilateral balance while targeting hamstring and glute strength
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg with a soft bend in the knee. 2. Hinge at the hips and extend the free leg straight back as you lower your torso toward the floor. 3. Squeeze the standing-side glute and hamstring to return to upright. 4. Repeat for reps then switch legs.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips with a neutral spine and reach hips back

Health benefit: Emphasizes upper chest and shoulder strength while challenging core stability
Steps to perform: 1. Place your feet on a sofa or chair and set hands shoulder-width on the floor. 2. Brace your core and lower your chest by bending both elbows until just above the floor. 3. Push through your palms to extend the elbows and return to the start position. 4. Keep a straight line from head to heels and control each rep.
Safety cue: Tighten core and maintain a straight line from head to heels

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and elbow extension control using bodyweight resistance
Steps to perform: 1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat and place hands behind hips fingers pointing forward. 2. Press through your palms to lift your hips slightly off the floor and bend elbows to lower a few inches. 3. Straighten the elbows to lift the hips back to the starting elevated position.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and elbows close to body during descent

Health benefit: Increases glute and inner thigh activation while improving muscular endurance in legs
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with a wide stance and toes turned outward and clasp hands at chest level. 2. Lower into a shallow sumo squat until thighs feel tension while keeping chest upright. 3. Pulse up and down a few inches using the glutes and inner thighs then stand tall to finish.
Safety cue: Drive knees out over toes and pulse from controlled hips and glutes

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and core activation while promoting shoulder mobility
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart. 2. Hinge at the hips and place hands on the floor
Safety cue: keeping legs as straight as comfortable. 3. Walk hands forward until you reach a strong plank
MET value: keeping your core engaged. 4. Walk hands back toward your feet and rise to standing to repeat.
is_not_suitable_for: Hinge from hips with a flat back and soft knees

Health benefit: Builds core stability and enhances shoulder endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Start on hands and knees
Safety cue: tuck toes
MET value: and lift knees a few inches off the floor. 2. Align shoulders over wrists
Tags: and brace your core. 3. Hold this tucked plank position while breathing steadily.
column19: Keep hips level and core braced to avoid sagging

Health benefit: Develops abdominal and hip flexor strength and improves seated posture
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with legs straight and heels resting on the floor
Safety cue: hands by your hips or on blocks. 2. Press down through your palms and straighten your arms to lift your hips slightly. 3. Keep legs straight and maintain heel contact with the floor. 4. Hold the lifted position with a tight core and relaxed shoulders.
MET value: Press through heels lift chest keep shoulders down away from ears

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder muscles and improves scapular mobility and posture
Steps to perform: 1. Lie face down with forehead on the mat and arms extended overhead in a Y. 2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms slightly off the floor into the Y position. 3. Move your arms out to the sides at shoulder level and lift into the T position. 4. Bend your elbows and pull them down toward your ribs into a W
Safety cue: lifting your shoulder blades.
MET value: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep neck long

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and controlled hip mobility while raising heart rate moderately
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a high plank with shoulders over wrists and a straight body line. 2. Slowly drive your right knee toward your chest
Safety cue: pause briefly
MET value: then return it to plank. 3. Repeat the movement with your left knee
is_not_suitable_for: alternating slowly while keeping your core engaged.
Tags: Drive knees slowly with steady breath and hips low

Health benefit: Targets obliques and lateral core stability for improved trunk control
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat about hip-width apart. 2. Crunch slightly and reach your right hand toward your right heel. 3. Return to center and reach your left hand toward your left heel. 4. Alternate sides in a controlled motion while keeping your lower back on the mat.
Safety cue: Press lower back into floor and brace core before each reach

Health benefit: Builds lower body muscular endurance and improves quadriceps strength and joint stability
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet about hip-width apart and a short distance from the wall. 2. Slide down until your knees form a 90-degree angle and your thighs are parallel to the floor. 3. Press your back into the wall and distribute weight through your heels. 4. Keep your arms relaxed or crossed and breathe steadily.

Safety cue: feet flat hip-width apart

Safety cue: continuous motion.

Sit back and down on the standing leg while keeping your torso upright and using the hand for support. 4. Press through the heel to return to standing and repeat

MET value: Hinge hips back and keep chest up while using doorframe light touch for balance

Health benefit: Targets glute strength and hip extension control for improved posterior chain function
Steps to perform: 1. Lie on your back with one foot resting on an elevated surface and the other leg extended straight. 2. Press the foot on the surface and drive your hips upward until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knee. 3. Squeeze the glute of the planted leg at the top while keeping your hips level. 4. Lower your hips slowly to the mat and repeat
Safety cue: then switch legs.
MET value: Drive through heel and lift hips until torso and thigh form straight line control descent

Exercise Name: Elbow Plank to Side Plank Flow
Health benefit: Enhances core stability and dynamic anti rotation control through coordinated transitions
Steps to perform: 1. Start in an elbow plank with elbows under shoulders and your body in a straight line. 2. Rotate your hips to one side and push onto the outer edge of that foot to lift into a side plank. 3. Hold the side plank briefly
Safety cue: then rotate back through center into the elbow plank. 4. Repeat the rotation to the other side in a controlled flow.
MET value: Maintain neutral spine brace core move slowly keeping hips square during transitions

Health benefit: Activates posterior chain muscles to support spinal extension and upright posture
Steps to perform: 1. Lie face down with your legs extended and your hands clasped behind your back. 2. Keep your chin neutral and squeeze your shoulder blades as you lift your chest off the ground. 3. Hold the elevated position briefly while keeping your hips grounded. 4. Lower your chest slowly to the mat and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift chest using upper back muscles keep neck long and gaze down

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and core control
Steps to perform: 1. Place forearms on the mat shoulder-width apart with elbows under shoulders. 2. Tuck toes and lift hips up and back to form an inverted V while pressing forearms down. 3. Walk feet slightly closer to hands and engage core and glutes. 4. Hold a steady line from shoulders to hips and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over elbows and press forearms into the ground

Health benefit: Increases explosive lower-body power and plyometric conditioning
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent. 2. Swing arms back then explosively jump while driving knees toward your chest. 3. Tuck knees tightly and prepare to land. 4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and rebound immediately into the next jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with hips back and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves quickness and reactive footwork
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with knees slightly bent and weight on the balls of your feet. 2. Rapidly take small steps forward then back while keeping a quick cadence. 3. Pump your arms and keep a light
Safety cue: bouncy rhythm.

Health benefit: Strengthens core and lateral stability through dynamic anti-rotation movement
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Shift your hips quickly side to side while pressing through the forearms. 3. Drive one knee slightly toward the opposite elbow as you shift to mimic skiing. 4. Keep your core tight and maintain controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Brace core

Health benefit: Enhances lower-body power and rapid force production
Steps to perform: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and chest up. 2. Bend knees and drop hips down quickly into a full squat. 3. Drive through your heels to stand back up and reset.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips

Health benefit: Improves acceleration and explosive hip drive from a stationary position
Steps to perform: 1. Position your feet in a staggered sprint stance and place fingertips on the ground. 2. Load weight onto the front leg and keep the rear knee bent near the ground. 3. Drive explosively through the front foot and swing the opposite arm forward. 4. Accelerate into a sprint and pump your arms while pushing off the back foot.
Safety cue: Drive through lead foot keep hips neutral and chest low

Health benefit: Improves single leg stability hip mobility and coordination
Steps to perform: 1. Step forward into a deep lunge with the front knee over the ankle and hands ready. 2. Push through the front heel to rise and transfer weight onto the front leg. 3. Bring the rear leg up quickly and extend it forward into a front kick
Safety cue: snapping at the knee. 4. Retract the kicking leg and return to the lunge or starting stance and repeat.
MET value: Keep torso upright and knee aligned over toes during lunge and kick

Health benefit: Builds dynamic core endurance and shoulder stability
Steps to perform: 1. Start in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders and body in a straight line. 2. Drive one knee toward the same-side elbow while keeping hips level. 3. Return the leg to plank and immediately drive the opposite knee toward its elbow. 4. Continue alternating controlled repetitions while maintaining a braced core.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over elbows and spine neutral while moving hips slowly

Health benefit: Improves coordination and high intensity cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet together and simulate holding a rope with hands at hip height. 2. Bend knees slightly and swing your wrists forward twice per jump as you prepare to jump. 3. Jump a bit higher and flick your wrists to make two rotations under your feet. 4. Land softly on the balls of your feet and continue rhythmically for repetitions.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and keep core engaged

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexor mobility and forearm flexibility
Steps to perform: 1. Stand facing a wall and place one arm out straight with the palm up and fingertips touching the wall at shoulder height. 2. Gently turn your body away from the wall and lean forward until you feel a stretch along the inside of the forearm. 3. Keep the elbow straight
Safety cue: hold the position
MET value: then release and repeat with the other arm.
is_not_suitable_for: Keep shoulder relaxed and elbow straight while gently pressing palm into wall

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and reduces hand stiffness
Steps to perform: 1. Kneel and place hands on the floor with fingers pointing toward your knees and backs of hands flat. 2. Spread fingers wide and press the back of each hand gently into the ground. 3. Sit back into your heels to increase wrist extension while keeping the spine tall. 4. Rock hips forward and backward slightly to mobilize the back of the wrists.
Safety cue: Keep elbows slightly bent and forearms relaxed to avoid joint compression

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioception while strengthening ankle and hip stabilizers
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot. 2. Reach arms out to the sides and lift the other leg back and out to form a star shape. 3. Keep hips level and fix your gaze on a point ahead to steady balance. 4. Lower the lifted leg with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Engage core and focus gaze to maintain hip alignment

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rotational control through controlled transitional movement
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with one shin in front and the other behind in a 90/90 position. 2. Lift your hips slightly and shift weight onto the back hip without using your hands. 3. Rotate your torso and bring the front knee across to switch legs smoothly. 4. Land in the opposite shin box and repeat the flow.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and control hips through slow deliberate transitions

Health benefit: Promotes neck and upper shoulder mobility and decreases muscular tightness
Steps to perform: 1. Sit or stand tall and retract your shoulders back and down. 2. Tilt your head toward one shoulder while actively lifting the opposite shoulder slightly. 3. Return to center with control and repeat toward the other side.
Safety cue: Breathe slowly and lengthen neck using shoulder stabilization

Health benefit: Strengthens the core and improves spinal endurance and postural stability
Steps to perform: 1. Sit with knees bent and feet flat
Safety cue: then lean back slightly and lift your feet off the floor. 2. Extend your arms forward and straighten your legs to form a V shape with your torso and thighs. 3. Hold the position while keeping the spine long and breathing steadily.
MET value: Lift chest draw ribs down breathe evenly to protect lower back

Health benefit: Builds single leg strength and challenges balance and lower body endurance
Steps to perform: 1. Stand tall with feet together and arms reaching overhead. 2. Shift weight into your left foot and lift your right foot off the floor behind you. 3. Bend the left knee and sink your hips back as if sitting
Safety cue: keeping the chest lifted. 4. Keep arms active overhead and maintain balance.
MET value: Sit hips back and keep chest lifted with core engaged for balance

Health benefit: Steps to perform
Steps to perform: Safety cue
Safety cue: MET value

Rest intervals: Builds biceps strength and improves arm muscle endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width on the band and hold handles with palms facing up.
2. Keep elbows fixed at your sides and curl hands toward your shoulders.
3. Lower the handles with control back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows close to ribs and curl with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Enhances lower body strength and functional leg power
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the handles at shoulder height.
2. Brace your core, push your hips back, and bend your knees to lower into a squat.
3. Keep your chest up and knees tracking over your toes.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and squeeze your glutes at the top.
Steps to perform: Sit back into hips chest up knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Combines lower and upper body strength with explosive full body coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold handles at shoulder level palms facing in.
2. Sit back into a squat by driving your hips back and bending your knees until thighs are near parallel.
3. Explosively stand and press the handles overhead until your arms are straight.
4. Lower the handles back to shoulder level with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels to stand and press overhead while bracing your core

Rest intervals: Strengthens core stability and resists rotational movement
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor, holding the handle with both hands at your chest.
2. Step away to create tension, brace your core, and position your feet hip-width apart.
3. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, resist rotation, then pull the handle back to your chest.
Steps to perform: Brace core and press straight out keeping shoulders level and hips square

Rest intervals: Targets triceps for improved arm extension strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand on or anchor the band behind you and hold the handle with both hands overhead, elbows close to your ears.
2. Keep your upper arms stationary and extend your forearms to straighten your arms.
3. Lower the handle slowly behind your head with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows close to ears and lower band slowly using triceps

Rest intervals: Activates glutes and posterior chain for hip strength and stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Place a resistance band just above your knees.
3. Press your feet into the floor and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Lower your hips with control until they hover above the floor.
Steps to perform: Drive hips up through heels, keep ribs down and core braced

Rest intervals: Builds leg and back strength while promoting postural control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the handles at your sides.
2. Sit back into a squat, keeping your chest up and knees tracking over toes.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and pull the handles toward your ribcage, squeezing shoulder blades.
4. Extend your arms forward and return into the squat to repeat.
Steps to perform: Maintain chest up and neutral spine, row by pulling elbows back

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and dynamic trunk control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band above shoulder height and grasp the handle with both hands.
2. Stand with feet hip-width and take a short staggered stance away from the anchor.
3. Rotate your torso and pull the band down and across your body toward the opposite hip with arms extended.
4. Control the band back to the start position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Rotate from hips and core, control the band on the descent

Rest intervals: Develops chest and shoulder strength with standing stability challenge
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at chest height and hold the handles at chest level.
2. Step forward into a split stance with one foot in front for stability.
3. Press the handles straight forward until your arms are extended and shoulders stay down.
4. Slowly return your hands to chest level and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and back, press with stable core and neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked, and place a band above your knees.
2. Keep your heels together and lift the top knee away from the bottom knee, opening the hips.
3. Pause at the top while maintaining a stable pelvis.
4. Slowly lower the top knee back to the start position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and still, open knee using glute control

Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength while improving balance and integrated arm strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot forward on the center of the band and hold the handles with palms facing up.
2. Step into a lunge by bending both knees until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Press through the front heel to rise and curl the band toward your shoulders.
4. Lower the arms with control and reset your stance before repeating or switching legs.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and torso upright

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and functional trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low and stand sideways to the anchor with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the handle with both hands near the hip farthest from the anchor and hinge slightly at the hips.
3. Pull the band diagonally upward across your body, finishing above the opposite shoulder.
4. Return the handle to the low start position with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate through hips and core while maintaining a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Strengthens upper back and improves scapular stability and pulling mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band at chest height and stand facing the anchor with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the handles with arms extended and hinge slightly at the hips while keeping a straight back.
3. Pull the handles toward your ribcage by driving elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Extend the arms slowly to the start position with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Pull with shoulder blades together keeping chest up and spine neutral

Rest intervals: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral stability during movement
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around both legs just above the knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Sink into a quarter squat by bending the knees and pushing the hips back.
3. Step laterally with one foot against the band's resistance, then follow with the other foot to restore hip-width.
4. Continue stepping side to side while maintaining band tension and a stable torso.
Steps to perform: Maintain a low half squat and step controlled without letting knees collapse

Rest intervals: Develops posterior chain strength while enhancing upper back and shoulder pulling power
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the handles in front of your thighs with palms facing you.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend and lower the handles toward mid-shin while keeping a flat back.
3. Drive the hips forward to stand tall and pull the handles upward toward your chin with elbows leading.
4. Lower the handles back to the starting position with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips with a neutral spine then lead pull with elbows high

Rest intervals: Strengthens obliques and improves trunk rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, loop the band around your feet, and hold the ends with both hands.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet a few inches off the floor to engage the core.
3. Rotate your torso and hands to one side, moving the band across your body.
4. Return to center and rotate to the opposite side in a controlled motion.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and rotate from the ribs with controlled movement

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder girdle stability and scapular retraction strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold the band at chest height with hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Pull your hands outward, keeping arms straight and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
3. Slowly return your hands to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades and lead with elbows to avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Activates and strengthens the glute muscles to enhance hip extension power
Health benefit:
1. Start on hands and knees and loop the band under your hands and around the sole of one foot.
2. Brace your core and drive that foot upward, keeping the knee bent at about 90 degrees.
3. Squeeze the glute at the top without arching the lower back.
4. Lower the foot back to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and kick with glute control without arching low back

Rest intervals: Combines unilateral lower body stabilization with chest pressing to improve functional pushing strength
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at chest height and hold the handles at chest level with elbows bent.
2. Step one foot back into a split stance while keeping your torso upright.
3. Press the handles forward to extend your arms until they are straight.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright torso and brace core as you step back and press

Rest intervals: Enhances deep core stability and coordination for improved spinal support
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent to 90 degrees and loop the band around both feet, holding the ends in your hands extended toward the ceiling.
2. Slowly lower one arm and the opposite leg toward the floor while maintaining tension on the band.
3. Return to the center and repeat the movement on the other side with controlled motion.
Steps to perform: Press low back into the floor and move limbs slowly with exhale

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder strength and overhead stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and the middle of the resistance band under both feet.
2. Hold the band handles at shoulder height with palms facing forward and elbows bent.
3. Press both hands upward until arms are nearly straight overhead.
4. Lower the handles back to shoulder height with control.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulders away from ears while pressing with control

Rest intervals: Enhances glute activation and hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your thighs just above the knees and come to hands and knees.
2. Keep your core tight and spine neutral.
3. Lift one knee out to the side to hip level while keeping the knee bent at 90 degrees.
4. Lower the knee back under control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and core braced as you lift the knee to the side

Exercise Name: Band Squat with Side Leg Lift
Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength and lateral hip control
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band above your knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Sit back into a squat by pushing hips back and bending knees until thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Stand up and shift weight onto one leg, lifting the other leg out to the side to hip height.
4. Return the lifted leg to neutral and repeat the squat on the next rep.
Steps to perform: Maintain chest up weight in heels and control the lateral lift

Rest intervals: Increases core endurance and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Wrap a thin band around both wrists and come into a high plank position with hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep hips steady.
3. Lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while maintaining a stable plank.
4. Return the hand to the floor and alternate taps with the other hand.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core tight while tapping hands with controlled reach

Rest intervals: Strengthens shoulder abductors and improves shoulder mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of the resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a handle in each hand at your sides.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and palms facing down.
3. Raise both arms out to the sides to shoulder level with control.
4. Slowly lower the arms back to your sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly from shoulders keep elbows soft and lift with scapular control

Rest intervals: Targets quadriceps strength and knee joint control
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and the band looped around one ankle and anchored under the chair leg.
2. Grip the sides of the chair and brace your core.
3. Extend the banded leg forward until the knee is straight.
4. Slowly return the leg to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Sit tall and brace core as you extend leg slowly

Exercise Name: Band Curtsy Lunge to Lateral Raise
Rest intervals: Combines lower body balance with shoulder and hip coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and a resistance band under both feet, holding the handles at your sides.
2. Step one leg diagonally behind into a curtsy and lower into a lunge.
3. As you push back to standing, lift both arms out to the sides to shoulder height.
4. Lower the arms and return feet to start, then repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright and step slowly to protect knee alignment

Rest intervals: Engages obliques and improves rotational core strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and the band looped around the soles of your feet, holding the ends in your hands.
2. Lift your head and shoulders and bring one elbow toward the opposite knee while extending the other leg.
3. Switch sides in a controlled pedaling motion while keeping tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back grounded and rotate from ribs with control

Rest intervals: Develops anterior shoulder strength and improves scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the handles in front of your thighs with palms facing down.
2. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, lift your hands forward to shoulder height.
3. Lower the handles slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Lead with shoulders down and lift slowly without swinging

Rest intervals: Strengthens hamstrings and enhances posterior chain activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on a mat with the band anchored at a low point and looped around your ankles.
2. Keep your hips pressed into the mat and bend your knees to curl your heels toward your glutes.
3. Squeeze your hamstrings at the top and hold briefly.
4. Slowly lower your legs to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips pressed down and curl heels toward glutes with control

Rest intervals: Improves rotational core strength and lower body power
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band at a high point and grasp the handles with both hands.
2. Step into a split stance with the front knee bent and the band held high to the outside of the front foot.
3. Drive through the front heel to rise and pull the band diagonally across your body toward the opposite hip.
4. Return to the lunge position while controlling the band back to the start.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and rotate from the torso not the knees

Rest intervals: Enhances core strength and abdominal control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a band overhead and kneel facing away while holding the ends behind your head.
2. Brace your core and curl your torso forward, bringing your elbows toward your knees.
3. Slowly return to the upright kneeling position while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Tuck ribcage and exhale to engage abs as you crunch

Rest intervals: Promotes scapular stability and upper back muscle balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at face height and grab the ends with an overhand or neutral grip.
2. Step back to create tension and pull your hands toward your face, leading with your elbows flared out.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together, then slowly extend your arms to return.
Steps to perform: Pull bands toward your face with elbows high and scapula retracted

Rest intervals: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral pelvic stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a mini band around both ankles and stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto the support leg and lift the other leg straight out to the side without leaning.
3. Control the band as you lower the leg back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and move slowly controlling the band resistance

Rest intervals: Simultaneously strengthens glutes and chest while enhancing posterior chain engagement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, and loop the band under your feet while holding the ends at chest level.
2. Drive through your heels and lift your hips into a glute bridge while simultaneously pressing the band straight up from your chest.
3. Squeeze your glutes and keep your core engaged at the top.
4. Slowly lower your hips and bring your hands back to chest level with control.
Steps to perform: Squeeze glutes press through heels and maintain a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Increases lateral trunk strength and improves side bending control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Secure one end of the band under the same-side foot and hold the other end overhead with that hand.
3. Keep hips square and bend at the waist toward the anchored foot.
4. Drive through your oblique to return upright and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked over hips and hinge only at the waist

Rest intervals: Develops triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place the band under one foot.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the elbow so the upper arm is aligned with your torso.
3. Extend the elbow straight back until the arm is fully extended.
4. Bend the elbow to return to start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow pinned to side and extend forearm with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Enhances hip extensor strength and supports posterior chain activation
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low behind you and loop the free end around your ankle.
2. Stand tall on the opposite leg with a slight forward lean.
3. Extend the banded leg straight back until the hip is fully extended, then return under control.
Steps to perform: Stand tall and squeeze glute to extend hip without arching lower back

Rest intervals: Builds core stability, shoulder endurance, and coordinated full body movement
Health benefit:
1. Loop a band around your waist and secure the other end to a low anchor behind you.
2. Start in a bear crawl position with hands under shoulders and knees hovering off the floor.
3. Move opposite hand and foot forward while resisting the band pull.
4. Maintain a flat back and controlled steps as you crawl.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and move slowly keeping spine long and hips level

Rest intervals: Strengthens anti rotation core stability and enhances bracing control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor.
2. Hold the band with both hands at your chest and step away to create tension.
3. Press the band straight out and hold, resisting rotation.
Steps to perform: Brace core and press away from anchor to resist rotation while breathing

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder external rotator strength and stability
Health benefit:
1. Attach the band to a stable anchor at elbow height or hold one end.
2. Stand side-on and bend your elbow to 90°, keeping the upper arm against your side.
3. Rotate your forearm away from your body until comfortable, keeping the elbow tucked.
4. Return slowly to the start position under control.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow tucked at side and rotate slowly with controlled scapular retraction

Rest intervals: Builds hip abductor strength and lateral stability
Health benefit:
1. Place the band around your ankles or just above your knees and stand with feet hip-width.
2. Sink into a shallow squat and brace your core.
3. Step diagonally forward with one foot, then follow with the other, keeping the band taut.
4. Continue stepping while maintaining the squat and steady band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep a slight squat, step sideways with constant tension and knees tracking toes

Rest intervals: Combines lower body strengthening with shoulder anterior control and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends at thigh level.
2. Sit back into a squat until your hips reach roughly knee level.
3. Stand up and lift the banded hands straight in front of you to shoulder height.
4. Lower the arms and return to the squat with control.
Steps to perform: Brace core, sit back into hips and raise arms maintaining a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves lower abdominal control and core stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around your feet while holding the ends near your hips.
2. Raise both legs straight up toward the ceiling with knees extended.
3. Lower your legs slowly toward the floor until just above the ground.
4. Pull the legs back up to vertical using your core while keeping your lower back pressed to the floor.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into the mat and lower legs slowly with controlled core

Rest intervals: Enhances upper back and shoulder pulling strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your chest up and pull the band upward along your midline toward your chin.
3. Lead the movement with your elbows and keep the band close to your body.
4. Lower the hands back down under control to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Lead with elbows, lift hands to chest height and avoid shrugging shoulders

Rest intervals: Develops single leg strength and balance control
Health benefit:
1. Place the resistance band under your front foot and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step into a split stance with the back heel lifted and hips square.
3. Bend both knees and lower the back knee toward the floor while keeping your torso upright.
4. Press through the front heel to return to the start position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and torso upright

Rest intervals: Increases low-impact cardiovascular fitness and lateral movement coordination
Health benefit:
