3. Pull the band gently to increase heel-to-glute approximation while keeping hips pressed into the floor.
4. Keep the torso flat and breathe steadily as you maintain the stretch.
Steps to perform: Tuck tailbone and squeeze glutes to protect low back as you lift

Rest intervals: Improves latissimus dorsi flexibility and overhead reach
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold the band overhead with both hands slightly wider than your shoulders.
2. Step back to create light tension in the band and pull your shoulders down.
3. Shift your hips opposite and lean your torso to one side until you feel a lateral stretch.
4. Return to center, switch sides, and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and reach band overhead with long spine

Rest intervals: Enhances hip extension mobility and glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and a loop band placed above your knees.
2. Press your knees outward against the band and brace your core.
3. Drive through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Hold the bridge position for the desired time, then lower slowly.
Steps to perform: Drive hips up while squeezing glutes and maintaining neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves neck lateral flexion range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and loop a light band under one foot, holding the other end in the hand on the same side.
2. Gently tilt your head away from the anchored hand until you feel a stretch along the side of your neck.
3. Hold briefly, then switch sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Lengthen through crown and tilt from upper neck without shrugging shoulders

Rest intervals: Increases groin and inner thigh flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and bring the soles of your feet together with knees bent outward.
2. Loop a band around the arches of your feet and hold the ends in each hand.
3. Gently pull the band toward you while allowing your knees to fall outward.
4. Hold the stretch, then release the band and relax.
Steps to perform: Let knees fall open while keeping low back gently pressed to floor

Rest intervals: Promotes hip mobility while lengthening the hamstrings
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band under your front foot and hold the ends at hip height.
2. Step into a forward lunge and lower your back knee toward the floor.
3. Shift weight forward and straighten your front leg while keeping hold of the band to deepen the hamstring stretch.
4. Flow back into the lunge, repeat for reps, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and hinge from hips with control

Rest intervals: Enhances anterior trunk flexibility and spinal extension capacity
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and hold both ends with your hands.
2. Step forward a few feet to create tension and stand with feet hip-width apart.
3. Reach the band overhead and gently arch your upper back to open the front body.
4. Keep hips square and hold the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and pelvis neutral while you lengthen through the spine

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and upper back scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band ends and extend your arms forward at shoulder height.
2. Cross one arm over the other at the elbows and wrap your forearms together.
3. Pull the band outward to create tension and draw the elbows toward your face.
4. Keep shoulders down and hold the position.
Steps to perform: Lift elbows to shoulder height and draw shoulder blades together

Rest intervals: Enhances ankle eversion flexibility and lateral stability awareness
Health benefit:
1. Sit with legs extended and loop the band around the forefoot of the target ankle.
2. Anchor the band to the opposite side or hold it with your hands to create lateral tension.
3. Gently invert the foot inward against the band to feel a stretch along the outer ankle.
4. Maintain a soft dorsiflexion and hold the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep foot aligned with shin and control movement into dorsiflexion

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor flexibility and pelvic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at hip height and hold the ends in both hands.
2. Step into a low lunge with the front knee over the ankle and the back knee on the ground.
3. Press the band overhead or slightly back to open the front hip and chest.
4. Square your hips and hold the lunge position.
Steps to perform: Square hips keep front knee over ankle and breathe slowly

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation and seated spinal mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and anchor the band to one side at chest height.
2. Hold the band with both hands and extend your arms in front of your chest.
3. Rotate your torso away from the anchor while keeping your hips facing forward.
4. Pause and hold the rotated position with a long spine.
Steps to perform: Sit tall rotate from the thoracic spine and keep hips anchored

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder external rotation and rotator cuff mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at waist height and stand with your side to the anchor.
2. Grasp the band with the hand nearest the anchor and bend your elbow to 90 degrees at your side.
3. Step away to create light tension and rotate your forearm outward until you feel resistance.
4. Hold the position briefly and then control the forearm back to the start.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow close to ribs and move shoulder slowly with controlled breathing

Rest intervals: Increases inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low to a stable point and loop it around the inner thigh of the working leg.
2. Step the working leg outward to create tension and widen your stance.
3. Shift your weight away from the anchored side and keep the leg straight to stretch the inner thigh.
4. Maintain an upright torso and control the return to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis neutral and hinge from hips with chest lifted

Rest intervals: Promotes lateral torso mobility and side body extension
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a wide stance and hold the band anchored low behind you with your top hand.
2. Turn the front foot out and hinge at the hip toward the front leg.
3. Reach the bottom hand down toward your shin while the top hand pulls the band upward to open the chest.
4. Keep a long spine and hold the position while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and lengthen spine while breathing into the side stretch

Rest intervals: Facilitates thoracic extension and anterior chest opening for improved posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and kneel with knees hip-width apart.
2. Grasp the band behind your shoulders with both hands and draw the shoulder blades down.
3. Press your hips forward and lift your chest as you gently arch back using the band for support.
4. Keep your neck neutral and control the movement back to upright.
Steps to perform: Engage core lift chest upward and maintain neutral neck to protect low back

Rest intervals: Enhances finger extensor mobility and hand flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Loop a light band around the tips of all fingers on one hand.
2. Spread your fingers apart against the band to extend the finger joints.
3. Hold the extended position briefly and then slowly relax the fingers.
Steps to perform: Keep wrist neutral and gently control band tension without forcing fingers back

Rest intervals: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and anterior lower leg mobility
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a low anchor and loop it over the top of your foot near the ankle.
2. Sit with the knee bent and the shin resting on the floor while holding the band ends.
3. Point your toes away from your shin and lean slightly forward to increase tension.
4. Maintain steady tension through the band and keep the ankle relaxed.
Steps to perform: Dorsiflex your ankle

Rest intervals: Assists hip flexor lengthening and standing balance during lunge alignment
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing away from the anchor and step into a lunge with the front knee over the ankle.
2. Hold the band ends overhead with arms straight and create steady tension from the anchor behind you.
3. Sink your hips forward and press your chest up while keeping the back leg long.
4. Keep the front knee aligned over the ankle and maintain firm footing.
Steps to perform: Square your hips toward the front

Rest intervals: Develops core stability while promoting shoulder girdle mobility
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around your upper back and hold the ends under each hand.
2. Assume a high plank position with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
3. Press your hands into the floor and gently pull the band to open the chest while keeping core engaged.
4. Keep a flat spine and breathe evenly while holding the position.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Opens chest and stretches shoulders while encouraging shoulder internal rotation
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band behind your back with one hand over your shoulder and the other behind your lower back.
2. Pull the band so both hands move toward each other behind your back with elbows slightly bent.
3. Lift your chest and squeeze your shoulder blades together as the hands draw closer.
4. Keep your chin neutral and breathe steadily while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Retract your shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Increases gluteal flexibility and hip external rotation range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the foot of the leg you will cross.
2. Cross that ankle over the opposite thigh in a figure-four position.
3. Pull the band toward your chest to draw the knee toward the opposite shoulder.
4. Keep the other foot on the floor and a neutral spine while holding steady tension.
Steps to perform: Keep spine long

Rest intervals: Promotes gentle full body mobility and dynamic flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends overhead with palms facing each other.
2. Inhale and lengthen the spine while pulling the band upward to lift the chest.
3. Exhale and hinge at the hips into a forward fold with a soft bend in the knees while maintaining band tension.
4. Step one foot back into a low lunge, then step back to plank while keeping the band engaged.
Steps to perform: Keep a long spine and lead with your chest

Rest intervals: Enhances core engagement and seated balance
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent and loop the band around the soles of your feet, holding the ends with both hands.
2. Lean back slightly onto your sit bones and lift your feet to balance, straightening the legs into a V while pulling the band toward you.
3. Keep your chest tall and the band taut as you hold the pose, then release slowly.
Steps to perform: Engage your core and lift through the crown

Rest intervals: Improves upper neck mobility and eases shoulder girdle tension
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low behind you or step on it and hold the free end with the hand on the side to be stretched.
2. Sit or stand tall and hold the band behind your back to keep the shoulder down.
3. Tilt your ear diagonally toward the same-side armpit while maintaining band tension to deepen the stretch.
Steps to perform: Tuck your chin slightly and keep a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Supports foot mobility and toe range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Sit and loop the band around the toes of one foot, holding the band ends in both hands.
2. Keep the knee bent and pull the band to draw the toes toward the shin until you feel a stretch along the sole.
3. Hold the stretch with a relaxed ankle, then release and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Support the ankle and dorsiflex gently without forcing

Rest intervals: Enhances hip adductor flexibility and lateral movement capacity
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and loop the band under the front foot, holding the ends with both hands.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee into a side lunge while keeping the opposite leg straight and foot flexed.
3. Pull the band gently toward your chest to intensify the inner-thigh stretch.
4. Keep the chest upright and switch sides after holding.
Steps to perform: Push hips back and keep knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Develops core stability and controlled limb coordination
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and loop the band around the soles of both feet while holding the band ends.
2. Engage your core and press your low back into the mat.
3. Extend one leg straight toward the ceiling and reach the opposite arm overhead while keeping the band taut.
4. Hold the position, then bend the knee and return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and draw your navel toward your spine during movement
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Sleep Apnea

Rest intervals: Increases thoracic mobility and chest opening
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall and hold a looped band behind your back with both hands clasped around it.
2. Pull the band upward so your hands move away from your lower back and your chest opens.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you lift the hands slightly.
4. Lower your hands back down under control and reset your posture.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulder blades stable while extending arms overhead

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring flexibility and seated forward range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with legs extended and loop the band around the arches of both feet.
2. Hold the band ends and lengthen your spine by reaching your chest forward.
3. Hinge at the hips and pull the band to increase the forward fold toward your feet.
4. Hold the stretch with a long spine, then release the band and sit upright.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips and maintain a long neutral spine as you fold

Rest intervals: Facilitates hip external rotation and gentle lower back mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the soles of your feet while holding the ends with both hands.
2. Draw your knees toward your armpits so the knees point beside your torso.
3. Use the band to pull your feet toward you while keeping your back on the mat.
4. Hold the position, then release one foot at a time and return to neutral.
Steps to perform: Keep low back gently pressed to mat and breathe into hips

Rest intervals: Promotes gentle lumbar extension and front body mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your stomach and place your forearms on the mat with elbows under the shoulders and loop a band across your upper back, holding the ends.
2. Press your forearms into the floor and gently lift your chest forward while using the band to broaden the front of your shoulders.
3. Keep your hips grounded and draw your shoulder blades down your back as you lift.
4. Hold the lifted position, then lower your chest and remove the band.
Steps to perform: Support weight on forearms and lengthen through the lower back without overarching

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral biceps strength and elbow stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with the band anchored under that foot and the other end in your hand.
2. Keep your elbow close to your side and palm facing up.
3. Curl your hand toward your shoulder against the band's resistance.
4. Lower the hand slowly and maintain balance.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow anchored at your side throughout each curl

Rest intervals: Enhances upper back strength and postural stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand in tandem stance with one foot directly in front of the other and hold the band ends with both hands.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and pull your shoulder blades back.
3. Pull the band toward your torso with elbows close to your sides.
4. Extend the arms slowly and keep a stable posture.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulder blades together on each row

Rest intervals: Develops single leg balance and overhead pressing control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with the other knee lifted and hold the band ends at shoulder height.
2. Press the hands overhead until the arms are fully extended.
3. Lower the hands back to shoulder height with control.
4. Keep your core engaged and maintain balance.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tall spine and engaged core while pressing

Rest intervals: Improves single leg strength and knee control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold the band anchored under that foot with both hands at chest height.
2. Sit back into a single-leg squat while keeping your knee aligned over your toes.
3. Use the band to assist as you push up to standing.
4. Squeeze the glute and fully extend the hip at the top.
Steps to perform: Sit back into the hips and keep weight on the heel

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral stability and neuromuscular coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on an imaginary straight line with feet heel-to-toe and hold the band with both hands at chest level.
2. Keep the band taut and take a slow step forward placing the heel on the line.
3. Continue stepping heel-to-toe while maintaining band tension and upright posture.
4. Focus on a fixed point and move deliberately to preserve balance.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and shoulders stacked over hips while stepping
MET value: Sarcopenia, Cognitive Decline / Dementia, Depression / Anxiety

Rest intervals: Improves dynamic hip mobility and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and loop a resistance band around the ankle of the opposite leg, holding the band end in one hand.
2. Keep a soft bend in the standing knee and maintain an upright torso.
3. Swing the banded leg forward and backward in a controlled arc while focusing on balance.
4. Pause briefly at each end of the swing and reset before the next repetition.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and hinge only at the hip

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and improves single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with a resistance band looped under that foot and hold the other end in both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the standing knee and a neutral spine.
3. Lower your torso as the free leg extends back until you feel tension in the standing hamstring.
4. Drive through the planted heel and squeeze the glute to return to standing.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and hinge from the hips

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral leg power and functional balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a step with a resistance band looped under the foot you will step onto and hold the band at chest height.
2. Step up onto the platform with the banded foot, driving through the heel and keeping hips level.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to balance on the step, hold briefly, then step down with control.
Steps to perform: Drive through the heel and keep knee tracking over the foot

Rest intervals: Promotes low impact cardiovascular activity and hip flexor activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a loop resistance band under both feet and the ends held at hip level.
2. Lift one knee to hip height while keeping an upright torso and light tension in the band.
3. Lower the foot and repeat on the other side, maintaining a steady marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Stand tall brace your core lift each knee with control

Rest intervals: Enhances anti rotation core stability and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor on one leg, holding the band at your chest.
2. Brace the core and press the band straight out until the arms are extended.
3. Hold the press briefly while resisting rotation and maintaining single-leg balance.
4. Slowly return the band to your chest under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and resist rotation while exhaling steadily

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral core strength and trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at shoulder height and stand sideways with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hold the band with the hand away from the anchor and place the other hand on your hip.
3. Contract your oblique and crunch your torso toward the anchor.
4. Slowly return to start with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep a neutral spine as you crunch slowly

Rest intervals: Improves core stabilization and contralateral limb coordination
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under your right foot and get into a tabletop position.
2. Hold the band with your left hand and brace your core.
3. Extend the right leg back and the left arm forward against the band’s resistance.
4. Retract the arm and leg slowly and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core tight to prevent rotation as you extend

Rest intervals: Develops single leg balance and overhead shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of the band with your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground.
2. Grasp the band with both hands and press it straight overhead until your arms are extended.
3. Keep your core tight and hips level while balancing on the standing leg.
4. Lower the band with control and switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders stacked over hips and core braced to avoid arching the lower back

Rest intervals: Builds triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and step into a staggered stance with one foot forward.
2. Grip the band behind your head with both hands and keep your elbows close to your ears.
3. Extend your forearms forward to straighten your arms and engage the triceps.
4. Bend the elbows to return to the start with control.
Steps to perform: Tuck elbows close to head and extend with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and lateral balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall on your left foot and loop the band around your right ankle with the other end under the left foot.
2. Brace your core and lift the right leg straight out to the side against the band.
3. Lower the leg with control and hold your balance before repeating.
Steps to perform: Keep standing knee soft and maintain a tall spine while lifting slowly

Rest intervals: Enhances single leg power and dynamic hip extension
Health benefit:
1. Stand with the band anchored under your front foot and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step backward with the other leg into a controlled reverse lunge.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and pull the rear knee forward and up.
4. Lower the rear leg back into a reverse lunge and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and core braced as you drive the knee up

Rest intervals: Improves single leg proprioception and ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a light band under the standing foot and hold the ends near your chest.
2. Lift the free leg so the knee bends and the foot hovers off the ground.
3. Maintain an upright torso and hold the single-leg balance while keeping tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Stand tall, hips level, soft knee on standing leg and control sway

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core strength and single leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low to one side and grab the handle with both hands.
2. Stand on the opposite leg with a slight knee bend and hinge at the hips.
3. Pull the band from low to high across your body in a chopping arc while rotating your torso.
4. Control the return to the start position and keep balance on the single leg.
Steps to perform: Rotate from hips, brace core, keep lifted leg stable and spine long
MET value: Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain, Sarcopenia

Rest intervals: Enhances full body balance and shoulder girdle stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and loop a band under the standing foot while holding the ends with both hands.
2. Extend the nonstanding leg and open your arms and leg out to form a star shape.
3. Hold the position with a tall spine and steady the balance.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine, squeeze glutes, control limb positions

Rest intervals: Improves back muscle endurance and seated balance control
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with legs slightly bent and loop the band around your feet while holding the handles.
2. Lean back to a balanced position and lift your feet if you can for added challenge.
3. Pull the handles toward your ribs by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Extend your arms slowly to return to the start while keeping your core engaged.
Steps to perform: Sit tall, draw shoulders down and back, pull with shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral chest and shoulder strength and stability
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a sturdy anchor at chest height and hold one handle in the working hand.
2. Step into a staggered stance with the working-side leg forward and create tension in the band.
3. Press the handle straight forward until your arm is fully extended and your shoulder feels stable.
4. Slowly return the handle to your chest under control.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and press slowly while bracing core

Rest intervals: Improves plantar flexor strength and single-leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under the ball of your working foot and hold the ends in both hands.
2. Balance on the working foot and raise your heel until your calf is fully contracted.
3. Slowly lower your heel back to the starting position under control.
Steps to perform: Drive through forefoot and lower slowly with knee slightly bent

Rest intervals: Enhances single-leg balance and posterior chain engagement
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at a low point and hold the handle with both hands while standing on the supporting leg.
2. Hinge forward from the hips and lift the back leg until your torso and lifted leg form a straight line.
3. Extend your arms into the band to maintain balance and tension.
4. Return to standing with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips keeping back flat and reach arms long

Rest intervals: Promotes coordinated core stabilization and contralateral limb control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around one foot while holding the opposite end in the opposite hand.
2. Lift both knees to tabletop and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly extend the banded leg away while lowering the opposite arm overhead, keeping the core engaged.
4. Return both limbs to the starting tabletop position under control.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into floor and move opposite arm and leg slowly

Rest intervals: Strengthens rotator cuff activation while challenging single-leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and secure the band to a low anchor beside you, holding the handle with the working hand.
2. Tuck your elbow to your side with a 90-degree bend and rotate your forearm away from your body.
3. Return your hand toward your body with control while maintaining single-leg balance.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while rotating shoulder under control

Rest intervals: Improves dynamic balance and lower limb proprioception
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with a loop band anchored under that foot and hold the band in the same-side hand.
2. Balance tall, brace the core, and reach the band upward and outward into a Y with a straight arm.
3. Control the band back to start and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Stand on one leg with soft knee and tall chest as you reach overhead

Rest intervals: Targets glute strength and enhances unilateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent, loop the band under the grounded foot and place the band across your hips, and extend the other leg straight.
2. Plant the grounded heel, squeeze the glute, and drive the hips upward until your hips align with your torso.
3. Pause at the top while maintaining band tension.
4. Lower the hips with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Drive through heel and keep hips level avoid dropping the opposite hip

Rest intervals: Develops core anti-rotation strength and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Assume a high plank with a loop band around both wrists and hands under shoulders.
2. Brace the core and lift one arm straight forward, stretching the band between the wrists.
3. Lower that arm with control and repeat, then switch arms.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep hips square as you lift arm slowly without rotating torso

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder endurance while promoting balance through heel-to-toe progression
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot slightly in front of the other (heel-to-toe) on a resistance band and hold the band ends with palms facing down.
2. Keep a soft bend in the elbows and brace the core.
3. Lift both hands straight in front to shoulder height with controlled motion.
4. Lower slowly and repeat, then swap the front foot position.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and nod chin slightly as you raise band to shoulder level

Rest intervals: Increases unilateral hip extensor strength and improves single-leg power
Health benefit:
1. Sit with your upper back against a bench, loop a band across your hips and anchor it under your driving foot, and extend the other leg straight.
2. Plant the driving heel, brace the core, and drive the hips up until your torso and thigh form a straight line.
3. Squeeze the glutes at the top while keeping band tension.
4. Lower the hips with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Press through heel drive hips up and keep ribcage down to avoid arching

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral leg strength and balance
Health benefit:
1. Step into a split stance with your front knee over the ankle and back foot on the toes.
2. Loop a resistance band under the front foot and hold the ends at shoulder level.
3. Lower into a deep split squat and hold the bottom position with chest upright.
4. Squeeze the front glute and maintain weight through the front heel.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee stacked over ankle and maintain upright chest
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight

Rest intervals: Increases core endurance and hip flexor engagement
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent and loop a resistance band around the soles of your feet while holding the ends.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the floor to balance on your sit bones.
3. Extend your legs into a V and straighten your arms to create tension in the band.
4. Keep your spine long and hold the boat position.
Steps to perform: Lengthen spine brace core and breathe evenly through the nose
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Rest intervals: Improves scapular stability and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with a loop band anchored under the standing foot and hold the band ends with both hands.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips with a straight back and extend your arms toward the band.
3. Pull your elbows back and squeeze your shoulder blades together to retract the scapulae.
4. Lower the band with control while maintaining single-leg balance.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades smoothly avoid shrugging and keep hips level

Rest intervals: Strengthens glute medius and enhances lateral core stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie in a side plank on your forearm with a band looped around both knees just above the knees.
2. Stack your feet and lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Open the top knee against the band while keeping your feet together.
4. Close the knee with control and keep your core stable.
Steps to perform: Stack hips and shoulders and move top knee slowly without rolling torso

Rest intervals: Develops dynamic balance and unilateral lower body endurance
Health benefit:
1. Step into a forward lunge with a loop band anchored under the front foot and hold the ends at chest level.
2. Lower until both knees are about 90 degrees while keeping an upright torso.
3. Pulse up and down a few inches in the bottom of the lunge while maintaining band tension.
4. Hold your balance and keep weight through the front heel.
Steps to perform: Drive through front heel control pulses keep torso tall and core braced

Rest intervals: Builds lateral core strength and hip abductor endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with a loop band around your thighs above the knees and prop up on your forearm.
2. Lift your hips into a side plank so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lift the top leg against the band to hip height while keeping hips steady.
4. Lower the top leg with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you lift the top leg

Rest intervals: Enhances upper back strength and postural shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a tandem stance with one foot slightly in front of the other and place the band under the front foot.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips with a tall spine and hold the band ends with arms extended in front.
3. Pull the band apart, squeezing the shoulder blades and opening the chest until your arms reach shoulder level.
4. Slowly return the arms to the start position under control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and squeeze shoulder blades together keeping elbows slightly bent

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor activation and gait related coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around both ankles and stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Brace your core and lift one knee toward your chest against the band’s resistance.
3. Lower the foot back to the floor with control.
4. Alternate legs in a steady marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis neutral and exhale as you lift avoid arching the lower back

Rest intervals: Combines posterior chain strengthening with single leg balance and pulling coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with the band secured under that foot and hold the other end in the opposite hand.
2. Hinge at the hips and lift the free leg back until your torso and lifted leg form a straight line.
3. Pull the band toward your hip, retracting the shoulder blade to perform a row.
4. Lower the band and return to standing with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the standing hip keeping spine neutral and row with control

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and shoulder endurance under anti rotational load
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band above your knees and come into a bear plank with knees hovering just off the floor and hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine while pressing your knees slightly outward against the band.
3. Hold the hover or perform small controlled knee taps toward the floor without resting.
Steps to perform: Brace the core keep hips level and breathe during controlled knee hovers

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder stability and single-leg balance through integrated core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and hold the band with both hands at chest level.
2. Move the band in a slow semicircle around your head to the opposite side while keeping elbows soft.
3. Reverse the halo back to the starting side with controlled motion and maintain balance.
4. Repeat for the set then switch legs and perform the same sequence.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while controlling the band around your head

Rest intervals: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral stability with controlled glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Place the band around your ankles and lower into a shallow squat with feet hip-width.
2. Step one foot outward and slightly forward to create tension in the band.
3. Follow with the other foot while keeping a steady squat and constant band tension.
4. Continue slow, deliberate steps for the desired distance or reps.
Steps to perform: Step slowly with knees tracking toes and maintain constant band tension

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core strength and coordinated oblique activation
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low beside one foot and grasp the handle with both hands.
2. Rotate your torso and pull the band diagonally upward across your body toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Control the band back to the starting position with a reverse rotation.
4. Repeat for reps then switch sides and perform the same movement.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and rotate through the torso with a braced core

Rest intervals: Builds anti-rotation core stability and shoulder girdle control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular holding the handle close to your chest with both hands.
2. Step away from the anchor until the band is taut and your arms are extended at chest level.
3. Walk sideways or forward in small controlled steps while keeping your torso square to the anchor and resisting rotation.
4. Walk back to the start under control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Lock ribs to pelvis and resist rotation as you slowly walk hands forward

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior shoulder and scapular retraction with increased upper back activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall on the balls of your feet with heels raised and hold the band in front at shoulder height.
2. Pull the band apart by squeezing your shoulder blades and moving your hands out to your sides with elbows soft.
3. Return the band to the center with control while maintaining the heel raise.
4. Repeat for the desired reps while keeping your posture tall and core engaged.
Steps to perform: Raise heels, keep chest tall and squeeze shoulder blades while maintaining a neutral neck

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and coordinated reach with single-leg balance challenge
Health benefit:
1. Secure one end of the band to a low anchor and hold the free handle with one hand.
2. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
3. Rotate your torso and reach the band across to tap the floor at each clock position one at a time.
4. Control the return to center between taps and keep tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Keep a tall chest and neutral spine as you reach and tap

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip stability and glute engagement through controlled single-leg loading
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under the front foot and hold the ends at your hips.
2. Step the back leg diagonally behind and across into a curtsy position.
3. Lower into a shallow lunge so the back knee hovers just above the floor.
4. Press through the front heel to return to standing while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Lower with control keeping front knee tracking over toes and chest upright
MET value: Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease

Rest intervals: Improves knee stabilization and hip muscle recruitment with resisted standing press
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you at knee height and loop the free end around the front of the working knee.
2. Stand tall on the supporting leg with the working knee slightly bent.
3. Drive the working knee forward against the band's resistance while keeping hips level.
4. Return the knee to the start position under control.
Steps to perform: Drive knee slowly into band while bracing core and keeping hips level

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral shoulder strength while challenging balance and scapular coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and place the band under the standing foot, holding the handle with the working hand.
2. Keep the standing knee soft and chest tall.
3. Pull the handle straight up toward your chin, leading with the elbow.
4. Lower the handle under control while maintaining balance on the supporting leg.
Steps to perform: Lead with elbow keeping shoulder down and spine long while balancing

Rest intervals: Strengthens ankle evertors and enhances lateral ankle control during seated resistance
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent and loop the band around the forefoot, anchoring the other end to a stable object at the inside of the foot.
2. Keep the heel planted and toes pointing forward.
3. Rotate the forefoot outward against the band's resistance to evert the ankle.
4. Return the foot to neutral under control.
Steps to perform: Move ankle slowly controlling eversion and keep knee and hip stable

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip and glute activation and movement coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and imagine a band lying on the floor between your feet.
2. Shift weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot to step over the imaginary band.
3. Place the right foot down beyond the band and control your balance.
4. Reverse the motion to step back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and chest tall as you step over

Rest intervals: Develops anti rotation core stability and torso control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the band with both hands at your chest and step away to create tension.
3. Press the band straight out and rotate your hands in a slow circular motion while bracing your core.
4. Reverse the circle and return the band to your chest with control.
Steps to perform: Brace core and exhale while moving slowly to resist rotation

Fitness Level: Limited single-leg balance | Rotator cuff weakness / instability
Rest intervals: Promotes shoulder posterior chain strength and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at upper-chest height and grab the band with both hands using an overhand grip.
2. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and step back to create tension.
3. Pull the band toward your face, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower the band with control and switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep a soft knee on stance leg and squeeze shoulder blades together

Rest intervals: Improves hip extensor strength and multiplanar hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a low anchor and wrap the other end around your ankle.
2. Stand tall with a slight forward lean and extend your leg straight back against the band's resistance.
3. From the same setup sweep your leg diagonally back and return with control.
4. Then move your leg out to the side against the band and repeat on the other ankle.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and drive from the glute with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Reinforces hip hinge mechanics while improving posterior chain activation and balance
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band handle in one hand and step back to create tension while standing on the opposite leg.
2. Hinge at your hips by sending them back and lowering your torso while extending the free leg behind you.
3. Keep a neutral spine and hold the band close to your hip to maintain tension.
4. Drive through the standing heel to return to standing and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips keeping spine long and shoulders stacked over hips

Rest intervals: Challenges core anti rotation control while enhancing shoulder stability and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a stable anchor at waist height and hold the band with both hands.
2. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hinge slightly at the hips to keep a tall spine.
3. Rotate your torso to move your hands in a circular "stir the pot" motion while keeping arms extended.
4. Reverse the circle direction after the set and maintain steady core tension.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and rotate slowly from the ribs keeping hips square

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation mobility and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and grab it with both hands.
2. Stand on one leg with the knee bent to about 90 degrees and keep hips level.
3. Rotate your torso away from the anchor while moving your hands across your body.
4. Repeat the desired reps and switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and rotate from thoracic spine while keeping knee stacked

Rest intervals: Builds anterior chain control and improves eccentric hip and trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Place the band under both feet and hold the ends at chest height.
2. Hinge at the hips and lean forward until you feel steady band tension.
3. Drive your hips forward to return to an upright stance while keeping the core engaged.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips keeping a neutral spine and shoulders over hips

Rest intervals: Develops posterior oblique strength and single leg rotational stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low beside you and grab the handle with the opposite hand.
2. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and lift the other foot off the ground.
3. Pull the band from low to high in a sweeping "lawn mower" motion across your body.
4. Control the return and repeat before switching legs.
Steps to perform: Balance on the supporting leg with a tall spine and controlled horizontal pull

Rest intervals: Increases core anti extension strength while activating glutes and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around your ankles and get into a forearm plank with a straight body line.
2. Brace your core and lift one leg straight back against the band's resistance.
3. Lower the leg slowly and alternate sides while maintaining a stable plank.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while breathing evenly during leg extension

Health benefit: Steps to perform
Steps to perform: Safety cue
Safety cue: MET value

Rest intervals: Improves chest and triceps strength while enhancing pressing stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with knees bent and a dumbbell in each hand at chest level.
2. Press the dumbbells straight up until your arms are nearly locked.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells until your elbows lightly touch the floor.
4. Pause briefly and press the weights back up to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades and keep ribs down while pressing with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Strengthens back muscles and improves posterior chain stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, hold a dumbbell in each hand, and hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
2. Keep your back flat and your core braced.
3. Pull the dumbbells toward your ribcage, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Lower the dumbbells with control back to the hanging position.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips, keep spine neutral, pull elbows toward hips with control

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder strength and supports overhead pressing control
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height and feet flat on the floor.
2. Brace your core and keep your back neutral.
3. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are nearly extended.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control.
Steps to perform: Sit tall, brace core, press overhead tracking wrists over elbows

Rest intervals: Increases biceps strength and enhances elbow flexion control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing forward.
2. Keep elbows close to your torso and curl the dumbbells up toward your shoulders.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top, then lower the dumbbells slowly to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows pinned to sides and avoid swinging the torso

Rest intervals: Develops triceps strength and improves elbow extension stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell vertically with both hands overhead.
2. Keep upper arms close to your head and bend your elbows to lower the dumbbell behind your head.
3. Extend your elbows to raise the dumbbell back overhead until your arms are nearly straight.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows close to ears, hinge slightly and exhale as you extend

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder abductor strength and lateral shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. With a slight bend in the elbows, lift the dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
3. Pause briefly at the top, then lower the dumbbells slowly back to your sides.
Steps to perform: Lift with controlled motion keeping a slight elbow bend and scapula stable

Rest intervals: Strengthens anterior deltoids and improves forward shoulder control
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and exhale as you raise the dumbbells straight forward to shoulder height.
3. Pause briefly at shoulder height with wrists neutral and shoulders down.
4. Inhale and lower the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Lead with the elbow keeping shoulders down and core braced

Rest intervals: Enhances upper trapezius strength and improves shoulder elevation stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing your body.
2. Keep your arms straight and exhale as you lift your shoulders straight up toward your ears.
3. Pause and squeeze your traps at the top without rolling your shoulders.
4. Inhale and lower your shoulders back down under control.
Steps to perform: Elevate scapula straight up without rolling shoulders and maintain neck neutral

Rest intervals: Activates posterior shoulder muscles to improve scapular stability and posture
Health benefit:
1. Hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor and hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other and knees slightly bent.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and exhale as you raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your elbows reach shoulder height.
3. Squeeze your rear delts and keep your neck and spine neutral at the top.
4. Inhale and lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips keep a flat back and retract shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Develops shoulder and upper back strength while improving scapular upward control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your body.
2. Pull the dumbbells upward toward your chin by leading with your elbows, keeping the weights close to your body.
3. Pause briefly with elbows higher than wrists and chest tall.
4. Lower the dumbbells controlled to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Pull with elbows high but avoid shrugging keep wrists neutral and core tight

Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength and teaches proper squat mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell vertically by one end against your chest with both hands.
2. Brace your core and push your hips back as you bend your knees to lower into a squat.
3. Keep your chest up and press your elbows between your knees to maintain an upright torso.
4. Drive through your heels to return to standing and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral leg strength and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step forward with one foot and lower your hips until your front thigh is parallel to the floor and your back knee nearly touches the floor.
3. Keep your torso upright and your front knee aligned over the ankle as you descend.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Steps to perform: Step far enough so front knee stays behind toes
is_not_suitable_for: Knee pain (general / chronic) | Limited single-leg balance

Rest intervals: Strengthens hamstrings and improves hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend and push your hips back while keeping a flat back as you lower the dumbbells along your legs until mid-shin.
3. Drive your hips forward and squeeze your glutes and hamstrings to return to standing while keeping the dumbbells close to your body.
4. Reset your posture and repeat with controlled movement.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips with a flat back and soft knees
is_not_suitable_for: Lower back pain (non-specific) | Reduced core stability

Rest intervals: Targets inner thighs and enhances hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes turned out, holding one dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands.
2. Sit back into your hips and lower down until your thighs are just above parallel while keeping your chest up.
3. Drive through your heels and push your knees out to return to standing.
4. Reset your stance and repeat with steady tempo.
Steps to perform: Drive hips down and keep knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Develops calf muscle endurance and ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Shift your weight onto the balls of your feet and raise your heels as high as possible.
3. Pause and contract your calf muscles at the top.
4. Lower your heels back down slowly and repeat.
Steps to perform: Push through midfoot and control the descent

Rest intervals: Activates glutes and supports hip extension strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width, and a dumbbell resting on your hips while holding it steady with both hands.
2. Brace your core and press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and hold for a brief pause.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the floor under control.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels, squeeze glutes, keep ribs down and spine neutral

Rest intervals: Improves lateral hip strength and side to side mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and feet hip-width apart.
2. Step your right foot wide to the side and push your hips back while bending the right knee and keeping the left leg straight.
3. Keep your chest up and weight on the heel of the bent leg as you lower until the right thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the right heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Sit hips back, keep chest upright, knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Enhances single leg power and functional stair climbing ability
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a sturdy bench or step holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step up with your right foot and drive through the right heel to bring your left foot onto the bench while keeping your torso upright.
3. Step back down with the left foot first, then the right, and repeat leading with the opposite leg.
Steps to perform: Step through with full foot, drive through heel, keep hips level

Rest intervals: Improves balance while strengthening posterior chain muscles
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step backward with your right foot and lower your body until both knees form about 90-degree angles.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and bring the back foot forward.
4. Repeat the movement on the opposite leg, alternating legs for each rep.
Steps to perform: Take a controlled step back, keep torso tall, front knee over ankle

Rest intervals: Teaches explosive hip drive and builds posterior chain strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a box with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides or racked at your shoulders.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the knees to lower back until you sit lightly on the box, keeping your chest up.
3. Pause briefly, then drive through your heels to stand tall, extending hips and knees and maintaining dumbbell position.
4. Reset your stance and repeat for the desired number of reps.
Steps to perform: Sit back to the box with a neutral spine, pause softly, drive up

Rest intervals: Enhances oblique strength and rotational core stability
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent and heels on the floor, holding one dumbbell with both hands at chest level.
2. Lean back slightly to engage the core and rotate your torso to the right, bringing the dumbbell beside your right hip.
3. Rotate your torso to the left, bringing the dumbbell beside your left hip, and continue alternating rotations.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and rotate from your ribs, not your lower back

Rest intervals: Improves lateral trunk mobility and oblique activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Keep the left hand on your hip, brace your core, and keep your chest lifted.
3. Exhale and slowly bend at the waist to the right, lowering the dumbbell down the right thigh.
4. Inhale and return to standing by contracting the left oblique; repeat and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the waist with a long spine, avoid collapsing the opposite side

Rest intervals: Develops dynamic rotational power and core coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands above your right shoulder.
2. Brace your core, slightly bend your knees, and prepare to rotate.
3. Exhale and drive the dumbbell diagonally down across your body toward the outside of your left knee, rotating your torso and pivoting your feet.
4. Inhale and control the dumbbell back to the start; repeat and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace your core, drive the movement with hip rotation, move deliberately

Rest intervals: Builds abdominal strength and muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and hold one dumbbell against your chest with both hands.
2. Brace your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Exhale and lift your shoulders off the ground into a crunch, keep the dumbbell stable, then inhale and lower back down.
Steps to perform: Keep chin neutral, exhale on effort, lift with abs not neck

Rest intervals: Enhances anti rotation stability and shoulder control
Health benefit:
1. Get into a high plank with a dumbbell beside your right hand and feet hip-width apart.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips level and shoulders stacked over your wrists.
3. Reach under your torso with your left hand, grip the dumbbell, and drag it across to the left side.
4. Reset your left hand to the plank and repeat the drag with the opposite hand, alternating sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain a flat back, minimize torso rotation as you reach across

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic mobility and engages core muscles
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back on a bench or the floor with knees bent and hold one dumbbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Brace your core and keep a slight bend in your elbows as you slowly lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head.
3. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest using your lats and core while keeping your pelvis stable.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and lower back neutral as you lower the weight

Rest intervals: Enhances coordinated core and limb stability and movement timing
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and hold a light dumbbell in each hand above your chest.
2. Brace your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly extend your right leg toward the floor while lowering your left arm with its dumbbell toward the floor.
4. Return to center and repeat the movement on the opposite side with controlled motion.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed into the floor and breathe steadily

Rest intervals: Improves spinal rotation mobility and torso control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a bench with feet flat and hold one dumbbell vertically at chest with both hands.
2. Sit tall and brace your core with a neutral spine.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, moving the dumbbell across your body with control.
4. Return to center and rotate to the left.
Steps to perform: Rotate from the thoracic spine keeping hips square and spine tall

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip flexors and challenges balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Shift weight slightly onto one leg and keep your posture upright.
3. Lift the opposite knee toward your chest while holding the dumbbells steady.
4. Lower the leg under control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly at the hips brace your core and control the lift

Rest intervals: Increases hamstring flexibility and core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended toward the ceiling and hold a dumbbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Engage your core and keep your lower back pressed into the floor.
3. Curl your upper body and reach the dumbbell toward your toes with control.
4. Lower your torso back to the floor and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis stabilized and hinge from hips reaching with control

Rest intervals: Builds full body power and improves coordination between lower and upper body
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Descend into a squat by pushing hips back and bending knees until thighs are near parallel.
3. Drive upward through the heels, extend hips, and press the dumbbells overhead until arms are straight.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height and immediately begin the next repetition.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and drive through heels as you press overhead

Rest intervals: Strengthens grip and enhances core stability and posture during loaded carrying
Health benefit:
1. Pick up a heavy dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip and stand tall.
2. Engage your core, pull shoulders down and back, and keep your chest up.
3. Walk forward in a straight line for the desired distance while maintaining posture.
4. Set the dumbbells down with control and rest before repeating.
Steps to perform: Stand tall brace core shoulders down and back walk with controlled steps

Rest intervals: Develops explosive whole body strength and movement coordination from ground to overhead
Health benefit:
1. Place dumbbells on the floor near your feet and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips and knees, grip the dumbbells, and drive through the heels to lift them to shoulder level.
3. Dip slightly at the knees and explosively extend hips while pressing the dumbbells overhead until arms are locked.
4. Lower the dumbbells under control back to the floor and reset for the next repetition.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and initiate drive from hips into the press

Rest intervals: Enhances hip power and conditions posterior chain while improving cardiovascular fitness
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width, grip one dumbbell with both hands and let it hang between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips with a soft bend in the knees and swing the dumbbell backward between your legs.
3. Drive your hips forward forcefully and let the momentum swing the dumbbell up to chest level.
4. Hinge back to control the descent and repeat the hip-driven swings.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keep a flat back power the swing with hips not arms

Rest intervals: Combines lower body strength development with upper back and shoulder pulling mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width, hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Lower into a squat by pushing hips back and keeping chest up until thighs are near parallel.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and pull the dumbbells upward with elbows leading to shoulder height.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to your sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep chest proud and knees tracking toes pull elbows high with control

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral leg strength and balance while adding targeted biceps strengthening
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and take a controlled step forward.
2. Lower into a front lunge until the front thigh is parallel and simultaneously curl both dumbbells toward your shoulders.
3. Pause briefly with the front leg planted and the weights at shoulder height.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing while lowering the dumbbells, then alternate legs.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and knee aligned over front foot while curling

Rest intervals: Builds single leg power and improves overhead pressing strength and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a sturdy bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing inward.
2. Step your right foot onto the bench and press through the heel to lift your body up.
3. Drive the dumbbells overhead into a full shoulder press as you stand tall on the bench.
4. Lower the weights to shoulder height and step down with the opposite foot.
Steps to perform: Drive through stepping heel brace core press overhead with control

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder stability and core control while challenging balance and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding light dumbbells overhead with arms extended and palms facing each other.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while keeping the weights steady overhead.
3. Lower the right foot and lift the left knee, continuing to alternate marching.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and engaged core as you lift each knee

Rest intervals: Develops explosive hip and posterior chain power and refines rapid pulling mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing your body.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend and lower the dumbbells to mid-thigh.
3. Explode upward by extending the hips and shrugging the shoulders to propel the weights.
4. Catch the dumbbells at the shoulder rack with elbows forward, then lower back to the start.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips drive explosively keep dumbbells close and maintain neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves overhead shoulder endurance and core anti rotation stability during loaded carries
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell overhead in one hand with elbow slightly bent and palm facing up.
2. Brace your core and keep your shoulder packed while maintaining a neutral spine.
3. Walk forward in controlled steps while keeping the dumbbell steady overhead.
4. Switch hands and repeat the same walk on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder packed ribs down walk tall with steady breathing

Rest intervals: Improves upper body coordination and dynamic punching endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a split stance holding a dumbbell in each hand at chin level with hands up and elbows in.
2. Snap the lead arm forward into a straight jab and immediately pull it back to guard.
3. Rotate your hips and shoulders and drive the rear arm across your body into a straight cross, then return to guard.
4. Continue alternating jab and cross with light, quick movements.
Steps to perform: Keep chin tucked and rotate hips and shoulders together

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and hip drive
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at mid-chest with palms facing you and knees slightly bent.
2. Drive one elbow down and then up in an arc while rotating your torso and lifting the dumbbell into an uppercut.
3. Lower that dumbbell back to the starting position and immediately perform the uppercut on the opposite side.
4. Continue alternating uppercuts in a smooth, rhythmic motion.
Steps to perform: Drive each uppercut from the hips with a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Develops shoulder mobility and overhead pressing stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at chest level with palms facing in.
2. Extend your right arm straight overhead in a punching motion while keeping the left hand near the chest.
3. Lower the right arm and immediately extend the left arm overhead in the same punching motion.
4. Continue alternating punches in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Steps to perform: Keep wrists neutral and brace your core before each overhead punch

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder speed and neuromuscular coordination with light load
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width apart and hold light dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Brace your core and press both dumbbells overhead quickly but under control.
3. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control.
4. Repeat at a faster, steady tempo while keeping shoulders relaxed.
Steps to perform: Control the lowering phase and keep ribs down to avoid lower back arch

Rest intervals: Increases shoulder joint mobility and muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold light dumbbells at your sides with palms facing in.
2. Lift arms out to shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows and make small forward circles.
3. Reverse the direction and continue making small circles while keeping your shoulders down.
Steps to perform: Maintain tall posture and move shoulders smoothly without shrugging

Rest intervals: Builds explosive rotational power and upper body speed
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and knees slightly bent and hold light dumbbells at your sides.
2. Rotate your torso and raise one elbow to about 90 degrees so the forearm is horizontal.
3. Snap the arm across in a horizontal hook using hip rotation and shoulder drive while keeping the wrist neutral.
4. Return under control and repeat on the opposite side in a steady alternating rhythm.
Steps to perform: Keep wrist neutral and rotate from hips control each hook

Rest intervals: Enhances transverse core engagement and punching accuracy
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a staggered stance and hold light dumbbells at chest level with elbows close to the body.
2. Rotate your torso and drive one arm diagonally across your body toward the opposite hip, extending the arm with a slight bend in the elbow.
3. Retract the dumbbell back to the starting position under control using the same torso rotation.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled, rhythmic pattern.
Steps to perform: Rotate through torso and pivot feet to protect lower back

Rest intervals: Improves arm coordination and replicates sprint arm mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold light dumbbells with a relaxed grip.
2. Bend your elbows to about 90 degrees and pump your arms front to back in a running motion driven from the shoulders.
3. Keep wrists neutral and avoid locking the elbows while maintaining quick, rhythmic arm swings.
4. Continue alternating arms while keeping an upright posture and a controlled tempo.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and core braced swing arms from shoulder joints

Rest intervals: Develops anterior shoulder endurance and fast muscle recruitment
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold light dumbbells at your thighs with palms facing down for Speed Front Raises.
2. Keep a slight bend in the elbows and brace your core.
3. Quickly raise the dumbbells straight in front to shoulder height with controlled motion.
4. Lower the weights back to the thighs under control and repeat at a brisk pace.
Steps to perform: Lead with elbows and avoid shrugging keep movements controlled

Rest intervals: Elevates shoulder endurance and rhythmic coordination without lower body impact
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms touching in front of your chest for Seal Jacks (Upper Body Only).
2. Open your arms out to the sides in a wide arc until your arms are extended, squeezing the shoulder blades together.
3. Rapidly bring the dumbbells back together in front of your chest with elbows soft.
4. Repeat the open-and-close motion at a steady, controlled tempo.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and squeeze shoulder blades together on each motion

Rest intervals: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and lower body power
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and hold dumbbells at your sides with a firm grip for Weighted High Knees.
2. Drive one knee up toward your chest while simultaneously pumping the opposite arm with the dumbbell.
3. Land softly on the ball of the foot and immediately drive the other knee up.
4. Continue alternating knees at a quick but controlled tempo while keeping an upright posture.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and drive knees up with controlled landings
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, COPD, Hyperthyroidism, Metabolic Syndrome

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and coordination while increasing muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Lift your right knee to hip level while driving the left elbow forward and keep your chest up.
3. Lower the right foot and immediately lift the left knee in the same controlled motion.
4. Continue alternating knees rapidly while maintaining an upright torso and steady arm drive.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and shoulders relaxed while lifting with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Improves lateral agility and hip strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Bend the knees slightly and hinge the hips to adopt an athletic stance.
3. Step laterally to the right with the right foot then quickly bring the left foot to meet it while staying low.
4. Repeat the shuffle to the opposite side with quick, controlled steps and an engaged core.
Steps to perform: Stay low in a slight squat and push through the whole foot

Rest intervals: Develops explosive leg power and movement efficiency
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a light dumbbell at chest level or one in each hand at your sides.
2. Send hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat until thighs are near parallel to the floor.
3. Explode up rapidly to standing, then descend with a slow, controlled three-count.
4. Repeat the fast-up, slow-down tempo for each rep while keeping weight on your heels and chest lifted.
Steps to perform: Sit hips back, keep chest tall, and control the descent

Rest intervals: Builds hamstring engagement and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Bend one knee and drive your heel up toward your glute while slightly hopping on the other foot.
3. Land softly and immediately drive the opposite heel up to alternate quickly.
4. Maintain a quick rhythm and braced core for the desired interval.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright torso and pull heels toward glutes with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Enhances foot quickness and lower body muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart holding light dumbbells at your sides.
2. Rapidly lift your feet in small, quick taps while keeping the knees soft and the dumbbells steady.
3. Stay on the balls of your feet and move for the chosen time or reps.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright, hinge slightly at the hips, maintain quick controlled steps
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, COPD, Hyperthyroidism, Metabolic Syndrome

Rest intervals: Strengthens glutes and promotes balance control
Health benefit:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and stand tall.
2. Step one foot back into a controlled lunge, lowering until the front knee is bent about 90 degrees.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and immediately step the other foot back.
4. Keep the torso upright and core engaged while alternating sides for the set.
Steps to perform: Step back with control, keep front knee tracking over toes, maintain upright chest

Rest intervals: Improves side-to-side stability and reactive coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Bend knees slightly and adopt a soft athletic stance.
3. Push off one foot and perform a small lateral hop to the other foot, keeping jumps low.
4. Land softly with bent knees and immediately repeat side-to-side with control.
Steps to perform: Land softly on midfoot, keep hips level and knees soft

Rest intervals: Increases calf endurance and ankle resilience
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Shift weight onto the balls of your feet and tighten your calves.
3. Perform small controlled bounces by lifting heels a few inches and returning them down.
4. Maintain a steady rhythm and keep core engaged throughout.
Steps to perform: Keep core braced, perform small controlled bounces from the balls of your feet

Rest intervals: Enhances hip flexibility and quadriceps strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level.
2. Lower into a deep squat with chest up and knees tracking over toes.
3. Take short, deliberate steps forward while keeping the squat depth.
4. Keep the movement steady and continue walking for the desired distance.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tall chest, keep hips low and knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Improves lateral trunk strength and mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at your side, left hand on your hip.
2. Inhale and slowly bend your torso to the right over three counts, keeping hips still.
3. Exhale and slowly return to center over three counts, keeping a neutral spine.
4. Switch sides and repeat with the same tempo.
Steps to perform: Keep hips squared and hinge only at the waist move slowly and controlled

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational power and functional core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands above your right shoulder.
2. Rotate your torso and swing the dumbbell diagonally down across your body toward your left hip in a controlled motion.
3. Reverse the motion and lift the dumbbell back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for reps then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate from the torso keep arms long and controlled exhale on the chop

Rest intervals: Targets obliques to improve core coordination and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a light dumbbell in each hand at your shoulders.
2. Lift your right knee and twist your torso to bring your left elbow toward the knee in a crunching motion.
3. Lower and return to start, then alternate sides while keeping a steady rhythm.
Steps to perform: Drive elbow toward opposite knee with stable hips brace core and exhale

Rest intervals: Boosts rotational endurance and dynamic core control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, hold one dumbbell with both hands at chest, and lift feet a few inches.
2. Rotate your torso quickly to the right, moving the dumbbell beside your hip in a controlled motion.
3. Rotate immediately to the left and continue alternating at a swift, controlled pace.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tall spine hinge slightly at hips control rotation avoid momentum

Rest intervals: Promotes shoulder mobility and upper core stabilization
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell vertically by the head with both hands at chest level.
