2. Lift the dumbbell to forehead height and circle it slowly around your head in a tight arc.
3. Maintain a neutral spine and soft elbows as you complete the circle behind your head.
4. Reverse the direction and repeat for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Circle dumbbell around head with straight spine and neck neutral exhale steadily

Rest intervals: Increases spinal rotation range and movement efficiency
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands at chest height.
2. Rotate your torso to the right, leading with your chest while your hips remain facing forward.
3. Rotate your torso to the left in a controlled motion and continue alternating rotations.
Steps to perform: Keep a tall spine and rotate from your upper back

Rest intervals: Enhances hip flexor and abdominal coordination during gait patterns
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Lift your right knee toward your left elbow while rotating your torso and bringing the left elbow down to meet the knee.
3. Lower the foot and return to standing while keeping your core tight.
4. Repeat on the other side in a controlled marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral pelvis and exhale as you drive knee to elbow

Rest intervals: Strengthens lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold one dumbbell with both hands extended over your chest.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor and perform small alternating flutter kicks.
3. Keep the lower back pressed into the floor and the dumbbell steady overhead.
Steps to perform: Press your lower back into the mat and keep small controlled kicks

Rest intervals: Builds central abdominal strength and improves seated posture control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench holding one dumbbell with both hands at your chest.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the floor to balance on your sit bones.
3. Draw your knees toward your chest while keeping the dumbbell against your chest.
4. Extend your legs back out without touching the floor and repeat with control.
Steps to perform: Sit tall, brace your core, and pull knees in with control

Rest intervals: Enhances side body flexibility and shoulder reach range
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand overhead.
2. Brace your core and slowly lean your torso to the right, reaching the right dumbbell toward your hip.
3. Return to center and repeat the reach to the left.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and reach through the ribs without collapsing the lower back

Rest intervals: Improves cardiovascular fitness and coordination while engaging shoulders and core
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet together and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Bend knees slightly and explode into a jump, planting feet wider while raising dumbbells overhead.
3. Land softly with knees bent and lower the dumbbells back toward your sides.
4. Repeat the movement rhythmically.
Steps to perform: Land softly with knees tracking toes and core braced

Rest intervals: Builds full body strength and movement control with lower impact
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and place the dumbbells on the floor, then step one foot back and then the other into a plank.
3. Perform a push-up with hands gripping the dumbbells, then step both feet forward toward your hands.
4. Stand up by driving through your heels and press the dumbbells overhead.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and lower with control

Rest intervals: Enhances hip power and lateral coordination while elevating heart rate
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands at arm's length.
2. Hinge at the hips and swing the dumbbell back between your legs while keeping a flat back.
3. Thrust your hips forward to propel the dumbbell up to chest level, keeping your arms relaxed.
4. Control the descent by hinging at the hips and let the dumbbell swing back between the legs.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with soft knees and braced core

Rest intervals: Develops total body strength and overhead stability through coordinated lifting
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width over dumbbells on the floor and hinge at the hips to grip them.
2. Drive through the legs and hips to lift the dumbbells to a racked position at your shoulders.
3. Press the dumbbells overhead by extending your elbows and bracing your core.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the shoulders, hinge at the hips, and place them on the ground under control.
Steps to perform: Drive with legs and press overhead keeping ribs down and core tight

Rest intervals: Combines lower body strength with upper body mobility and dynamic core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Sit back into a squat until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor while keeping your chest up.
3. Drive up through your heels to stand tall and extend the right arm forward in a controlled punch.
4. Return the right hand to the shoulder and repeat the next rep, alternating the punching arm each repetition.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and exhale as you extend the punch

Rest intervals: Improves aerobic capacity and leg endurance with reduced joint stress
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet together and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while lifting both arms out and up to shoulder height.
3. Step the right foot back to center while lowering the dumbbells, then repeat to the left.
Steps to perform: Land softly through the whole foot

Rest intervals: Enhances explosive power, unilateral coordination, and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend and hold one dumbbell between your feet with the working arm extended.
2. Drive through your hips and explode upward while pulling the dumbbell close to your body.
3. Punch the dumbbell overhead as you drop under it and lock your arm at full extension.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting hinge position under control and reset.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with a tall chest

Rest intervals: Improves metabolic conditioning and synchronized lower to upper body power output
Health benefit:
1. Hold a light dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with feet hip-width apart.
2. Drop into a quick shallow squat, then drive through your heels and explosively press the dumbbells overhead.
3. Lower the dumbbells back to your shoulders as you return to standing and continue in a fast, controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Exhale forcefully on the upward drive

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral leg strength, balance, and dynamic hip control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and feet hip-width apart.
2. Step back into a reverse lunge, keeping your torso upright and the dumbbells steady at your sides.
3. Push through the front foot and drive the rear knee forward and up toward your chest while holding the dumbbells.
4. Return to standing with control and repeat, alternating legs.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright while driving the knee

Rest intervals: Increases posterior chain power and conditioning through ballistic hip hinge movements
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hold one dumbbell vertically with both hands between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend and let the dumbbell swing back between your legs while keeping a flat back.
3. Explosively extend the hips to drive the dumbbell forward to chest level using hip power.
4. Let the dumbbell descend under control back between your legs and repeat in a smooth rhythm.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips to generate power from the glutes

Rest intervals: Improves rotator cuff strength and shoulder joint stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side or stand with the working elbow bent 90 degrees and pressed to your side, holding a light dumbbell.
2. Externally rotate the shoulder to lift the dumbbell away from your body until the forearm is roughly parallel to the floor.
3. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the starting position with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow tucked to your side and rotate slowly with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder endurance and controlled mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold light dumbbells in each hand with arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height, palms facing down.
2. Keep a slight bend in the elbows and rotate both arms slowly in small controlled circles forward using the shoulders to move the weights.
3. Reverse the direction and rotate both arms slowly in small controlled circles backward.
4. Lower the arms and dumbbells to your sides with control and reset for the next set.
Steps to perform: Keep core braced and control small slow circles from the shoulder

Rest intervals: Strengthens scapular muscles and improves shoulder posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with elbows bent at 90 degrees and hands near your hips.
2. Pull your shoulder blades straight back and together while keeping your elbows close to your sides and your chest neutral.
3. Release the squeeze slowly until the shoulder blades return to a neutral position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulder blades together without shrugging keep neck long

Rest intervals: Increases chest flexibility and promotes upper body range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a flat bench or the floor with knees bent and hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other and a slight bend in the elbows.
2. Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a gentle stretch across the chest.
3. Keep a constant slight bend in the elbows and avoid letting the weights drop behind the plane of your shoulders.
4. Exhale and bring the dumbbells back together above your chest using control.
Steps to perform: Maintain a soft bend in elbows lower with control until you feel a stretch

Rest intervals: Builds midback strength and enhances shoulder blade control
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on an incline bench for Prone Y-Raise, holding light dumbbells with thumbs up.
2. Let your arms hang straight down with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Raise the dumbbells up and out at a 45-degree angle to form a Y, leading with the thumbs and keeping shoulders down.
4. Lower the weights slowly to the start position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep neck neutral and lift through the scapula using controlled motion

Rest intervals: Improves forearm strength and grip endurance
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a bench and rest your forearms on your thighs with palms facing up, holding dumbbells.
2. Allow the dumbbells to hang just past your knees so your wrists are extended.
3. Curl your wrists upward by contracting the forearms, keeping the forearms stationary.
4. Lower the dumbbells under control to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep wrists neutral and curl with slow controlled motions

Rest intervals: Develops wrist extensors and balances forearm muscle strength
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a bench and rest your forearms on your thighs with palms facing down, holding dumbbells.
2. Let the dumbbells hang past your knees so your wrists are flexed.
3. Raise the backs of your hands toward the ceiling by extending the wrists, keeping forearms still.
4. Lower the weights slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep forearm aligned and lift the wrist slowly with control

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder mobility and joint range through controlled movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a single light dumbbell horizontally with both hands in front of your hips, palms facing down.
2. Keep arms straight and slowly lift the dumbbell up and over your head in a wide arc while maintaining a neutral spine.
3. Continue the arc until the dumbbell reaches behind your hips with arms extended but not locked.
4. Reverse the arc with control to return the dumbbell to the front of your hips.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and pull shoulder blades down and back

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and proprioception through rotational movement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hold one light dumbbell vertically in one hand, elbow bent 90° at your side.
2. Keep the elbow pinned to your side and rotate the forearm across your body like turning a steering wheel toward your stomach.
3. Move the forearm outward in a smooth arc to rotate the dumbbell away from your body while maintaining the 90° elbow.
4. Repeat the arc for reps, then switch the dumbbell to the other hand and repeat.
Steps to perform: Anchor elbows at your sides and rotate slowly with scapular stability

Rest intervals: Promotes thoracic mobility and scapular coordination for better posture
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and hold a light dumbbell in each hand with arms by your sides.
2. Press your upper back into the floor and slide the dumbbells up toward the ceiling, keeping them close to your ears.
3. Lower the dumbbells in a wide arc out to the sides until your elbows near the floor while keeping contact of your upper back with the floor.
4. Reverse the motion with control to bring the dumbbells back beside your hips.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed to the floor and move arms slowly with scapular control

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and heels together, holding a dumbbell against the outside of the top thigh.
2. Brace your core and keep hips stacked and feet touching.
3. Lift the top knee upward while keeping heels together and the dumbbell stable.
4. Lower the knee with control back to the start position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and still lift the knee slowly

Rest intervals: Strengthens anterior lower leg muscles and improves ankle dorsiflexion control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench with knees bent and place a small dumbbell on top of one foot near the toes, stabilizing it with your hand.
2. Pull your toes and foot upward toward your shin to dorsiflex and lift the dumbbell.
3. Lower the foot slowly with control back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Sit tall and pull toes toward shin with slow controlled ankle movement

Rest intervals: Improves balance and proprioception for single-leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and shift weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the free foot a few inches off the ground and keep hips level and core engaged.
3. Hold the position for the chosen time while maintaining balance, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Stand tall soften the knee slightly and keep hips level

Rest intervals: Builds hip abductor strength and supports hip joint stability
Health benefit:
1. Get on all fours with a light dumbbell held behind the working knee by the same-side hand.
2. Brace your core and lift the knee out to the side until the thigh is roughly parallel to the floor.
3. Pause and squeeze the glute at the top.
4. Lower the leg under control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral avoid rotating and lift the knee with control

Rest intervals: Improves hip and ankle mobility while reinforcing squat motor patterns
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell vertical at your chest with both hands.
2. Sit back into a deep squat until your hips are as low as your mobility allows while keeping an upright chest.
3. Press your knees outward and brace your core to maintain the position.
4. Hold the bottom position for the desired time, then stand up under control.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up knees tracking toes and breathe evenly through the hold

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and reinforces proper hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and rest a dumbbell in each hand on your upper traps with elbows slightly back.
2. Hinge at the hips with a flat back and push your hips backward while keeping a soft bend in the knees.
3. Lower your torso until it is nearly parallel to the floor or you feel tension in the posterior chain.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and squeeze your glutes at the top.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips keeping a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves lateral mobility and single-leg strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand wide with toes pointing forward and hold a dumbbell vertically at your chest in a goblet grip.
2. Shift weight to one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight and toes up.
3. Lower only as far as a shallow range allows while keeping chest tall and the dumbbell close.
4. Push through the bent foot to return to center and repeat to the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Keep lead foot flat and chest tall while moving with control

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor endurance and coordination for gait and stepping
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Drive one knee up toward your chest to hip height while keeping the opposite leg slightly bent and core engaged.
3. Lower the leg under control and alternate sides in a steady marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Anchor pelvis and lift knee using abdominal control

Rest intervals: Promotes hip external rotation mobility and lateral stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step one leg back and diagonally behind the front leg into a curtsy while bending both knees.
3. Keep your chest lifted and torso upright as you lower until the front thigh is near parallel.
4. Drive through the front foot to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and lower with control

Rest intervals: Targets glute strength and pelvic stability on each side
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended, and rest a dumbbell on the hip of the bent leg.
2. Press the planted foot into the floor and drive your hips up until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knee.
3. Squeeze the glute of the planted leg at the top and keep the extended leg in line with the torso.
4. Lower your hips slowly to the mat and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Drive through heel and keep hips level at the top

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral core stability and grip strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell at one side in a neutral grip.
2. Engage your core and keep shoulders down and back while bracing the torso.
3. Hold the weight steady without rotating or leaning for the desired time.
4. Switch sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders level and chest upright while breathing steadily

Rest intervals: Enhances posterior chain coordination and spinal stability
Health benefit:
1. Start on hands and knees with a light dumbbell in one hand and your spine neutral.
2. Brace your core and simultaneously extend the dumbbell-bearing arm forward and the opposite leg straight back.
3. Keep hips level and avoid twisting as you reach long through fingertips and toes.
4. Return the arm and leg to the starting position with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace core lengthen spine move slowly to prevent hip rotation

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core control and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width, hold one dumbbell in each hand with arms relaxed and a slight bend in the elbows.
2. Hinge at the hips, push your butt back, and guide the right-hand dumbbell between your legs toward the left hand in a sweeping figure-8 path.
3. Pass the dumbbell to the left hand behind the left knee and continue the sweep back through the legs to the right hand with control.
4. Repeat the figure-8 motion fluidly, keeping a flat back and braced core.
Steps to perform: Control the swing path hinge at hips keep chest lifted

Rest intervals: Strengthens oblique muscles and improves lateral torso mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, grip one dumbbell with both hands and press it overhead, arms extended and core engaged.
2. Keep hips square and slide the dumbbell down the right side of your body by bending at the waist, maintaining a neutral spine.
3. Return to center with control and slide the dumbbell down the left side by bending to the left.
4. Alternate sides with each repetition, keeping the dumbbell overhead and the core tight.
Steps to perform: Lower ribcage into pelvis keep hips square move with control

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder stability and anti-lateral flexion core control
Health benefit:
1. Clean and press a dumbbell overhead with one arm until the elbow is locked and the wrist is stacked over the shoulder.
2. Stand tall with feet hip-width and engage your core, keeping the opposite arm relaxed at your side.
3. Walk forward in short, controlled steps while keeping the dumbbell directly overhead and the torso stable.
4. Continue for the chosen distance or time, then switch arms and repeat.
Steps to perform: Stack wrist over shoulder engage lats breathe and walk tall

Rest intervals: Improves total body tension, core stability, and shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Place a dumbbell in each hand under your shoulders and start on hands and knees.
2. Tuck your toes and lift your knees a few inches off the floor so your shins hover.
3. Brace your core, keep a flat back, and grip the dumbbells firmly.
4. Hold the position, keep hips level, and breathe steadily.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep hips level to prevent lower back sag

Rest intervals: Strengthens obliques and enhances hip and lower back mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold one dumbbell with both hands extended over your chest.
2. Lift your legs to vertical with knees slightly bent and press your shoulders into the floor.
3. Lower your legs slowly to one side until you feel controlled tension.
4. Return legs through center and lower to the other side with control.
Steps to perform: Keep both shoulders pressed to the ground and move legs with control

Rest intervals: Builds anterior core endurance and promotes spinal alignment
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold a dumbbell with both hands extended overhead.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs off the floor and reach the dumbbell back to lengthen your body.
3. Press your lower back into the floor and tighten your core.
4. Hold the hollow position and breathe steadily while maintaining the reach.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into floor and reach through toes with tight core

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder mobility and thoracic rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a bench with feet flat and hold one dumbbell vertically by the head at chest level.
2. Brace your core and keep elbows slightly bent.
3. Move the dumbbell in a controlled arc around your head, keeping it close to the skull.
4. Reverse the direction after each rep and maintain an even tempo.
Steps to perform: Maintain tall spine and move weight slowly around head with controlled shoulders

Rest intervals: Develops anti-rotation core strength and standing stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell at chest in one hand.
2. Adopt a staggered stance and brace your core to prevent rotation.
3. Press the dumbbell straight out in front of your chest until your arm extends, keeping shoulders square.
4. Slowly return the dumbbell to the chest and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace core and exhale while resisting rotation with feet shoulder width apart

Rest intervals: Builds lateral core strength and shoulder stability while promoting hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hold one dumbbell overhead in one hand with the arm locked.
2. Turn the toes of the weight-bearing side slightly out and brace your core.
3. Hinge at the hips and slide the free hand down the inside of the front leg while keeping eyes on the dumbbell.
4. Drive through the hips to return upright and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and eyes on the dumbbell

Rest intervals: Enhances coordinated shoulder stability and transitional core control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold one dumbbell in your right hand extended toward the ceiling.
2. Bend your right knee with the foot flat and roll onto your left forearm while keeping the dumbbell vertical.
3. Press through your right foot and left forearm to lift your hips into a bridge while keeping the dumbbell overhead.
4. Lower your hips, roll back onto your back, and place the dumbbell safely on your chest.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep the overhead arm locked and shoulder packed

Rest intervals: Promotes lower body strength and overhead mobility through full body extension
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Sit back into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor while keeping your chest upright.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and lift both dumbbells overhead until your arms are straight.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to your sides under control and reset your stance.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and core braced to prevent low back arch when reaching

Rest intervals: Enhances hip and leg strength while improving thoracic rotation and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a single dumbbell with both hands at chest level.
2. Step forward with your right foot into a lunge so the front knee tracks over the ankle.
3. Rotate your torso to the right over the front leg while keeping the dumbbell close to your chest.
4. Rotate back to center, push through the front heel to stand, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and rotate from the upper spine not the low back

Rest intervals: Develops rotational power and controlled core stability while improving coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands near one hip.
2. Rotate your torso and lift the dumbbell slowly on a diagonal toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Reverse the movement slowly and control the dumbbell back to the starting hip.
4. Repeat for the desired reps, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and move slowly driving rotation from the ribs not the hips

Rest intervals: Increases unilateral core stability and carry strength while challenging posture and grip
Health benefit:
1. Clean a dumbbell to one shoulder and hold it in the rack position with elbow close to the body.
2. Brace your core, stand tall, and walk forward with steady steps while keeping the dumbbell secure at the rack.
3. Carry for a set distance or time, then switch arms.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and brace core to prevent lateral flexion

Rest intervals: Targets dynamic hip mobility and cross body flexibility while enhancing coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach your left hand across your body toward your right toes while guiding the dumbbell in your right hand toward the same toe.
3. Return to standing using your core, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and keep a neutral spine as you reach

Rest intervals: Builds functional lower body strength and improves everyday transfer ability and power
Health benefit:
1. Sit at the edge of a stable chair with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Lean slightly forward and press through your heels to stand up fully while keeping the dumbbells at your sides.
3. Pause at the top with hips and knees extended and shoulders tall.
4. Slowly sit back down with control until your butt lightly touches the chair, keeping weight in your heels.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels and keep chest up while maintaining a tight core

Rest intervals: Increases shoulder stability and thoracic mobility while engaging core and hamstrings eccentrically
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a light dumbbell in each hand with arms at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and walk your hands forward on the dumbbells until you reach a high plank, keeping the core engaged.
3. Hold the plank briefly, then walk your hands back toward your feet using the dumbbells.
4. Hinge at the hips and roll up to standing while keeping the dumbbells close to your body.
Steps to perform: Maintain a flat back and control movement from shoulders to hips

Rest intervals: Trains unilateral leg strength and balance while enhancing hip control and proprioception
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step one foot back and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees are near 90 degrees, keeping your torso upright.
3. Drive through the front heel to return to standing, lift the back knee into a balance, and pause before repeating.
Steps to perform: Step knee over midfoot and keep torso tall as you recover into balance

Rest intervals: Improves chest flexibility and thoracic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a flat bench with feet planted and hold a dumbbell in each hand above your chest, palms facing one another.
2. Open your arms slowly out to the sides with a soft bend in the elbows until you feel a stretch across the chest.
3. Hold the open position while keeping a steady breath and a neutral spine.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together over the chest using the chest muscles and set them down with control.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder blades down and back to protect shoulders

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring flexibility and posterior chain mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand with arms hanging in front.
2. Hinge at the hips, push the hips back, and lower the torso with a flat back until you feel a hamstring stretch.
3. Hold the hang with a slight bend in the knees and steady breathing.
4. Drive the hips forward to stand tall and place the dumbbells down with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips with soft knees and a long neutral spine

Rest intervals: Strengthens obliques and improves lateral trunk mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell in one hand at your side.
2. Brace your core and slowly bend the torso sideways toward the dumbbell while keeping hips stable.
3. Pause briefly at the bottom without rotating the torso.
4. Use your oblique to lift back to upright and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and spine tall while moving through the obliques

Rest intervals: Promotes spinal stretch and hamstring flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands in front of your hips.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward, letting the dumbbell hang toward the floor.
3. Relax your neck and shoulders and allow the torso to drape while keeping a slight bend in the knees.
4. Gently sway side to side or nod the dumbbell to increase the hang.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips relax your neck and maintain a long spine

Rest intervals: Improves latissimus flexibility and shoulder range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a bench or the floor and grip one dumbbell vertically with both hands above your chest.
2. Keep your arms mostly straight and slowly lower the dumbbell back over your head until you feel a lat stretch.
3. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest by engaging the lats and returning your hands toward your hips.
4. Pause briefly at the top and repeat or hold at end-range for a stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down engage core and control shoulders while lowering the dumbbell

Rest intervals: Enhances hip mobility and squat depth through deep loaded hold
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and hold one dumbbell vertically at chest level with both hands.
2. Push your hips back and descend into a deep squat until your hips are near knee level.
3. Press your elbows against your inner thighs and drive them outward to pry your knees apart.
4. Hold the bottom position while keeping your chest up and core braced.
Steps to perform: Sit back into hips chest up keep knees tracking toes

Rest intervals: Improves spinal rotation and thoracic mobility while engaging core stabilizers
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a bench or chair with feet flat and hold one dumbbell vertically at chest with both hands.
2. Engage your core and rotate your torso slowly to one side until you feel the twist in your mid-back.
3. Pause for a moment while keeping your hips facing forward.
4. Rotate back through center and repeat to the other side.
Steps to perform: Sit tall lengthen spine rotate slowly from thoracic spine not lower back

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor openness and lateral torso mobility while challenging balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in one hand overhead with your arm straight and feet hip-width apart.
2. Step back with the opposite leg and lower into a lunge until your front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Keep the arm overhead and lean your torso toward the side of the front leg to perform a side reach.
4. Push through the front foot to return to standing and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee over ankle reach overhead without arching lower back

Rest intervals: Increases lateral neck mobility and muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright and hold a light dumbbell in one hand against the side of your head.
2. Slowly bend your neck toward the hand holding the dumbbell while keeping your shoulders relaxed.
3. Return your head to neutral and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright move only the neck slowly and with control

Rest intervals: Enhances hip flexor length and single leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step one foot back into a stationary lunge and bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your torso upright and press your hips forward slightly to target the rear hip flexor while keeping the dumbbells steady.
4. Hold the position for the desired time, then push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Steps to perform: Tuck tailbone slightly to lengthen front hip keep chest tall

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat while holding a dumbbell in one hand at chest level.
2. Engage your core and reach the dumbbell diagonally across your body toward the opposite outer thigh while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Control the return by bringing the dumbbell back to chest without arching your lower back.
4. Repeat the reach for the desired reps then switch the dumbbell to the other hand and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep low back pressed gently into mat as you reach across

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral flexibility and lower body stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wide and hold a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended at shoulder height.
2. Turn your front foot forward, hinge at the hip, and reach the front hand with its dumbbell down toward the shin while lifting the opposite arm and dumbbell toward the ceiling.
3. Keep a soft bend in both knees, open your chest to the side, and maintain a long spine.
4. Hold the triangle position for the desired time, then press through the top arm to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Square hips forward and maintain neutral spine while holding weight
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Rest intervals: Increases biceps and forearm flexibility and elbow extension range
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a bench with feet flat and hold a light dumbbell in one hand.
2. Rotate the palm up and move the arm behind your torso so the dumbbell rests near your hip.
3. Straighten the elbow slightly and lower the dumbbell to increase the stretch in the biceps.
4. Hold for 20–30 seconds, then switch arms.
Steps to perform: Sit tall with shoulders down and keep elbows aligned

Rest intervals: Improves calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion aiding balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a wall and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step one foot back with the heel down and keep the back leg straight.
3. Lean forward into the front knee while keeping your hips square until you feel the calf stretch, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep back leg straight and heel pressing into the floor

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral torso flexibility and spinal extension mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands overhead.
2. Keep arms straight and lengthen through the spine as you tilt your torso to one side.
3. Hold briefly, return to center, then tilt to the other side.
Steps to perform: Reach overhead while lengthening the spine and breathing evenly

Rest intervals: Improves hip and hamstring mobility and functional squat mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell vertically with both hands at your chest.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower into a squat, keeping the dumbbell close to your body.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and extend your hips while pressing the dumbbell overhead.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to your chest and hinge forward to return to the squat position.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and drive chest up with weight close to body
MET value: Hypertension, Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis, Chronic Low Back Pain, Coronary Artery Disease

Rest intervals: Increases triceps and shoulder flexibility to improve overhead reach
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall and hold a light dumbbell in your right hand with the arm extended overhead.
2. Bend your right elbow and lower the dumbbell behind your head while reaching your left hand to support the right elbow.
3. Hold the stretch for several breaths, then switch sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and avoid arching lower back while reaching overhead

Rest intervals: Enhances hamstring and groin flexibility while promoting core control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs in a wide straddle and hold one dumbbell vertically against your chest with both hands.
2. Keep your spine long and hinge at the hips to fold forward, guiding the dumbbell toward the floor between your legs.
3. Use the dumbbell for gentle added pressure as you maintain a relaxed neck and open chest.
4. Hold the forward position briefly, then lift the dumbbell to sit upright and release the stretch.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a long spine and exhale as you fold

Rest intervals: Improves lateral trunk mobility and oblique muscle engagement for stability
Health benefit:
1. Kneeling Side Reach: Kneel on your right knee with your left foot flat and hold a dumbbell in your left hand at your side.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the dumbbell down and slightly out to the left while keeping a straight spine.
3. Pause briefly at the end range with the arm extended.
4. Return the dumbbell to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace your core, keep hips square, and reach laterally with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Develops rotational power while enhancing shoulder stability and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Weighted Dynamic Windmill: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell in your right hand overhead with your arm straight.
2. Rotate your left foot slightly and hinge at the hips while reaching your left hand toward the floor and keeping your eyes on the dumbbell.
3. Lower the free hand toward the shin or floor while keeping the weighted arm locked and torso tall.
4. Reverse the motion to stand upright and repeat, then switch the dumbbell to the other hand.
Steps to perform: Keep the loaded shoulder packed, hinge at hips, move slowly with control

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder mobility and gentle joint range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Weighted Pendulum Swing: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell with both hands between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips and drive them forward to swing the dumbbell up toward chest height while keeping the arms relaxed.
3. Let the weight swing back down between your legs and repeat in a smooth, controlled pendulum motion.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and hinge from hips with core braced

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Step wide to the right and shift hips back, bending the right knee while keeping the left leg straight.
3. Sink into the right lunge until the right thigh is parallel or comfortable and keep your chest upright.
4. Hold the position, keep weight on the right foot, then push through the right heel to return to center.
Steps to perform: Ensure knee tracks toes and hips sit back with chest upright

Rest intervals: Promotes thoracic extension and lower back stability under light load
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down with forearms on the floor and place a light dumbbell across your hips, holding it steady with both hands.
2. Press forearms into the floor and lift your chest into a gentle sphinx, keeping hips grounded and shoulders relaxed.
3. Hold the lifted position while breathing steadily, then lower with control and remove the dumbbell.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and glutes engaged to avoid overarch in lower back

Rest intervals: Enhances hip adductor flexibility and glute activation during lateral movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step your right leg diagonally behind your left into a curtsy, bending both knees and keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower until the front thigh is parallel or comfortable and feel the stretch across the glutes.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the start, then repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Drive through the heel and maintain upright torso with knee aligned over toes

Rest intervals: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and promotes improved shoulder posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Keep your arms straight and pull your shoulder blades down toward your hips to depress the scapulae.
3. Hold the depressed position briefly, then slowly relax back to a neutral shoulder position.
Steps to perform: Pull shoulder blades down and back while keeping ribs stable and neck long

Rest intervals: Increases hip external rotation mobility while adding gentle loading
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a chair or bench and cross your right ankle over your left thigh to form a figure-4.
2. Place a light dumbbell on top of the right knee or hold it gently against the shin for added weight.
3. Hinge forward from the hips with a flat back until you feel a stretch, then return to upright.
Steps to perform: Keep spine long and neutral

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor length and standing balance
Health benefit:
1. Step your left foot forward into a low lunge with the back heel lifted and hold a dumbbell in each hand by your sides.
2. Square your hips forward and lengthen through your spine.
3. Press both dumbbells overhead or keep them at shoulder height while reaching upward to deepen the stretch.
4. Hold briefly, then lower the weights and step back to standing.
Steps to perform: Tuck pelvis and lengthen through the spine

Rest intervals: Promotes hamstring flexibility and spinal mobility under controlled load
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward, keeping a long spine as you lower the dumbbells toward the floor.
3. Allow the dumbbells to hang toward your feet, keeping a slight bend in the knees and a relaxed neck.
4. Hold the position for the desired time and slowly roll up by stacking the spine to stand.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with soft knees

Rest intervals: Improves anterior shoulder and chest flexibility while promoting postural openness
Health benefit:
1. Stand upright and hold one light dumbbell behind your back with the palm facing away.
2. Gently lift the dumbbell upward by extending the shoulder backward until you feel a stretch across the front of the shoulder.
3. Keep the chest open and the opposite hand resting on the hip or thigh.
4. Hold the stretch and lower the dumbbell slowly to release.
Steps to perform: Keep neck neutral and draw shoulders back slightly

Rest intervals: Enhances groin and inner thigh flexibility with added loading for deeper mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with the soles of your feet together and hold a light dumbbell in each hand resting on your knees.
2. Press your knees gently toward the floor using the weight of the dumbbells while keeping the spine long.
3. Lean slightly forward from the hips to deepen the stretch while maintaining a neutral spine.
4. Hold the position and breathe steadily before releasing the dumbbells and returning upright.
Steps to perform: Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic extension
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on a mat with toes together and knees apart and hold a light dumbbell in your right hand.
2. Sit back on your heels, hinge at the hips, and extend the dumbbell-holding arm forward along the mat.
3. Reach the dumbbell forward as far as comfortable while keeping your forehead or chest close to the mat.
4. Return the dumbbell to your side and repeat on the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Keep a long neutral spine and engage core as you reach the weight forward

Rest intervals: Enhances hip flexor flexibility and rotational core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and hold one dumbbell vertically at chest height with both hands.
2. Step forward into a deep lunge, keeping the front knee over the ankle and the back leg extended.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping the dumbbell at chest height.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the opposite leg.
Steps to perform: Square hips forward and rotate from the thoracic spine keeping front knee over ankle

Rest intervals: Increases wrist and forearm flexibility for better mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit with your forearm resting on your thigh and hold a light dumbbell in your hand with the palm facing down.
2. Let the dumbbell gently pull your hand downward so the wrist flexes and you feel a stretch across the top of the forearm.
3. Use your opposite hand to apply light downward pressure on the back of the hand to deepen the stretch.
4. Hold for the desired time, then switch to the other wrist.
Steps to perform: Maintain a straight forearm and gently extend fingers while breathing into the stretch

Rest intervals: Builds lower body endurance and hip abductor strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned slightly outward, holding one dumbbell vertically with both hands at chest.
2. Sit back into a deep sumo squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor or lower.
3. Press your knees outward, keep your chest up, and grip the dumbbell firmly.
4. Hold the static squat, maintain steady breathing, and keep weight through your heels.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking toes sit back through your heels

Rest intervals: Improves spinal rotation range and oblique activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hold one light dumbbell with both hands over your chest.
2. Draw your knees toward your torso and lift your feet off the floor slightly.
3. Slowly lower both knees to one side toward the floor while keeping your shoulders flat and the dumbbell steady.
4. Bring knees back to center with control and repeat the movement to the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Draw belly button to spine control the rotation and keep shoulders grounded

Rest intervals: Promotes hamstring flexibility and posterior chain lengthening
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward with a long spine, letting the dumbbells hang between your legs.
3. Slightly bend the knees as needed, hold the fold briefly, and then engage the core to rise back up.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a long spine and soft knees

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder external rotation and scapular stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, holding a light dumbbell in each hand.
2. Extend your arms out to the sides in a T with elbows soft and palms facing up.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift the dumbbells slightly off the floor with control.
4. Hold the position for 20–30 seconds and then bring the dumbbells back to your chest.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders pressed into mat and squeeze shoulder blades together

Rest intervals: Challenges hamstring isometric strength and posterior chain endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a pair of dumbbells in front of your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and slide the dumbbells down your legs while keeping a slight bend in the knees.
3. Hold the hinged position feeling hamstring tension and then squeeze your glutes to return to standing.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine, hinge from hips, and maintain a micro bend in knees

Rest intervals: Increases lateral trunk flexibility and oblique muscle activation
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with both legs folded to one side and hold a light dumbbell in the top hand at shoulder height.
2. Press the bottom hand into the floor for support and reach the dumbbell overhead with a long spine.
3. Lean the torso away from the weight into a side bend while keeping your hips grounded.
4. Hold the stretch for 20–30 seconds, then lower the dumbbell and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Lengthen through the ribcage, avoid collapsing, and breathe into the stretched side

Rest intervals: Improves hip external rotation mobility and glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands at chest.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and soften the knees.
3. Rotate your torso and sweep the dumbbell outward and down like opening a gate.
4. Reverse the motion and return to the start with control.
Steps to perform: Control the descent, keep hips level, and lead movement with the chest

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral shoulder strength and overhead stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height with palm facing forward.
2. Brace your core and press the dumbbell straight overhead until the arm is fully extended.
3. Keep the wrist neutral and avoid leaning back as you press.
4. Lower the dumbbell with control back to shoulder height.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and press with controlled motion avoiding torso lean

Rest intervals: Develops biceps strength while promoting balance and lower body stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with one foot slightly forward and hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing forward.
2. Keep your elbows tight to your torso and brace your core.
3. Curl the dumbbell(s) toward your shoulders by contracting the biceps.
4. Lower the weight slowly back to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep elbows near torso during slow controlled curls

Rest intervals: Targets lateral deltoid strength and improves shoulder abduction control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side.
2. Slightly bend your elbow and brace your core.
3. Lift the dumbbell out to the side in a controlled motion until your arm reaches shoulder height.
4. Pause briefly and lower the dumbbell slowly back to your side.
Steps to perform: Keep a soft elbow and lift with controlled scapular stability

Rest intervals: Enhances scapular plane strength and core stability in a unilateral position
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on one knee with the opposite foot planted and hold a dumbbell in the hand of the front leg with thumb pointing up.
2. Keep a neutral spine and brace your core.
3. Raise the dumbbell in the scapular plane about 30° forward of the side with a slight elbow bend to shoulder height.
4. Pause, then lower the dumbbell with control back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and core braced while lifting in the scapular plane

Rest intervals: Develops anterior shoulder endurance and promotes controlled arm elevation
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at thigh level with palms facing down.
2. Brace your core and keep a slight bend in the elbows as you raise one dumbbell straight in front of you to shoulder height.
3. Lower that dumbbell with control and repeat on the opposite side, alternating reps.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and lift with slow controlled motion without momentum

Rest intervals: Increases upper trapezius strength and shoulder girdle stability under asymmetrical load
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side with a neutral grip.
2. Keep your arm straight and brace your core.
3. Elevate the shoulder of the weighted side straight up toward your ear in a shrugging motion.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then lower the shoulder back down under control.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder packed and lift scapula slowly without neck tension

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell overhead in one hand with your palm facing inward.
2. Keep the upper arm vertical and brace your core to prevent arching.
3. Bend the elbow to lower the dumbbell behind your head until your forearm approaches parallel to the floor.
4. Extend the elbow to press the dumbbell back overhead without moving the upper arm.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow close to head and extend with slow controlled motion

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation while challenging scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell vertically by one end with both hands at chest level.
2. Brace your core and bring the dumbbell close to your forehead.
3. Move the dumbbell in a controlled semi-circle around your head to the other side, keeping it close to your skull.
4. Reverse the path to return to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace core and move weight slowly around head with neck long

Rest intervals: Enhances isometric core and shoulder endurance while improving grip strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height.
2. Press the dumbbell overhead until the arm is straight and the wrist is neutral.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged without letting the body lean.
4. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Stack wrist elbow and shoulder and breathe steadily to maintain upright posture

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral chest and triceps strength with improved pressing mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and place a dumbbell in one hand at chest level.
2. Press the dumbbell straight up until your arm is fully extended over your chest.
3. Lower the dumbbell slowly until your elbow touches the floor.
4. Press the dumbbell back up to full extension and repeat, then switch arms.
Steps to perform: Keep scapula pinned to the floor and press deliberately through hand

Rest intervals: Develops posterior chain strength and single-leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand with the rear foot a step back and toes touching the floor.
2. Shift most of your weight to the front leg and keep a slight bend in the front knee.
3. Hinge at the hips with a flat back and lower the dumbbells toward the shin until you feel a hamstring stretch.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat, then switch stance.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips keeping a neutral spine and front knee slightly bent
MET value: Hypertension, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Rest intervals: Enhances static balance and ankle proprioception
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toe of the back foot and hold light dumbbells at your sides.
2. Square your hips, lift your chest, and fix your gaze forward to steady your balance.
3. Slightly bend the front knee and maintain the heel-to-toe stance while holding weight evenly.
4. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch the front and back feet and repeat.
Steps to perform: Stack hips and shoulders over feet to stabilize balance

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral leg strength and hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a split stance with one foot forward and one foot back and hold dumbbells at your sides.
2. Lower your hips straight down until the front thigh is about parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the lowered position with tension in both legs for the chosen duration.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the starting split stance and then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and descend with weight through the front heel

Rest intervals: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot beside a sturdy support, hold a dumbbell in the same-side hand, and lightly touch the support with the other hand.
2. Keep the standing knee soft and rise onto the ball of your foot by lifting the heel as high as possible.
3. Pause briefly at the top while maintaining balance and control.
4. Slowly lower the heel back down, complete the desired reps, and then switch to the other leg.
Steps to perform: Drive through the ball of the foot while controlling movement using the assisting hand

Rest intervals: Challenges balance while increasing single-leg load tolerance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall on one leg while holding a dumbbell in the opposite hand at your side.
2. Hinge slightly at the hip of the standing leg and lift the free foot toward the back while keeping the dumbbell close to your body.
3. Keep the standing knee soft and maintain a straight spine as you balance.
4. Pause briefly, then lower the free foot to the floor and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep hips level with a soft standing knee

Rest intervals: Targets glute medius and lateral hip strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand beside a sturdy box or bench holding dumbbells at your sides.
2. Place the nearest foot on the box and push through that heel to lift your body until both legs are straight.
3. Step down with control and repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Drive through the stepping heel and keep knee tracking over the foot

Rest intervals: Combines posterior chain strength with dynamic hip flexion control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding dumbbells at your sides.
2. Step back with one foot and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and immediately lift the rear knee toward your chest.
4. Control the landing, reset your stance, and repeat on the opposite leg.
Steps to perform: Lower with control keep torso upright then drive knee forward under control

Rest intervals: Promotes controlled single-leg strength and sit-to-stand mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand on your working leg facing a high box, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and push your hips back while keeping the non-working foot slightly off the floor.
3. Lower yourself slowly until your glutes touch the box lightly, keeping your chest up.
4. Drive through the heel of the standing leg to return to standing and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Sit back softly keeping chest up and opposite hip level

Rest intervals: Improves gait coordination and forward balance control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Place the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other and take a controlled step forward.
3. Continue walking in a straight line heel-to-toe while maintaining an upright posture.
Steps to perform: Place heel to toe slowly keep spine tall and eyes forward

Rest intervals: Develops multidirectional leg control and movement awareness
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step a short distance forward and slightly to the diagonal and lower into a shallow lunge by bending the front knee a few inches.
3. Push through the front foot to return to standing.
4. Repeat to different clock directions for the desired reps, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Control each step stop short of full depth and keep knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral core stability and grip endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side.
2. Brace your core and keep your shoulder down and back.
3. Lift one knee to about hip height and lower it, alternating legs in a controlled marching rhythm.
4. Maintain an even posture and switch the dumbbell to the other hand after the set.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral and shoulders down while marching with controlled steps

Rest intervals: Targets lateral core strength and improves trunk mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet close together and hold a dumbbell in one hand at your ribcage, with the other hand on your hip.
2. Brace your core and bend your torso sideways toward the dumbbell, lowering the weight toward the hip.
3. Return to upright with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep hips anchored and lead with ribs while exhaling into each crunch

Rest intervals: Develops rotational power and coordinated core activation
Health benefit:
1. Kneel with one knee on the floor and the opposite foot flat, holding a dumbbell with both hands above the shoulder on the high side.
2. Brace your core and rotate your torso as you bring the dumbbell diagonally downward across your body toward the opposite hip.
3. Pause briefly at the finish with arms extended and chest lifted.
4. Reverse the motion with control to the start and repeat, then switch kneeling sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate through thorax not low back and brace core on each turn

Rest intervals: Improves posterior chain coordination and scapular stability
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on all fours with a dumbbell in one hand and align your hands under your shoulders.
2. Brace your core and extend the opposite leg straight back until it is parallel to the floor.
3. Pull the dumbbell toward your ribcage in a row while keeping your hips square.
4. Lower the dumbbell and return the extended leg, then repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and avoid hip rotation as you row slowly

Rest intervals: Enhances deep core control and shoulder stabilization
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90° and hold one dumbbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Brace your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbell backward overhead as you extend one leg toward the floor.
4. Reverse the motion to return the dumbbell and leg to start, then alternate sides.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed to floor and breathe steadily as limbs move

Rest intervals: Improves rotational endurance and trunk control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, feet flat, and hold a dumbbell with both hands at chest level.
2. Lean back slightly to engage your core and keep your back straight.
3. Rotate your torso to one side, moving the dumbbell beside your hip.
4. Return to center and repeat to the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Lift your chest and rotate from the ribs with control

Rest intervals: Strengthens lateral torso muscles and improves oblique endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width, hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side, and place the other hand on your hip.
2. Keep a tall chest and slowly bend at the waist toward the dumbbell, sliding it down your thigh.
3. Pause briefly at the bottom, then lift through the oblique to return to standing and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and slide ribs down toward your hip slowly

Rest intervals: Challenges core stability and dynamic anti-rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Begin on your knees in a high plank with hands under shoulders and a dumbbell placed outside one hand.
2. Brace your core and reach with the opposite hand to drag the dumbbell under your body to the other side.
3. Keep hips level and avoid rotating as you pull the weight across.
4. Set the dumbbell down, reset your shoulders, and repeat the pull with the other hand.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and maintain a straight line from head to knees

Rest intervals: Trains shoulder stability and asymmetrical load tolerance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, hold one dumbbell overhead in one hand with arm fully extended and the other hand by your side.
2. Squeeze your glutes and brace your core to keep your torso upright and prevent leaning.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then lower the weight under control and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Squeeze glutes and maintain a neutral spine while pressing overhead

Rest intervals: Develops lower abdominal control while maintaining upper body bracing
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, and hold one dumbbell against your chest with both hands.
2. Raise your legs so your shins are vertical and brace your core.
3. Slowly lower both legs toward the floor while keeping your lower back pressed into the mat.
4. Stop just before your lower back lifts, then raise your legs back to vertical.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into the floor and lower legs slowly with control

Rest intervals: Enhances lower body strength and ankle mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up and immediately lift your heels to rise onto your toes for a calf raise.
4. Lower your heels back to the floor and repeat the squat to calf-raise sequence.
Steps to perform: Sit back with chest up and control the rise onto your toes

Rest intervals: Improves single-leg strength and overhead pressing capacity
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a sturdy bench or box and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Step up onto the bench with one foot, driving through the heel to bring the trailing foot up.
3. As you reach full standing on the bench, press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height, step down with the same foot, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Step fully onto the box, brace your core, press overhead in a straight line
is_not_suitable_for: Limited single-leg balance | Limited shoulder range of motion

Rest intervals: Enhances hip mobility and thoracic spine rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding one dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands.
2. Step back into a lunge and lower until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Rotate your torso and the dumbbell toward the front leg while keeping hips square.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee over ankle, square hips, and rotate through the thoracic spine with control
is_not_suitable_for: Limited single-leg balance | Thoracic stiffness (upper-back rigidity)

Rest intervals: Builds grip strength and unilateral core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand upright and pick up one dumbbell in one hand with a neutral grip.
2. Brace your core, keep your shoulders level, and walk forward in controlled steps.
3. Stop, set the dumbbell down with control, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Stand tall with shoulders down, brace your core, walk without leaning to one side

Rest intervals: Improves upper arm strength while promoting gait rhythm and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing forward.
2. Lift one knee to hip height while simultaneously curling the opposite arm toward your shoulder.
3. Lower the weight as you step down and immediately lift the other knee while curling the other arm.
4. Keep an upright posture and continue alternating marches and curls at a steady tempo.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis stable, march tall, and curl with slow controlled breathing

Rest intervals: Develops shoulder stability and foundational core control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with one dumbbell in the working hand and the same-side knee bent.
2. Press the dumbbell overhead and brace your core.
3. Push through the planted foot and lift your hips into a quarter bridge while keeping the dumbbell vertical.
4. Lower the hips back to the floor under control and keep the dumbbell locked overhead.
Steps to perform: Keep eyes on the weight and stabilize the shoulder by pressing the arm up

Rest intervals: Enhances explosive overhead power and unilateral coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge to grip a dumbbell on the ground with one hand.
2. Drive through hips and legs to bring the dumbbell smoothly to your shoulder.
3. Press the dumbbell overhead until the arm is locked, then lower it back to the ground under control.
Steps to perform: Drive through your feet brace the core and lock the arm overhead

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and improves lateral core resilience
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and a dumbbell beside one foot, hinge at the hips and grip the handle.
2. Drive through your heels and extend the hips to stand upright while keeping the dumbbell close and spine neutral.
3. Hinge at the hips and lower the dumbbell back to the ground with control while maintaining a braced core.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine with shoulders stacked over hips and hinge from hips

Rest intervals: Improves squat mechanics and forward reach mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides for the Squat to Forward Reach.
2. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat until thighs are near parallel.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and extend both arms forward to shoulder height while holding the dumbbells.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to your sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Sit back into the hips keep chest up and reach forward with control

Rest intervals: Promotes shoulder endurance and coordinated hip flexor activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height for the Overhead March.
2. Press the right dumbbell overhead as you lift the left knee toward hip level.
3. Lower the right dumbbell to shoulder height as you lower the left foot and prepare the opposite side.
4. Repeat the movement alternating sides in a controlled, marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down brace core and march slowly without arching the low back

Health benefit: Steps to perform
Steps to perform: Safety cue
Safety cue: MET value

Rest intervals: Builds chest and core strength while offering adjustable resistance for progressing push-up form
Health benefit:
1. Loop the resistance band across your upper back and hold the ends under each palm while assuming a high plank.
2. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels with hands under shoulders.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the floor, feeling the band add resistance.
4. Press through your palms to extend your elbows and return to the starting plank.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and brace core to avoid sagging hips

Rest intervals: Strengthens upper back and improves posture through horizontal pulling movements
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, holding the band ends with palms facing in.
2. Keep a flat back and pull your elbows back, squeezing your shoulder blades to row the band toward your hips.
3. Slowly extend your arms to control the band's return and reset for the next rep.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a long spine and retract shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder and upper arm strength and improves overhead mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Brace your core and press the band overhead until your arms are fully extended.
3. Lower the band back to shoulder height with control.
Steps to perform: Stand tall keep ribs down and press straight overhead

Rest intervals: Promotes scapular stability and balances posterior shoulder muscles for improved posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at eye level and grab the ends with both hands.
2. Step back to create tension and stand with feet hip-width apart.
3. Pull the band toward your face, flaring your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Slowly extend your arms to return to the start while keeping a tall posture.
Steps to perform: Pull elbows high with scapular retraction and control the return

Rest intervals: Increases elbow flexor strength and functional pulling capacity
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of the band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ends with palms facing up.
2. Keep your elbows close to your sides and brace your core.
3. Curl your hands toward your shoulders by bending the elbows and contracting the biceps.
4. Lower your hands slowly back to the starting position under control.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows tucked by sides and lower slowly under control

Rest intervals: Builds triceps strength and supports elbow extension during pushing tasks
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band overhead and grasp the ends with palms facing down.
2. Step back to create tension and position your elbows tight to your sides.
3. Press your hands downward by extending your forearms until your arms are straight.
4. Return your hands slowly to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows close to ribs and lower with slow controlled motion

Rest intervals: Develops horizontal pressing strength and improves functional pushing mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the resistance band at chest height behind you and grab the handles with palms facing down.
2. Step forward to create tension and stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
3. Press both hands forward until your arms are fully extended.
4. Return your hands to chest level slowly and with control.
Steps to perform: Stand tall retract shoulder blades and press with steady controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Targets lateral deltoids to enhance shoulder width and abduction control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of the resistance band with feet hip-width and hold the handles at your sides.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and brace your core.
3. Lift both arms out to the sides to shoulder height with control.
4. Lower your arms back to your sides slowly.
Steps to perform: Lead with elbows slightly bent and lift with slow controlled motion

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral back strength and corrects strength imbalances
Health benefit:
1. Place the band under your front foot or anchor it low and hold the handle with one hand.
2. Hinge at the hips with a flat back and extend your arm toward the anchor.
3. Pull the handle toward your hip while squeezing your shoulder blade.
4. Extend your arm back to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keep spine neutral and pull with scapular retraction

Rest intervals: Strengthens upper back and rear delts to counteract rounded shoulders
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and hold the resistance band with both hands at shoulder width in front of you, arms straight.
2. Pull the band apart by moving your hands outward until your arms reach shoulder level.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and pause for one second.
4. Slowly return your hands to the starting position under control.
Steps to perform: Stand tall squeeze shoulder blades together and move through slow controlled range

Rest intervals: Targets quadriceps and glutes while promoting lower body strength and movement control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ends at shoulder height across your upper back.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your chest up and knees tracking over your toes while maintaining tension in the band.
4. Drive through your heels and extend your hips to return to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking over toes descend with control

Rest intervals: Strengthens hamstrings and posterior chain while improving hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet hip-width apart and hold the ends in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the knees and keep your back flat as you lower the band toward your shins.
3. Feel the stretch in your hamstrings while maintaining tension in the band and a neutral spine.
4. Drive your hips forward, squeeze your glutes, and return to standing.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a neutral spine keep soft knees
MET value: Hypertension, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Rest intervals: Activates glute muscles to improve hip extension strength and pelvic stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and loop a resistance band just above your knees.
2. Press feet into the floor, squeeze glutes, and lift hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keep tension on the band by pushing knees slightly outward and hold briefly at the top.
4. Lower hips slowly back to the floor with control.
Steps to perform: Squeeze glutes and press hips up while keeping ribs tucked

Rest intervals: Develops lateral leg strength and hip mobility for improved side to side control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, place a band around your thighs just above the knees, and step one foot wide to the side.
2. Push hips back and bend the stepping knee into a lateral lunge while keeping the other leg straight and chest upright.
