Rest intervals: Improves ankle stability and strength of supporting foot muscles
Health benefit:
1. Sit with your heel on the floor and securely anchor one end of the band to a stable object outside the foot.
2. Loop the free end around the forefoot so the band pulls the sole outward.
3. Slowly turn the sole of your foot inward against the band's resistance, then return to neutral.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral ankle alignment and invert slowly with controlled tension

Rest intervals: Develops single leg strength and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of a loop resistance band with feet hip-width and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back into a controlled reverse lunge, keeping torso upright and band tension.
3. Drive the back knee forward and up into a high knee, pulling the band upward.
4. Return to standing with control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and drive through heel when returning to high knee

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a resistance band around both ankles and stand tall on one leg.
2. Brace the core and lift the free leg out to the side until the band is taut.
3. Hold the raised position with hips level, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep standing hip stacked and pelvis level control abduction without torso lean

Rest intervals: Strengthens glutes and improves rotational control and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot on the center of a loop band and hold the ends at chest height.
2. Step the other leg diagonally behind into a curtsy lunge, keeping the front knee aligned.
3. Push through the front heel to rise and bring the back leg forward into a single-leg balance while maintaining band tension.
4. Hold the balance briefly, then lower the back foot and repeat before switching sides.
Steps to perform: Descend into curtsy with chest up knee tracking over toes then stabilize through core

Rest intervals: Enhances anti rotation core strength and trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor with feet hip-width.
2. Hold both ends with both hands at your chest and step away to create tension.
3. Extend your arms forward and brace your core, keeping hips square.
4. Move your arms in slow controlled circles while maintaining tension and a neutral spine.
Steps to perform: Brace your core keep ribs down move slowly maintaining neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves contralateral coordination and posterior chain activation
Health benefit:
1. Anchor one end of the band low and loop the other end around the top of one foot while on hands and knees.
2. Brace your core and extend the banded leg straight back until it aligns with your torso.
3. Reach the opposite arm forward as you hold the leg extension, keeping hips level.
4. Return both limbs to the starting position with control and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and spine neutral as you extend opposite arm and banded leg

Rest intervals: Increases shoulder stability and anterior core endurance
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band under a stable anchor in front of you and assume a high plank facing the anchor.
2. Grip the band with one hand and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Reach the band-hand forward, fully extending the arm while preventing hip rotation.
4. Pull the hand back under your shoulder with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and brace your core

Rest intervals: Builds anti rotation endurance and lateral trunk stabilization
Health benefit:
1. Anchor band at chest height and grab the handle with both hands while standing perpendicular to the anchor.
2. Step away to create tension and hold your hands at chest level with feet shoulder-width.
3. Press your arms straight in front and resist the band pulling you into rotation.
4. Brace your core and hold the position for the target time.
Steps to perform: Anchor ribs over pelvis, press into band and prevent torso rotation

Rest intervals: Improves core timing and coordinated limb control
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band overhead and lie on your back with knees bent and feet lifted off the floor.
2. Hold the band with both hands extended toward the anchor and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly lower one leg and the opposite arm toward the floor while maintaining band tension.
4. Return both limbs to center and repeat on the other side in a controlled manner.
Steps to perform: Lower limbs with control while keeping low back gently pressed to floor

Rest intervals: Strengthens obliques and hip external rotators for side stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around your thighs above the knees and set up in a side plank on your elbow with legs stacked.
2. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels and stabilize your torso.
3. Open your top knee against the band for a clamshell, then close it while keeping hips elevated.
Steps to perform: Stack shoulders, keep hips lifted, and move the top knee with control

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on a mat and loop the band around the back of your head, holding ends at your temples.
2. Sit tall and brace your core with a neutral spine.
3. Move your hands and the band in a slow circular path around your head, keeping constant tension.
4. Reverse the circle after the set and keep movements controlled.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked over hips and move slowly with shoulder blade control

Rest intervals: Builds core stability and scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your wrists, come to hands and knees, and lift knees a few inches off the ground so hips stay level.
2. Push your hands outward against the band's resistance and draw your belly toward your spine.
3. Hold a steady breath and maintain a flat back for the required time.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine with hips level and breathe evenly

Rest intervals: Enhances pelvic stability and coordinated hip flexor activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and loop the band around the arches of both feet.
2. Hold the band's ends at your hips and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Engage your core and lift one foot a few inches off the ground in a controlled march while keeping band tension.
4. Alternate legs smoothly and keep your hips level throughout.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into mat and march slowly with controlled core

Rest intervals: Builds core anti rotation strength and unilateral stability
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on your right knee with your left foot flat and loop the resistance band overhead to your right; grasp the band with both hands at chest height.
2. Brace your core and pull the band down and across your body toward your left hip in a controlled chop.
3. Hold the end position isometrically for the prescribed time while keeping your torso stable.
4. Slowly return to chest height and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace core keep hips square and generate movement from the torso
MET value: Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease

Rest intervals: Improves integrated pressing strength and contralateral coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and step the band under your left foot; hold the band in your right hand at shoulder level.
2. Sit back into a controlled squat while keeping the band at the shoulder and your chest upright.
3. Drive up through your legs and press the band overhead until your elbow is extended.
4. Lower the band back to shoulder level and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Drive through front heel and keep chest tall with shoulders packed

Rest intervals: Enhances balance, proprioception, and hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on your left foot and secure one end of the resistance band under that foot; hold the other end in your right hand with light tension.
2. Hinge forward and simultaneously extend your right leg and left arm out to the side into a star position while keeping the standing knee soft.
3. Control the return to upright and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and move slowly to maintain control

Rest intervals: Strengthens glute activation while promoting shoulder endurance and upright posture
Health benefit:
1. Step on the center of a long resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ends overhead with arms extended.
2. Bend knees into a shallow squat and brace your core.
3. Take a wide controlled step to the right, keeping the band taut overhead.
4. Step the left foot in to meet the right and continue side-stepping, then repeat to the left.
Steps to perform: Brace core, keep chest lifted, take controlled lateral steps

Rest intervals: Increases single leg strength and rotational mobility
Health benefit:
1. Place one end of the resistance band under your front foot and hold the other end with both hands at chest height.
2. Lower into a split squat by bending the front knee until the thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Rotate your torso away from the front leg while extending your arms to create tension on the band.
4. Drive up through the front heel and return your hands to chest position.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee tracking over toes and rotate from torso

Rest intervals: Improves single leg balance while building posterior chain and rowing strength
Health benefit:
1. Loop a resistance band under the working foot and hold the ends with both hands at chest level.
2. Lift the non-working leg slightly and sit back into a single-leg squat on the working leg.
3. As you rise, pull your elbows back to perform a rowing motion against the band.
4. Lower with control and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Steps to perform: Hinge hips back, keep weight on heel, row with scapular squeeze

Rest intervals: Develops lower body power and overhead pressing coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with your front foot on the resistance band and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step back into a lunge until both knees are bent.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and press the band overhead until arms are straight.
4. Lower the band to shoulder height and repeat with control.
Steps to perform: Drive through front heel, keep ribs down, exhale on press

Rest intervals: Improves single-leg strength and balance control
Health benefit:
1. Place a low platform in front and loop the band under the stepping foot while holding the ends at your hips.
2. Step onto the platform with the banded foot and press through the heel to fully stand.
3. Bring the trailing foot up and hold a single-leg balance with the band under tension.
4. Step down slowly and repeat for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Drive through lead heel keeping hips level and chest tall

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and pelvic control during walking
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band around your waist and anchor it behind at hip height.
2. Stand with feet in a straight line and maintain a tall posture.
3. Step forward heel-to-toe while resisting the backward pull of the band.
4. Continue the tandem walk for the set distance, then turn and repeat.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and steady small steps to control band tension

Rest intervals: Enhances full-body coordination and controlled mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with the resistance band looped under your right foot and held in your right hand extended toward the ceiling.
2. Brace your core and roll onto your left forearm while keeping the band arm straight overhead.
3. Push through the left foot and press your hips up into a partial bridge while keeping the band arm locked.
4. Reverse the movement slowly to return to lying and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Move slowly exhaling during transitions and keep shoulder packed over ribs

Rest intervals: Builds lower-body strength and improves balance during transitions
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of a looped resistance band with feet hip-width apart and hold the ends at your shoulders.
2. Sit back into a squat keeping chest up and knees tracking over toes.
3. Drive through one foot to stand tall and lift the other foot into a single-leg stance with band tension.
4. Lower the lifted foot back to a squat and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Sit back into squat keeping knees tracking toes then shift weight with control

Rest intervals: Promotes chest activation and unilateral shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor holding the far end in your outside hand.
2. Step away to create light tension and adopt a split stance for stability.
3. With a slight bend in the elbow, open the arm out to the side to feel the band pull.
4. Squeeze the chest and bring the hand across your body in a controlled arc, then return slowly.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly with braced core and keep shoulder blade stable against torso

Rest intervals: Develops eccentric hamstring strength and knee joint control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a long resistance band to a low, sturdy point and loop the free end around your torso just below the armpits.
2. Kneel on a pad with your ankles secured under a stable object and keep your body stiff from knees to shoulders.
3. Slowly lean forward from the knees, resisting the descent with your hamstrings and the band.
4. Use the band to assist you back to the upright kneeling start if needed.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked over knees and descend slowly with control

Rest intervals: Improves explosive lower-body power and sprint acceleration
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band low behind you and loop the other end snugly around your hips or waist.
2. Set up in a sprinter start with one foot forward, the back knee bent, and hands on the ground for balance.
3. Explode forward into the sprint position by driving through the front leg and pumping the arms while the band provides rearward resistance.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and drive through hips with controlled acceleration
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Hyperthyroidism, Metabolic Syndrome, Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD)

Rest intervals: Improves core endurance and trunk stabilization
Health benefit:
1. Attach a light resistance band to a low anchor and loop the free end around the arches of your feet.
2. Lie on your back, press your lower back into the floor, lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches, and hold a hollow body shape.
3. Rock gently back and forth using your abs while maintaining band tension and a flat lower back.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into the floor and breathe evenly throughout

Rest intervals: Increases rotational power and oblique muscle activation
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low to your right and grasp the handle with both hands, arms extended toward the anchor.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hinge slightly at the hips, and rotate your torso away from the anchor.
3. Explosively pull the band diagonally upward and across your body in a chopping motion, driving the rotation with your hips.
4. Control the return to the start and repeat quickly for the desired reps, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate from the torso with a braced core and controlled speed

Health benefit: Steps to perform
Steps to perform: Safety cue
Safety cue: MET value

Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength and improves squat mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands.
2. Brace your core and push hips back as you bend knees to lower into a squat until thighs are parallel.
3. Pause at the bottom with chest up and knees tracking over toes.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and squeeze your glutes at the top.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and knees tracking toes as you squat

Rest intervals: Enhances chest and triceps strength with reduced shoulder strain
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, holding a dumbbell in each hand at chest level.
2. Brace your core and press both dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended over your chest.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping shoulders grounded and wrists stacked over elbows.
4. Lower the dumbbells with control until your elbows touch the floor.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back neutral on floor and exhale as you press

Rest intervals: Develops upper back strength while challenging core stability
Health benefit:
1. Start in a high plank with hands gripping a dumbbell under your shoulders and feet wider than hip-width.
2. Brace your core and row one dumbbell toward your ribcage, keeping hips square to the floor.
3. Lower that dumbbell with control and immediately row the opposite dumbbell in the same manner.
4. Maintain a steady plank position and keep your body stable throughout each repetition.
Steps to perform: Brace core, hinge at hips and row without rotating torso

Rest intervals: Combines leg power and shoulder endurance for efficient full body conditioning
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Bend hips and knees into a squat until thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through heels and explode upward while pressing the dumbbells overhead.
4. Fully extend arms, lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height, and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels and press overhead while keeping core braced

Rest intervals: Targets hamstring and glute strength while promoting hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold dumbbells in front of your thighs with palms facing your body.
2. Push hips back and hinge forward with a slight bend in the knees while sliding the dumbbells down your legs.
3. Lower until you feel a stretch in the hamstrings or the dumbbells reach mid-shin.
4. Drive hips forward to stand tall while squeezing the glutes and return the dumbbells to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with soft knees and keep a neutral spine
MET value: Hypertension, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder and upper body pressing strength and postural control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Brace your core and press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended overhead.
3. Pause briefly at the top with elbows locked and shoulders engaged.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and core braced as you press overhead

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and hold one dumbbell with both hands at chest level.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet a few inches off the floor.
3. Rotate your torso and move the dumbbell to the right, tapping the floor if possible.
4. Twist to the left, bringing the dumbbell across your body with controlled movement.
Steps to perform: Rotate from the torso keeping spine long and avoid rounding

Rest intervals: Builds grip strength and improves walking stability under load
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and pick up one dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward.
2. Brace your core, keep your shoulders down, and walk forward in short controlled steps.
3. Maintain an upright posture and steady breathing while carrying the dumbbells for the desired distance.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulders down and keep chest tall while walking

Rest intervals: Strengthens unilateral leg power and enhances balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step backward with your right foot and lower your body until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Push through your left heel to return to standing while keeping your torso upright.
4. Repeat by stepping back with the left foot, alternating sides with controlled movements.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright torso and step back landing through the heel

Rest intervals: Develops posterior chain and upper back strength for better pulling ability
Health benefit:
1. Stand hip-width with knees slightly bent and hold a dumbbell in one hand, hinging at the hips until your torso is near parallel to the floor.
2. Keep your back flat and core braced while letting the arm hang straight toward the floor.
3. Pull the dumbbell toward your ribcage by driving the elbow up and squeezing the shoulder blade.
4. Lower the dumbbell under control to full extension and switch sides after completing the set.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keeping neutral spine and pull elbows past torso

Rest intervals: Enhances hip extension strength and glute muscle activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, place a dumbbell across your hips and hold it there with both hands.
2. Drive through your heels and lift your hips by squeezing the glutes until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Lower your hips slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels and squeeze glutes at the top keeping ribs down

Rest intervals: Increases pectoral strength and chest range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a bench or the floor holding a dumbbell in each hand above your chest with palms facing each other and a slight bend in the elbows.
2. Keep the elbows slightly bent and open your arms out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in the chest.
3. Pause briefly at the bottom while maintaining the elbow bend and stable shoulder position.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest by squeezing the chest and following the same arc.
Steps to perform: Maintain a slight bend in elbows and lower with control to chest level

Rest intervals: Builds core stability and anti-rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Get into a high plank with feet wide and place a dumbbell beside your right hand.
2. Reach with your left hand to pull the dumbbell under your torso to the left while keeping hips level.
3. Return your left hand to the floor, grasp the dumbbell with your right hand, and pull it back under to the right.
4. Alternate sides for reps and keep your core tight to minimize hip rotation.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral and brace core while moving dumbbell slowly across

Rest intervals: Develops lower and upper body strength and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell at your chest with both hands in a goblet grip.
2. Sit back into a squat until your thighs are parallel while keeping your chest up and knees tracking over your toes.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and press the dumbbell overhead until your arms are extended.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to your chest and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge hips into a full squat then press overhead with core braced

Rest intervals: Strengthens inner thighs and improves hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, toes turned out, and hold a dumbbell with both hands between your legs.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a deep sumo squat until your thighs are parallel.
3. Drive through your heels to return to standing, squeeze your glutes at the top, and repeat.
Steps to perform: Push knees out over feet and keep chest proud as you descend

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder strength and rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing you and elbows bent.
2. Rotate your palms outward while pressing the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
3. Pause briefly at the top with palms facing forward and arms locked.
4. Reverse the movement by lowering and rotating the dumbbells back to the start.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulders packed as you rotate and press

Rest intervals: Improves core control and lower back stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hold one dumbbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Extend your right leg toward the floor and simultaneously lower the dumbbell slowly overhead toward the floor.
3. Return the right leg and dumbbell to the start and then repeat the same motion with the left leg.
4. Keep your core engaged and the lower back pressed to the floor throughout.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral low back and exhale as you lower opposite limb

Rest intervals: Develops explosive power and unilateral coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in one hand between your feet with a neutral grip.
2. Hinge at the hips and swing the dumbbell back, then explosively extend hips and knees while pulling the dumbbell upward.
3. Rotate your elbow under the dumbbell and punch your hand overhead to lock out the arm straight.
4. Lower the dumbbell under control back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Drive through the hips keep a flat back and control the arm lockout

Rest intervals: Builds leg strength and improves balance during functional tasks
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step onto the bench with your right foot and press through the heel to lift your body upward.
3. Bring your left foot up to stand tall with hips fully extended.
4. Step back down with the left foot then the right and repeat, then switch lead legs.
Steps to perform: Push through the stepping heel keep chest tall and knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Strengthens lateral deltoids and enhances shoulder abduction control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and a slight bend in the knees.
2. Raise both arms out to the sides with elbows slightly bent until they reach shoulder height.
3. Lower the dumbbells slowly to your sides under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Lead with elbows maintain slight bend and raise with slow controlled motion

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and oblique engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding one dumbbell with both hands near one hip.
2. Rotate your hips and torso to lift the dumbbell diagonally across your body toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Pause briefly at the top with arms extended and core engaged.
4. Reverse the motion back down under control to the starting hip position and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate from your core keep hips square and knees slightly bent

Rest intervals: Builds lower body stability while developing biceps and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step forward with one foot and lower into a lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Curl both dumbbells toward your shoulders as you lower into the lunge.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and lower the dumbbells to your sides.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall front knee aligned over ankle and control the curl

Rest intervals: Improves calf strength and ankle stability for better walking and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Keep knees slightly bent and shift weight onto the balls of your feet.
3. Raise your heels as high as possible, squeezing your calves.
4. Lower your heels back to the floor with control.
Steps to perform: Rise through balls of feet pause at top then lower with control

Rest intervals: Strengthens forearms and biceps while enhancing grip strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your torso.
2. Keep elbows close to your sides and curl the dumbbells upward.
3. Pause at the top and squeeze the forearms and biceps.
4. Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep wrists neutral elbows close to sides and lift with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Targets lateral core muscles to increase trunk stability and posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side.
2. Brace your core and slowly bend at the waist toward the dumbbell side.
3. Slide the dumbbell down your thigh while keeping your back straight.
4. Contract the oblique and lift your torso back to standing.
Steps to perform: Hinge at waist with neutral spine avoid collapsing into the bend

Rest intervals: Develops explosive full body power and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and explosively pull the dumbbells to shoulder level, rotating elbows under.
3. Dip slightly and press the dumbbells overhead until arms are extended.
4. Lower the dumbbells to your shoulders and then to your sides in a controlled motion.
Steps to perform: Drive through hips then press overhead with a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves hip mobility and lateral leg strength for functional movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding one dumbbell close to your chest with both hands (goblet hold).
2. Step wide to the right and push your hips back while bending the right knee.
3. Keep the left leg straight and the dumbbell close to your chest as you lower.
4. Drive through the right foot to return to center and repeat to the other side.
Steps to perform: Push hips back and keep chest upright while tracking knee over toes

Rest intervals: Isolates triceps to enhance arm extension strength and upper limb control
Health benefit:
1. Hinge at hips and bend knees slightly while holding a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Keep upper arms close to torso and hinge forward until torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
3. Extend forearms backward until elbows straighten and squeeze the triceps.
4. Slowly return the dumbbells to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keep upper arm parallel to torso extend with control

Rest intervals: Increases abdominal strength and resistance to improve core endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie on back with knees bent and hold a dumbbell at chest level.
2. Exhale and sit up by lifting chest toward knees while keeping the dumbbell steady.
3. Inhale and lower back down with control to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Exhale as you sit up brace core and avoid pulling on neck

Rest intervals: Combines strength and conditioning to boost muscular endurance and metabolic demand
Health benefit:
1. Start standing with a dumbbell in each hand and squat down to place them on the floor.
2. Kick feet back into a plank and perform one push-up with hands on the dumbbells.
3. Row each dumbbell by pulling the elbow toward the ribs one arm at a time.
4. Jump feet forward, stand up, and press the dumbbells overhead to complete the rep.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and control movement between transitions

Rest intervals: Targets glutes and improves hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step your right leg back and diagonally behind your left leg into a curtsy position.
3. Bend both knees and lower until your front thigh is nearly parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright and step back diagonally while controlling the descent

Rest intervals: Builds biceps strength and enhances elbow control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench with feet flat and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
2. Lean forward and rest your elbow on the inside of the same-side thigh.
3. Curl the dumbbell up toward your shoulder while keeping your upper arm still.
4. Lower with control and repeat, then switch arms.
Steps to perform: Anchor elbow against inner thigh and curl with slow controlled motion

Rest intervals: Increases core endurance and anterior chain strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold one dumbbell with both hands extended overhead.
2. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the floor while keeping your lower back pressed into the ground.
3. Hold the position, breathing steadily, then lower with control to release.
Steps to perform: Tuck pelvis and brace core to prevent low back arch while breathing steadily

Rest intervals: Develops hip hinge power and conditions the posterior chain
Health benefit:
1. Dumbbell Swing: Stand feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips with a soft knee bend and lower the dumbbell back between your thighs.
3. Drive your hips forward forcefully and swing the dumbbell up to chest level.
4. Let the dumbbell descend under control and repeat the hip hinge and swing.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips snap hips forward and keep back flat throughout

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral leg strength and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Bulgarian Split Squat: Stand a couple of feet in front of a bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you and position the front foot under your hip.
3. Lower your back knee toward the floor until the front thigh is near parallel to the ground.
4. Press through the front heel to rise back up and repeat for reps, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee tracking over toes and maintain upright torso while lowering

Rest intervals: Enhances scapular retraction and activates upper back muscles
Health benefit:
1. Reverse Fly: Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand, hinge at the hips with a flat back.
2. Slightly bend your elbows and raise both arms out to the sides until the dumbbells reach shoulder height.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together, then lower the dumbbells back under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keep spine neutral and squeeze shoulder blades slowly

Rest intervals: Builds core stability and strengthens hip flexors
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and hold a dumbbell against your chest.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet until your shins are parallel to the floor.
3. Straighten your legs or keep a slight bend while balancing on your sit bones.
4. Hold the V position with the dumbbell close to your chest and your core tight.
Steps to perform: Brace core maintain a neutral spine and control breath throughout

Rest intervals: Strengthens unilateral posterior chain and improves grip endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place a dumbbell beside one foot.
2. Hinge at the hips, push your hips back, keep your back flat, and grab the dumbbell.
3. Drive through your heels and extend your hips to stand, keeping the dumbbell close to your leg.
4. Lower the dumbbell with control by hinging at the hips back to the floor.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips keep weight close and spine neutral while standing tall

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip flexors and enhances balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and hold a dumbbell at chest level in a goblet position.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and brace your core.
3. Lift the opposite knee toward your chest to hip height while keeping your torso upright.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Stand tall brace core lift knee with control avoid leaning backward

Rest intervals: Combines lower body strength development with anterior shoulder activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat until thighs are near parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and simultaneously lift both dumbbells straight in front to shoulder height.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to your sides and repeat with controlled motion.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up squat to depth drive through heels and control arms

Rest intervals: Improves upper body endurance and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a staggered boxing stance and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at chin level.
2. Extend your lead arm quickly into a straight jab while rotating the shoulder and torso.
3. Retract the arm immediately back to the starting guard position.
4. Alternate jabs rhythmically while keeping knees slightly bent and core engaged.
Steps to perform: Keep core braced during each jab

Rest intervals: Increases cardiovascular fitness and lower body power
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Drive one knee up toward your chest while shortening the opposite arm forward.
3. Quickly switch legs, bringing the other knee up while alternating arm movement.
4. Continue alternating at tempo, landing lightly on the balls of your feet and keeping an upright posture.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright posture while driving knees with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Strengthens core rotational muscles and improves trunk mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell vertically with both hands at chest.
2. Brace your core and pivot your torso to the right while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Rotate back through center and pivot to the left with the same controlled motion.
4. Continue alternating twists in a steady rhythm for the desired repetitions.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and rotate through the torso with controlled movement

Rest intervals: Develops explosive full body power and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell between your legs with a neutral spine and a hip hinge.
2. Explosively extend your hips and knees and shrug to drive the dumbbell upward.
3. Pull your elbow under the dumbbell and rotate your wrist to catch it at shoulder height in a front rack.
4. Stand tall to finish, then lower the dumbbell back to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips and extend explosively while maintaining a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Enhances upper body power and rotational core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet staggered and hold a dumbbell in one hand near your chin with elbow tucked.
2. Rotate your hips and drive the dumbbell upward in an arcing uppercut toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Keep the motion quick and controlled and guide the dumbbell back down to chin position.
4. Repeat for reps then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Drive the punch from the hips while keeping back straight

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral leg power and cardiovascular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a sturdy bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step onto the bench with your right foot and drive through the heel to lift your body.
3. Quickly bring the left foot up to meet the right, then step down with the right foot.
4. Alternate leading legs in a controlled, brisk rhythm while keeping your chest up.
Steps to perform: Drive through the heel and control the descent

Rest intervals: Increases shoulder mobility and thoracic spine rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell by the ends at chest level.
2. Move the dumbbell in a controlled arc around your head, keeping elbows close to your temples.
3. Reverse the direction after each rep and keep your core engaged throughout.
Steps to perform: Keep a tall neutral spine and move the weight slowly around the head

Rest intervals: Combines lower body strength and aerobic conditioning for functional fitness
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet together holding a dumbbell in each hand at your shoulders.
2. Push hips back and lower into a squat until thighs are near parallel to the floor.
3. Explode slightly and jump your feet wide into a squat jack, landing softly.
4. Jump your feet back together to return to the start and repeat at a steady pace.
Steps to perform: Sit back into the hips keep knees tracking toes and chest lifted

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder endurance and power for overhead movements
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
2. Dip slightly by bending your knees and then explosively press both dumbbells overhead until your arms are nearly straight.
3. Quickly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control.
4. Repeat the explosive press in a fast, controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Brace your core avoid lumbar arch exhale powerfully on each press

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral stability and explosive single leg strength and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step one foot diagonally behind and across into a lateral lunge while keeping your chest up.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing and drive the rear foot forward into a lateral hop or step.
4. Land softly and repeat on the opposite side in a flowing skater pattern.
Steps to perform: Land softly on the midfoot and keep the knee aligned over the toes

Rest intervals: Improves standing core strength and oblique engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands at chest level.
2. Lift your right knee and rotate your torso to bring the dumbbell across to meet the knee with your left elbow.
3. Lower and repeat on the opposite side, alternating sides in a controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and rotate from the ribs not the lower back

Rest intervals: Develops full body power and functional overhead strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and place the dumbbell on the floor between your feet.
2. Hinge at the hips, keep your chest up, and grab the dumbbell with both hands.
3. Explode through the hips, extend knees, and press the dumbbell overhead until arms are locked.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the floor under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips use leg drive and control the overhead lockout

Rest intervals: Enhances upper body speed and rotational power
Health benefit:
1. Stand in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at chin level.
2. Rotate your torso and snap one arm across your body in a horizontal hooked motion with the elbow bent.
3. Return to guard and quickly repeat the hooked motion on the other side in a steady rhythm.
Steps to perform: Keep wrists neutral and rotate through the torso for controlled power

Rest intervals: Improves lateral agility and lower body power
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet together and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Push off both feet and hop laterally to the right, landing softly on the balls of your feet.
3. Immediately hop back to the left with a slight knee bend and maintain a quick, controlled tempo.
Steps to perform: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and chest upright

Rest intervals: Builds core stability and coordinated shoulder control during resisted movement
Health benefit:
1. Get into a high plank with a single dumbbell on the floor beside your right hand.
2. Reach across with your left hand and drag the dumbbell under your chest to the left side.
3. Return the dumbbell back to the right side with your right hand while maintaining a flat back.
4. Alternate sides by repeating the drag with the opposite hand for each rep.
Steps to perform: Maintain a straight spine and brace core while moving arm slowly

Rest intervals: Improves hip hinge power and core rotational endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand hip-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands in front of your hips.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower the dumbbell between your legs.
3. Thrust your hips forward and swing the dumbbell up and slightly across your body like a skiing motion.
4. Let the dumbbell descend under control back between your legs and repeat, alternating the slight side-to-side arc.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips and keep the core braced throughout the swing

Rest intervals: Enhances coordination and rotational core endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a light split stance and hold a dumbbell in each hand at chin level.
2. Rotate your torso and extend your right arm across your body in a controlled cross punch.
3. Retract your right hand quickly back to guard and reset your stance.
4. Repeat the movement with your left arm and continue alternating punches.
Steps to perform: Rotate through the torso and snap punches with neutral wrist alignment

Rest intervals: Increases lower body explosive power and single leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a split stance with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Bend both knees and lower into a shallow lunge while keeping your chest upright.
3. Explode upward and switch legs in midair so your back leg becomes the front leg.
4. Land softly in a split stance and immediately prepare for the next rep.
Steps to perform: Land softly with knees tracking toes and maintain an upright chest

Rest intervals: Targets abdominal strength and hip flexor control for improved core function
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench holding a single dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Lean back slightly, brace your core, and pull your knees toward your chest.
3. Extend your legs forward without touching the floor and repeat the tuck motion.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed to seat and exhale as you draw knees in

Rest intervals: Develops explosive full body power and coordinated triple extension
Health benefit:
1. Stand over a single dumbbell with feet hip-width apart and hinge at the hips to grip it.
2. Drive through your heels and explosively extend hips and knees while pulling the dumbbell upward.
3. Shrug and pull your elbow high, then flip your wrist to receive the dumbbell overhead.
4. Lock out the arm overhead briefly, then control the dumbbell back to the start position.
Steps to perform: Drive through the hips keep chest up and control the arm overhead

Rest intervals: Improves upper back strength and unilateral pulling coordination
Health benefit:
1. For DB Alternating Speed Row, hinge at the hips and hold one dumbbell in your right hand with arm extended toward the floor.
2. Quickly row the dumbbell to your ribcage, keeping the elbow close to your body.
3. Lower the weight under control and pass the dumbbell to the other hand.
4. Repeat alternating sides with a fast, controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Maintain a flat back

Rest intervals: Enhances balance and lower body endurance through controlled alternating leg movement
Health benefit:
1. For DB March in Place, stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Drive one knee up toward hip height while lifting the opposite elbow, keeping a steady posture.
3. Continue alternating knees and arms, marching in place with a controlled tempo.
Steps to perform: Brace your core while marching

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core strength and trunk stability for functional movement
Health benefit:
1. For DB Rotational Chop, stand with feet wider than hip-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands at one hip.
2. Rotate your torso and lift the dumbbell diagonally across your body toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Reverse the motion and chop the dumbbell down back to the starting hip with control.
4. Repeat the chops for the set, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate through the thoracic spine

Rest intervals: Boosts full body conditioning and cardiovascular fitness through dynamic plyometric movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge and squat down, place the dumbbells on the floor shoulder-width apart.
3. Jump your feet back to a high plank position, then immediately jump your feet forward toward your hands.
4. Grab the dumbbells, stand up explosively and finish with a small jump or upright shrug.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine during transitions

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder endurance and challenges core stability during sustained front-loaded posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell in each hand with palms facing down and arms raised to shoulder height.
2. Brace your core and maintain the front-raise hold with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. March in place by lifting one knee toward your chest, then alternate knees while keeping the dumbbells steady.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down while marching

Rest intervals: Improves lateral hip strength and balance through controlled step-over movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand beside a low bench or step and hold a dumbbell close to your chest in a goblet hold.
2. Step laterally onto the bench with the nearest foot and push through the heel to lift your body across.
3. Bring the trailing foot onto the bench, then step down to the opposite side with the leading foot.
4. Repeat by stepping back over the bench to the starting side in a controlled manner.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced as you step over

Rest intervals: Enhances anti-rotation core stability and engages posterior chain during diagonal movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands at your hip on one side.
2. Rotate your hips and drive the dumbbell diagonally up across your body toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting hip position under control while rotating your torso back.
4. Repeat for repetitions then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate from the hips and control the weight on the return

Rest intervals: Combines shoulder endurance and cardiovascular challenge for improved upper body stamina
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Jump feet outward into a wide stance while pressing both dumbbells overhead until arms are extended.
3. Land softly with feet together while lowering the dumbbells back to shoulder height.
4. Repeat the movement continuously for repetitions.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tight core and press smoothly without arching the lower back

Rest intervals: Increases upper body power and muscular endurance through rapid pressing repetitions
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a flat bench or the floor and hold a dumbbell in each hand at chest level with elbows bent.
2. Explosively press both dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended and palms face forward.
3. Lower the dumbbells back to your chest quickly but under control and repeat at a fast tempo.
Steps to perform: Keep scapulae retracted and lower the weights with control between reps

Rest intervals: Enhances lower limb muscular endurance and knee stability through controlled pulsing
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step back with one foot into a split stance and lower until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Pulse up and down a few inches at the bottom with controlled quick movements while keeping weight on the front heel.
4. Press through the front heel to return to standing or switch legs and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and pulse with steady breath

Rest intervals: Improves lateral core strength and trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at your side with the left hand on your hip.
2. Brace your core and slowly bend your torso to the right over a 3-second count, sliding the dumbbell down your leg.
3. Reverse the motion and lift back to neutral over a 2-second count using your oblique.
4. Switch the dumbbell to the left hand and repeat the same tempo on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked over hips and hinge from the waist

Rest intervals: Enhances single-leg stability and overhead pressing strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
2. Step one foot back into a controlled reverse lunge and keep your torso upright.
3. Push through the front heel and press both dumbbells overhead as you stand back up.
4. Lower the dumbbells to shoulder height and repeat leading with the opposite leg.
Steps to perform: Step back with a long spine and press while bracing your core

Rest intervals: Enhances footwork, coordination, and light cardiovascular conditioning
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a light dumbbell in each hand near your chin.
2. Shift weight and perform quick small shuffles left and right on your toes.
3. Punch alternating jabs and hooks with the dumbbells while you shuffle.
4. Stay light on your feet and keep hands protecting your face.
Steps to perform: Stay tall with soft knees, maintain a light bounce and controlled footwork

Rest intervals: Improves calf power and reactive lower-body explosiveness
Health benefit:
1. Hold one dumbbell with both hands at your chest and stand with feet hip-width.
2. Bend knees slightly and perform small, explosive pogo hops on the balls of your feet.
3. Keep ankles stiff and use quick rebounds rather than high jumps.
4. Land softly with knees bent and maintain an upright torso.
Steps to perform: Land quietly with knees soft and hips back to absorb impact

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and hip drive
Health benefit:
1. Hold one dumbbell with both hands overhead and stand with feet hip-width.
2. Drive your right knee up as you chop the dumbbell diagonally down toward your left hip.
3. Control the return by bringing the dumbbell back overhead and lowering your foot.
4. Repeat on the opposite side while keeping your core tight and torso upright.
Steps to perform: Rotate from the torso, keep shoulders down and exhale on the chop

Rest intervals: Builds full-body power, coordination, and metabolic conditioning
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and explosively shrug and pull the dumbbells to shoulder level, rotating elbows under to catch them in the front-rack.
3. Drop into a shallow squat then drive through your legs and press the dumbbells overhead into a full lockout.
4. Lower the dumbbells to the shoulders and then to your sides, reset, and repeat.
Steps to perform: Maintain an upright torso into the front rack

Rest intervals: Improves posterior chain engagement and single-leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands at chest level.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the dumbbell straight forward until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
3. Reverse the hinge and pull the dumbbell back to your chest to return to standing.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips to keep a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Increases leg muscular endurance and dynamic hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step forward quickly with one leg and lower into a lunge until the front knee is over the ankle.
3. Drive through the front foot to rise and immediately step forward with the opposite leg into the next lunge.
4. Continue alternating steps at a fast, controlled tempo for the desired distance or reps.
Steps to perform: Keep torso tall for each step

Rest intervals: Enhances core rotational control and hand-eye coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at waist height.
2. Hinge at the hips and pass the dumbbell between your legs to your left hand, drawing a diagonal line.
3. Bring the dumbbell around the outside of your left thigh and back to the front.
4. Continue passing the dumbbell in a smooth figure-eight pattern, alternating hands each pass.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips with chest lifted

Rest intervals: Builds full-body conditioning and high-intensity work capacity
Health benefit:
1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge and place the dumbbells on the floor, then kick your feet back into a plank position.
3. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet forward toward your hands and clean the dumbbells to your shoulders.
4. Explosively press the dumbbells overhead, then reverse the motion to return to the start.
Steps to perform: Brace your core as you lower the dumbbells

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder strength and scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and palms facing your body.
2. Raise the dumbbells in a V path about 30–45 degrees forward of your torso with thumbs pointing up.
3. Stop at shoulder height, pause briefly, and lower the dumbbells with control to the start.
Steps to perform: Lift in the scapular plane with thumbs up and slow controlled motion

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip mobility and single-leg strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wide and hold a dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands.
2. Shift weight to one leg and push hips back while lowering into a deep lateral squat, keeping the opposite leg straight and heel on the floor.
3. Keep chest upright and core braced as you descend, maintaining a neutral spine.
4. Drive through the bent-leg heel to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright and push hips back while driving through the bent heel

Rest intervals: Builds core stability and improves shoulder mobility through rotational load
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell overhead in one hand with the arm locked.
2. Turn the feet slightly away from the weight and hinge at the hips toward the opposite side while keeping the dumbbell overhead.
3. Slide the free hand down the front of the leg and keep your eyes on the dumbbell while maintaining a straight arm.
4. Drive the hips forward to return upright, lower the dumbbell, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips and keep spine neutral while eyes follow the top hand

Rest intervals: Develops posterior chain strength and squat mobility in a compact loaded position
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip- to shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell in the goblet position at your chest.
2. Push hips back and bend knees to descend with a tall chest and knees tracking the toes.
3. Lightly tap a box or bench with your glutes without fully relaxing, keeping tension in the legs.
4. Drive through the heels and hips to stand back up and reset for the next rep.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up descend between feet control depth and press through heels

Rest intervals: Enhances rotator cuff activation and overhead pressing coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your thighs.
2. Lift the dumbbells toward chest height by leading with your elbows and keeping the weights close to your body.
3. Rotate your upper arms so your forearms point forward and the dumbbells come near ear level.
4. Press the dumbbells overhead until arms are extended, then reverse the motion to return.
Steps to perform: Start with elbows high rotate externally then press overhead with control

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring and glute strength while challenging balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand with a neutral grip.
2. Hinge at the hips and push your butt back while lowering the dumbbell toward the standing foot and extending the free leg behind you.
3. Keep a slight bend in the standing knee and maintain a straight spine as you lower until you feel hamstring tension.
4. Drive through the standing heel to return upright and lower the free leg back beside the support leg.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keeping a neutral spine and slow controlled descent

Rest intervals: Improves core stability and transitional strength during controlled positional changes
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back holding a dumbbell in one hand with the arm extended vertically and the same-side knee bent.
2. Press the dumbbell up and roll onto the opposite forearm while keeping your shoulder packed and eyes on the weight.
3. Push up from the forearm to a tall seated position while keeping the dumbbell overhead and the torso braced.
4. Reverse the steps under control to return to the floor and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder packed and eyes on dumbbell while controlling each transition

Rest intervals: Builds overhead shoulder stability and improves postural control during loaded carries
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and hold one dumbbell overhead with a straight arm and neutral grip.
2. Brace your core and pull your shoulder blade down and back.
3. Take slow, controlled steps while keeping the dumbbell steady overhead.
4. Stop, lower the dumbbell to your shoulder, and set it down safely.
Steps to perform: Stand tall brace core press dumbbell fully overhead and walk with controlled steps

Rest intervals: Strengthens chest and lat engagement while promoting thoracic extension
Health benefit:
1. Lie flat on a bench with feet planted and hold one dumbbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and hinge at the shoulders to lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head.
3. Engage your lats and chest to pull the dumbbell back over your chest using the same arc.
4. Lower the dumbbell to your chest and set it down with control.
Steps to perform: Maintain scapular control and slow controlled arc without overarching the lower back

Rest intervals: Activates hip external rotators and improves lateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked and knees bent about 90 degrees, and rest a dumbbell on your top outer thigh.
2. Keep your feet together and lift your top knee by rotating the top hip while keeping your pelvis steady.
3. Lower your knee with control back to the start and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked core braced and move through the hip without rotating torso

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral grip strength and resists lateral trunk flexion
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine.
3. Keep your arm straight and shoulder packed while holding the weight.
4. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Stand tall brace core keep shoulders down and spine neutral

Rest intervals: Enhances lower body mobility and strengthens hip and ankle positioning
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and hold a dumbbell by one end with both hands in front of you.
2. Sit back into a deep squat until your hips drop below your knees and keep your heels on the floor.
3. Press the dumbbell forward as a counterbalance and keep your chest upright.
4. Hold the deep squat with control, then stand up when ready.
Steps to perform: Sit back through hips maintain chest up knees tracking toes

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder external rotation control and rotator cuff endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with the top elbow bent 90° and hold a light dumbbell in the top hand.
2. Keep the elbow pinned to your side and the wrist neutral.
3. Rotate your forearm upward away from your body until the dumbbell reaches chest level.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow tucked at side rotate forearm away with control

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and improves hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell across your upper back with both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips with a soft bend in the knees and keep your back flat as you lower your torso until it is nearly parallel to the floor.
3. Drive your hips forward and squeeze your glutes to return to standing.
4. Reset your posture and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips push hips back maintain neutral spine and soft knees

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder stability and core anti-extension control
Health benefit:
1. Clean and press one dumbbell overhead until your elbow is locked and your shoulder is stable.
2. Brace your core and keep your torso upright with the dumbbell aligned over your hand.
3. Walk forward with small, controlled steps while maintaining the overhead position.
4. Turn around or stop after the set distance or time, then switch sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace core keep ribs down and glutes engaged stand tall

Rest intervals: Enhances anti-rotation core strength and cross-body coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at thigh level.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the dumbbell diagonally across your body toward your left foot while keeping your back flat.
3. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and bring the dumbbell back to the starting position.
4. Switch the dumbbell to the left hand and repeat the movement on the other side.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and rotate from your upper back not your lower back

Rest intervals: Develops biceps strength and forearm pronation-supination control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing forward.
2. Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders while keeping elbows close to your body.
3. Rotate both wrists at the top so palms face down and lower the dumbbells slowly.
4. Rotate wrists back to palms-up at the bottom and repeat.
Steps to perform: Lift with controlled supination and lower with slow pronation maintaining elbow stability

Rest intervals: Improves spinal flexion mobility and hamstring passive length
Health benefit:
1. Stand on a low elevated surface with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands in front of your hips.
2. Tuck your chin slightly and hinge at the hips, then slowly roll down one vertebra at a time as the dumbbell descends toward your feet.
3. Pause at the bottom with control and a deep stretch through the back and hamstrings.
4. Reverse the motion by sequentially extending the spine and return to standing while keeping the dumbbell close.
Steps to perform: Use light load and hinge gradually articulating each vertebra with control

Rest intervals: Enhances core anti-rotation control and scapular retraction strength
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on hands and knees with a dumbbell beside one hand and brace your core.
2. Reach the free hand forward and extend the opposite leg back until your body forms a straight line.
3. Grip the dumbbell and row it toward your ribcage while keeping hips square and torso stable.
4. Lower the dumbbell with control, return the arm and leg, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and exhale as you row avoiding torso rotation

Rest intervals: Improves single-leg balance and coordination during loaded movements
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and lift the free foot off the ground for balance.
3. Pass the dumbbell under the lifted thigh to the other hand while staying upright.
4. Secure the dumbbell, re-establish balance, and repeat for reps then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Anchor standing hip and soft knee while breathing evenly during the pass

Rest intervals: Improves forearm strength and grip endurance
Health benefit:
1. Sit and rest your forearm on your thigh or a bench with the wrist hanging over the edge and hold a dumbbell in your hand, palm up.
2. Curl the dumbbell by flexing your wrist to lift the weight toward your forearm.
3. Lower the dumbbell slowly to a full wrist extension and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep forearm supported and curl with slow controlled wrist motion

Rest intervals: Enhances glute strength and hip stability during single leg control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and place a dumbbell on your hips, holding it in place.
2. Drive through your heels and lift your hips into a full bridge, squeezing your glutes.
3. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping hips elevated and stable.
4. Lower that foot back to the ground, repeat on the other side, and continue marching.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced as you alternate knee lifts

Rest intervals: Strengthens deep core coordination and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hold one dumbbell with both hands over your chest.
2. Extend one leg toward the floor while lowering the dumbbell slowly overhead until your arms are near the floor.
3. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest and bring the extended leg back to the start.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into the floor and move limbs with slow controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Builds core stability and total body coordination under load
Health benefit:
1. Start in a tabletop position with hands gripping dumbbells under your shoulders and knees lifted a few inches off the floor.
2. Brace your core and keep hips low as you reach forward with one hand while stepping the opposite foot forward.
3. Continue crawling by alternating the opposite hand and foot in controlled steps.
4. Keep the dumbbells stable and avoid shrugging your shoulders as you move.
Steps to perform: Keep hips low and spine neutral, take controlled steps without collapsing shoulders

Rest intervals: Improves scapular stability and posterior shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on an incline bench or the floor with a light dumbbell in each hand and arms extended overhead in a Y.
2. Rotate your thumbs up and lift the dumbbells by squeezing your upper back until your arms clear the surface.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping your neck neutral.
4. Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the start under control.
Steps to perform: Keep neck neutral and lift through scapula with straight arms avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Cradle a light dumbbell behind your working knee with the same-side hand.
2. Keep hips square and core braced and lift the bent knee out to the side to hip height.
3. Pause and squeeze the glute at the top.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and core braced as you lift the weighted knee

Rest intervals: Develops isometric core strength and balance capacity
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the mat and hold one dumbbell with both hands at chest level.
2. Lean back slightly, lift your feet, and extend your legs into a V if possible.
3. Hold the dumbbell steady with a straight spine and steady breath.
4. Lower your legs and place the dumbbell down with control.
Steps to perform: Maintain a long spine pull shoulders back and breathe steadily

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral leg strength and rotational core mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell at chest with both hands (goblet grip).
2. Step forward with one foot and lower into a lunge until the front thigh is near parallel.
3. Rotate your torso and the dumbbell toward the front leg, then return to facing forward.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee stacked over ankle and rotate torso with control
MET value: Osteoarthritis, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain, Obesity / Overweight

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder mobility and motor control through coordinated circular movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and grip one dumbbell vertically with both hands at chest.
2. Press the dumbbell overhead and begin moving it in a slow, controlled circle around your head and shoulders.
3. Keep your core braced and knees slightly bent throughout the movement.
4. Complete the circle back to chest and repeat, then reverse the direction.
Steps to perform: Control the path keep shoulders down and brace your core

Rest intervals: Builds single leg endurance and lower body stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, feet hip-width.
2. Step one foot back and lower into a lunge until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the lunge with torso upright and weight through the front heel for the set time, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Stand tall tuck hips slightly and breathe evenly while holding
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral core strength and trunk endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Slide the dumbbell slowly down your right thigh by bending at the waist until the oblique engages, keeping hips square.
3. Hold the bent position for the set time, then return upright and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace your core to keep hips and shoulders stacked

Rest intervals: Builds lower body muscular endurance and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell vertically at chest with both hands.
2. Lower into a shallow squat with chest up and knees tracking toes.
3. Take short, controlled steps forward while keeping hips low.
4. Continue for the desired distance, then rise to stand.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tall chest and neutral spine while stepping

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder pressing strength and scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and press two dumbbells together at chest with palms touching.
2. Brace your core and press the dumbbells straight overhead until arms are extended.
3. Lower the dumbbells back to the chest while keeping palms in contact.
4. Reset your posture and repeat.
Steps to perform: Pack your ribs to maintain a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Targets calf muscle strength and ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a bench with knees bent and place one dumbbell on each knee.
2. Press through the balls of your feet to lift your heels as high as possible.
3. Lower your heels slowly until you feel a stretch, then repeat.
Steps to perform: Lower heels slowly with control

Rest intervals: Develops antirotation core strength and oblique control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back holding one dumbbell with both hands straight above your chest and legs extended toward the ceiling.
2. Brace your core and slowly lower both legs to the right side until you feel resistance, keeping shoulders on the floor.
3. Pull your legs back through center with control and lower them to the left side.
4. Keep your arms locked and shoulders pressed into the ground as you repeat.
Steps to perform: Pin shoulders to the floor to protect your lower back

Rest intervals: Enhances hamstring mobility and shoulder stability through controlled core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at thigh level.
2. Hinge at the hips and place the dumbbells on the floor, then walk your hands forward into a high plank.
3. Keep your core tight and walk your feet forward in small steps toward your hands until your legs are near straight.
4. Reverse the movement by walking your hands back to the dumbbells and hinging up to stand.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and hinge from hips as you walk hands forward

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and joint circulation
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Raise both arms to shoulder height with a soft bend in the elbows and palms facing down.
3. Make small, controlled circular motions with the arms using the shoulder joint.
4. Reverse the circle direction after the set and keep your core engaged.
Steps to perform: Keep scapula stable and move shoulders slowly without shrugging

Rest intervals: Strengthens deep hip flexors and promotes coordinated core activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent to 90 degrees and hold a dumbbell vertically against your hips with both hands.
2. Brace your core and lower one foot toward the floor in a slow, controlled march while keeping the opposite knee at 90 degrees.
3. Return the lowered leg to the starting position and repeat on the other side without letting your lower back arch.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral lumbar spine and exhale as you lift each knee

Rest intervals: Builds anterior core endurance and dynamic spinal stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold a dumbbell with both hands extended overhead while lifting your shoulders and legs into a hollow position.
2. Rock smoothly back toward your heels and then forward to the starting hollow while keeping your lower back pressed to the floor.
3. Maintain tight core tension and controlled breathing throughout each rock.
Steps to perform: Squeeze ribs down and press lower back into mat for controlled rocking

Rest intervals: Improves squat mechanics, hip mobility, and lower body strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and hold a dumbbell vertically at your chest in a goblet grip.
2. Sit back and down into a deep squat keeping your chest up and elbows inside your knees.
3. Use your elbows to push your knees outward (pry) to open the hips and deepen the squat.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and reset your goblet hold before the next rep.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright and knees tracking toes while driving hips back and down

Rest intervals: Enhances chest muscle activation and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other and arms extended above your chest.
2. Keep a soft bend in both elbows and slowly lower your arms out to the sides until you feel a stretch in the chest.
3. Pause and hold the dumbbells steady at the lower position for the prescribed time.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest in a controlled motion and rack them safely.
Steps to perform: Maintain slight elbow bend and retract shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring flexibility and posterior chain mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart holding one dumbbell with both hands in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the knees and push your hips back as you lower the dumbbell toward your shins.
3. Keep your spine neutral and hold the lowest position where you feel the hamstrings engaged.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and place the dumbbell down safely.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips keeping a neutral spine and chest lifted

Rest intervals: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and oblique muscle endurance
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a bench holding a dumbbell in one hand beside your thigh and keep the other hand on your waist or thigh.
2. Slowly bend your torso toward the dumbbell side, sliding the weight down toward the knee while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Hold the lateral bend at the lowest comfortable point while maintaining a neutral spine.
4. Return to upright by contracting the opposite oblique and switch sides after completing the hold.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked over hips and brace core

Rest intervals: Promotes hamstring lengthening and increased spinal mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands in front of you.
2. Hinge at the hips and let the dumbbell hang toward the floor with a soft bend in the knees.
