3. Relax your upper back and let your chest and head drop toward your thighs while keeping hold of the dumbbell.
4. Engage your glutes and drive through your heels to return to standing while keeping the dumbbell close to your legs.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips and maintain long spine while relaxing neck

Rest intervals: Improves triceps and shoulder flexibility for better overhead range
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall and hold one dumbbell vertically overhead in your right hand.
2. Bend your right elbow and lower the dumbbell behind your head while keeping the upper arm close to your ear.
3. Reach your left hand to gently support the right elbow and deepen the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and spine neutral while pressing elbow overhead

Rest intervals: Enhances hip and ankle mobility while promoting squat depth control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell at your chest with both hands in a goblet grip.
2. Squat down by pushing your hips back and keeping your chest up until you reach a deep squat.
3. Relax and breathe while holding the deep squat and keep the dumbbell close to your chest.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and ribs down with knees tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility with rotational loading
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, and hold a dumbbell with both hands across your chest.
2. Engage your core and slowly lower your knees together to one side while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Pause at the end range, then use your core to bring your knees back to center.
4. Repeat the motion to the other side for desired reps.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tall spine and inhale before rotating then exhale as you twist

Rest intervals: Improves full body mobility and dynamic hip and thoracic coordination
Health benefit:
1. Step forward into a tall lunge and hold a dumbbell in the hand opposite your front leg.
2. Place your front-side hand on the floor inside your front foot and sink your hips toward the ground.
3. Rotate your torso and reach the dumbbell up toward the ceiling while following it with your eyes.
4. Return your hand to the floor, step back, and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace core hinge at hips and control rotation while keeping shoulders down

Rest intervals: Promotes scapular depression control and upper back mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in one hand and your arm relaxed at your side.
2. Allow the weight to pull your shoulder down while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Tilt your head away from the weighted side to deepen the stretch, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Gently pull shoulder blade down and relax neck avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Increases hip and groin flexibility and improves adductor range
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with the soles of your feet together and knees bent outward.
2. Hold a dumbbell vertically with both hands and place it on top of your feet or against your lower shins.
3. Hinge forward from the hips with a straight spine until you feel a stretch in the inner thighs.
4. Maintain the position and gently deepen the forward lean as tolerated.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and hinge forward from hips avoid rounding lower back

Rest intervals: Enhances core strength and trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, holding one dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Lean back slowly from the hips until your torso reaches about a 45-degree angle while keeping your core engaged.
3. Return to an upright position by contracting your abs and control the movement.
Steps to perform: Brace core and hinge from hips keeping a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves hip mobility and rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor in a shin box position with the front shin vertical and the back shin behind you.
2. Hold a dumbbell with both hands and rest it on your front thigh or across your hips.
3. Keep an upright chest and engage the hips as you rotate slightly toward the front leg.
4. Hold the position or perform small controlled lean-ins and lean-outs to load the hips.
Steps to perform: Sit tall stack hips and shoulders control movement with slow transitions

Rest intervals: Increases lat and shoulder mobility for improved overhead movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and hold a light dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Reach your left arm overhead and hinge slightly at the hips while sliding the dumbbell down the outside of your right thigh.
3. Lean your torso toward the right to feel the lat stretch and breathe evenly.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep ribcage down and reach through the arm without arching lower back

Rest intervals: Enhances hip extension and anterior hip flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Step your left foot forward into a low lunge and place your right knee on the floor while holding one dumbbell with both hands at chest height.
2. Tuck your pelvis under and shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the right hip.
3. Keep your torso upright and engage your core to stabilize the position.
4. Hold for the set time, then switch legs and repeat.
Steps to perform: Tuck pelvis chest upright keep front knee aligned over ankle

Rest intervals: Strengthens oblique muscles and improves lateral trunk control
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in your right hand with your arm extended overhead.
2. Keep your hips square and slowly bend your torso to the left, lowering the dumbbell along the right side.
3. Pause when you feel a controlled stretch in the oblique, then use your obliques to pull back upright.
4. Switch the dumbbell to the left hand and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Brace core exhale and control the side bend without twisting torso

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic spine mobility and upright posture
Health benefit:
1. Sit with your upper back supported on a bench or foam roller and plant your feet flat.
2. Hold one dumbbell across your chest with both hands.
3. Lean back over the support by hinging through the mid-back and let the weight assist the extension.
4. Extend the thoracic spine to lift your chest, control the return, and repeat.
Steps to perform: Extend through thoracic spine with controlled motion, avoid collapsing lower back

Rest intervals: Promotes anterior arm flexibility and shoulder extension range
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright on a bench with feet flat and hold a light dumbbell in one hand with the palm facing up.
2. Extend that arm behind your torso with the elbow straight and let the dumbbell gently pull the hand downward.
3. Hold the stretch for the desired time, then switch sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep scapula depressed and spine long, avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Improves calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion for better gait mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with the balls of one foot on a low step or curb and hold a dumbbell at your side.
2. Keep the knee of the standing leg straight and slowly lower the heel below the step to feel a calf stretch.
3. Maintain an upright posture and hold the lowered position for the desired time.
4. Press the heel back up to the step to release the stretch and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep toes forward and heel anchored, avoid bouncing

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and side bending range
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall with legs crossed and hold a light dumbbell in the hand on the side to be stretched.
2. Reach the opposite arm overhead and lengthen the spine.
3. Lean away from the weighted side until you feel a lateral stretch in the lower flank.
4. Breathe and return to center before switching sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and lengthen side body, avoid rotating torso

Rest intervals: Promotes spinal elongation and gentle shoulder and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Kneel with knees wide and toes together and hold a light dumbbell with both hands extended forward.
2. Sit hips back toward your heels and fold your torso over your thighs while reaching the dumbbell along the floor.
3. Press the dumbbell into the mat to deepen the stretch and relax the chest.
4. Breathe and slowly lift the dumbbell as you return to a kneeling position.
Steps to perform: Breathe deep and maintain neutral cervical spine, press hips back evenly

Rest intervals: Improves forearm flexibility and grip comfort
Health benefit:
1. Sit with forearm supported on your thigh or a bench and hold a light dumbbell with palm facing up.
2. Allow the weight to pull your wrist back until you feel a gentle stretch along the inner forearm.
3. Keep the elbow soft, hold the position, then slowly lift the dumbbell to release the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow straight while slowly lowering the wrist into a controlled stretch

Rest intervals: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Health benefit:
1. From all fours, slide one knee forward and place that shin under your torso while extending the opposite leg straight back.
2. Place a light dumbbell on top of the front thigh near the hip, square your hips, and lengthen your spine.
3. Hold the pose for the chosen time, remove the dumbbell, and press back into tabletop to switch sides.
Steps to perform: Square hips forward while lengthening the spine and breathing evenly

Rest intervals: Builds core stability and hip flexor endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and secure a light dumbbell between your feet near the arches.
2. Place your hands under your glutes and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Lift both legs to about a 45-degree angle and hold with the dumbbell secured.
4. Lower the legs slowly, remove the dumbbell, and rest.
Steps to perform: Lift the weighted anchor leg with a neutral spine and braced core

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down with your arms extended to the sides and hold a light dumbbell in the hand on the same side as the leg you will rotate.
2. Engage your glutes, lift that leg, bend the knee, and rotate the foot across your back toward the opposite hand.
3. Return the leg to the start position, set the dumbbell down if needed, and repeat before switching sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain a grounded pelvis and control rotation through the thoracic spine

Rest intervals: Enhances anterior shoulder mobility and scapular awareness
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on a bench with your chest supported and your arm hanging down holding a dumbbell in a neutral grip.
2. Keep a slight bend in the elbow and raise the dumbbell forward to shoulder height with controlled motion.
3. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the start position and reset before the next rep.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder blades depressed with core engaged to protect the anterior shoulder

Rest intervals: Increases adductor flexibility and hip abduction range
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with soles together and knees dropped outward, holding a dumbbell across your thighs near the knees.
2. Sit tall and press the dumbbell gently down toward your thighs to apply light resistance.
3. Hinge forward from the hips with a straight back until you feel a stretch in the inner thighs.
4. Hold the stretch briefly, then release pressure and return to an upright seated position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and hinge from hips to avoid lower back rounding

Rest intervals: Improves trunk rotation and single leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Start in a half-kneeling stance with one knee on the floor and the front foot flat, holding a dumbbell with both hands at chest height.
2. Brace your core and rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping hips square and the dumbbell close to your chest.
3. Pause briefly at the end range while maintaining an upright posture.
4. Rotate back to center with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Anchor pelvis and rotate thorax while keeping hips facing forward

Rest intervals: Enhances posterior chain activation and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Set a dumbbell handle across the base of both palms and place hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Tuck toes and lift hips to form a Down Dog, pressing palms down onto the dumbbell.
3. Hold the position while maintaining a long spine and steady breaths.
4. Lower hips back to the floor and remove the dumbbell.
Steps to perform: Press through palms and drive hips back while lengthening the spine

Rest intervals: Improves pectoral flexibility and upper chest mobility
Health benefit:
1. Adjust an incline bench to 30–45 degrees and lie back with a light dumbbell in one hand.
2. Extend the arm out to the side with a slight elbow bend and lower the dumbbell until the chest opens.
3. Hold the stretch, then raise the arm back and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder blade down and back and avoid shrugging the working shoulder

Rest intervals: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and joint mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright with one knee bent at 90 degrees and place a light dumbbell across the top of the foot near the toes.
2. Point the toes down to plantarflex and then pull the toes up to dorsiflex in a controlled motion.
3. Perform repeated smooth repetitions for the desired count.
4. Remove the dumbbell and repeat on the opposite ankle.
Steps to perform: Stabilize shin over foot and move only at the ankle joint

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic mobility and shoulder range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your right side with knees bent and hold a light dumbbell in your top hand across your chest.
2. Place your lower arm on the floor and lift the top arm so the dumbbell points to the ceiling.
3. Rotate your torso and open the top arm across your body so the dumbbell moves toward the floor behind you.
4. Reverse the rotation and return the dumbbell to point toward the ceiling with controlled motion.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine not the lower back

Rest intervals: Builds lateral hip strength and improves single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell at your chest with both hands in a goblet hold.
2. Step your right foot wide to the side and bend your right knee while keeping your left leg straight.
3. Sink your hips back and lower into a lateral lunge, holding the bottom position.
4. Press through your right foot to return to standing.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and knee tracking over toes, weight through heels
MET value: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease

Rest intervals: Strengthens shoulder internal rotators and enhances joint control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your right side with your upper arm against your torso and elbow bent 90°, holding a light dumbbell in your top hand.
2. Keep your elbow pinned to your side and rotate your forearm inward to bring the dumbbell toward your abdomen.
3. Pause briefly at the end range with control.
4. Slowly rotate outward to return the dumbbell to the starting neutral position.
Steps to perform: Control the movement, keep elbow pinned to the side and forearm steady

Rest intervals: Improves single leg stability and enhances core anti rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Set one foot forward and one foot back in a stable split stance about one stride apart.
2. Hold a dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands in a goblet or racked position.
3. Lower your hips slightly and settle into a static, upright position while keeping weight evenly distributed.
4. Maintain the hold for the desired time and breathe steadily.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and brace core, distribute weight evenly between feet

Rest intervals: Increases glute and posterior chain activation for hip extension strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Place a dumbbell across your hips and secure it with both hands.
3. Drive through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Squeeze your glutes and hold the top position for the desired time while breathing steadily.
Steps to perform: Squeeze glutes, keep ribs down and avoid overextending lower back
MET value: Sleep Apnea, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Heart Failure (Stable)

Rest intervals: Promotes hamstring flexibility and lumbar spine mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a light dumbbell with both hands in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips and slide the dumbbell down your shins toward your ankles while keeping your back long.
3. Relax your head and neck, reach toward your toes with the dumbbell, and hold the stretch while breathing.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a long spine and controlled descent

Rest intervals: Enhances scapular stability and supports improved upper back posture
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on an incline bench with a light dumbbell in each hand and your arms hanging long.
2. Keep arms straight and pull your shoulder blades together to lift the dumbbells slightly by retracting the scapulae.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blades and hold the top position briefly.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells by letting the shoulder blades spread and repeat.
Steps to perform: Retract shoulder blades slowly keeping neck neutral and ribs stacked

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor flexibility and anterior chain mobility
Health benefit:
1. Kneel with your back knee against a wall and place the same-side foot on the wall while holding a dumbbell in the hand on the back-leg side.
2. Tuck your pelvis and squeeze your glutes while pressing the back knee into the wall and raising the dumbbell overhead.
3. Maintain an upright torso and feel the front hip flexor lengthen.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Tuck pelvis and brace core to protect lower back

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and shoulder girdle opening
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand overhead with a neutral grip.
2. Brace your core and side-bend away from the dumbbell while keeping the opposite hand by your thigh.
3. Pause at the bottom to feel a lateral stretch along the ribs and obliques.
4. Slowly return to center and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs anchored and hinge from the waist for controlled lateral bend

Rest intervals: Improves hip external rotation mobility and promotes glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and place your right ankle across your left thigh into a figure-4; hold a dumbbell on top of the crossed shin near the ankle.
2. Drive through the left heel to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line, pressing the dumbbell into the crossed leg for resistance.
3. Lower your hips with control until your glutes touch the floor and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and hinge forward from hips to deepen safely

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral shoulder strength and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on your left leg and hold a dumbbell at shoulder height with your left hand; brace your core and keep a slight bend in the standing knee.
2. Press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is fully extended while maintaining balance on the standing leg.
3. Lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Brace your core before pressing overhead

Rest intervals: Develops lower body strength and improves hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with your left foot forward and your right toes resting lightly on a low bench behind you while holding a dumbbell in the goblet position at your chest.
2. Sit back into the left hip and bend the left knee to lower into a squat until the thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through the left heel to stand upright while keeping the dumbbell at your chest, then repeat and switch legs.
Steps to perform: Drive through your front heel on every rep

Rest intervals: Builds core rotational strength and oblique control
Health benefit:
1. Assume a side plank on your forearm with feet stacked and hold a dumbbell in the top hand.
2. Lift hips to form a straight line and raise the top arm holding the dumbbell toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate your torso and thread the dumbbell under your torso toward the floor without letting hips sag.
4. Reverse the movement and return the dumbbell to the ceiling with core engaged.
Steps to perform: Maintain a straight spine while reaching under with control

Rest intervals: Improves core anti rotation stability and shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and press a dumbbell overhead with one arm, palm facing forward and elbow locked.
2. Brace your core and take small controlled steps forward while keeping the weight stabilized overhead.
3. Walk the prescribed distance or time while maintaining posture, then lower the dumbbell slowly to the shoulder.
Steps to perform: Keep your shoulders level while walking

Rest intervals: Promotes unilateral biceps strength and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and hold a dumbbell in the working hand at your side.
2. Keep your torso upright and curl the dumbbell toward your shoulder with controlled elbow flexion.
3. Lower the weight slowly to the start position and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Curl with a controlled tempo while standing tall on one leg

Exercise Name: DB Reverse Lunge to Knee Drive
Rest intervals: Develops lower body strength and explosive hip drive
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step one foot back into a controlled reverse lunge, lowering until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through the front heel and lift the rear knee forward and up into a knee drive.
4. Reset briefly and repeat on the same leg or switch legs on the next rep.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and control the descent before driving the knee up

Rest intervals: Increases core engagement and improves gait stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell in one hand at your side to create an offset load.
2. Brace the core and lift one knee up to hip level while keeping the torso upright and the weight steady.
3. Lower the foot back down with control and alternate knees in a marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep hips level as you slowly lift each knee

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and upper back while enhancing single leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the dumbbell toward the ground while extending the free leg behind to keep a straight spine.
3. Pull the dumbbell into a row by driving the elbow up toward the ribcage as you return the torso toward upright.
4. Lower the weight with control and repeat or switch sides after the set.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips with a flat back and control the row movement

Rest intervals: Enhances grip strength and shoulder stability through controlled pressing
Health benefit:
1. Hold a dumbbell bottoms-up at shoulder with the handle vertical and elbow tucked.
2. Brace your core and press the dumbbell straight overhead without letting the wrist collapse.
3. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the shoulder while keeping the bottom-up orientation.
4. Repeat for reps then switch arms.
Steps to perform: Keep wrist stable and elbow close to maintain shoulder alignment

Rest intervals: Improves lower body mobility and multi directional coordination
Health benefit:
1. Hold a dumbbell at chest in a goblet or racked position and stand tall.
2. Step forward (or diagonally like a clock position) into a controlled lunge, lowering until the front knee tracks over the toes.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat for reps, alternating clock positions and legs.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee tracking over toes and remain tall through the torso

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and shoulder girdle control through anti-rotation and upper body coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place two dumbbells on the floor shoulder-width apart and adopt a bear hold with knees hovering and hands on the handles.
2. Brace your core and lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while keeping hips and torso stable.
3. Return the hand to the handle and repeat the tap with the other hand.
4. Continue alternating taps while maintaining a flat back and steady breathing.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep hips level during each shoulder tap

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral shoulder stability and core bracing while challenging grip and posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and press a dumbbell overhead with one hand until the arm is straight.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine and gaze forward.
3. Walk forward in controlled steps while keeping the dumbbell stable overhead.
4. Lower the dumbbell to your side under control and switch arms.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulder packed while walking tall

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral pressing strength and improves hip and trunk stability during overhead movement
Health benefit:
1. Set into a half-kneeling position with the front foot planted and hold a dumbbell at shoulder level of the front arm.
2. Square your hips, brace your core, and keep your back upright.
3. Press the dumbbell overhead until the arm is fully extended.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the shoulder with control and switch kneeling sides.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and glutes engaged to avoid lower back arch

Rest intervals: Builds single-leg strength and balance while enhancing knee and hip control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and cradle a dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the standing knee to lower into a single-leg squat while the other leg moves slightly back.
3. Keep your chest up and core engaged as you descend to a comfortable depth.
4. Drive through the heel to return to standing and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep knee tracking over toes and control the descent

Rest intervals: Trains full-body coordination mobility and core stability through controlled transitional movement
Health benefit:
1. DB Turkish Sit-Up: Lie on your back holding a dumbbell vertical in one hand with the same-side knee bent and the other leg extended.
2. Brace your core and use your free elbow to help sit up while keeping the dumbbell overhead.
3. Continue to rise to a tall kneel while keeping the dumbbell aligned over your shoulder.
4. Reverse the steps slowly to return to the starting lying position with control.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and move slowly while maintaining scapular stability

Rest intervals: Combines lower body power with rotational core engagement to improve coordinated strength
Health benefit:
1. DB Squat to Rotational Press: Stand feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell at one shoulder with elbow tucked.
2. Sit back into a squat until your thighs are near parallel while keeping your chest upright.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and rotate your torso toward the dumbbell side.
4. Press the dumbbell overhead and lower it back to the shoulder under control.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels keep chest lifted and rotate using a braced core

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral shoulder strength and single-leg balance while promoting scapular control
Health benefit:
1. DB Single-Leg Lateral Raise: Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand with a slight elbow bend.
2. Hinge at the hips and lift the arm out to the side until it is parallel to the floor while keeping balance.
3. Lower the dumbbell with control and repeat while keeping the standing knee soft and torso stable.
Steps to perform: Keep standing knee soft and torso stable as you lift with slow control

Rest intervals: Strengthens glute activation and single-leg hip extension improving posterior chain stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent, the other leg extended, and a dumbbell rested on your hips held with both hands.
2. Drive through the heel of the planted foot and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to extended heel.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and keep the dumbbell stable with your hands.
4. Lower your hips slowly to the mat and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Press through heel keep hips level and avoid arching lower back

Rest intervals: Improves core anti-rotation strength and shoulder stability through dynamic plank transitions
Health benefit:
1. Grasp a dumbbell in one hand and set into a high plank with feet wider than hip-width.
2. Rotate your torso and press the dumbbell toward the ceiling as you stack or stagger your feet into a side plank.
3. Return the dumbbell to the floor under control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Maintain a braced core and stacked shoulders as you rotate with control
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Rest intervals: Develops rotational lower body strength and coordinated upper body pressing in multiple planes
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell at chest level with both hands in a goblet grip.
2. Step diagonally back and across into a transverse lunge, lowering until your front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through the front foot to stand and simultaneously press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is extended.
4. Lower the dumbbell to your chest with control and repeat on the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Step across with knee tracking toes keep chest tall and press from core

Rest intervals: Improves overhead pressing strength and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Brace your core and sit tall to keep an upright torso.
3. Press both dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and core braced as you press overhead

Rest intervals: Enhances single-leg strength and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides.
2. Step forward with one foot into a long lunge and lean your torso slightly forward over the front thigh.
3. Bend both knees until the front thigh is roughly parallel to the floor and the rear knee lowers toward the ground.
4. Drive through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and keep chest proud to maintain neutral spine

Rest intervals: Enhances core control and coordinated limb movement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hold a single dumbbell in the hand on the same side as the leg you will move.
2. Slowly extend the same-side leg toward the floor while lowering the dumbbell overhead and keep your lower back pressed into the floor.
3. Return the leg and dumbbell to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Press lower back gently into floor and exhale to control limb movement

Rest intervals: Develops lateral leg strength and improves hip mobility and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands.
2. Step wide to the right and push hips back while bending your right knee into a side lunge, keeping the left leg straight.
3. Drive through the right foot to return to center and lift the right knee up into a balance, squeezing the glutes.
4. Lower back to start and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Drive through bent heel and keep knee tracking over toes as you rise

Rest intervals: Increases unilateral pressing strength while promoting posterior chain activation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and hold one dumbbell in your right hand extended above your chest.
2. Drive through both feet and lift your hips into a bridge so your torso forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Bend your right elbow to lower the dumbbell to your chest while keeping wrist neutral.
4. Press the dumbbell back to full arm extension while maintaining the bridge, then lower and repeat; switch arms.
Steps to perform: Squeeze glutes to keep hips level and brace core as you press

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral leg endurance and joint stability under load
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a split stance with your front knee over the ankle and rear foot on the toes, and hold one dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Lower into a split squat until the front thigh is parallel to the floor and your weight is evenly distributed.
3. Hold the iso-position with a braced core and tall chest for the prescribed time, then press up to standing.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee stacked over ankle

Rest intervals: Builds core strength and hip flexor endurance
Health benefit:
1. Place two dumbbells parallel on the floor shoulder-width apart and sit between them.
2. Grip the handles firmly and press down to lift your hips off the floor.
3. Extend your legs straight in front of you and hold the L position.
4. Keep the shoulders down and breathe steadily while holding the position.
Steps to perform: Press hands firmly into the floor

Rest intervals: Improves coordinated lower to upper body strength and functional pressing power
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back into a controlled reverse lunge, keeping the front knee over the ankle.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and press both dumbbells overhead.
4. Lower the weights to shoulder height and repeat on the other leg.
Steps to perform: Drive through front heel throughout the lunge

Rest intervals: Strengthens biceps while encouraging trunk stability and posture control
Health benefit:
1. Kneel tall with knees hip-width and hold one dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Keep elbows close to your ribs and curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders.
3. Lower the dumbbells with control to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep torso tall with ribs down

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and reinforces hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with one foot forward and hold a dumbbell at your upper chest with both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips with a flat back and push your hips back while keeping the front knee soft.
3. Lower your torso until it is near parallel to the floor.
4. Drive your hips forward and return to standing while squeezing your glutes.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves single-leg balance and ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell at your side in the hand opposite the standing leg.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips level while maintaining a tall spine.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while softening the standing knee

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and functional trunk control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell with both hands by one hip.
2. Rotate your torso and chop the dumbbell diagonally upward across your body to finish overhead by the opposite shoulder.
3. Reverse the movement with control and return the dumbbell to the starting hip position.
4. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Lead with your core not arms and exhale during the lift

Rest intervals: Improves rear shoulder and upper back muscle coordination for posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand on your right leg with a slight bend in the knee and hold a dumbbell in your left hand.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor and let the left arm hang toward the ground.
3. Raise the dumbbell out to the side in a wide arc, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Lower the weight with control and repeat, then switch legs and arm sides.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and retract shoulder blades as you control the fly

Exercise Name: DB Curtsy Lunge to Lateral Kick
Rest intervals: Enhances hip stability and lateral movement control for functional mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Step your right leg diagonally behind your left into a curtsy, bending both knees.
3. Push through the front foot to stand and immediately lift the rear leg out to the side for a controlled lateral kick.
4. Lower the leg, reset, and repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright chest and front knee tracking over toes during both movements

Rest intervals: Increases core endurance and tension for improved midline stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold a dumbbell with both hands extended overhead.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs a few inches off the floor into a hollow position while keeping the dumbbell overhead.
3. Rock gently back and forth in small arcs using your core to control the movement.
Steps to perform: Brace your core tuck pelvis and breathe steadily during controlled rocking

Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength while promoting shoulder mobility and overhead stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width, hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core and squat down until thighs are parallel, keeping chest up and weight in the heels.
3. Drive through the heels to stand and press both dumbbells overhead into a wide Y position with arms slightly diagonal.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep chest lifted as you press into the Y

Rest intervals: Targets triceps while challenging unilateral stability and core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with one foot forward and one foot back and hold a single dumbbell with both hands overhead.
2. Keep elbows close to your head and lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending the elbows.
3. Extend the elbows to raise the dumbbell back overhead with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and elbow tucked to minimize shoulder movement

Rest intervals: Improves dynamic balance and single-leg control during walking
Health benefit:
1. Stand in tandem stance with one foot directly in front of the other and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Tighten your core and take a small controlled step forward with the front foot while maintaining balance.
3. Bring the back foot forward to re-establish tandem alignment while keeping an upright posture.
4. Continue heel-to-toe steps in a controlled manner, then switch lead foot as needed.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright torso and take small controlled steps to challenge balance

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral trunk strength and challenges balance under asymmetric load
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips facing forward.
3. Bend your torso to the right, sliding the dumbbell down your thigh.
4. Return to standing and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and avoid rotating spine as you bend
MET value: Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain, Sarcopenia

Rest intervals: Combines hamstring and core mobility with upper back pulling strength development
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Hinge at the hips, place both hands on the floor, and walk your hands forward into a high plank.
3. Shift weight to the left hand and row the dumbbell toward your ribcage, then lower it.
4. Walk your hands back to your feet, stand up by reversing the hinge, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and hips stable during walkout then row with scapular retraction

Health benefit: Steps to perform
Steps to perform: Safety cue
Safety cue: MET value

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral chest and shoulder strength and horizontal pushing balance
Health benefit:
1. Loop the resistance band across your upper back and hold the ends under each hand with a wide grip.
2. Shift weight toward one arm and straighten the opposite arm out to the side.
3. Bend the supporting elbow and lower your chest toward the ground while keeping the extended arm straight.
4. Press through the supporting hand to return to the start and alternate sides.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and control lateral band tension through slow movement

Rest intervals: Builds single arm shoulder strength and overhead stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one end of the band with feet hip-width and hold the other end in one hand at shoulder height.
2. Brace your core and press the band overhead until the elbow is nearly locked.
3. Lower the hand back to shoulder height with control.
4. Repeat for the set and switch arms.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and press slowly without leaning your torso

Rest intervals: Develops explosive pulling and pushing strength and transition coordination
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band over a high pull-up bar and place one knee or foot into the band for assistance, using a false grip on the bar.
2. Pull explosively while driving the knee up and leaning your chest toward the bar to reach the transition point.
3. Rotate your wrists and shift your chest forward while pressing down on the bar to move into the dip position.
4. Press the body up until the elbows lock, then lower back to a hang with control.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tight hollow body and move deliberately through the transition
MET value: Sarcopenia, Depression / Anxiety, Cognitive Decline / Dementia, Coronary Artery Disease

Rest intervals: Increases scapular stability and chest strength through variable resistance
Health benefit:
1. Place the resistance band across your upper back and grasp the ends under each hand while in a high plank.
2. Walk hands slightly wider than shoulder width and brace your core.
3. Bend elbows and lower your chest toward the floor while keeping the band taut.
4. Press through your palms to straighten arms and return to plank while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Pack shoulders and lower with control keeping elbows at 45 degrees

Rest intervals: Enhances single arm back strength and core anti rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with one foot on the resistance band and hold the other end in one hand.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor and keep a slight bend in the knees.
3. Pull the band hand toward your ribcage, driving the elbow back and squeezing the shoulder blade.
4. Lower the hand back to full arm extension under control while keeping tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a neutral spine and pull without rotating your torso

Rest intervals: Strengthens latissimus dorsi engagement and supports improved posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the resistance band overhead and kneel facing the anchor while holding the band with both hands overhead.
2. Pull your shoulder blades down and back and keep your chest upright.
3. Pull the band down toward your upper chest by driving your elbows toward your sides.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and ribs down while pulling shoulder blades down and back slowly

Rest intervals: Improves single arm chest isolation and horizontal stability
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band to a stable anchor at chest height behind you.
2. Grasp the handle with one hand and step forward until the band is taut, feet hip-width apart.
3. Keep a slight bend in the elbow and pull the handle across your chest until your arm is extended in front of you.
4. Slowly return to the start under control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly at hips and keep a neutral spine while controlling both directions

Rest intervals: Builds triceps strength and elbow extension capacity under load
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends with both hands behind your head.
2. Keep elbows close to your ears and brace your core.
3. Extend your elbows to press your hands upward until your arms are straight overhead.
4. Slowly bend the elbows to lower back to start under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep elbows tucked while lowering under control

Rest intervals: Enhances posterior shoulder endurance and improves upper back posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height in front of you and grasp a handle in each hand with arms extended.
2. Hinge at the hips with a soft bend in the elbows and pull your hands out laterally until your rear delts engage.
3. Hold the outward position isometrically for several seconds, then slowly return to start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulder blades and keep neck long while avoiding shrugging during hold

Rest intervals: Develops biceps strength and forearm rotational control for grip function
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and step the band under both feet; hold the band with palms facing up.
2. Curl your hands toward your shoulders while keeping elbows at your sides.
3. Rotate your wrists to palms-down at the top and slowly lower against band tension.
4. Rotate your wrists back to palms-up before starting the next rep.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows steady rotate wrists smoothly and lower with control

Health benefit:
1. Place one foot on a bench behind you and step the band under the front foot; hold the band ends at shoulder height.
2. Lower your hips straight down until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Press through the front heel to return to standing while keeping your torso upright.
4. Reset your balance and repeat for reps before switching legs.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and knee tracking over toes as you control the descent

Rest intervals: Enhances posterior chain strength and hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with the working foot and hold the band ends in both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and push the free leg back while lowering your torso until you feel band tension.
3. Keep a slight bend in the standing knee and maintain a neutral spine.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and squeeze the glutes at the top.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and slow controlled band tension

Rest intervals: Increases single-leg strength and lower limb mobility
Health benefit:
1. Attach a loop or long band to a sturdy anchor at chest height and hold the band with both hands.
2. Stand on one leg with the other leg extended forward and step back to create band tension.
3. Sit back and down into a pistol squat, using the band to assist the upward phase.
4. Press through the heel to stand and control the descent on each rep.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and sit back slowly as the band assists

Rest intervals: Boosts glute strength and hip extension power
Health benefit:
1. Sit with your upper back on a bench, feet flat, and loop a heavy band across your hips with its ends anchored under your feet.
2. Drive your hips upward by squeezing your glutes until your torso forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Pause and squeeze at the top against the band's resistance.
4. Lower your hips under control until the band is taut and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels and brace your core while maintaining neutral spine

Rest intervals: Develops lateral hip strength and upper body pressing coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of a resistance band with feet together and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot wide to the side and bend that knee into a lateral lunge while keeping the other leg straight.
3. Drive through the planted foot to stand and press the band overhead as you return to center.
Steps to perform: Push hips back keep chest lifted and press the band slowly

Rest intervals: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a resistance band under the ball of the working foot and hold the band ends at your hips while standing on the other foot.
2. Keep the working knee straight and press through the ball of the foot to raise your heel as high as possible.
3. Lower the heel slowly with control back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep knee slightly soft and hips level as you raise and lower with control

Rest intervals: Builds quadriceps strength and lower body pushing power
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and loop a heavy resistance band around the soles of both feet, holding the band ends firmly at your shoulders.
2. Plant your feet hip-width and press both feet forward to straighten your legs against the band tension.
3. Pause briefly at full extension without locking the knees.
4. Bend the knees slowly to return to the start with control.
Steps to perform: Brace core, press through heels, control the descent to avoid locking knees

Rest intervals: Enhances hip mobility and lower-body muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Place a resistance band just above your knees and assume a low squat with chest up.
2. Take small controlled steps forward while keeping knees pushed out against the band.
3. Continue stepping with steady squat depth and maintain constant band tension.
Steps to perform: Stay low with neutral spine, step slowly and keep knees tracking toes

Rest intervals: Improves dynamic leg strength and step stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width, loop the band under your front foot, and hold the ends at shoulder level.
2. Step forward into a controlled lunge and lower until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing while keeping the band taut.
4. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright, knee aligned over toes, control return to start

Rest intervals: Increases muscular endurance and unilateral stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a split stance with front foot forward and back foot on toes, and loop the band under the front foot holding the ends at shoulder height.
2. Lower into a split squat and stop when the front thigh is parallel to the floor; hold that position.
3. Keep your torso upright, squeeze the front glute, and maintain steady tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis square, core braced, maintain vertical front shin and even breathing

Rest intervals: Improves core stability and scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold the band overhead with straight arms while lifting shoulders and legs into a hollow position.
2. Rock slowly back and forth using your core while keeping your lower back pressed to the floor.
3. Simultaneously pull the band apart to shoulder width, squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Return the arms together as you continue the hollow rock and maintain tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed to mat and control the band pull apart

Rest intervals: Strengthens anti rotation core control and upright posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height to your side and stand with feet close together.
2. Hold the band with both hands at your chest and step away to create tension.
3. Brace your core and press your hands straight out, keeping shoulders square to the anchor.
4. Pull your hands back to your chest with control while maintaining tension.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and maintain a tall spine as you extend the band

Rest intervals: Develops rotational power and explosive core strength
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band high to one side and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grip the band with both hands overhead and rotate your torso away from the anchor.
3. Explode down and across your body toward the opposite hip while driving your hips and pulling the band.
4. Control the return to the start position and reset for the next rep.
Steps to perform: Rotate from the hips and control the band on the return

Rest intervals: Builds lower abdominal and hip flexor strength under load
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at the top of your mat and loop it around both feet while lying on your back.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and keep your legs straight and together.
3. Lift your legs toward the ceiling against the band's tension until your hips reach about 90 degrees.
4. Slowly lower your legs back toward the floor while maintaining core tension.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs tucked and lower slowly with controlled breathing

Rest intervals: Improves lateral core stability while strengthening upper back and lats
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under your bottom foot and hold the free end in your top hand while setting into a side plank on your bottom forearm.
2. Press hips up to form a straight line from head to heels and tighten your core.
3. Pull the band toward your ribcage, bending the elbow and squeezing the shoulder blade, then control the band back out.
4. Lower hips to reset or switch sides after desired reps.
Steps to perform: Stack hips keep a straight line and row with scapular control

Rest intervals: Enhances lumbar pelvic stability and coordinated contralateral limb control
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around the arch of one foot and hold the other end with the opposite hand while on all fours.
2. Keep a neutral spine and engage your core.
3. Extend the banded arm forward and the banded leg back until they are parallel to the floor.
4. Return both limbs under control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and extend limbs slowly with control

Rest intervals: Increases oblique endurance and trunk rotational control during movement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with the band looped around both feet and hold the band ends lightly by your head.
2. Lift your shoulders off the mat and draw one knee toward your chest while twisting to bring the opposite elbow toward that knee against band tension.
3. Switch sides in a controlled pedaling motion, keeping tension on the band throughout.
Steps to perform: Tuck your chin and brace your core while rotating slowly from the torso

Rest intervals: Builds strong spinal flexion strength and abdominal muscle recruitment
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a heavy resistance band high and kneel facing the anchor.
2. Hold the band ends beside your head with elbows bent.
3. Crunch your torso down and bring your elbows toward your knees.
4. Slowly return to an upright kneel against the band's resistance.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and posteriorly tilt the pelvis and exhale on effort
MET value: Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain, Hypertension

Rest intervals: Challenges core stability while improving shoulder girdle coordination and anti rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Secure a band at one side of your mat and assume a high plank with the nearest hand by the band.
2. Reach the opposite hand under your body and grab the band handle.
3. Pull the band across to the other side while keeping hips level and core tight.
4. Return the hand under control and repeat, switching sides after each rep.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and shoulders stacked while pulling slowly without rotating

Rest intervals: Promotes deep core bracing and coordinated limb control under high tension
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop a band around both feet, holding the ends overhead.
2. Bend knees to 90 degrees and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly extend one leg toward the floor while lowering the opposite arm behind your head against the band's tension.
4. Pull both limbs back to the start and alternate sides with controlled movement.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into floor and move limbs slowly with steady breathing

Rest intervals: Builds explosive power and unilateral shoulder and core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, place the band under one foot, and hold the band in the same-side hand between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips, keep your back flat, and let your arm hang straight.
3. Explosively extend hips and knees while pulling the band upward, leading with a high elbow.
4. Punch the hand overhead with the arm extended, stand tall, then lower the band with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips and maintain a neutral spine while controlling the overhead pull
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Sarcopenia, Hyperthyroidism

Rest intervals: Increases total body strength and metabolic conditioning
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the handles at shoulder height.
2. Brace your core and squat down by pushing hips back until thighs are at least parallel.
3. Drive up through your heels, extend your hips, and press the band overhead in one fluid motion.
4. Lower the band back to your shoulders with control and reset for the next rep.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up, knees tracking toes, and exhale as you press overhead

Rest intervals: Strengthens the posterior chain and hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width over the band and hold the ends with both hands in front of your hips.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight knee bend, push your hips back, and keep your back flat as you lower the hands.
3. Drive your hips forward, squeeze your glutes, and pull the band to a standing position.
4. Lower back down by hinging at the hips with control while maintaining tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Push hips back, keep a flat back, and drive through heels with steady breath

Rest intervals: Enhances full body strength, coordination, and muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet shoulder-width and hold the handles at your sides.
2. Lower into a squat while keeping your chest up and hands near knee level.
3. Rise and curl the handles to shoulder height.
4. Press the handles overhead, then lower to the start.
Steps to perform: Maintain a braced core, control each transition, and avoid rounding the lower back

Rest intervals: Improves single leg strength and shoulder stability while challenging core control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of the band with feet hip-width and hold the handles at shoulder level.
2. Step one foot back and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees form about 90 degrees.
3. Push through the front heel to stand while pressing the handles overhead.
4. Lower the handles to shoulders and repeat on the other leg.
Steps to perform: Step back with a tall torso, keep front knee aligned, and exhale on press

Rest intervals: Develops shoulder stability, core strength, and coordinated movement patterns
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band behind you and loop it around your hips, then assume a bear crawl position.
2. Tuck toes under and lift your knees an inch off the floor while keeping a flat back.
3. Move your right hand and left foot forward together while maintaining band tension.
4. Alternate limbs and continue crawling forward with hips level.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and drive core stability with slow controlled steps

Rest intervals: Builds lower body strength while promoting upper back and shoulder engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ends with palms facing your body at thigh level.
2. Bend at the hips and knees to lower into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Drive up through your heels and pull the band upward by leading with your elbows to chest height.
4. Lower the hands back to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Maintain chest up and knees tracking toes during squat and row

Rest intervals: Enhances single leg power, balance, and functional stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a stable step with the band looped under the stepping foot and hold the ends at shoulder level.
2. Step up onto the platform with the banded foot, driving through the heel to straighten the leg.
3. Lift the trailing knee to hip height and pause to balance while keeping tension in the band.
4. Step back down with control and repeat on the same side.
Steps to perform: Drive through the heel and fully extend the hip pause to control balance

Rest intervals: Improves posterior chain strength and hip hinge control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width apart and place the band across your upper back, holding the ends at the shoulders.
2. Hinge at the hips with a soft bend in the knees and push your hips back until your torso is about parallel to the floor.
3. Contract your glutes and drive your hips forward to return to standing while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and soft knees

Rest intervals: Simultaneously strengthens lower body and upper back to support better posture
Health benefit:
1. Place a resistance band under both feet and hold the ends with palms facing each other at chest level.
2. Sit back onto a chair with chest lifted and light tension on the band.
3. Stand up by driving through the heels and pull the band toward your ribs, squeezing the shoulder blades.
4. Lower the handles to the start position and repeat smoothly.
Steps to perform: Sit back into the chair keeping chest lifted and retract shoulders when rowing

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder endurance and movement coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a resistance band end in each hand with slight tension.
2. Raise hands to chin level with elbows bent and core engaged.
3. Punch one hand forward, extending the arm while the band resists, then retract to chin.
4. Alternate punches quickly and maintain controlled tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up core braced and shoulders relaxed

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and unilateral power development
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place the band under both feet, holding an end in each hand with knees slightly bent.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips with a neutral spine and create tension in the band.
3. Drive one hand down and the other up to produce an alternating wave motion from the shoulders.
4. Continue alternating arms at a steady tempo while keeping the core braced.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly from hips keep a neutral spine and control each wave

Rest intervals: Increases explosive upper body power and fast-twitch muscle recruitment
Health benefit:
1. Secure a resistance band across your upper back and hold the ends under your hands in a high-plank.
2. Brace your core and position hands shoulder-width beneath your shoulders.
3. Lower your chest toward the floor with control.
4. Explode upward, pushing through your hands against the band, land softly, and control the descent.
Steps to perform: Land softly absorb force with elbows tracking under shoulders

Rest intervals: Improves agility and quickness through rapid coordinated upper body movement
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band behind you at chest height and hold an end in each hand with slight tension.
2. Stand with feet hip-width and bring your hands to a boxing guard.
3. Throw quick alternating punches, extending the arm and rotating the torso against the band.
4. Return hands to guard after each punch and maintain a fast continuous rhythm.
Steps to perform: Stay upright keep chin tucked and breathe rhythmically

Rest intervals: Develops pressing power and chest muscle activation
Health benefit:
1. Secure a resistance band to a sturdy anchor at chest height and hold the handles with both hands.
2. Stand facing away or kneel with the band across your chest and elbows bent at 90 degrees.
3. Explosively press your hands forward until your arms are fully extended.
4. Control the band on the return to the start position and repeat with power.
Steps to perform: Control the return keep shoulder blades retracted and core tight

Rest intervals: Builds posterior chain explosiveness and scapular retraction strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold handles with palms facing each other.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips, keep chest up, and brace your core.
3. Explosively pull both handles toward your ribs by driving elbows back and squeezing shoulder blades.
4. Slowly extend arms to the start position and prepare the next explosive rep.
Steps to perform: Brace core and lead with scapula retraction before each explosive pull

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder girdle endurance and rear delt activation
Health benefit:
1. Hold the band in front of you at shoulder height with arms extended and palms down.
2. Rapidly pull your hands apart by retracting shoulder blades until the band reaches your chest level.
3. Control the band back to the start and immediately perform the next fast repetition.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and squeeze shoulder blades together to avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral pulling speed and coordination under resistance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at waist height and grab handles with both hands, palms facing each other.
2. Hinge at the hips and take a staggered stance for stability.
3. Quickly pull one handle toward your hip while the other arm stays extended, then immediately switch sides.
4. Maintain a fast rhythm and control the returning arm before each alternate pull.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and control the return of each alternating row

Rest intervals: Increases time under tension for chest and triceps endurance
Health benefit:
1. Chest Press Pulses: Stand with feet hip-width apart and loop the band behind your upper back, holding handles at chest level.
2. Press both hands forward until arms are almost fully extended.
3. Pulse forward with small, quick movements while keeping the band tight.
4. Return hands to chest level under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and back, exhale on each press pulse

Rest intervals: Enhances triceps power and rapid elbow extension control
Health benefit:
1. Speed Tricep Extensions: Anchor the band overhead and face away, holding a handle in each hand with elbows bent by your ears.
2. Extend both forearms quickly downward until arms are straight.
3. Return to the starting bent-elbow position with control.
4. Repeat at a fast, controlled tempo while keeping the elbows stationary.
Steps to perform: Tuck elbows close to ribcage and control the band on the return

Rest intervals: Increases lower body power and explosive leg strength
Health benefit:
1. Continuous Jump Squat: Place the band above your knees and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend hips and knees to lower into a squat until thighs are near parallel to the floor.
3. Explode upward into a controlled jump while keeping knees tracking over toes.
4. Land softly into the squat and continue jumping without pause.
Steps to perform: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and chest lifted

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral leg strength and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a staggered lunge with a loop band secured under the front foot and held at hip level.
2. Lower into a deep lunge while keeping steady band tension.
3. Explode upward, switch legs mid-air, and control the band.
4. Land softly into the opposite lunge and reset.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and front knee aligned over ankle on each landing

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor power and running stride mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Loop a band around your waist and anchor it firmly behind you.
2. Stand tall with a slight forward lean and keep the band taut.
3. Drive one knee up explosively against the band while pumping the opposite arm.
4. Alternate knees rapidly while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Drive knees up while keeping pelvis neutral and posture tall

Rest intervals: Boosts lateral agility and hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a mini loop band around both ankles and stand on one leg.
2. Bend slightly at the hips and push off laterally into a side bound.
3. Land softly on the opposite leg with the band resisting inward travel.
4. Repeat side-to-side quickly while keeping chest up and controlled movement.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and hinge slightly while controlling lateral landings
MET value: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, Sarcopenia, Hypothyroidism

Rest intervals: Enhances explosive coordination and plyometric power
Health benefit:
1. Loop the resistance band around your hips and hold the ends at your sides.
2. Step slightly forward on one foot and drive the opposite knee upward explosively.
3. Push off forcefully and skip forward, extending the hip against the band tension.
4. Land softly on the same foot and repeat the skip rhythmically.
Steps to perform: Explode upward while maintaining tall posture and soft controlled landings
MET value: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, Sarcopenia, Hypothyroidism

Rest intervals: Develops lateral power and single leg control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band to a low point at your side and loop the free end around your hips.
2. Stand on the outside foot with a slight knee bend facing perpendicular to the anchor.
3. Push laterally away from the anchor into a bound, driving through the outside hip.
4. Land softly on the opposite foot and immediately prepare to bound back.
Steps to perform: Land softly with knees tracking toes and hips level
MET value: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, Sarcopenia, Hypothyroidism

Rest intervals: Increases horizontal force production and jump distance
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band snugly around your hips and secure the other end behind you to a fixed anchor.
2. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge slightly at the hips to load the glutes.
3. Explode forward into a broad jump, driving hips and swinging arms against the band resistance.
4. Land softly on both feet, absorb the impact, and reset for the next jump.
Steps to perform: Push through hips land softly with knees aligned over toes
MET value: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, Sarcopenia, Hypothyroidism

Rest intervals: Improves foot speed and neuromuscular coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with a looped band around your ankles in an athletic low stance.
2. Step both feet quickly outward and then immediately step both feet inward.
3. Keep knees bent and maintain constant band tension.
4. Move feet rapidly with light ground contact.
Steps to perform: Stay tall keep core braced and move feet with controlled rhythm

Rest intervals: Enhances rapid lower body force and muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends at your shoulders.
2. Drop into a shallow squat quickly while keeping tension in the band.
3. Explode upward as fast as possible, extending hips and knees.
4. Absorb the landing and immediately repeat with controlled form.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine hinge hips and control the descent

Rest intervals: Boosts unilateral leg power and stepping speed
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your thighs just above the knees and face a sturdy step.
2. Step one foot onto the step and press through the front heel to stand up sharply against the band.
3. Lower the trailing foot back to the floor with control.
4. Keep torso upright and the band taut as you alternate or repeat.
Steps to perform: Step up through heel keep pelvis level and avoid leaning forward

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and dynamic hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your feet and assume a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Drive your right knee diagonally toward your left elbow, pulling against the band's resistance.
3. Return the right foot to plank and immediately drive the left knee toward the right elbow.
4. Alternate sides quickly while keeping hips stable and core tight.
Steps to perform: Keep hips low and core braced

Rest intervals: Builds explosive core strength and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band above your ankles and assume a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Jump your feet wide and then back together quickly against the band's resistance.
3. Land softly and keep hips level while maintaining a firm core.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and control movements
MET value: Hypertension, Obesity, Osteoporosis, Hypothyroidism, Hyperthyroidism, Coronary Artery Disease

Rest intervals: Improves abdominal power and hip flexor engagement
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under your feet and lie on your back with knees bent and hands holding the band ends.
2. Explosively sit up and drive your right elbow toward your left knee while extending your left leg.
3. Control the descent back to the start while keeping tension on the band.
4. Repeat on the opposite side and alternate sides in a fast, controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Lead with chest and keep neck long

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and trunk power
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low to your side and grasp it with both hands, feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Rotate your torso and lift your hands across your body toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Chop the band down and across your body toward the opposite hip with a quick, controlled motion.
4. Return to the start swiftly and repeat the movement.
Steps to perform: Rotate from hips and keep ribs stacked over pelvis

Rest intervals: Strengthens midline abdominal muscles and hip flexors
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around your feet and hold the ends overhead while lying flat.
2. Engage your core and lift your torso and legs simultaneously into a V position.
3. Reach your hands toward your feet against the band's resistance and hold briefly.
4. Lower with control while maintaining tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Exhale on each lift and keep lower back tucked

Rest intervals: Improves trunk flexion control and abdominal endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees pulled toward your chest and loop the band around your feet.
2. Hold the band ends and pull to create tension as you curl your shoulders toward your knees.
3. Squeeze into a tight cocoon at the top while keeping the band taut.
4. Lower back down slowly while keeping the knees hugged and the band engaged.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and exhale as you curl

Rest intervals: Boosts oblique endurance and rotational core stability
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, feet flat, and loop the band around your feet while holding the ends.
2. Lean back slightly, lift your feet a few inches, and brace your core.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, pulling the band across your body toward your right hip.
4. Rotate explosively to the left, pulling the band across and control back to center.
Steps to perform: Lead rotation with the torso keep spine neutral and controlled

Rest intervals: Targets lower abdominal strength and hip flexor coordination
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and loop the band around the soles of your feet while holding the ends behind your hips.
2. Lean back slightly and brace your core.
3. Pull your knees toward your chest against the band's resistance, then extend your legs back to the start with control.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed to seat and exhale on the tuck

Rest intervals: Improves lateral core strength and standing trunk stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and hold the handle in the top hand with your side facing the anchor.
2. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and place your free hand behind your head.
3. Exhale and bend sideways, crunching your ribs toward your hip while pulling the band down.
4. Return to the start slowly and maintain core tension throughout the movement.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and perform slow controlled crunches with steady breathing

Rest intervals: Develops anterior core endurance and whole body tension control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop a light resistance band around the soles of your feet, holding the ends overhead.
2. Draw your ribs down and lift your shoulders and legs off the floor into a hollow shape.
3. Rock gently between your shoulders and hips using your core, keeping the band taut.
4. Keep small controlled motions and maintain the hollow position throughout each rep.
Steps to perform: Maintain posterior pelvic tilt and steady exhale while rocking
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Rest intervals: Builds full body strength and explosiveness
Health benefit:
1. Stand on a looped band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends at chest height against your upper back.
2. Drop into a squat and place hands on the floor, then jump or step feet back into a plank while keeping band tension.
3. Lower your chest all the way to the floor in one smooth motion.
4. Push back to plank, jump feet forward, stand, and drive through feet to return to standing while controlling the band.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders packed and core braced when lowering to the floor

Rest intervals: Improves lower body endurance and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band just above your knees and stand with feet together.
2. Sit back into a shallow squat with chest up and core braced.
3. Jump feet wide into a squat while pressing knees outward against the band.
4. Jump feet back together to the start and repeat with consistent band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and knees tracking over toes during each squat

Rest intervals: Enhances leg power and movement coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and a looped band just above your knees.
2. Push hips back and lower into a shallow squat, keeping tension on the band.
3. Explode upward into a small vertical hop while driving knees slightly outward.
4. Land softly into the squat and repeat with a controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Control descent, land softly with hips back and knees aligned

Rest intervals: Develops core stability and shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Place a mini band around your upper thighs and get into a bear crawl position on hands and toes with hips low.
2. Reach forward with one hand and drive the opposite foot forward quickly while keeping hips stable.
3. Maintain constant tension on the band and take quick, short steps to move forward.
4. Stay low and keep a fast cadence throughout the crawl.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level, core braced, and hands firm as you drive forward

Rest intervals: Combines lower and upper body power with cardiovascular conditioning
Health benefit:
1. Stand on a resistance band with feet hip-width and hold the handles at shoulder height.
2. Drop into a quick squat by bending the knees and pushing the hips back.
3. Explode upward through the hips and press the handles overhead in one fluid motion.
4. Lower the band back to shoulder height under control and repeat at a brisk tempo.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels, extend hips powerfully and exhale on the press
