Rest intervals: Increases muscular endurance and whole-body movement efficiency
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of a looped resistance band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Hinge at the hips, bend knees, and place hands on the floor in front of your feet.
3. Step both feet back into a plank while keeping tension on the band.
4. Step feet forward to hands, drive through heels to stand, and return the band to shoulder height.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up hips back and lower with control of the band

Rest intervals: Builds explosive strength and improves power transfer between limbs
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet hip-width and grasp the ends with palms facing you.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend knees slightly to prepare the pull.
3. Explosively extend hips and shrug to bring the band handles to chest level in a clean.
4. Press the handles overhead until arms lock, then lower under control.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels and maintain neutral spine while controlling band pull
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Sarcopenia, Metabolic Syndrome

Rest intervals: Improves aerobic fitness with low-impact joint-friendly movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand on a long resistance band with feet hip-width and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Keep an upright posture and brace your core.
3. Lift one knee toward hip level while maintaining band tension.
4. Lower the foot and repeat with the opposite knee in a steady march.
Steps to perform: Stand tall engage core and lift each knee under band tension with control

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral agility and hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around both ankles and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Drop into a shallow squat and keep tension on the band.
3. Take a quick lateral step to the right, then bring the left foot to meet it.
4. Continue shuffling side to side while maintaining the squat and band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up knees soft and step wide to protect hips under resistance

Rest intervals: Develops coordination while strengthening upper body endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of the resistance band with feet hip-width apart and hold the handles at shoulder height.
2. Step your right foot to the right, then bring the left foot to meet it in a step-touch.
3. Press the handles overhead as you step outward.
4. Repeat the step-touch and press to the opposite side while keeping the band taut.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright posture press band slowly and exhale on the press

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and rotator cuff flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Grasp the band with a narrow overhand grip and hold it in front of your hips with arms straight.
2. Keep your arms straight and lift the band up and over your head toward your upper back.
3. Allow the band to travel down toward your lower back while maintaining the narrow grip.
4. Reverse the motion slowly to return the band to the front of your hips.
Steps to perform: Keep a tall chest and packed shoulder blades as you slowly glide arms back

Rest intervals: Enhances scapular upward rotation and serratus anterior activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width and loop the band behind your upper back, holding an end in each hand.
2. Place forearms and palms flat on the wall at shoulder height with elbows slightly bent.
3. Slide your arms upward on the wall while actively pushing your shoulder blades forward to protract the serratus.
4. Reverse the motion slowly to the start while maintaining tension in the band.
Steps to perform: Press evenly through forearms and draw ribs down to emphasize scapular upward rotation

Exercise Name: Banded Face Pull with External Rotation
Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior shoulder and external rotators for better shoulder posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at head height and grasp the ends with both hands, stepping back to create tension.
2. Pull the band toward your face with elbows high and out, leading with the elbows.
3. Rotate your hands outward so the backs of the hands move toward your ears and squeeze the shoulder blades.
4. Extend the arms forward slowly to return to start while keeping consistent band tension.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulder blades and lead with elbows while externally rotating with slow control

Rest intervals: Improves overhead flexibility and lat muscle extensibility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead and grasp an end with the hand on the target side, stepping forward to create upward pull.
2. Reach the arm overhead and straighten it while gently leaning away from the anchor to load the lat.
3. Maintain a long spine and steady breathing while holding the distracted position.
4. Return to an upright stance and release the band tension in a controlled manner.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and neutral spine as you pull lats long overhead with control

Rest intervals: Increases cervical mobility and neck muscular control
Health benefit:
1. Position the band for Banded Neck Tilt (Loaded) by anchoring it at shoulder height and looping it around your forehead.
2. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold the band ends lightly.
3. Tilt your head slowly toward one shoulder against the band's resistance.
4. Return to center under control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral neck alignment and move slowly without compressing cervical vertebrae

Rest intervals: Enhances scapular control and coordinated shoulder movement
Health benefit:
1. Attach the band for Scapular CARs to a chest-height anchor and hold the ends with arms extended.
2. Stand tall with straight arms and a relaxed neck.
3. Move the scapula through protraction, upward rotation, elevation, retraction, and depression in one smooth arc.
4. Reverse the arc slowly and repeat for the other direction.
Steps to perform: Move slowly and control scapular movement with a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Promotes anterior shoulder flexibility and chest muscle lengthening
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band for Banded Chest Opener (Dynamic) behind you at chest height and hold an end in each hand.
2. Step forward to create tension and stand tall.
3. Pull your hands back while squeezing the shoulder blades and opening the chest.
4. Return forward under control and repeat the motion dynamically.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and retract shoulder blades slightly as you open the chest

Rest intervals: Improves pectoral mobility and unilateral shoulder range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Anchor band at shoulder height to a stable point.
2. Grasp the band with one hand and step forward until you feel tension behind the shoulder.
3. Rotate your torso away and pull the elbow slightly back while keeping the shoulder down.
4. Hold the end range then slowly step forward to release tension.
Steps to perform: Stabilize the scapula and avoid elbow hyperextension while breathing deeply

Rest intervals: Restores thoracic mobility and encourages upright spinal posture
Health benefit:
1. Anchor band at chest height behind you.
2. Hold the band with both hands and place it across your upper back while kneeling or standing.
3. Hinge at the mid-back and lean back over the band to extend the thoracic spine.
4. Pause in extension then return to an upright position with control.
Steps to perform: Keep chin tucked, extend thoracic spine over band while maintaining lumbar neutrality

Rest intervals: Builds upper back endurance and scapular upward rotation strength
Health benefit:
1. Anchor band low behind you and lie face down on a bench or the floor.
2. Grasp the band with thumbs up and extend your arms overhead into a Y.
3. Pull the band until your arms reach end range and your shoulder blades lift.
4. Hold the end-range position then lower your arms slowly.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulder blades down and together, lift with controlled motion and exhale

Rest intervals: Improves hip internal and external rotation mobility and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor in a 90/90 position with both knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Place a resistance band around your thighs just above the knees and create light lateral tension.
3. Drive the front hip upward and rotate your torso to switch legs, moving the back leg to the front.
4. Control the return to the start and repeat for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked over hips and move with slow controlled hip rotation

Rest intervals: Improves ankle joint mobility and range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a loop band to a low, sturdy point and loop the other end around your ankle above the ankle bones.
2. Sit or lie so the band pulls your ankle away from the anchor to create steady longitudinal tension.
3. Maintain the distraction and move the ankle through slow dorsiflexion, plantarflexion, or small circles.
Steps to perform: Anchor band securely and relax foot while breathing to allow gentle joint separation

Rest intervals: Enhances quadriceps eccentric control and knee extension mobility
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on a pad with knees hip-width apart and secure a resistance band overhead so it reaches behind your upper back.
2. Hold the band or grips and keep a tall chest with your quads engaged.
3. Slowly lean back from the knees, allowing the band to assist and control the descent.
4. Drive through the knees and contract the quads to return to the upright start position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips forward and core braced to control backward lean

Rest intervals: Increases hip external rotation mobility and gluteal muscle flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor and loop the band around the front foot, holding the band ends.
2. Position the front shin across the mat and extend the back leg straight behind you.
3. Gently pull the band to draw the front knee toward your chest without forcing it.
4. Hold the position for the desired time.
Steps to perform: Square hips to front and lengthen spine before easing into stretch

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring control and active hip flexion range
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the arch of the working foot, holding the band ends by your hips.
2. Keep the non-working leg bent with the foot flat and maintain a neutral spine.
3. Lift the working leg straight against the band's resistance to hip height with control.
4. Lower the leg slowly to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed to floor and lift with hip flexors controlled

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip strength and single-leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with the band looped under the front foot and hold the band ends at chest level.
2. Step the other leg wide and shift your weight onto the front leg.
3. Sit back and down into a deep side squat on the front leg, using the band for balance and assistance.
4. Drive through the front foot and use the band to help return to standing.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and sit back with weight through the working heel

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip abductors and improves pelvic control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked and knees bent about 90°, and loop the band just above both knees.
2. Keep feet together and drive the top knee upward against the band's resistance to your end range.
3. Hold the end-range position firmly without rotating the pelvis.
4. Slowly lower the knee back to start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and pelvis still breathe and lift with glute control

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic mobility and dynamic hip flexor activation
Health benefit:
1. Place a looped band under the lead foot and hold the band ends at chest level.
2. Step forward into a deep lunge while lowering the same-side elbow toward the lead foot.
3. Drive through the front heel and pull upward on the band as you push back to standing.
4. Continue stepping forward with alternating lunges while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and brace core as lead knee tracks over toes

Rest intervals: Promotes joint awareness and controlled multi-planar hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a looped band low and secure the band around the ankle of the moving leg while standing tall.
2. Shift weight onto the support leg and lift the banded knee slightly forward with a long spine.
3. Slowly trace a large controlled circle with the knee, moving through flexion, external rotation, extension, and internal rotation against the band's resistance.
4. Reverse the circle back to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Move slowly through full hip range keeping pelvis stable and torso upright

Rest intervals: Enhances hip abduction range and dynamic neuromuscular coordination
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band to a low fixed point and loop the other end around the ankle of the moving leg.
2. Stand sideways to the anchor with feet hip-width and hold onto a support for balance.
3. Swing the banded leg across your body, then drive it out to the side in a controlled motion.
4. Keep a slight bend in the standing knee and maintain rhythmic, controlled swings.
Steps to perform: Control swing with hip drive and soft core keep spine neutral

Rest intervals: Enhances spinal mobility and core activation
Health benefit:
1. Loop a light band across your upper back and hold the ends under your palms on the mat.
2. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
3. Inhale, drop your belly, lift your chest and tailbone to arch the back with band tension.
4. Exhale, round your spine, tuck your chin and tailbone, and pull the band ends gently as you move.
Steps to perform: Move slowly through the spine keeping pelvis neutral and neck aligned

Rest intervals: Improves anti-rotation core stability and overhead shoulder control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor holding the band with both hands at your sternum.
2. Step away to create tension and brace your core to resist rotation.
3. Press the band straight out in front of you, then continue pressing it
Steps to perform: Brace your core to resist rotation and keep shoulders packed during the press and raise

Rest intervals: Increases thoracic mobility and rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and assume a half-kneeling position perpendicular to the anchor.
2. Grasp the band with both hands at chest level and extend your arms slightly.
3. Rotate your thoracic spine away from the anchor while keeping your hips square.
4. Return to center under control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and spine neutral rotating from the thoracic spine with control

Rest intervals: Develops hamstring flexibility while improving shoulder mobility and core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and secure one end of the band under your front foot while holding the other end overhead.
2. Hinge at the hips and push your hips back while keeping the arm with the band straight overhead.
3. Rotate your torso and reach the free hand toward the opposite foot while keeping the overhead arm stable.
4. Reverse the motion to stand tall and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and controlled descent maintaining shoulder stability

Rest intervals: Promotes controlled spinal flexion and hamstring mobility
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band overhead and hold it with both hands behind your neck while standing with feet hip-width apart.
2. Tuck your chin and slowly round your upper back one vertebra at a time.
3. Continue to curl down toward your toes while slightly bending the knees and using the band to control the descent.
4. Sequentially extend the spine back to standing and repeat for reps.
Steps to perform: Curl slowly segmenting the spine keep knees soft and breathe throughout

Rest intervals: Builds lateral core strength while enhancing thoracic rotation
Health benefit:
1. Position body in a side plank with feet stacked and forearm planted, and loop a resistance band around the top wrist.
2. Reach the top arm straight overhead to create steady tension on the band.
3. Thread the top arm under your torso while keeping hips lifted and the band taut.
4. Reverse the motion to return the arm overhead with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and level as you thread under move slowly

Rest intervals: Enhances contralateral stability and glute activation
Health benefit:
1. Get on hands and knees and loop a resistance band from your right hand to your left foot.
2. Extend the right arm forward and the left leg back until they form a straight line and the band is taut.
3. Pause with a braced core and hips square.
4. Return both limbs to the start with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine and steady breath as you extend opposite arm and leg

Rest intervals: Strengthens deep core muscles and pelvic control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and loop a band across your hips with the ends anchored under both feet.
2. Tilt your pelvis posteriorly to flatten the lower back into the floor and press gently against the band.
3. Hold briefly, then slowly release to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Posteriorly tilt pelvis using core keeping lower back gently pressed to the floor

Rest intervals: Improves lateral trunk mobility and oblique muscle engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width, step the band under both feet and hold ends with arms extended overhead.
2. Tighten core and keep chest tall.
3. Bend toward one side, lowering the torso while keeping arms overhead and the band taut.
4. Return to center by engaging the opposite oblique and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and ribs stacked hinge laterally without collapsing through the ribcage

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder endurance while activating the posterior chain dynamically
Health benefit:
1. Place a loop band around your wrists and get into a bear plank with knees hovering and hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine.
3. Push hips up and back into Down Dog, straightening the legs as tolerated and keeping the band taut.
4. Lower hips back into bear plank with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace core move hips up with control avoid letting lower back sag

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and lower body strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the band ends overhead with a wide grip and locked arms.
2. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a deep squat while keeping the band overhead and chest upright.
3. Drive through heels to stand, pressing the band overhead and maintaining tension.
4. Repeat with controlled depth and band tension for each rep.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and ribs down, drive knees out

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under the front foot and hold the ends with both hands while stepping into a deep lunge.
2. Place the forearm inside the front thigh and press the hips forward.
3. Rotate the torso toward the front leg and reach the top arm up while pulling the band overhead.
4. Lower the hands to the ground, return the band to start, and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain a braced core and hinge from hips while controlling band tension

Rest intervals: Increases hamstring flexibility and spinal extension control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of the band and hold the ends, hinge at the hips and walk your hands forward into a plank while keeping the band taut.
2. Lower the hips and chest toward the floor, then press the chest up into a cobra while pulling the band slightly overhead.
3. Walk your hands back toward your feet and roll up to standing while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down away from ears and move slowly into extension

Rest intervals: Builds full body coordination and core stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent, loop the band under the bent foot, and hold the band in the same-side hand extended overhead.
2. Roll onto the opposite forearm, then press up onto the hand while keeping the band arm vertical and taut.
3. Drive the hips up into a bridge and sweep the straight leg back into a kneeling lunge while holding the band overhead.
4. Stand up from the lunge while keeping the arm locked and band tension steady.
Steps to perform: Maintain a straight wrist and track elbow under the weight

Rest intervals: Promotes squat depth while improving upper back mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and loop a resistance band under both feet while holding the ends at chest level behind your upper back.
2. Descend into a deep squat with chest tall and elbows pressing against the band to maintain tension.
3. Drive through one heel and rotate your thoracic spine, lifting that elbow toward the ceiling while keeping squat depth and band tension.
4. Return to center, reset your chest, and repeat the rotation to the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep heels planted spine long rotate thoracic spine slowly with control

Rest intervals: Improves single leg balance and posterior chain strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with a resistance band under that foot and hold the free end with both hands at hip height.
2. Hinge at the hips with a soft knee and lower the band toward the floor while extending the non-stance leg back into a straight line.
3. Rotate your torso toward the standing side and open into the airplane position, extending the band away from the body.
4. Reverse the rotation and hinge to stand tall while controlling the band, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a neutral spine and soft standing knee

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic mobility and hip extensor strength
Health benefit:
1. Sit with knees bent, loop a band above your knees, place hands behind you, and lift hips into a crab position.
2. Press your knees outward against the band to engage your hips and glutes while keeping hips lifted.
3. Reach the opposite arm overhead and rotate your chest toward the raised arm, then return to center and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and glutes squeezed preventing knees from collapsing

Rest intervals: Enhances hamstring and calf flexibility while reinforcing squat mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the center of the band with feet hip-width and hold both ends at shoulder height.
2. Sit hips back and lower into a squat while keeping the band taut and chest lifted.
3. Drive through your heels to rise while pulling the band upward and extending your hips.
4. Return to the squat with control and maintain band tension.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and pull band with control as you hinge and stand

Rest intervals: Increases hip mobility and lateral stability through dynamic loading
Health benefit:
1. Stand with the band looped under your front foot and hold the ends with both hands at chest level.
2. Step the other foot back and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Reach your arms laterally toward the front foot while keeping the band taut.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and bring your arms back to center.
Steps to perform: Brace core keep hips square and control reach without twisting the torso

Rest intervals: Improves balance and hip flexor activation during single leg control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot on the middle of the band and hold the ends at your hips.
2. Brace your core and lift the opposite knee toward your chest against the band tension.
3. Pause briefly at the top while maintaining balance and steady band resistance.
4. Lower the knee under control and repeat before switching legs.
Steps to perform: Stand tall keep hips level and drive knee with controlled hip flexion

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic mobility and scapular movement
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band to a sturdy point at chest height.
2. Grasp the band with both hands and step forward to create light tension.
3. Pull your hands apart while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Hold the position and breathe evenly.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and scapulae pinched together while controlling band tension

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder and triceps flexibility for improved overhead reach
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band overhead.
2. Grasp one end with the working hand and bend that elbow so the hand reaches behind your head.
3. Use the other hand to pull the band gently to increase the stretch on the bent arm.
4. Hold the position and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs tucked and core engaged to avoid lower back arch during overhead band pull

Rest intervals: Improves pectoral flexibility and anterior shoulder openness for better posture
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around a sturdy anchor in a doorway at chest height.
2. Hold one end in each hand and step forward into the doorway with a staggered stance.
3. Raise your arms to shoulder height and press them back to open the chest.
4. Hold the stretch and breathe steadily.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral and press chest forward gently without shrugging shoulders

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder internal rotator flexibility and range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band at waist height behind you and hold it in the hand of the stretched arm with the palm facing your body.
2. Step forward to create light tension and bend your elbow to about 90 degrees.
3. Externally rotate your shoulder by moving your hand away from your body until you feel a stretch in the front of the shoulder.
4. Hold the position for the chosen duration and slowly return to the start.
Steps to perform: Externally rotate humerus slightly and keep shoulder blade stabilized against ribcage

Rest intervals: Improves latissimus dorsi flexibility and overhead reaching ability
Health benefit:
1. Kneel facing an anchor and grasp a resistance band overhead with both hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Sit back slightly on your heels and extend your arms overhead to create tension in the band.
3. Hinge forward at the hips while reaching your arms forward, then return to the upright kneel to perform a controlled pulse.
4. Repeat the forward-and-back motion for the desired number of repetitions while keeping steady breathing.
Steps to perform: Breathe rhythmically and move slowly keeping spine long and ribs down

Rest intervals: Improves posterior shoulder flexibility and horizontal adduction range
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band at shoulder height on the opposite side and grab the band with the working hand.
2. Step away to create tension and bring your arm across your chest with a slight bend in the elbow.
3. Pull the band gently across your body to apply traction to the deltoid, hold briefly, and then release slowly.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and avoid rounding shoulders

Rest intervals: Increases cervical extension mobility and upper neck muscle flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at shoulder height behind you and loop it around the back of your head.
2. Stand tall and tuck your chin slightly.
3. Nod your head forward slowly against light resistance until you feel a gentle stretch in the back of the neck.
4. Hold the stretch and then return to the starting position slowly.
Steps to perform: Tuck chin gently and lengthen through the back of the neck

Rest intervals: Enhances biceps and anterior shoulder tissue flexibility for improved elbow extension
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low behind you and grasp the end with the hand to be stretched behind your back.
2. Stand tall and rotate your palm upward.
3. Step forward slowly to create tension and reach your hand backward to lengthen the biceps.
4. Hold the stretch and then return to the starting position slowly.
Steps to perform: Keep chest open and scapula depressed to avoid shoulder impingement

Rest intervals: Improves scapular mobility and upper back flexibility through rhomboid stretching
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band in front at chest height and hold the ends with both hands.
2. Sit or stand tall and extend both arms forward to create light tension.
3. Cross one arm over the other while pulling the band to draw your shoulder blades apart.
4. Hold the stretch and then return to the starting position slowly.
Steps to perform: Pull shoulder blades apart gently avoid shrugging

Rest intervals: Improves upper cervical mobility and shoulder elevation range
Health benefit:
1. Anchor one end of the resistance band at chest height behind you and grasp the free end with the hand on the side you want to stretch.
2. Sit or stand upright and rotate your head diagonally down toward your armpit on the banded side.
3. Use the band to apply a gentle lateral pull on the shoulder while maintaining the head tilt.
4. Hold the position and keep the opposite shoulder relaxed.
Steps to perform: Keep opposite shoulder down and lengthen through the side of the neck

Rest intervals: Increases hip extension range of motion and tissue mobility
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around your front hip crease and anchor the other end low behind you to a stable point.
2. Kneel in a half-lunge with the banded hip forward and step slightly forward to create traction through the hip.
3. Tuck your pelvis and shift your weight back to open the front of the hip while keeping the band engaged.
4. Maintain the position and breathe steadily.
Steps to perform: Keep pelvis neutral and brace core before applying band tension

Rest intervals: Enhances hamstring flexibility and neural mobility during leg movement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the ball of one foot, holding the ends with both hands.
2. Straighten the knee and lift the leg toward the ceiling while keeping the band taut.
3. Actively bend and straighten the knee to glide the hamstring while moving the leg slowly.
4. Keep your lower back pressed to the floor and continue controlled repetitions.
Steps to perform: Control band movement and hinge at hip not at lower back

Rest intervals: Improves quadriceps flexibility and hip joint openness for deeper extension
Health benefit:
1. Secure a resistance band to a stable anchor behind you and loop the free end around the ankle of your rear leg.
2. Kneel with your back knee against a couch or pad and place your front foot flat on the floor.
3. Pull the band toward the anchor to create forward tension and tuck your pelvis under to stretch the front hip.
4. Adjust the band tension to control the intensity and maintain steady breathing.
Steps to perform: Tuck tailbone maintain neutral spine and breathe smoothly into the hip

Rest intervals: Increases groin and inner thigh flexibility while promoting hip external rotation
Health benefit:
1. Attach a resistance band to a low stable anchor and loop the free end around your hips or across your pelvis.
2. Start on hands and knees with knees wide and toes turned out in a frog position.
3. Slide your hips back toward your heels while the band provides a gentle rearward assist.
4. Widen or narrow your knee placement and adjust band tension to control the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking outward with slow controlled breaths

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip joint mobility and improves load distribution during movement
Health benefit:
1. Secure a resistance band to a stable anchor at hip height and loop the free end around the outside of the working thigh.
2. Lie on your side near the anchor so the band pulls your thigh laterally away from the hip socket.
3. Bend the top knee and use your bottom leg or hands to control hip rotation while holding the lateral pull.
4. Adjust band tension and body position to maintain a steady lateral distraction.
Steps to perform: Align shoulders over hips and move band slowly while breathing evenly

Rest intervals: Increases ankle dorsiflexion range of motion for better squat and gait mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Sit facing a low anchor and loop the band around the ball of your foot, securing the other end behind you.
2. Pull the band to create gentle posterior tension against your ankle.
3. Actively draw your toes toward your shin while sliding your knee forward over your toes.
4. Release the band tension, reset the foot, and repeat the controlled movement.
Steps to perform: Keep heel grounded and lift toes slowly using controlled ankle movement

Rest intervals: Improves adductor flexibility and dynamic control during lateral movements
Health benefit:
1. Attach the band to a low anchor at side level and loop the free end around the ankle of the working leg.
2. Step away to create tension and stand tall with a slight bend in the knee.
3. Swing the banded leg across your body toward the opposite foot with controlled motion.
4. Return the leg outward to the start position and repeat the adduction movement.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral pelvis and move slowly to avoid sharp groin pulls

Rest intervals: Increases hip mobility and supports external rotation control of the gluteal region
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall on a chair and cross the ankle of the target leg over the opposite knee.
2. Loop the band around the crossed ankle and hold both ends or anchor them under the supporting foot.
3. Gently pull the band to bring the crossed knee closer to your chest while keeping your back straight.
4. Maintain the stretch briefly, then relax the band and repeat with control.
Steps to perform: Sit tall with neutral spine and slowly control band tension

Rest intervals: Enhances inner thigh flexibility and neuromuscular coordination through contract relax technique
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the sole of one foot, holding the ends in both hands.
2. Raise the leg and open the knee outward until you feel a gentle inner-thigh stretch.
3. Push the leg inward against the band's resistance for 6–8 seconds with steady effort.
4. Relax the leg and gently pull the band to allow the leg to move farther outward into a deeper stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back flat and exhale during gentle resisted lengthening

Rest intervals: Increases quadriceps length and improves balance and standing postural control
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band low behind you and loop the free end around one ankle.
2. Stand tall and hold the band with the hand on the same side for support.
3. Bend your knee and pull the heel toward your glute against the band's resistance while keeping knees aligned.
4. Hold briefly at full flexion, then slowly extend the leg back to the start while maintaining posture.
Steps to perform: Stand tall squeeze glutes keep knees aligned and move slowly

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down with arms out to the sides and loop the band around the instep of one foot, holding the other end with the opposite hand behind your back.
2. Bend the knee and lift it, pulling the foot toward the opposite hand while rotating the hip and keeping the pelvis grounded.
3. Pause when you feel a controlled stretch across the lower back and chest while maintaining steady tension on the band.
4. Slowly return the leg to the start position and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips down while rotating slowly

Rest intervals: Opens the chest and improves shoulder mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the resistance band behind you at shoulder height and hold one end in each hand with arms extended out to the sides.
2. Step forward until the band has light tension and stand tall with palms facing forward.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and slowly open your arms wider into a T position against the band.
4. Control the tension and maintain the position as long as needed.
Steps to perform: Draw ribs toward spine to protect shoulder alignment

Rest intervals: Increases hamstring flexibility and posterior chain lengthening
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and loop the resistance band around the soles of your feet, holding an end in each hand.
2. Sit tall, brace your core, and pull the band slightly to create tension.
3. Hinge at the hips and reach your chest toward your thighs while the band resists the movement.
4. Control the return to upright by slowly releasing the tension.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips keeping spine long against the band

Rest intervals: Improves lateral trunk mobility and side bending range
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the resistance band overhead and kneel a short distance away facing sideways to the anchor.
2. Grasp the band with the hand closest to the anchor and raise that arm overhead while keeping the other hand on your hip or thigh.
3. Bend your torso away from the anchor into a side bend while feeling the band’s resistance on the raised arm.
4. Hold the position while keeping hips squared and then control the return to center.
Steps to perform: Stack hips and breathe into the side during the bend

Rest intervals: Enhances spinal rotation and mobility through gentle resisted movement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and loop the band around both knees, anchored to a fixed point at your side.
2. Keep both shoulders on the floor and hold the free band end with the hand on the anchor side.
3. Drop both knees toward the opposite side against the band’s tension.
4. Pull knees back to center with control and repeat to the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep both shoulders grounded and rotate from the waist

Rest intervals: Promotes spinal mobility and coordinated core activation
Health benefit:
1. Start on hands and knees with the band looped over your upper back and the ends under your hands.
2. Tuck your chin and round your spine upward against the band’s pull.
3. Arch your back and lift your chest while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Start from neutral spine, articulate each vertebra while controlling band tension

Rest intervals: Supports lumbar extension and upright posture awareness
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and loop the band around your lower back, holding the ends behind you.
2. Hinge slightly forward from the hips while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Drive your hips forward and extend your lower back while tightening the band.
4. Return to neutral slowly and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked over pelvis and extend from thoracic spine, not lower back

Rest intervals: Increases oblique flexibility and lateral torso mobility
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band under your left foot and hold the free end in your right hand.
2. Step right to create tension and stand with feet hip-width.
3. Rotate your torso to the right and lift your right arm overhead to open the right oblique.
4. Hold the stretch and breathe evenly.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips, brace core, rotate from midline with controlled band recoil

Rest intervals: Stretches lateral torso and improves shoulder and scapular mobility
Health benefit:
1. Kneel and sit back into child's pose with the band looped around your upper back and ends in both hands.
2. Reach your left arm forward on the mat and pull the right end of the band laterally to the right.
3. Keep hips grounded and lengthen through the left side of your torso.
4. Breathe and then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep hips back, lengthen through spine, inhale to expand ribs during lateral reach

Rest intervals: Encourages gentle lumbar extension and anterior chest opening
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down and place the band under your palms with the band resting across your forearms.
2. Press your forearms into the mat and pull the band gently toward your hips to create tension.
3. Lift your chest into a gentle sphinx backbend while keeping forearms grounded and shoulders relaxed.
4. Hold the position and breathe evenly.
Steps to perform: Lift chest using upper back engagement, keep neck long and avoid shrugging shoulders

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder mobility and promotes spinal lengthening
Health benefit:
1. Secure a long resistance band to a low anchor behind you and loop it around your hips.
2. Step back into a downward dog with hands shoulder-width and hips lifted.
3. Allow the band to gently pull your hips back to create traction while pressing through your hands.
4. Hold the position and keep a long spine with slight bend in the knees.
Steps to perform: Spread fingers and press evenly through palms maintaining neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic rotation and hip external rotation mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your right side and loop a resistance band around your left foot.
2. Bend your right knee and place your right hand on the mat for support.
3. Pull the band with your left hand to draw the left foot toward your head and rotate your torso.
4. Keep your hips stacked and hold the rotated position.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulder blades anchored to protect lower back

Rest intervals: Increases thoracic rotation and coordinated hip mobility during loaded movement
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band low beside you and hold the free end with your right hand.
2. Start in a high plank and step your right foot outside your right hand into a Spiderman stance.
3. Rotate your torso and reach your right hand up toward the ceiling against the band tension.
4. Return your hand to the mat and repeat while keeping your core braced.
Steps to perform: Lead rotation with your chest not just your arms keeping hips square

Rest intervals: Improves hip external rotation and dynamic spinal extension control
Health benefit:
1. From tabletop, loop the band around your front foot and hold the ends with your hands.
2. Slide the front shin forward and lower into pigeon while keeping the band taut.
3. Press into your palms, lift your hips, and push back into Down Dog while maintaining band tension.
4. Walk your feet forward and return to pigeon while controlling the band.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and move slowly controlling breath through transitions

Rest intervals: Enhances ankle dorsiflexion and hip mobility for improved squat depth
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and loop the band just above your knees.
2. Sit back into a deep squat until your hips drop near knee level.
3. Place your elbows against your inner knees and push outward to pry against the band.
4. Drive through your heels to stand while keeping the band engaged.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and weight on heels to protect knees and spine

Rest intervals: Improves lateral stability and hamstring flexibility through resisted reaching
Health benefit:
1. Stand wide and wrap the band under your front foot, holding the other end in the front hand.
2. Hinge at the front hip and reach the band-hand toward the front ankle while keeping tension.
3. Open your chest and lift the opposite arm toward the ceiling while maintaining band tension.
Steps to perform: Keep a tall spine and hinge from the hips as you reach

Rest intervals: Promotes thoracic extension and gentle shoulder mobility in a supported position
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on hands and knees and loop a long resistance band around your upper back, holding an end in each hand.
2. Walk your hands forward and sit your hips back over your knees while keeping light band tension.
3. Lower your chest toward the floor and rest your forehead or a block on the mat while keeping arms extended.
4. Maintain steady pull on the band to feel gentle shoulder traction as you sink into the pose.
Steps to perform: Draw shoulder blades apart and maintain neck alignment while breathing steadily

Rest intervals: Enhances glute activation and hip extension mobility during controlled bridging
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet hip-width, and loop the band over your hips with ends anchored under your feet.
2. Hold the band ends at your sides and press your feet into the floor to establish band tension.
3. Drive your hips upward into a bridge, using the band's support to assist the lift.
4. Squeeze at the top and lower down with control while keeping consistent band resistance.
Steps to perform: Lift through the hips keeping ribs down and knees aligned over feet

Rest intervals: Improves hip rotational control and integrated core stability during loaded transitions
Health benefit:
1. Sit in a shin-box position with one shin vertical and the other horizontal, and loop a resistance band under the front foot, holding the ends at chest height.
2. Brace your core and pull the band slightly to create steady tension across your torso.
3. Rotate your hips and swing the rear leg through to switch shin positions while maintaining band tension.
4. Settle into the new shin-box and control the band to keep the load steady before repeating.
Steps to perform: Keep a tall chest and control the switch from the hips not the low back

Rest intervals: Increases hamstring flexibility while encouraging hip hinge and lumbar control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place the middle of the resistance band under both feet.
2. Hold the band ends with straight arms overhead and create steady tension.
3. Hinge from the hips and fold forward with a long spine and a slight bend in the knees.
4. Use the band tension to gently pull the hands upward while keeping the hamstrings engaged.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips with a soft knee and long neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral shoulder strength and core anti-rotation stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and loop the band under the standing foot.
2. Hold the band in the opposite hand at shoulder height.
3. Brace your core and keep your hips square.
4. Press the band overhead until the arm is fully extended, then lower under control.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep hips level as you press overhead

Rest intervals: Enhances posterior shoulder activation and scapular stability during single-leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at head height and grab the ends with both hands.
2. Stand on one leg in a stork stance with the other foot off the ground.
3. Pull the band toward your face with elbows high and squeeze the shoulder blades.
4. Return the hands forward under control while maintaining balance.
Steps to perform: Pull band toward face with controlled scapular retraction and tall posture

Rest intervals: Strengthens chest pressing while improving core anti-rotation and single-leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height behind you and grasp the handles with both hands.
2. Stand on one leg with hips square and hold the band at your sternum with elbows bent.
3. Press both hands straight forward to full extension while resisting any torso rotation.
4. Slowly return to the start and repeat for the set before switching legs.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked over pelvis and resist torso rotation during press

Rest intervals: Develops posterior shoulder and upper back strength while challenging balance
Health benefit:
1. Secure the band at chest height in front of you and hold a handle in each hand.
2. Stand on one leg with a slight hinge at the hips and arms extended in front of you.
3. Pull the handles outward and back, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Slowly control the return and repeat for the set before switching legs.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and keep a neutral spine while squeezing shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Improves upper back strength and postural control in a narrow base of support
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height in front of you and hold the handles with an overhand grip.
2. Adopt a tandem stance with one foot directly in front of the other and knees slightly bent.
3. Pull the handles up toward your upper chest with elbows flared and shoulders down.
4. Control the return and repeat before switching the front foot.
Steps to perform: Stand tall in tandem stance and pull elbows high while squeezing shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral arm strength while enhancing single-leg balance and joint control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall on one foot with the center of a resistance band under that foot.
2. Hold the band ends with palm facing up and elbow pinned to your side.
3. Curl your hand toward your shoulder with controlled motion.
4. Lower slowly with control and maintain balance.
Steps to perform: Maintain tall spine and engaged core while controlling each curl

Rest intervals: Targets lateral shoulder strength while challenging core and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with the middle of a resistance band under that foot.
2. Hold the band in the same-side hand at your side with a slight bend in the elbow.
3. Raise the arm out to shoulder height, then lower with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge slightly at hips keep shoulder down and control the raise

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder endurance and core stability while training dynamic single-leg control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of a resistance band with feet hip-width and grip the ends overhead.
2. Extend your arms fully overhead and keep the band taut.
3. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping arms steady and core engaged.
4. Lower the foot and alternate knees in a controlled marching rhythm.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs stacked press band overhead breathe steadily while marching
Tags: Limited single-leg balance | Limited overhead reach

Rest intervals: Enhances triceps strength while promoting unilateral hip and core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot and loop the band under that same foot while holding the band handle in the same-side hand.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the elbow to 90 degrees with the upper arm close to the torso.
3. Extend the forearm backward until the elbow is straight.
4. Return slowly to the start and maintain balance on the standing leg.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keep elbow anchored to torso extend with control
Tags: Limited single-leg balance | Reduced core stability

Rest intervals: Strengthens anterior shoulder muscles while challenging single-leg balance and posture
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with the other knee bent and loop the band under the standing foot, holding both band ends with your hands.
2. Keep a tall posture and start with your hands at thigh level.
3. Raise both arms straight in front to shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows.
4. Lower the arms slowly and keep balance on the standing leg.
Steps to perform: Stand tall on supporting leg avoid leaning forward lift using shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Improves lateral single-leg strength and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band under the front foot and hold the band ends at chest level while standing on that same foot.
2. Sit back on the standing leg and bend the knee, lowering into a single-leg squat while the rear leg extends behind you.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand up, keeping the chest upright and the band taut.
4. Lower with control and keep the trailing toe lightly touching for balance.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Enhances glute strength and hip extension control
Health benefit:
1. Lie with your upper back on a bench, one foot flat on the floor, and the other knee bent.
2. Loop a resistance band over your hips and anchor the ends under the bench or hold them at the floor.
3. Drive the hip of the working leg up until your torso and thigh form a straight line.
4. Lower the hips with control while keeping constant tension on the band.
Steps to perform: Drive through the heel, keep hips level and core braced

Rest intervals: Increases lateral hip strength and coordinated lower body power
Health benefit:
1. Stand with a loop band around your thighs just above the knees and feet hip-width apart.
2. Step wide to the side into a deep lateral lunge, keeping the trailing leg straight and chest upright.
3. Push off the lunging foot and drive the opposite knee up against the band tension.
4. Return to the starting stance with control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Push hips back, keep chest tall, drive knee with control

Rest intervals: Improves ankle stability and unilateral calf strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand barefoot on one foot and place the middle of a loop band under the ball of that foot.
2. Hold both ends of the band behind your back to keep it taut and the free leg lifted.
3. Rise onto the ball of the foot as high as possible, then lower the heel slowly.
Steps to perform: Stand tall, align ankle under hip, lower slowly with control

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip flexors and enhances front leg control
Health benefit:
1. Loop a resistance band around the working ankle and secure the other end under the opposite foot.
2. Stand tall on the opposite leg with core braced and shoulders back.
3. Lift the banded knee forward to hip height in a controlled motion.
4. Lower the leg slowly to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral, brace core, lift knee with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Develops explosive single-leg power and landing stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor a resistance band under the front foot and hold the ends at chest level.
2. Step into a lunge with the rear foot hovering off the ground and torso upright.
3. Push through the front heel and pull the band as you drive back to standing.
4. Reset your stance and repeat for the set.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and core engaged as you control the landing

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring strength and knee control
Health benefit:
1. Attach a resistance band to a low anchor and loop the free end around the working ankle.
2. Stand on the opposite leg with a slight knee bend and hips square.
3. Bend the working knee and curl the heel toward the glutes against the band.
4. Lower the foot back under control to the start position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hip and control band return with slow steady movement

Rest intervals: Targets glute medius and improves rotational stability and balance
Health benefit:
1. Loop a resistance band above your knees and stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step your right leg diagonally behind and lower into a curtsy lunge, keeping tension on the band.
3. Drive through the left foot and swing the right knee up into a high knee against the band's resistance.
4. Land softly, reset your stance, and repeat before switching sides.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and weight centered over front foot as you transition

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip strength and pelvic stability during single-leg stance
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around both ankles and stand tall on your left leg.
2. Lift your right foot slightly off the ground into a hover with a soft knee bend on the standing leg.
3. Push the right leg outward against the band's resistance into abduction, hold briefly, and return slowly.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral pelvis and small controlled range of motion on abducted leg

Rest intervals: Trains reactive power and improves post-landing stability and balance
Health benefit:
1. Place a resistance band above your knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Bend slightly at the hips and knees and perform a small explosive hop forward or upward while maintaining band tension.
3. Land softly on both feet with knees bent and absorb the impact.
4. Hold a stable position for a moment, then reset and repeat.
Steps to perform: Land softly with knees aligned over toes and absorb force through hips

Rest intervals: Enhances core antirotation control and single leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at chest height to a sturdy post and hold it with both hands at your chest while standing on one leg.
2. Step sideways to create tension and brace your core, keeping hips square to the anchor.
3. Press the band straight out from your chest until your arms are extended and resist rotation.
4. Slowly return the band to your chest and repeat while maintaining balance on the single leg.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep hips square as you slowly press the band away

Rest intervals: Improves core endurance and scapular stability while engaging posterior chain muscles
Health benefit:
1. Anchor the band at floor level and hold one handle in a hand, then come into a bear plank with knees hovering.
2. Keep hips low and core tight while pulling your elbow back toward your ribcage against the band.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blade and control the band back to the start position.
4. Repeat for the set then switch the band to the other hand and repeat on the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral and hips level as you row the band with control

Rest intervals: Strengthens lateral core muscles and hip abductors to support pelvic stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop the band around both legs just above the ankles and press up into a side plank on your forearm.
2. Stack your feet and lift the top leg against the band's resistance while keeping hips lifted.
3. Lower the top leg with control without letting your hips drop.
4. Repeat for reps then switch to the other side.
Steps to perform: Stack shoulders and lift hips to keep a straight line while lifting the leg

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core power and single leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot and trap the band under that foot; hold the band ends with both hands near your hip.
2. Hinge slightly and bend the standing knee while keeping the other leg lifted.
3. Rotate your torso and pull the band diagonally across your body toward the opposite shoulder.
4. Slowly reverse the motion back to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive rotation from your torso and keep standing knee soft with spine long

Rest intervals: Enhances core coordination and pelvic control during limb movement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the soles of your feet; hold the band ends in both hands.
2. Lift your legs to tabletop and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Extend one leg forward and the opposite arm overhead while keeping tension in the band.
4. Draw the arm and leg back to center with control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Press low back into the floor and breathe steadily while extending limbs

Rest intervals: Improves core strength and upper back activation for better posture
Health benefit:
1. Sit in a V position with legs lifted and hold the band stretched between both hands at chest height.
2. Keep your torso tall and arms extended forward.
3. Pull the band apart by opening your arms wide and drawing your shoulder blades together.
4. Return the hands together under control while maintaining the V-sit.
Steps to perform: Keep spine tall and pull shoulders down and back during each controlled band pull

Rest intervals: Promotes dynamic balance and coordinated core hip flexor engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and loop the band under your left foot while holding the other end with your right hand at chest height.
2. Balance on your left foot and lift your right knee toward your right elbow while pulling the band toward the knee.
3. Pause at the top and hold your balance.
4. Slowly lower the leg and reset before repeating, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep hips level as you slowly drive knee toward elbow

Rest intervals: Enhances lumbar stability and gluteal muscle engagement
Health benefit:
1. Get on hands and knees and loop the band over your right hand and left foot with knees hovering just above the ground.
2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until they are in line with your torso while keeping the band taut.
3. Pause, control the return to the hovering start position, and repeat before switching sides.
Steps to perform: Keep back neutral and hips square as you control limb movement

Rest intervals: Builds antirotation core stability and enhances single leg overhead control
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a split stance perpendicular to the band anchor and hold the band with both hands overhead with elbows slightly bent.
2. Brace your core and press the band straight out in front of your head away from the anchor until your arms are extended.
3. Hold briefly and resist rotation, then slowly pull your hands back to the overhead start position.
4. Reset your feet and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Tighten ribs and glutes to prevent torso rotation while pressing overhead

Rest intervals: Combines core endurance and upper back pulling strength while challenging balance
Health benefit:
1. Sit in boat pose with knees bent and loop the resistance band around the soles of your feet.
2. Hold the band ends in both hands and extend your arms forward at chest height.
3. Engage your core and pull the band toward your ribs, squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the start while maintaining balance.
Steps to perform: Maintain tall chest and retract shoulder blades as you row with control

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral lower body and upper back strength and improves postural control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on the middle of the resistance band with one foot and hold the ends in both hands at chest level.
2. Brace your core and lower into a single-leg squat by pushing your hips back and bending the standing knee.
3. As you rise, pull the band toward your torso with elbows bending to perform a row.
4. Return to standing with control and repeat before switching legs.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and knee driven over toes as you row

Rest intervals: Improves dynamic balance, hip mobility, and lower limb proprioception
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot and secure the resistance band under that foot while holding the free end in the opposite hand.
2. Slightly bend the standing knee and keep your chest upright.
3. Reach the free leg diagonally (forward-diagonal, sideways, or backward-diagonal) while pulling the band across your body for resistance.
4. Return the reaching leg to center with control and reset before repeating in each direction.
Steps to perform: Maintain tall spine and control reach without collapsing through standing hip

Rest intervals: Develops single-leg stability, hip strength, and transitional balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with the resistance band looped under your front foot and hold the band ends at shoulder height.
2. Step forward into a lunge until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Push through the front foot to rise, pulling the band to assist the ascent.
4. Hold the single-leg balance briefly with hips level before repeating.
Steps to perform: Step softly, keep torso upright and push through front heel

Rest intervals: Builds single-leg power, lower body strength, and core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one foot with the band under the sole and the handles held at shoulder level.
2. Lower into a single-leg squat, keeping the knee aligned over the toes.
3. Drive through the heel to extend the hip and press the handles overhead.
4. Return the band to shoulder level with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through heel, extend hips smoothly while bracing your core

Rest intervals: Enhances hip strength and rotational core control for improved functional mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold the band in both hands at chest height with tension.
2. Step one foot back into a reverse lunge while rotating your torso toward the front leg and keeping the band taut.
3. Push through the front heel to stand and rotate back to center before repeating.
Steps to perform: Rotate from thoracic spine, keep hips square and knees aligned

Rest intervals: Strengthens hamstrings and glutes while improving balance and hip driving mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Place one foot on the center of the band and hold the ends with both hands at hip level.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your chest while lifting the opposite leg straight back.
3. Drive through the standing foot, pull the band upward, and bring the raised knee forward into a high knee.
4. Return to the hinge position with control and repeat for reps.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with a flat back and control the movement

Rest intervals: Improves lateral power and single-leg landing stability
Health benefit:
1. Loop a band around both thighs just above the knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Push off laterally with one foot and bound to the opposite side, keeping the band taut.
3. Land softly on the lead foot and hold the landing for one second.
4. Reset and repeat the bound back to the other side.
Steps to perform: Land softly with knees tracking over toes and absorb through hips

Rest intervals: Challenges postural control, shoulder endurance, and coordination during gait-like movement
Health benefit:
1. Hold a resistance band overhead with both hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Step into a tandem stance with heel of front foot touching toe of back foot.
3. Walk forward slowly one heel-to-toe step at a time while keeping the band stretched overhead.
4. Keep your torso tall and controlled as you continue the tandem walk.
Steps to perform: Keep a long spine ribs down and shoulders packed while stepping deliberately

Rest intervals: Combines quadriceps and calf strengthening, enhancing ankle mobility and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and loop the resistance band under both feet while holding the ends at shoulder height.
2. Lower into a squat by bending hips and knees until thighs are about parallel to the floor, keeping chest lifted.
3. Drive through the heels to stand up, and as you reach the top, lift both heels into a calf raise against the band's tension.
4. Slowly lower your heels back down and reset your squat position for the next repetition.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright knees tracking toes rise onto balls of feet with control

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral leg strength, glute activation, and step-to-balance stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a sturdy step and loop the resistance band under the stepping foot while holding the band ends at shoulder level.
2. Place the front foot firmly on the step and push through the heel to extend the hip and knee, keeping tension in the band.
3. Bring the trailing foot up and balance on the stepping leg while maintaining core engagement and band tension.
4. Step back down with control to the start position and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Press through the heel control the ascent and stabilize hips before releasing band tension

Health benefit: Steps to perform
Steps to perform: Safety cue
Safety cue: MET value

Rest intervals: Enhances full body strength and metabolic conditioning
Health benefit:
1. Start in a high plank with a dumbbell in each hand under your shoulders.
2. Do a push-up, then row each dumbbell by pulling your elbow up toward your ribs.
3. Jump your feet to your hands, hinge, and clean both dumbbells to your shoulders.
4. Stand and press the dumbbells overhead, then reverse the move back to plank.
Steps to perform: Keep core braced and back flat through each dip and push movement
MET value: Hypertension, Obesity / Overweight, Coronary Artery Disease, Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD), Hyperthyroidism

Rest intervals: Develops explosive power and single-arm coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place one dumbbell between your feet and hinge at the hips to grip it with one hand.
2. Explode through the hips and pull the dumbbell upward close to your body.
3. Punch the dumbbell overhead to lock your arm, then lower it back under control.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips maintain neutral spine and control the pull

Rest intervals: Improves unilateral leg strength and single-leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand a couple steps in front of a bench and place the top of one foot on the bench behind you while holding a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Lower your back knee toward the floor by bending the front knee until the front thigh is near parallel.
3. Drive through the front heel to return to standing, then switch legs after the set.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright front knee tracking over toes and descend with control

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder stability core strength and coordinated mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with a dumbbell in one hand pressed straight up and the same-side knee bent with foot flat.
2. Roll onto the opposite elbow, then press up onto the hand while keeping the dumbbell vertical overhead.
3. Lift the hips and sweep the straight leg back into a kneeling lunge while maintaining the dumbbell overhead.
4. Stand up tall, then reverse the steps with control to return to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Brace core keep eyes on the dumbbell and move through slow controlled steps

Rest intervals: Builds back strength and anti-rotation core stability
Health benefit:
1. Set up in a high plank with a dumbbell in each hand under your shoulders and feet wider than hip-width.
2. Brace the core and row one dumbbell toward your hip, keeping the elbow close and the hips square.
3. Lower the dumbbell with control, then row the opposite side.
4. Maintain a neutral spine and minimize hip rotation throughout each rep.
Steps to perform: Hold a strong plank keep hips square and row without twisting the torso

Rest intervals: Develops oblique strength hip mobility and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hold one dumbbell overhead with the arm locked and eyes on the weight.
2. Hinge at the hips and slide the opposite hand down the inner thigh toward the opposite foot while keeping the dumbbell arm vertical.
3. Keep the supporting knee slightly bent and the torso aligned as you reach down.
4. Reverse the motion to stand tall and then repeat for the other side.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keep spine long eyes fixed on overhead dumbbell

Rest intervals: Combines lower and upper body power with metabolic conditioning
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing inward.
2. Bend your knees and push your hips back into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels and extend your hips while pressing the dumbbells overhead until your arms are straight.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels to stand tall then exhale as you press overhead

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain while improving single-leg balance and control
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in front of the standing thigh with both hands, keeping a slight knee bend.
2. Hinge at the hips and push your hips back while lowering the dumbbell toward the floor and extending the free leg straight behind you.
3. Keep your back flat and core braced as you lower until you feel a stretch in the standing hamstring.
4. Drive your hips forward and squeeze the glute to return to standing.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hip with a neutral spine and hips square to the floor

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder mobility and rotational pressing strength
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand with a straight back and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with palms facing you and elbows tucked.
2. Rotate your palms outward while pressing the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
3. Reverse the rotation and lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with controlled movement.
Steps to perform: Rotate smoothly keep elbows under wrists and brace core through the press

Rest intervals: Improves full-body conditioning and explosive power with cardiovascular challenge
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge at the hips, place the dumbbells on the floor, and jump or step your feet back into a plank.
3. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet forward toward the dumbbells.
4. Explosively clean the dumbbells to your shoulders and press them overhead as you stand.
Steps to perform: Maintain a flat back during the hinge and control the descent and press
MET value: Hypertension, Obesity / Overweight, Coronary Artery Disease, Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD), Hyperthyroidism

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral mobility and single-leg strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wide and hold a dumbbell at your chest in a goblet position.
2. Shift your weight to one leg and bend that knee while keeping the other leg straight and toes pointed up.
3. Lower your hips toward the bent knee with chest up and the dumbbell close to your body.
4. Drive through the bent heel to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Hinge hips back during the lateral descent

Rest intervals: Improves core stability and shoulder control
Health benefit:
1. Place a single dumbbell beside your right hand and assume a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips level and shoulders stable.
3. Reach under your torso with your left hand and drag the dumbbell across to the left side.
4. Return your hand to the plank, reset your position, and repeat the drag with the opposite hand.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral spine while slowly dragging the dumbbell

Rest intervals: Builds elbow flexion strength and forearm control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand and palms facing up at your sides.
2. Curl the dumbbells to shoulder height, keeping elbows close to your torso.
3. Rotate your wrists so palms face down and lower the dumbbells slowly.
4. Rotate wrists back to palms up at the bottom and repeat.
Steps to perform: Rotate wrists slowly on the lowering phase with elbows stationary

Rest intervals: Develops upper chest and triceps pressing strength
Health benefit:
1. Set an incline bench to 30–45 degrees and lie back with a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Hold the dumbbells together above your chest with palms facing each other.
3. Press the dumbbells up until your arms are nearly straight, then lower them back to chest level.
Steps to perform: Squeeze the dumbbell firmly while retracting shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral leg strength and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step forward with one foot and lower into a lunge until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Push through the front heel to rise and bring the back foot forward into the next step.
4. Continue walking forward, alternating legs while keeping your torso upright.
Steps to perform: Keep knee tracking over toes while driving through the front heel

Rest intervals: Strengthens anterior core endurance and body tension
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold one dumbbell with both hands extended toward the ceiling.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor while lifting your shoulders and legs a few inches off the ground.
3. Hold the hollow position with steady breathing, then lower with control.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and press lower back gently into the floor

Rest intervals: Develops explosive full body power and movement coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place one dumbbell between your feet on the floor.
2. Hinge at the hips and explosively extend knees and hips to pull the dumbbell to a shoulder rack, catching it at chest level.
3. Dip slightly, drive upward with your legs, and press or jerk the dumbbell overhead to lockout.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the rack, then to the floor under control and reset.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips, keep chest up and drive through heels
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, COPD, Hyperthyroidism
is_not_suitable_for: Rotator cuff weakness / instability | Limited overhead reach

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and hip extension capacity
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned slightly outward with a dumbbell between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips, push knees outward, grip the dumbbell with both hands, and keep your chest high and back flat.
3. Drive through your heels, extend your hips to stand tall while squeezing your glutes, then lower the dumbbell back down with control.
Steps to perform: Spread feet wide, push knees out and keep spine neutral

Rest intervals: Builds horizontal pressing strength and triceps stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with knees bent and hold a dumbbell in each hand at chest height.
2. Press the dumbbells straight up until your arms are fully extended and palms face forward.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping shoulders pressed into the floor.
4. Lower the dumbbells slowly back to chest level with control.
Steps to perform: Pin shoulder blades, control eccentric descent and press with full elbow extension

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral core strength and rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Start in a side plank on your forearm with feet stacked and hold one dumbbell in the top hand toward the ceiling.
2. Rotate your torso and thread the dumbbell under your body, lowering it toward the floor while keeping a straight line from head to heels.
3. Reverse the motion to rotate the dumbbell back up to the ceiling and stabilize at the top.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked, brace core and rotate slowly with control
MET value: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Rest intervals: Improves single-leg strength and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a sturdy bench or box holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step up with one foot and drive through the heel to lift your body onto the bench.
3. Bring the trailing knee up toward your chest and hold a brief balance at the top.
4. Step back down with the same foot first and reset before repeating on the other side.
Steps to perform: Drive through heel keep hips level and chest upright

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core strength and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands overhead on the high side of your body.
2. Rotate your torso and hips to bring the dumbbell diagonally down across your body toward the opposite hip.
3. Keep knees slightly bent and drive the movement from your core while maintaining a controlled tempo.
4. Reverse the motion by rotating back up to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Brace core and rotate from torso keeping knees soft

Rest intervals: Enhances triceps strength and elbow control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a flat bench and hold two dumbbells above your chest with palms facing each other and elbows flared outward.
2. Lower the dumbbells by bending the elbows so the weights come toward the outer chest with upper arms nearly parallel to the floor.
3. Press the dumbbells back up by extending the elbows until the arms are nearly straight.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulder blades and lower weights with slow controlled elbow movement

Rest intervals: Improves grip strength and lateral core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and pick up one dumbbell with a neutral grip at your side while bracing your core.
2. Walk forward with short, controlled steps while keeping your torso upright and the dumbbell close to your hip.
3. Continue for the desired distance or time, then set the dumbbell down and repeat on the opposite side.
