Steps to perform: Stand tall brace core keep shoulders down and maintain neutral spine

Rest intervals: Enhances hip stability and single-leg strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand by your sides.
2. Step your right leg diagonally behind your left and lower into a lunge, keeping your chest upright.
3. Press through the left foot to return to standing and bring the right foot forward.
4. Repeat on the opposite side, alternating legs for desired reps.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright step diagonally and control knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Develops explosive shoulder power and full-body coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing each other.
2. Bend your knees slightly and dip your hips to load the legs.
3. Drive through your legs and extend your hips as you press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are straight.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the shoulders under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through legs then press under control keeping a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Improves chest and lat mobility while engaging core stabilizers
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a bench with your upper back supported and hold one dumbbell with both hands over your chest.
2. Keeping a slight bend in the elbows, slowly lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head until you feel a stretch.
3. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest using your lats and triceps.
4. Lower the dumbbell to the starting position under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep ribs long while moving through a controlled shoulder arc

Rest intervals: Enhances rotational core strength and oblique endurance
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet elevated, holding a dumbbell with both hands at chest height.
2. Lean back slightly, brace your core, and rotate your torso to touch the dumbbell beside your right hip.
3. Rotate to the left side with control to touch the dumbbell beside your left hip and repeat.
Steps to perform: Maintain a tall neutral spine and rotate from the ribs with control

Rest intervals: Combines lower body strength with upper back and shoulder activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell vertically with both hands at chest level.
2. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and pull the dumbbell upward toward your chin with elbows high.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to chest level with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up knees tracking toes and pull elbows along a controlled path

Rest intervals: Builds glute strength and improves hip extension power
Health benefit:
1. Sit with your upper back against a bench and place a dumbbell on your hips, holding it steady with both hands.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees while squeezing your glutes.
3. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Drive through heels keep hips level and maintain a neutral spine at lockout

Rest intervals: Strengthens rear deltoids and upper back to support improved shoulder posture
Health benefit:
1. Hinge at the hips with a flat back and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
2. Bend your elbows slightly and let your arms hang under your shoulders.
3. Raise both dumbbells out to the sides until your arms reach shoulder height.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the start position with control.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a flat back and squeeze shoulder blades on each rep

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder strength while challenging core stability and seated balance
Health benefit:
1. Sit in a V position with knees bent, feet off the ground, and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level.
2. Brace your core and press the dumbbells straight up until your arms are fully extended overhead.
3. Pause briefly at the top while maintaining the V-sit balance.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level with control.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep a neutral spine as you press the dumbbells overhead

Rest intervals: Enhances grip strength and core endurance while improving functional carrying ability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and shoulders back.
2. Walk forward with short, controlled steps while keeping the dumbbells at your sides and your core engaged.
3. Stop and set the dumbbells down with control when finished.
Steps to perform: Stand tall with shoulders back and core braced and take controlled steps

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral leg strength and balance while promoting hip and ankle mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand while placing the free hand on a stable support for balance.
2. Extend the non-working leg forward and push your hips back as you lower into a controlled single-leg squat.
3. Descend to a comfortable depth while keeping your chest upright and the dumbbell close to your body.
4. Drive through the heel of the standing leg to return to standing and keep the dumbbell steady.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and sit back into heel control on the descent

Rest intervals: Builds explosive hip and upper body power while improving posterior chain coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips while holding a dumbbell in one hand between your legs.
2. Explode by extending hips and knees and pull the dumbbell upward close to your body, leading with the elbow to shoulder height.
3. Absorb the momentum with a slight knee bend and lower the dumbbell under control back to the start position.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips pull with elbow leading keep core tight and controlled

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder stability and core endurance while reinforcing upright posture under load
Health benefit:
1. Clean and press a dumbbell overhead and lock the elbow with the weight aligned over the wrist.
2. Brace your core and stand tall with shoulders stacked over hips.
3. Walk forward in short controlled steps while keeping the dumbbell steady overhead, then lower it safely to the shoulder.
Steps to perform: Brace core keep ribs down and shoulders packed as you walk

Rest intervals: Develops hip hinge power and posterior chain endurance with cardiovascular conditioning
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands down between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips and drive them forward to swing the dumbbell up to chest level with straight arms.
3. Let the dumbbell descend by hinging back at the hips and keep a flat back.
4. Repeat the hip hinge and swing with controlled rhythm.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips drive with glutes and keep a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Reinforces squat mechanics and builds glute and hamstring strength through controlled depth
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and hold one dumbbell vertically at your chest.
2. Sit back onto a box by pushing hips back and lowering until your glutes touch the box lightly.
3. Pause briefly with weight in your heels and chest lifted.
4. Press through the heels to stand and drive your hips forward to full extension.
Steps to perform: Sit back to the box keep knees tracking over toes and chest lifted

Rest intervals: Enhances core stability and pelvic control while training anti extension strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with hips and knees bent at 90 degrees and hold one dumbbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Lower one leg toward the floor while slowly lowering the dumbbell toward the floor behind your head, keeping your lower back pressed down.
3. Return the leg and dumbbell to the starting position with control.
4. Alternate sides with slow, deliberate movements.
Steps to perform: Brace your core press lower back into the floor and move slowly

Rest intervals: Increases chest pressing strength while boosting forearm grip and hand stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on a bench or the floor and hold a dumbbell vertically with both hands, squeezing the handle in a crush grip.
2. Press the dumbbell straight up by extending your arms while keeping the handle compressed.
3. Lower the dumbbell slowly to your chest, keeping elbows tucked and grip tight.
4. Pause briefly, then drive the dumbbell back up while maintaining the crush grip.
Steps to perform: Squeeze the dumbbell firmly keep wrists neutral and exhale on press

Rest intervals: Improves upper body muscular endurance and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold light dumbbells at your sides for DB Shadow Boxing.
2. Throw controlled jabs, crosses, and hooks with relaxed wrists and slight rotation of the hips.
3. Move around lightly and keep a steady rhythm while maintaining a soft bend in the knees.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and stay light on your feet

Rest intervals: Enhances upper body power and rapid pressing ability
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand with dumbbells at shoulder height and elbows slightly in front for DB Speed Press.
2. Explosively press the dumbbells overhead, extending the arms quickly but under control.
3. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with a controlled descent.
4. Repeat at a brisk tempo, keeping wrists neutral and core engaged.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and press explosively while keeping shoulders down

Rest intervals: Increases rotational power and core engagement during punching motions
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at chest level with palms facing you.
2. Rotate your torso slightly toward the side of the punching arm and drive that elbow upward in an arc, leading with the knuckles.
3. Extend the arm partially while keeping the wrist neutral and raise the dumbbell toward chin level.
4. Return the weight under control to the starting guard and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Rotate from the hips and keep elbows tucked to protect the shoulder

Rest intervals: Improves forearm and biceps endurance and grip speed
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with thumbs up.
2. Keep elbows close to your torso and curl both dumbbells quickly toward your shoulders in a hammer grip.
3. Squeeze the forearms at the top without swinging your torso.
4. Lower the dumbbells under control to the starting position and repeat at a fast pace.
Steps to perform: Control the descent and avoid swinging by bracing your core

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder abduction speed and lateral deltoid endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold light dumbbells at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. Bend your elbows slightly and raise both arms out to the sides rapidly up to shoulder height.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping your shoulders down and elbows slightly above the wrists.
4. Lower the dumbbells under control to your sides and repeat at a quick rhythm.
Steps to perform: Lead with the elbows and maintain a slight bend to protect the shoulder

Rest intervals: Develops balance and coordinated striking mechanics from stable stance
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a staggered fighting stance and hold a light dumbbell at chest height in the front hand.
2. Rotate your torso and extend the punching arm straight toward the target while keeping the elbow slightly bent.
3. Snap the wrist at full extension and exhale as you reach forward.
4. Retract the dumbbell quickly to the guard position and reset your stance.
Steps to perform: Keep a neutral spine and soft knees as you drive the punch

Rest intervals: Boosts anterior shoulder endurance and punching acceleration
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at chest level.
2. Drive one arm straight forward in a quick punch while the other stays at your chest.
3. Alternate arms rapidly in a controlled punching rhythm.
4. Retract each dumbbell back to the chest and maintain an engaged core.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and exhale as you extend the arms

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and controlled rotational stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and grip one dumbbell vertically by the ends at chest level.
2. Move the dumbbell quickly in a semicircle around one side of your head with soft elbows.
3. Continue the fast smooth arc behind your head to the other side.
4. Repeat in the opposite direction and keep your core braced.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders packed and core engaged while moving the weight around your head

Rest intervals: Enhances upper trapezius power and rapid scapular elevation
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Keep arms straight and quickly shrug both shoulders up toward your ears.
3. Drop your shoulders back down under control to the starting position.
4. Repeat the quick shrug motion in short, fast sets.
Steps to perform: Drive shrugs from the traps with a neutral neck and controlled descent

Rest intervals: Increases anterior deltoid power and coordinated arm drive
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your thighs.
2. Raise one dumbbell straight in front of you to shoulder height with a quick motion.
3. Lower that dumbbell as you simultaneously raise the opposite one, alternating rapidly.
4. Keep a slight bend in the elbows and maintain a firm core throughout.
Steps to perform: Maintain scapular stability and control each raise without swinging

Rest intervals: Improves lower body power and explosive strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your shoulders or sides.
2. Sit back into a squat until your thighs are about parallel to the floor while keeping your chest up.
3. Explode upward into a jump and land softly back into the squat position.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and land softly through hips and knees

Rest intervals: Enhances unilateral leg strength and cardiovascular fitness
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a sturdy bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step onto the bench with your right foot and drive through the heel to lift your body up quickly.
3. Step down with the same foot and immediately alternate by stepping up with the left foot.
4. Maintain a brisk, controlled tempo and keep dumbbells steady at your sides.
Steps to perform: Drive through the whole foot and lower with controlled knee tracking
is_not_suitable_for: Knee pain (general / chronic) | Limited single-leg balance

Rest intervals: Builds single leg power and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a split stance with a dumbbell in each hand and feet staggered.
2. Lower into a quick lunge until both knees are bent about 90 degrees.
3. Explosively jump and switch legs in midair, landing softly in the opposite split stance.
4. Continue alternating jumps while keeping your torso upright and dumbbells secure.
Steps to perform: Absorb the landing with hips back and soft knees
is_not_suitable_for: Knee pain (general / chronic) | Limited single-leg balance

Rest intervals: Improves lateral leg strength and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Rapidly step your right foot wide to the side and push your hips back into a lateral lunge.
3. Drive off the right foot to return to the starting position quickly.
4. Repeat immediately to the left side and alternate sides while holding the dumbbells steady.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips and push hips back while keeping chest tall

Rest intervals: Strengthens posterior chain and hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Hold one dumbbell close to your chest in a goblet position.
2. Drop into a low squat with knees wide and heels down.
3. Take small controlled steps forward while staying low.
4. Keep the dumbbell tight to your chest and maintain an upright torso.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up hips low and take small controlled steps

Rest intervals: Improves foot speed and overall agility
Health benefit:
1. Hold one dumbbell at chest level in a goblet position.
2. Bend knees into a shallow athletic squat and stay on the balls of your feet.
3. Rapidly tap your feet in place with quick small steps.
Steps to perform: Land softly on the midfoot

Rest intervals: Develops calf power and ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
3. Rise explosively onto the balls of your feet and jump a few inches.
4. Land softly with knees bent and immediately repeat.
Steps to perform: Absorb landing with slightly bent knees

Rest intervals: Boosts lateral explosive power and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell at chest in a goblet grip.
2. Push off the right foot and jump laterally to the left, landing softly on the left foot.
3. Immediately bound back to the right, landing on the right foot and switching the trailing foot.
4. Continue alternating lateral bounds with controlled landings and a steady chest position.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and hips square

Rest intervals: Enhances single leg strength and hip flexor activation
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding one dumbbell at chest in a goblet grip.
2. Step back into a reverse lunge, lowering until both knees are bent about 90 degrees.
3. Drive through the front foot and explosively bring the rear knee up toward the chest.
4. Stabilize at standing and repeat on the opposite leg.
Steps to perform: Push through the front heel

Rest intervals: Increases muscular endurance and time under tension in legs
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and hold one dumbbell at chest in a goblet grip.
2. Lower into a squat until thighs are just above parallel.
3. Pulse up and down in a small range of motion for the desired repetitions.
Steps to perform: Keep weight in heels

Rest intervals: Improves full body conditioning and explosive lower body power
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Hinge and place the dumbbells on the floor, then jump your feet back into a high plank.
3. Jump your feet forward to the hands and lift your chest.
4. Drive your hips forward and stand up tall with the dumbbells at your sides.
Steps to perform: Land softly and hinge through hips keeping chest lifted and core braced

Rest intervals: Enhances cardiovascular fitness and lower body muscular endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and hold dumbbells at your sides.
2. Drop into a squat and place the dumbbells on the floor in front of you.
3. Jump or step your feet back into a plank while maintaining a straight line.
4. Jump or step your feet forward to the squat and drive through your heels to stand.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and drive through heels as you stand into squat

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral power and coordination for improved functional strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell between your legs in one hand.
2. Hinge at the hips and then explosively extend hips and knees while pulling the dumbbell upward close to your body.
3. Rotate your elbow under the dumbbell and catch it in the front-rack position at shoulder height.
Steps to perform: Explode from hips keep wrist neutral and guide elbow to rack position

Rest intervals: Improves core stability and shoulder endurance while challenging coordination
Health benefit:
1. Place two dumbbells on the floor shoulder-width apart and grip the handles with straight arms.
2. Lift your knees a few inches off the ground and brace your core to keep hips low.
3. Crawl forward by moving the right hand and left foot together, then the left hand and right foot together.
4. Keep a flat back and controlled, steady steps for the desired distance or repetitions.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral shoulders stacked over wrists and move with slow controlled steps

Rest intervals: Builds posterior chain strength and scapular control for better pulling mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and hinge at the hips while holding a dumbbell in each hand between your legs.
2. Keep a tall chest and slight knee bend while the dumbbells hang near the ground.
3. Pull both dumbbells up toward your lower ribs with elbows driving back and shoulder blades squeezing.
4. Lower the dumbbells under control back to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips keeping back flat and row with elbow close to ribcage

Rest intervals: Enhances hip extension power and upper back recruitment for explosive movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at thigh level with palms facing your body.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and prepare by loading the hips and core.
3. Explosively extend the hips and knees while shrugging and pulling the dumbbells upward with elbows leading.
4. Guide the dumbbells back down under control to the thighs and reset for the next rep.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and pull with elbows high and outside

Rest intervals: Combines shoulder strength and aerobic challenge to improve upper body endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet together and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Jump feet wide into a slight squat while pressing the dumbbells overhead.
3. Land softly with feet wide and arms extended overhead.
4. Jump feet back together and lower the dumbbells to shoulder height.
Steps to perform: Brace core and press evenly while landing softly with knees slightly bent

Rest intervals: Improves lateral mobility and hip stability while engaging core control
Health benefit:
1. Stand beside a low step and hold a dumbbell in a goblet grip at your chest.
2. Step the nearest foot onto the step and drive through the heel to lift your body.
3. Bring the trailing foot over the step and plant it on the opposite side.
4. Step down back to the starting side and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and step controlled without twisting the torso

Rest intervals: Trains full body coordination and load transfer from hips to overhead
Health benefit:
1. Stand over a dumbbell with feet hip-width and hinge to grip it with both hands.
2. Explosively extend hips and knees and pull the dumbbell to your shoulder in a clean motion.
3. Press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is fully extended.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to your shoulder and then to the ground under control.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips and maintain neutral spine before pressing overhead with stable shoulder blades

Rest intervals: Enhances dynamic hip mobility and rotational core strength for movement efficiency
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips and swing the dumbbell back like a pendulum.
3. Thrust the hips forward and swing the dumbbell up to chest level while stepping one foot out to the side.
4. Let the dumbbell return between your legs and repeat, alternating which foot steps out each rep.
Steps to perform: Control the swing and hinge from hips keeping a soft knee and braced core

Rest intervals: Increases core stability and shoulder endurance
Health benefit:
1. Get into a high plank with each hand gripping a dumbbell beneath your shoulders.
2. Jump your feet out wide like a jumping jack and then jump them back together while keeping hips steady.
3. Keep a neutral spine and tight core as you repeat for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while moving feet slowly

Rest intervals: Enhances core strength and hip flexor activation for dynamic stability
Health benefit:
1. Start in a high plank with each hand firmly on a dumbbell under your shoulders.
2. Drive your right knee toward your chest, aiming to move from the hips.
3. Quickly switch legs by bringing the left knee forward while keeping hips level.
4. Continue alternating knees in a controlled, rhythmic pattern for the desired reps.
Steps to perform: Maintain a straight spine and brace core while driving knees toward chest

Rest intervals: Improves explosive hip flexor power and core endurance
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench and hold one dumbbell with both hands at your chest in a goblet grip.
2. Lean back slightly, brace your core, and drive your right knee up quickly toward your chest while keeping the dumbbell steady.
3. Immediately switch legs in a rapid alternating motion like sprinting while keeping your chest up.
4. Maintain a quick, controlled pace and keep the dumbbell close to your chest until the set is complete.
Steps to perform: Sit tall with a neutral spine and drive arms under control

Rest intervals: Strengthens obliques and improves lateral trunk control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Brace your core and slowly bend your torso to the right over a 3-second count, lowering the dumbbell toward your knee.
3. Reverse the motion under control over 1 second to return upright.
4. Switch the dumbbell to the left hand and repeat the same tempo on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips stacked and ribs down bend slowly from the waist

Rest intervals: Increases lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and hold a light dumbbell with both hands straight above your chest.
2. Tuck your pelvis slightly and lift both legs a few inches off the floor while keeping the dumbbell stable.
3. Engage your core and perform small, rapid alternate leg kicks up and down while keeping your lower back grounded.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into the floor and breathe steadily during small kicks

Rest intervals: Enhances integrated core engagement and movement coordination
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, hold one dumbbell vertically against your chest with both hands.
2. Pull your knees toward your chest and wrap your arms around the dumbbell and shins to form a compact cocoon.
3. Squeeze your abs, hold briefly, then slowly release back to the start.
Steps to perform: Keep spine neutral and brace core while moving the dumbbell with control

Rest intervals: Improves hip flexor strength and dynamic balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell at chest level with both hands (goblet hold).
2. Brace your core and lift one knee toward your chest to hip height while keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower the leg under control and repeat on the other side while keeping the dumbbell close to your body.
Steps to perform: Stand tall, engage core, lift knee slowly with controlled breathing

Rest intervals: Targets obliques to improve rotational stability and torso strength
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, hold a dumbbell vertically on your chest with both hands.
2. Rotate and crunch your torso to bring your right elbow and the dumbbell toward your left knee, contracting the right oblique.
3. Lower back to center under control and repeat the movement on the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Exhale on each crunch, keep neck relaxed and ribs rotating

Rest intervals: Combines core strengthening with upper body power and coordination
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat while holding one dumbbell with both hands at your chest.
2. Engage your core and sit up until your torso is upright.
3. Extend your arms forward and punch the dumbbell straight out at shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower back to the floor and reset before the next rep.
Steps to perform: Keep core engaged, exhale as you sit up, extend the punch slowly

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring flexibility and upper abdominal engagement
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and lift your legs straight up at 90 degrees while holding one dumbbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Engage your core and crunch up toward your toes.
3. Reach the dumbbell toward your toes, keeping your neck neutral.
4. Lower back down with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep lower back pressed to the floor and reach with ribs not neck

Rest intervals: Enhances rotator cuff strength and shoulder external rotation control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand with elbows bent at 90 degrees and palms facing down.
2. Raise your elbows to shoulder height while externally rotating your shoulders so your forearms turn upward.
3. Press the dumbbells overhead in a controlled motion until your arms are extended.
4. Reverse the movement to return to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows high and squeeze shoulder blades together

Rest intervals: Improves scapular stability and upper back endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on a bench or the floor with a light dumbbell in each hand and arms extended overhead in a Y, thumbs up.
2. Keep your neck neutral and slightly retract your shoulder blades.
3. Lift the dumbbells off the surface by squeezing the upper back and raising the arms into the Y without shrugging.
4. Lower the dumbbells slowly to the start position with control.
Steps to perform: Keep neck neutral and lead with thumbs to engage scapula

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder stability while challenging forearm and grip strength
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall with a light dumbbell held vertically in one hand, the end of the dumbbell pointing up and the handle balanced in your palm.
2. Brace your core and keep the wrist straight while pressing the dumbbell overhead until the arm is fully extended.
3. Hold briefly while maintaining the dumbbell vertical and stable.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to shoulder height and repeat, then switch hands.
Steps to perform: Keep wrist stacked and elbow under the dumbbell

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder mobility and multidirectional control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides and palms facing inward.
2. Lift both dumbbells in front of you and continue the motion up and over your head toward the opposite side with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Move the dumbbells down behind you and then up and around to return to the starting position, tracing a controlled circular path.
4. Keep your core braced and shoulders engaged throughout each circle and reverse direction after each set.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and move slowly with controlled shoulder movement

Rest intervals: Develops rotational core stability and shoulder coordination
Health benefit:
1. Hold one dumbbell in your right hand at your right hip with a neutral grip and feet hip-width apart.
2. Rotate your torso and draw the dumbbell diagonally across your body toward the opposite shoulder in a controlled motion.
3. Continue the arc to raise the dumbbell overhead across the body like drawing a sword while keeping your core engaged.
4. Reverse the motion slowly to return to the starting hip position and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Rotate from hips while keeping the shoulder blade stable

Rest intervals: Targets deltoid function and improves scapular upward rotation
Health benefit:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing each other and feet hip-width apart.
2. Angle your arms forward about 30–45 degrees from your torso with thumbs pointing up.
3. Lift both dumbbells to shoulder height in a controlled motion while keeping a slight bend in the elbows.
4. Lower the dumbbells slowly back to your sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Lift in the scapular plane with thumbs up and scapula stabilized

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder external rotation and posterior deltoid activation
Health benefit:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing your thighs and feet hip-width apart.
2. Slightly bend your elbows and rotate your hands so your thumbs point upward.
3. Lift the dumbbells outward and slightly forward to shoulder height in a smooth arc.
4. Lower the weights under control back to your sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders down and elbows soft to avoid neck tension

Rest intervals: Strengthens rotator cuff external rotators and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a light dumbbell in one hand.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the elbow to 90 degrees so the upper arm is parallel to the floor.
3. Rotate the shoulder to lift the forearm upward until it aligns with the upper arm.
4. Lower the forearm with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow raised at 90 degrees and rotate slowly with shoulder stability

Rest intervals: Promotes joint mobility and blood flow to shoulder musculature
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a light dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Raise your arms to shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Make small controlled circular motions with your arms and shoulders.
4. Reverse the circles for the same number of repetitions.
Steps to perform: Move slowly with scapula anchored and maintain upright posture

Rest intervals: Activates serratus anterior to enhance scapular protraction and shoulder support
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall and hold a dumbbell in one hand with the arm extended forward at shoulder height.
2. Keep the arm straight and push the dumbbell forward by reaching through the shoulder.
3. Pull the shoulder back to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Protract scapula fully with controlled reach and exhale

Rest intervals: Enhances quad and hip control for improved lower body strength
Health benefit:
1. Hold one dumbbell vertically against your chest with both hands and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Sit hips back and bend knees, lowering into a deep squat while keeping chest upright.
3. Pause at the bottom, then drive through your heels to stand while keeping the dumbbell close to your chest.
4. Repeat with controlled tempo for the planned repetitions.
Steps to perform: Keep chest upright and knees tracking over toes during slow controlled descent

Rest intervals: Improves posterior chain activation and hip hinge mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench with feet flat and hold a dumbbell across your upper back with both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the knees and lower your torso forward while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Reverse the hinge by driving your hips forward to return upright while keeping the dumbbell stable.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with a flat back and neutral neck

Rest intervals: Builds single leg balance and eccentric control in the lower body
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand with a slight bend in the standing knee.
2. Hinge at the hip and lower the dumbbell toward the ground while extending the free leg behind you for balance.
3. Lightly touch the floor with the dumbbell while maintaining a straight back.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and bring the free leg back to the start position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced as you control the touchdown

Rest intervals: Enhances hip stability and rotational control through single leg strength work
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in the same-side hand at your hip.
2. Hinge forward at the standing hip and extend the free leg straight behind you.
3. Rotate your torso toward the standing leg while keeping a flat back and the dumbbell close.
4. Reverse the rotation and hinge to return to standing, then repeat for reps.
Steps to perform: Anchor standing hip keep spine long and control rotation through the torso

Rest intervals: Develops deep hip mobility and unilateral leg strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand in a split stance with the rear foot on a low platform and hold a dumbbell at your sides.
2. Keep the torso upright and descend by bending both knees until the front thigh reaches full depth.
3. Maintain a straight front shin and weight on the front heel as you lower.
4. Drive through the front heel to extend the knee and return to the top, then repeat.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright torso and drive through front heel while keeping knee aligned

Rest intervals: Strengthens anterior lower leg muscles to support ankle dorsiflexion and control
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a bench and place a dumbbell across the top of your forefoot near the toes.
2. Anchor your heel on the floor and dorsiflex the foot, lifting the toes toward the shin.
3. Lower the toes under control until the foot returns to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep shin vertical and lift foot with controlled dorsiflexion

Rest intervals: Improves hip external rotation and lateral glute strength for pelvic stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked and knees bent to about 90 degrees, and place a dumbbell on the outer thigh of the top leg.
2. Keep your heels together and hold the dumbbell steady with your top hand.
3. Lift the top knee upward by opening the hip while keeping the pelvis stable.
4. Lower the knee slowly with control to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Anchor hips and open knee with slow controlled external rotation

Rest intervals: Increases glute endurance and posterior chain engagement during hip extension
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and place a dumbbell across your hips, holding it to secure.
2. Drive through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the top position for the set time, then lower hips with control.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine and squeeze glutes while breathing steadily

Rest intervals: Promotes unilateral glute activation and pelvic control during hip extension
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat, cross the opposite ankle over the bent knee, and place a dumbbell on the hip of the side you will lift.
2. Brace your core and drive through the planted heel to lift your hips until your torso and thighs form a straight line.
3. Squeeze the glutes at the top while keeping the crossed ankle off the floor.
4. Lower your hips with control to the mat and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Drive through the heels keep pelvis level and avoid lumbar hyperextension

Rest intervals: Enhances hip abduction strength and lateral hip stability under load
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Place a light dumbbell behind the bent working knee and secure it by gently squeezing the thigh and calf together.
3. Brace your core and lift the bent knee straight out to the side until hip height or comfortable.
4. Lower the knee with control back to the start and repeat for reps.
Steps to perform: Keep core braced and hips stacked lift with controlled abduction

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic mobility and lower body strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell overhead with both hands and arms fully extended.
2. Tighten your core and keep the dumbbell aligned over your mid-foot as you sit hips back and bend knees into a squat.
3. Maintain an upright chest and straight arms while descending to at least parallel or a comfortable depth.
4. Push through your heels to stand while keeping the dumbbell steady overhead.
Steps to perform: Keep the dumbbell stacked over wrist and chest upright as you sit between heels

Rest intervals: Develops shoulder mobility and coordinated rotational core strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell at shoulder height in one hand with the palm facing inward.
2. Slightly bend the knees and hinge your torso away from the dumbbell while lowering the torso to create a pressing lane.
3. Press the dumbbell overhead by extending the arm while leaning the torso to the opposite side until the arm locks out.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the shoulder under control and re-center before the next rep.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips and shift torso away while maintaining a straight loaded arm

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and overhead stability
Health benefit:
1. Grip a pair of dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Descend into a deep squat with chest upright and elbows under the dumbbells.
3. Drive through your heels and press the dumbbells overhead until arms lock.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the shoulders and stand up under control.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and core braced while pressing the dumbbells overhead from squat

Rest intervals: Increases hip mobility and dynamic rotational core stability
Health benefit:
1. Hold one dumbbell at your chest in a goblet grip and stand tall.
2. Step forward into a deep lunge and lower your hips toward the floor.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg and bring your elbow to the outside of the front knee.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Drive through the front heel and keep hips square while rotating from the thoracic spine

Rest intervals: Develops posterior chain power and explosive hip drive
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back holding one dumbbell with both hands extended overhead.
2. Engage your core and lift your torso and legs into a V position.
3. Reach the dumbbell toward your feet and touch your shins or ankles.
4. Lower your torso and legs back to the floor with control and reset.
Steps to perform: Brace core and keep neutral spine while hinging and pulling the dumbbell to hips

Rest intervals: Enhances grip strength and shoulder stability while improving wrist control
Health benefit:
1. Pick up a dumbbell and invert it so the bell faces upward above your hand.
2. Rack the inverted dumbbell near your shoulder with your elbow bent and palm facing upward.
3. Brace your core and walk forward with short controlled steps while keeping the bell balanced.
4. Set the dumbbell down with control after the walk.
Steps to perform: Grip firmly and keep wrist stacked under shoulder

Rest intervals: Promotes hip opening and deeper squat mobility
Health benefit:
1. Hold one dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands.
2. Squat down until your hips are at or below knee level while pressing your elbows between your knees to pry them open.
3. Drive through your heels to stand up while keeping the dumbbell close to your chest.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up press knees outward and maintain neutral spine

Rest intervals: Builds unilateral shoulder endurance and anti-lateral flexion core strength
Health benefit:
1. Pick a dumbbell with one hand and press it overhead until your elbow is straight and your wrist is stacked.
2. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and brace your core while keeping the arm vertical.
3. Hold the position for the target time while maintaining shoulder stability.
4. Lower the dumbbell with control back to your shoulder and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Pack shoulder and align wrist over elbow while bracing your core

Rest intervals: Improves coordinated cross-body movement and contralateral core engagement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell in both hands at your hip.
2. Hinge slightly and rotate your torso as you lift the dumbbell diagonally across to the opposite shoulder.
3. Pause at shoulder height with a soft elbow and a braced core.
4. Reverse the path and lower the dumbbell under control back to the starting hip.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips maintain neutral spine and control the cross body movement

Rest intervals: Enhances dynamic core stability and shoulder pressing strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold two dumbbells, then hinge forward and place them on the floor shoulder-width apart.
2. Walk your hands forward gripping the dumbbell handles until you reach a high plank with a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lower your chest to perform a push-up while holding the dumbbells, then press back up.
4. Walk your hands back toward your feet, pick up the dumbbells, and stand up by reversing the hinge.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level crawl hands with control maintain a tight core

Rest intervals: Increases core strength and anterior chain stability
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on a mat and grasp a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended under your shoulders.
2. Brace your core and slowly roll the dumbbells forward, extending your body until your abs engage.
3. Pull the dumbbells back toward your knees using your core and return to the starting kneeling position.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and roll out slowly keeping hips aligned with shoulders

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and oblique strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell overhead with both hands.
2. Brace your core and hinge laterally at the waist toward one side.
3. Slide the dumbbell down the outside of your thigh and then return upright.
4. Repeat for reps and then switch bending to the other side.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips and move through obliques without collapsing the ribcage

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation with core stability
Health benefit:
1. Kneel with one knee on the floor and the opposite foot flat, holding a dumbbell with both hands at chest height.
2. Brace your core and move the dumbbell in a controlled arc around your head from one ear to the other.
3. Keep your torso square to the front and limit motion to the shoulders and arms.
4. Complete reps and then switch the kneeling leg and reverse the direction.
Steps to perform: Keep ribcage down and rotate shoulders around head with controlled movement

Rest intervals: Develops posterior chain coordination and unilateral pulling strength
Health benefit:
1. Start on hands and knees with a dumbbell beside one hand and knees hip-width apart.
2. Extend the opposite leg straight back and grip the dumbbell with the working hand.
3. Row the dumbbell toward your hip by pulling your elbow back and squeezing the shoulder blade.
4. Lower the dumbbell with control, return the hand to the floor, and then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Maintain flat spine and pull elbow back without rotating hips

Rest intervals: Builds lower abdominal control and hip flexor awareness
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with arms at your sides and hold a dumbbell securely between your feet.
2. Lift both legs to 90 degrees while keeping your lower back pressed into the floor.
3. Slowly lower your legs toward the floor until they are a few inches off the ground while maintaining core tension.
4. Raise your legs back to vertical using your lower abs while keeping the dumbbell stable.
Steps to perform: Press lumbar into floor and lower legs slowly with controlled breathing

Rest intervals: Enhances resistance to rotation and core endurance for coordinated trunk control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hinge at the hips, and hold a single dumbbell with both hands in front.
2. Swing the dumbbell slowly from side to side like a metronome while keeping a flat back.
3. Control the movement and breathe steadily while maintaining the hip hinge and engaged core.
Steps to perform: Brace core and move dumbbell slowly across midline keeping torso stable

Rest intervals: Strengthens scapular stability and core resistance to rotation
Health benefit:
1. Start in a high plank holding a dumbbell in each hand under your shoulders with feet hip-width apart.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips level.
3. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder while balancing on the other dumbbell.
4. Return the hand to the dumbbell and repeat on the other side with controlled movement.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced while tapping shoulder slowly

Rest intervals: Improves single arm stability and whole body balance
Health benefit:
1. Start in a high plank with feet hip-width and a dumbbell placed beside your right hand.
2. Brace your core, lift your left hand off the floor, and reach across to grasp the dumbbell.
3. Stabilize your hips and extend the left arm forward while keeping the body level.
4. Lower the dumbbell back down under control and switch sides after desired reps.
Steps to perform: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and reach without rotating

Rest intervals: Develops isometric core and hip flexor strength with improved posture
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and grasp a dumbbell in each hand positioned beside your hips.
2. Press down through the dumbbells, straighten your arms, and lift your hips and legs off the floor into an L position.
3. Hold the L-sit with legs parallel to the floor and shoulders engaged.
4. Lower back to the floor with control when finished.
Steps to perform: Press into handles lift hips keep shoulders down and core fully engaged

Rest intervals: Increases grip strength and unilateral loaded core stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in your right hand at your side with a neutral grip.
2. Brace your core, pull your right shoulder down, and maintain an upright posture while holding the weight.
3. Hold for the desired time while breathing steadily.
4. Switch the dumbbell to the left hand and repeat for equal duration.
Steps to perform: Stand tall shoulders stacked over hips brace core and breathe steadily

Rest intervals: Improves chest and anterior shoulder mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie supine on a bench or floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Grasp a single dumbbell with both hands and extend it above your chest.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbell in an arc to each side until you feel a gentle chest stretch.
4. Hold the position briefly, then raise the dumbbell back over your chest.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulder blades anchored and shoulders back to protect the joints

Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall and grasp a dumbbell in one hand.
2. Raise that arm overhead and bend the elbow so the dumbbell rests behind your head.
3. Use your free hand to gently press the bent elbow toward your head to increase the stretch.
4. Hold briefly, then switch hands and repeat.
Steps to perform: Engage your core and tuck ribs to avoid low back arching

Rest intervals: Increases neck lateral mobility and range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hold a light dumbbell in one hand.
2. Place the dumbbell against the side of your head near the temple with your palm supporting it.
3. Slowly tilt your head toward the shoulder on the dumbbell side while applying gentle pressure with the dumbbell.
4. Hold briefly, then switch sides and repeat.
Steps to perform: Move slowly and align ears over shoulders to avoid spinal compression

Rest intervals: Improves biceps and elbow flexor flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Sit tall on the edge of a bench and hold a light dumbbell in one hand with the palm facing up.
2. Place the forearm on the bench behind you with the elbow extended and let the weight pull the hand backward until you feel a biceps stretch.
3. Keep the chest upright and hold the position while breathing steadily.
Steps to perform: Sit tall depress shoulders keep chest open and control the descent

Rest intervals: Promotes posterior shoulder and scapular mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on a bench with the chest supported and hold a dumbbell in one hand with the palm facing backward.
2. Let the arm hang straight toward the floor and then lift the arm backward by squeezing the shoulder blade until the arm is level with the torso.
3. Keep the elbow straight and control the movement.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the hanging start position.
Steps to perform: Keep neck neutral retract scapula and lower weight with slow controlled motion

Rest intervals: Enhances scapular control and lower shoulder mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Sit or stand tall and hold a dumbbell in each hand with the arms straight at your sides.
2. Keep the arms straight and pull the shoulder blades down and slightly together to depress the scapula while the dumbbells remain at your sides.
3. Hold the depressed scapular position briefly while maintaining a neutral spine.
4. Release the scapular depression and allow the shoulders to return to the start position under control.
Steps to perform: Depress shoulder blades slowly while maintaining a neutral neck

Rest intervals: Improves wrist extensor flexibility and hand mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit and rest your forearm on your thigh or a bench with your palm facing down and a dumbbell in your hand.
2. Slowly lift the back of your hand by extending your wrist to raise the dumbbell.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping your forearm stable.
4. Lower the dumbbell with control back to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Perform slow controlled wrist extensions with forearms supported

Rest intervals: Enhances scapular protraction range and shoulder mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on a bench with your chest supported and hold a light dumbbell in one hand with the arm extended toward the floor.
2. Keep your elbow straight and reach the weight slightly forward to push your shoulder blade away from the spine.
3. Hold the protracted position briefly while maintaining a neutral neck and spine.
4. Retract your shoulder blade and lower the weight to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Protract shoulders while maintaining a tall straight spine

Rest intervals: Improves thoracic mobility and shoulder upward rotation
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hold a light dumbbell in each hand with elbows bent at 90 degrees.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and slowly slide your arms upward in an arc like a snow angel while keeping wrists and elbows close to the floor.
3. Pause with your arms extended overhead while maintaining contact with the floor.
4. Reverse the arc with control to return to the start.
Steps to perform: Press lower back into the floor and slowly slide arms overhead

Rest intervals: Increases anterior chest openness and shoulder external rotation
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing an open doorway and hold one dumbbell vertically with both hands at chest level.
2. Place your forearms or hands against the door frame at shoulder height.
3. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the doorway until you feel a stretch in the chest and front shoulders.
4. Maintain steady breathing and keep light tension on the dumbbell.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and shoulders relaxed while breathing without arching the back

Rest intervals: Enhances spinal mobility and hamstring flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell with both hands in front of your thighs.
2. Tuck your chin and slowly round your upper back while curling down one vertebra at a time toward your toes.
3. Continue curling until you reach a comfortable forward fold while keeping the dumbbell close to your legs.
4. Reverse the motion by unrolling your spine upward to standing while controlling the dumbbell.
Steps to perform: Articulate slowly from thoracic to sacral spine using hip hinge and controlled descent

Rest intervals: Improves hip adductor flexibility and pelvic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with soles of your feet together and hold a dumbbell with both hands over your feet.
2. Bring your elbows to your knees and use the dumbbell for mild additional downward pressure on the knees.
3. Hinge forward from the hips with a long spine and hold the stretch.
Steps to perform: Keep chest lifted and spine tall breathe deeply to control the fold

Rest intervals: Improves ankle dorsiflexion range of motion and mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a chair with the heel on the floor and the knee bent.
2. Rest a light dumbbell on top of the foot near the toes and hold it in place with your hands.
3. Pull the foot upward, bringing the toes toward the shin while keeping the heel grounded.
4. Lower the foot slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Steps to perform: Stabilize shin and move ankle slowly avoiding knee or hip compensation

Rest intervals: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Start in a pigeon position on the floor with the front knee bent and the back leg extended.
2. Place one light dumbbell on the outside of the front hip or across the back of the pelvis for gentle added weight.
3. Square the hips, lift the chest, then exhale and fold forward over the front leg.
4. Hold with steady breathing, then remove the dumbbell and return to a neutral position.
Steps to perform: Square hips forward keep spine long and breathe slowly into the hip

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring and inner thigh flexibility and pelvic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs spread wide into a comfortable straddle and a straight spine.
2. Place one light dumbbell across both thighs near the knees for added resistance.
3. Hinge at the hips and reach toward one foot while keeping the spine long and chest open.
4. Return to center, then hinge toward the opposite foot and repeat.
Steps to perform: Sit tall hinge from hips avoid rounding lower back and breathe evenly

Rest intervals: Increases hip internal rotation and adductor flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Assume a frog position on hands and knees with knees wide and feet turned out, and place a light dumbbell on your hips.
2. Lower your chest toward the floor by sliding your hips back while keeping your forearms on the ground.
3. Keep a neutral spine and hold the dumbbell steady on your hips to add gentle downward pressure.
4. Breathe steadily and control the return to the starting position.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and core braced to avoid lower back sag

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring flexibility and posterior chain mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor and extend one leg forward with the heel on the ground, and hold a dumbbell with both hands above the extended thigh.
2. Hinge at the hips with a long back and slide the dumbbell toward your toes until you feel a stretch in the hamstring.
3. Keep a slight bend in the knee and avoid rounding the lower back as you reach.
4. Slowly return upright and repeat on the other leg.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips and keep spine long avoid rounding

Rest intervals: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and hip extension range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Kneel on one knee with the other foot planted forward and place a light dumbbell on the top of the rear foot while holding the handle.
2. Reach back with the same-side hand to grasp the top of the rear foot or the dumbbell and draw the heel toward your glute.
3. Keep your torso upright and hips square as you pull to deepen the quad stretch.
4. Release the foot with control and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Tuck pelvis and keep torso upright avoid arching lower back

Rest intervals: Improves adductor mobility and dynamic hip stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and hold a dumbbell vertically at your chest.
2. Shift your weight to one leg and bend the knee while keeping the other leg straight and toes slightly turned out.
3. Rock your hips toward the bent knee until you feel tension in the inner thigh while keeping the chest upright.
4. Drive through the bent foot to return to center and repeat toward the other side.
Steps to perform: Control each rock from the hips and keep chest lifted

Rest intervals: Increases calf flexibility and ankle range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Stand facing a wall with one foot forward and the other foot back, holding a dumbbell in the same-side hand.
2. Keep the back heel pressing down and bend the front knee while leaning into the wall.
3. Hold the stretch for the desired time then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep heel down and kneecap tracking over toes breathe into stretch

Rest intervals: Enhances lower body strength and deep hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell at chest level in a goblet hold.
2. Sit back and down into a deep squat until your hips are below parallel while keeping the chest tall.
3. Brace your core, hold the position for the desired time, then stand by driving through the heels.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up and press through heels
MET value: Hypertension, Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis, Coronary Artery Disease

Rest intervals: Improves posterior chain flexibility and spine mobility
Health benefit:
1. Stand hip-width and hold one dumbbell with both hands in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward with soft knees, lowering the dumbbell toward your feet.
3. Let the dumbbell hang heavy and allow your torso to relax and gently sway.
4. Drive the hips forward to stand and keep the dumbbell close to your body.
Steps to perform: Hinge from hips with soft knees and maintain a neutral spine

Rest intervals: Promotes thoracic spine mobility and upper back rotation
Health benefit:
1. Kneel with one knee down and the opposite foot flat, place one hand on the floor, and hold a dumbbell in the other hand at chest level.
2. Rotate the torso and lift the dumbbell upward and back to open the thoracic spine.
3. Pause at the top and follow the dumbbell with your eyes to enhance rotation.
4. Lower the dumbbell under control and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Stack ribs over hips and rotate from the thoracic spine

Rest intervals: Enhances full body mobility and integrated movement coordination
Health benefit:
1. Step into a forward lunge and hold a dumbbell in the hand of the front leg near the ground.
2. Place the opposite elbow inside the front knee and reach the dumbbell forward to feel a stretch in the hamstring and hip.
3. Rotate your torso and lift the dumbbell toward the sky while opening the chest and tracking the dumbbell with your eyes.
4. Return the dumbbell to the ground, step back to stand, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Control lunge depth and lead rotations with your chest

Rest intervals: Improves hip and thoracic rotation mobility for movement integration
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat and hold a dumbbell in the hand opposite the leg you will cross, arm extended toward the ceiling.
2. Cross the ankle of the leg you will move over the opposite thigh and draw the bottom knee toward your chest.
3. Lower both knees to the side of the crossed leg while rotating your torso and keeping the dumbbell arm extended overhead.
4. Pause, lift the knees back to center, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Anchor shoulders and exhale while slowly controlling the twist

Rest intervals: Increases lumbar rotation awareness and hip mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down with arms extended in a T and hold a light dumbbell in the hand opposite the leg you will move.
2. Bend one knee and lift the foot while rotating the hips toward the opposite side.
3. Reach the weighted hand toward the lifted foot and aim to get the hand and foot close without forcing range.
4. Lower the leg back down and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep hips square and rotate slowly with controlled movement

Rest intervals: Enhances upper back and shoulder mobility while promoting relaxation
Health benefit:
1. Kneel with big toes together and hold a dumbbell with both hands overhead.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward, reaching the dumbbell out in front along the floor.
3. Rest your forehead on the mat and keep the dumbbell light and controlled.
4. Use your legs to sit back up when finished.
Steps to perform: Lengthen spine and breathe deeply while reaching actively through the arms

Rest intervals: Improves hamstring flexibility and posterior chain lengthening
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold one dumbbell vertically with both hands in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips and slide the dumbbell down your shins with a soft bend in the knees.
3. Fold forward into a pike while keeping the dumbbell close and your chest moving toward your thighs.
4. Pause at depth, then drive hips forward to stand and return to the start.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips with a long spine and control the descent

Rest intervals: Enhances hip external rotation mobility and sitting positional control
Health benefit:
1. Sit in a shin-box position with knees stacked and hold a dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Keep hips grounded and rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping a tall spine.
3. Place the outside hand behind you for support and lift your chest to extend the thoracic spine while holding the dumbbell.
4. Lower back to the start and repeat, then switch sides after completing reps.
Steps to perform: Maintain a neutral pelvis and rotate from the thorax with a lifted chest

Rest intervals: Increases thoracic extension and improves posture mechanics
Health benefit:
1. Sit on your heels or on a bench and hold a light dumbbell with both hands behind your head.
2. Support your upper back on the edge of a bench or roller and lean back to extend the thoracic spine while holding the dumbbell.
3. Return to neutral by contracting the mid-back and repeat for the set.
Steps to perform: Extend through the thoracic spine while bracing the core and avoiding lumbar collapse

Rest intervals: Promotes thoracic extension and chest mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie face down on a mat with legs extended and toes tucked under, hold one light dumbbell with both hands against your sternum.
2. Press your chest upward by extending the upper back while keeping your hips on the floor.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift to a comfortable height without straining the neck.
4. Hold briefly, then lower the torso slowly to the mat and release the dumbbell.
Steps to perform: Keep ribs down and shoulder blades drawn together while lifting chest

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral trunk flexibility and oblique endurance
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and press a dumbbell overhead with one hand, keeping the other hand at your side.
2. Brace your core and slowly tilt your torso toward the opposite side of the weight, sliding the free hand down your thigh.
3. Pause at a comfortable stretch while keeping the overhead arm long and hips facing forward.
4. Return to center with control, lower the dumbbell, and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral hips and avoid collapsing the ribcage while side bending

Rest intervals: Improves spinal rotation and lumbar mobility
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, hold one dumbbell with both hands above your chest.
2. Engage your core and lower both knees to one side while keeping the dumbbell aligned over your chest.
3. Turn your head toward the opposite side and keep your shoulders grounded for a gentle twist.
4. Slowly bring knees back to center and repeat the movement to the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep shoulders grounded and move the hips slowly to control the twist

Rest intervals: Increases lateral lower back mobility and soft tissue flexibility
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in one hand with the arm extended overhead.
2. Keep the opposite hand on your hip and bend laterally away from the dumbbell.
3. Slide the free hand down the outer thigh as you deepen the side bend.
4. Return upright and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Brace core and lengthen through the opposite side of the torso

Rest intervals: Strengthens core endurance and promotes abdominal control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold a dumbbell with both hands extended overhead.
2. Engage your core and lift your shoulders and legs slightly off the floor into a hollow position.
3. Press your lower back into the floor and keep your arms straight holding the dumbbell.
4. Hold the position, then slowly lower your arms, shoulders, and legs.
Steps to perform: Anchor lower back to the floor and exhale while maintaining tension

Rest intervals: Supports lumbar extension and gentle spinal stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie prone and prop your forearms on the floor under your shoulders in a sphinx position.
2. Place a light dumbbell across your upper back or hold it with both hands at chest level.
3. Lift your chest by extending through the spine while keeping forearms grounded, then lower.
Steps to perform: Keep neck neutral and lift from the upper back not the lower spine

Rest intervals: Improves lateral fascial chain flexibility and postural alignment
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Raise the dumbbell overhead with the right arm and place the left hand on your hip.
3. Lean the torso slowly to the left until you feel a stretch along the right side.
4. Return to center and repeat the same steps on the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Hinge from the hips and lengthen through the side without collapsing the ribcage

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic rotation and seated trunk mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on a bench with feet flat and hold a dumbbell vertically against your chest with both hands.
2. Brace the core and rotate your torso to the right while keeping the hips facing forward.
3. Pause briefly at the end range and control the movement back through center.
4. Rotate to the left and repeat the same pattern.
Steps to perform: Sit tall brace your core rotate from the thoracic spine not the lower back

Rest intervals: Increases anterior core flexibility and extension range
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and grasp one dumbbell with both hands overhead, arms extended.
2. Keep the hips stable and slowly arch the upper back to open the front of the torso.
3. Hold the top position briefly while maintaining a controlled breath.
4. Return to an upright position and lower the dumbbell.
Steps to perform: Maintain posterior pelvic tilt and control the descent to protect the lumbar spine

Rest intervals: Improves oblique flexibility and rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell vertically with both hands at chest, elbows tucked.
2. Rotate your torso toward the dumbbell side and press it overhead.
3. Hinge at the hips and lean away from the weighted side to open the oblique with the arm extended.
4. Return to center under control and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Stabilize the pelvis exhale as you open keeping ribs stacked over hips

Rest intervals: Enhances shoulder strength and single-leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on your right leg with left knee lifted and hold a dumbbell in your right hand at shoulder level.
2. Brace your core and keep hips square to the front.
3. Press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is extended while maintaining balance.
4. Lower the dumbbell to shoulder under control and switch legs after the set.
Steps to perform: Brace your core to maintain balance

Rest intervals: Builds biceps strength and improves single-leg stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on your right leg with left knee slightly bent and hold a dumbbell in your right hand at your side, palm facing forward.
2. Keep your torso tall and elbow fixed against your hip.
3. Curl the dumbbell toward your shoulder, pause at the top, and lower slowly; switch legs after the set.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow pinned to your side

Rest intervals: Strengthens lateral shoulder muscles and enhances single-leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in the hand on the same side with the arm by your thigh.
2. Brace your core and keep a slight bend in the elbow.
3. Raise the dumbbell out to the side to shoulder height with controlled motion.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Lift slowly with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Develops triceps strength while challenging unilateral stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell overhead with one hand.
2. Keep the upper arm vertical and the elbow close to your head.
3. Bend the elbow to lower the dumbbell behind your head with control.
4. Extend the elbow to straighten the arm, then switch legs and arms.
Steps to perform: Keep upper arm stationary during the extension

Rest intervals: Promotes shoulder pressing strength and core stability with improved thoracic mobility
Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor with legs straight and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level.
2. Sit tall, brace your core, and maintain an upright torso.
3. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
4. Lower the dumbbells to shoulder level under control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Sit tall to prevent lower back arching

Rest intervals: Enhances biceps and forearm strength while promoting controlled wrist stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder level with elbow pointing forward and palm facing up.
2. Keep your upper arm steady and curl the dumbbell toward your ear by flexing your elbow.
3. Pause briefly at the top with the forearm vertical and maintain a neutral wrist.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the start and control the descent.
Steps to perform: Keep elbow pinned to ribs and move only at the elbow

Rest intervals: Builds shoulder endurance and scapular stability through isometric tension
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Raise both arms out to the sides to shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows and palms facing down.
3. Hold the position, brace your core, and keep your shoulders level for the desired time.
Steps to perform: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep ribs down

Rest intervals: Improves posterior shoulder and upper back strength while challenging balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand with a soft bend in the standing knee.
2. Hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor and let the dumbbell hang beneath your shoulder.
3. With a slight bend in the elbow, lift the dumbbell out to the side until your arm reaches shoulder height.
4. Lower the dumbbell slowly and maintain balance on the standing leg.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips keep spine neutral and hips level

Rest intervals: Increases core anti-rotation strength and unilateral pressing power
Health benefit:
1. Get into a high plank with hands shoulder-width and place one dumbbell handle under one hand.
2. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend both elbows and lower your chest toward the floor.
4. Press back up to the plank while keeping hips level.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and maintain a straight plank without torso rotation

Rest intervals: Enhances thoracic mobility and shoulder joint control while reinforcing core stability
Health benefit:
1. Kneel tall on both knees and hold a dumbbell vertically at chest with both hands.
2. Brace your core and keep your chest tall.
3. Move the dumbbell slowly in a wide circle around your head, staying close to the skull.
4. Reverse the circle while keeping your torso still.
Steps to perform: Keep neck neutral and move weight slowly using shoulder control

Rest intervals: Enhances glute strength and unilateral hip extension control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent, the other leg extended toward the ceiling, and hold a dumbbell on your hips with both hands.
2. Press the heel of the bent leg into the floor and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips until body forms a straight line from shoulders to knee.
3. Keep the extended leg aligned and the dumbbell steady on your hips.
4. Lower your hips slowly to the ground and repeat, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Drive through heel keeping hips level and core braced

Rest intervals: Develops single-leg strength and lateral knee stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the standing knee while extending the free leg back for balance.
3. Drive through the heel of the standing foot to return to upright, keeping your chest tall.
4. Repeat for reps, then switch legs.
Steps to perform: Sit back into the hip keep front knee tracking over toes

Rest intervals: Improves dynamic balance and coordinated lower body control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step forward with one foot and lower until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through the front heel and lift the back knee up into a high-knee balance.
4. Pause to stabilize, then return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Step forward with controlled descent keeping torso upright and shoulders stacked

Exercise Name: DB Reverse Lunge to High Knee
Rest intervals: Builds unilateral leg strength and improves hip flexor power
Health benefit:
1. Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step backward with one foot and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees bend about 90 degrees.
3. Push through the front heel and explosively pull the rear knee up toward your chest into a high knee.
4. Land softly on the same leg, reset your posture, and repeat before switching legs.
Steps to perform: Push through front heel to stand then drive knee up with control

Rest intervals: Enhances lateral hip mobility and standing balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell at chest in a goblet grip.
2. Step wide to the right and bend the right knee, pushing hips back into a lateral lunge while keeping the left leg straight.
3. Drive through the right foot to return to standing and lift the left knee up into a balance while keeping the dumbbell at chest.
4. Pause briefly, lower the left foot back to start, and repeat for reps then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Push hips back and chest up then return to balance slowly

Exercise Name: DB Curtsy Lunge to Lateral Kick
Rest intervals: Targets hip stabilizers while improving coordination and lateral movement control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall and hold a dumbbell at chest with both hands.
2. Step your right leg diagonally behind and across your left leg into a curtsy lunge, lowering until the front knee is bent.
3. Drive through the left foot to stand and swing the right leg out to the side into a controlled lateral kick while keeping the dumbbell at chest.
4. Land softly, reset, and repeat for reps then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep torso upright and perform the kick with slow controlled hip movement

Rest intervals: Increases calf strength and single-leg ankle stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand on your right foot with a slight bend in the knee and hold a dumbbell in your right hand by your side.
2. Push through the ball of the right foot to raise your heel as high as possible while keeping the torso upright.
3. Lower the heel back down with control to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Keep knee soft and rise slowly through the ball of the foot

Rest intervals: Develops maximal single-leg strength, mobility, and balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell at chest level with both hands in a goblet grip.
