2. Extend the non-working leg straight in front of you and keep your chest lifted.
3. Sit back into the standing hip and bend the knee to lower into a full one-legged squat to a comfortable depth.
4. Press through the heel to stand back up and control the descent on each rep.
Steps to perform: Keep chest tall and lower slowly while pushing hips back to maintain balance

Exercise Name: DB Front Foot Elevated Split Squat
Rest intervals: Increases quad strength and hip mobility through greater range of motion
Health benefit:
1. Place your front foot on a low platform and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step the rear foot back until you feel balanced and keep your torso upright.
3. Bend the front knee and lower until the front thigh is parallel to the floor while the back knee moves toward the ground.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the start and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep front knee aligned over ankle and descend with controlled tempo

Rest intervals: Improves deep single-leg mobility and control while increasing lower body strength
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, hold a dumbbell at chest in a goblet grip, and place the opposite foot behind you with toes lightly touching the floor.
2. Shift weight onto the front leg, keep your chest tall, and hinge slightly at the hips.
3. Bend the front knee and lower into a deep single-leg squat while keeping the rear toes in contact with the ground.
4. Drive through the front heel to return to standing and maintain control on the return.
Steps to perform: Maintain upright torso and lower slowly keeping weight through the heel for control

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral leg strength and shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and press a dumbbell overhead with one arm, locking the elbow.
2. Step forward with the opposite leg and lower into a lunge until the front thigh is about parallel to the floor.
3. Keep the torso upright and the dumbbell steady overhead as you press through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat for reps then switch the dumbbell to the other arm.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and keep torso upright with shoulder stacked over hip

Rest intervals: Enhances hip and core stability through unilateral loading
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and hold one dumbbell at shoulder on one side, other hand relaxed.
2. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat, keeping chest up and knees tracking over toes.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and maintain the offset dumbbell position without leaning away.
4. Repeat for reps then move the dumbbell to the opposite side.
Steps to perform: Keep chest up neutral spine and weight balanced through midfoot

Rest intervals: Promotes upright posture and loaded core endurance
Health benefit:
1. Clean the dumbbell to the front-rack position and rest it against your shoulder with elbow tucked.
2. Brace your core and stand tall with shoulders back and hips neutral.
3. Walk forward in controlled steps while keeping the dumbbell stable and your torso upright.
4. Continue for distance or time then switch the dumbbell to the other side.
Steps to perform: Keep elbows high shoulders down and back walk tall and breathe

Rest intervals: Improves shoulder stability and overhead control
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell overhead in one hand with a slight bend in the elbow.
2. Brace your torso and keep your gaze forward.
3. Walk forward in controlled, even steps while keeping the dumbbell steady overhead.
4. Switch hands and repeat for the other side.
Steps to perform: Pack the shoulder fully extend the arm brace core and inhale steadily

Rest intervals: Develops explosive hip drive and coordinated full-body power
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell near one foot with a slight hip hinge.
2. Explosively extend the hips and pull the dumbbell diagonally across the body toward the opposite shoulder.
3. Rotate your elbow under the dumbbell and catch it at shoulder height in a rack position.
4. Lower the dumbbell under control back to the start and repeat, then switch sides.
Steps to perform: Hinge at hips drive with legs keep spine neutral and elbows high
MET value: Sarcopenia, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Rest intervals: Builds rotational core strength and single-leg balance
Health benefit:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell with both hands at chest height.
2. Step one foot back into a reverse lunge and lower until the front knee is approximately bent 90 degrees.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping the dumbbell at chest level.
4. Push through the front foot to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Steps to perform: Rotate through your thoracic spine with a tall, braced chest
MET value: Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Rest intervals: Enhances posterior chain strength and unilateral shoulder coordination
Health benefit:
1. Stand on one leg holding a dumbbell in one hand at the hip.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower the dumbbell toward the floor while extending the free leg back.
3. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and bring the dumbbell to shoulder height.
4. Press the dumbbell overhead, lower it back to the hip, and repeat.
Steps to perform: Hinge at the hips maintaining a neutral spine and controlled descent

Rest intervals: Combines lower-body power with rotational upper-body control
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a dumbbell at chest with both hands.
2. Descend into a squat, keeping the chest up and knees tracking the toes.
3. Explode up from the squat and rotate the torso to one side while bringing the dumbbell to shoulder.
4. Press the dumbbell overhead on that side, return it to the chest, and rotate back to center.
Steps to perform: Maintain an upright chest while rotating from the thoracic spine
MET value: Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Rest intervals: Improves hip mobility and lateral stability through transverse plane movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart holding a dumbbell at the chest in goblet position.
2. Step one foot diagonally behind and across the other into a lunge while keeping the torso upright and the front knee aligned.
3. Push through the front foot to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Steps to perform: Step sideways ensuring the knee tracks over the toes
MET value: Osteoarthritis, Obesity / Overweight, Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis

Rest intervals: Builds full-body strength and metabolic conditioning through compound movement
Health benefit:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell at shoulder with one hand, elbow tucked.
2. Push hips back and bend knees into a squat until thighs are near parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through the heels to stand and press the dumbbell overhead by extending the arm.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the shoulder with control and repeat, then switch arms.
Steps to perform: Press overhead driving through the heels with a braced core

Rest intervals: Develops core strength and hip flexor coordination
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back holding one dumbbell with both hands extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Simultaneously lift your torso and legs into a V shape and reach the dumbbell toward your feet.
3. Lower your torso and legs back down with control and repeat.
Steps to perform: Exhale as you lift and keep lower back pressed to the floor

Health benefit:
1. Sit on the floor, hold one dumbbell with both hands at chest or extended in front, and bend knees.
2. Lean back slightly, lift your feet off the floor, and straighten your legs to form a V with your torso.
3. Brace your core, hold the position for the desired time, then lower with control.
Steps to perform: Keep a long spine and lift chest while breathing evenly

Rest intervals: Strengthens obliques and challenges shoulder stability
Health benefit:
1. Place a dumbbell on the floor and get into a high plank with one hand gripping the dumbbell.
2. Brace your core and lift the opposite arm and opposite leg out to the side to form a star shape.
3. Hold briefly, then lower and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Stack shoulders over wrists and brace core to prevent hip sag
is_not_suitable_for: Limited single-leg balance | Rotator cuff weakness / instability

Rest intervals: Improves core stability and unilateral shoulder control
Health benefit:
1. Start in a high plank with each hand gripping a dumbbell shoulder-width apart.
2. Keep hips steady and lift one dumbbell a few inches forward by marching the hand toward your chest.
3. Return the hand and repeat the march with the other hand.
Steps to perform: Keep hips level and steady while reaching slowly with controlled motion

Rest intervals: Builds core endurance and scapular control
Health benefit:
1. Position two dumbbells under your hands and come into a bear plank with knees hovering a few inches off the floor.
2. Tuck knees slightly under hips and keep your spine neutral while gripping the dumbbells.
3. Hold the stable position and maintain steady breathing for the desired time.
Steps to perform: Maintain neutral spine breathe steadily and avoid letting hips rise or drop

Rest intervals: Enhances full body mobility and core to shoulder coordination
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, hold a dumbbell in one hand pressed straight toward the ceiling, and place the other hand beside you on the floor.
2. Roll onto your forearm, then onto your hand while lifting your chest to sit up and keep the dumbbell overhead.
3. Drive through the planted foot and stand upright while keeping the dumbbell locked overhead.
4. Reverse the sequence to return to the starting position with control.
Steps to perform: Keep the dumbbell shoulder packed and spine neutral as you control the descent and rise

Rest intervals: Develops unilateral core strength and rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hold a dumbbell in one hand extended toward the ceiling.
2. Use your abdominal muscles to sit up and reach the dumbbell toward your opposite knee.
3. Lower back down slowly to the start while maintaining control of the dumbbell.
Steps to perform: Exhale as you sit up while maintaining a tall chest and packed shoulder

Rest intervals: Targets obliques and improves spinal rotational control
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your back and hold a dumbbell with both hands above your chest while extending your legs straight up.
2. Brace your core and keep your shoulders on the floor as you lower both legs to one side in a controlled motion.
3. Sweep your legs across to the opposite side in a single arc without letting your shoulders lift.
4. Continue alternating sides while keeping the dumbbell steady and your movements controlled.
Steps to perform: Brace your core and move hips slowly to protect the lower back

Rest intervals: Strengthens lower abdominals and increases hip flexor endurance
Health benefit:
1. Lie flat on your back on a mat with your arms by your sides.
2. Squeeze a dumbbell securely between your feet or ankles and brace your core.
3. Lift your legs together until they reach about 90 degrees from your torso.
4. Slowly lower your legs while keeping your lower back pressed to the floor and repeat.
Steps to perform: Keep your lower back pressed into the floor and control the legs on descent

Rest intervals: Strengthens hip adductors and improves lateral pelvic stability
Health benefit:
1. Lie on your side next to a bench and drape your top leg across the bench.
2. Rest a dumbbell on your top thigh near the hip and place your forearm on the floor under your shoulder.
3. Lift your hips into a side plank, supporting weight on your forearm and the bench-held top leg.
4. Hold the position with hips elevated, then lower with control and switch sides.
Steps to perform: Align hips with torso and squeeze glutes to prevent hip sag
